name: Open the Bridge
description: The fun game in which players open and close the bridges to win the race with their car and boat.

name: Celestial FireStorm
description:
Description from the designer:

Players choose one of the five celestial animals to fight for supremacy of the skies - using fireworks! Connect firework tiles to gain territory, break up other firework collections, and battle for the largest section of the night sky.

The game is played with tiles, each tile is broken into four sections and contains four fireworks. At the start of the game, players are dealt three tiles. Then they choose the celestial animal they want to play - there can only be one player for each animal. Players place their tiles in such a way as to connect the most fireworks for their animal together. Tiles can be placed over other tiles, as long as the tile below isn't locked.

Each turn players:

Play one tile from their hand.
Draw a new tile from the pool of tiles.


Play continues until all the tiles have been placed. At the end of the game, all the fireworks on the board are tallied for points.

The game includes rules for solitaire play.

name: Snow-White and Rose-Red
description:
Description from the designer:

Snow-White and Rose-Red is a fairy tale adventure where you take control of Snow-White and/or her sister Rose-Red. The goal is to save the Enchanted Bear, who once was a prince but has fallen under a vile curse from the Ungrateful Dwarf.

To defeat the Ungrateful Dwarf you need to steal back the treasure he stole from the prince or you need to remove his source of power - his luxuriant beard - with a pair of scissors. Explore the woods near Mother's Cottage, rescue trapped animals, and make sure you never have more than four curses upon you at a time! Will you be able to save the Enchanted Bear and defeat the Ungrateful Dwarf? Or will you become cursed too?

Each turn the sisters travel to different locations around the board to have encounters. These encounters can lead to rescuing animal companions, gaining useful items, collection treasure, encountering the Ungrateful Dwarf, or encountering the Enchanted Bear. Watch out for the curses! Curses make it harder for the sisters to complete their goals! The encounters at the locations are different depending on which sisters are present, and if both sisters are there.

This game can be played solo where one person controls one or two of the sisters, or can be played as a full co-op where both sisters quest to save the Enchanted Bear.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Point to Point Movement, Role Playing, Storytelling, Variable Player Powers

name: Pounce and Stalk
description:
Description from the designer:

This morning your mother, a superb snow leopard, took you outside to practice your pouncing. What she didn't realize is that a deadly Siberian tiger stalks these mountains too! Find the adult snow leopard before you find the Siberian tiger to win in this game of frolics turned fatal!

In this game, one or two players play a group of four snow leopard cubs who are in danger! They must find their mother before the Siberian Tiger finds them. The board is made up of thirty cards, played face down. Twenty-eight of those cards are mountains, one is the adult snow leopard, one is the Siberian tiger.

On each player's turn, as long as they hold a snow leopard cub in their hand, they may swap that card with any card on the board. The card they take is revealed. If it is a mountain, nothing happens. If it is the Siberian tiger, all is lost. If it is the adult snow leopard, they win!

If the adult snow leopard or Siberian tiger hasn't yet been found, for each snow leopard cub already on the board, the player can flip face-up one card that is located diagonally adjacent to the snow leopard cub card. These cards are flipped down at the end of the turn.

Once all the snow leopard cub cards have been played, players may retrieve a snow leopard cub card on their next turn by swapping it back out with a Mountain card in your hand. When playing a two-player game, this means you can start to retrieve your cards after playing two, instead of all four.

This game can be played solo, with one person controlling all four snow leopard cubs, or fully co-op with two players playing two cubs each.

name: Copiii Capitanului Grant
description:
The game can be played with 2-6 players
Each player representing one of the main characters from the "Les Enfants du capitaine Grant" novel by Jules Verne: Mary Grant, Robert Grant, Lord Glenarvan, Major Mac Nabbs, Captain John Mangles and Paganel.

The game contains 60 cards with characters (10 cards for each character), 30 value cards (positive and negative), a world map and two plastic figures.

Based on the number of players, a equal number of characters are chosen (there are ten cards for each character) and only these cards will be used in the game.
All these characters cards are shuffled (the total of the caracter cards used it will be ten multiplied by the number of players). Also the value cards are shuffled.

Each player starts the game with ten character cards and five value cards.

The game is played clockwise. The first player put one card from his hand face down. The next player put also a card from his hand face down and then take the card from the previous player and so on.
The scope is to have all the ten cards from a single caracter.
The first player to collect these cards will gain 2000 points.
Bellow are the points for each place:
1 – 2000 points
2 – 1600 points
3 – 1200 points
4 – 800 points
5 – 600 points
6 – 400 points
After that, each player looks at his value cards to calculate the final score. The points from his value cards (can be positive or negative) are added to the points based on his place.
The player with the most points win the game.

name: Host Party: Back to the Eighties
description:
This is a murder mystery party game for 8-14 guests.

Setting / Theme:
Get ready for some teased up hair and Member's Only jackets mixed with a fun '80s story line and trivia challenges! Everyone who is anyone in the 80s will be there, all coming from Hollywood to Broadway through Texas. J.R. and Melinda are throwing this dig to introduce Allegra and her new business. This will be a totally bodacious affair. The guests can chill out and have a blast until that moment when someone gets murdered!

Oh those 80s! What fun years with big teased hair and characterized by a "disco" backlash, Rock and Pop Bands with long hairstyles and citizens with political correctness became popular. Prepare your guests for the 80s murder.

How to Play
Planning:

Host of the Murder Mystery picks the day/time and location for the game which will take 2-3 hours and finds out how many guests can attend.
Host creates guest list and assigns each guest one of the characters to play.
Host sends official invite with their character background to each guest.
Guests create / purchase a costume based on their character. Thrift stores are good for this.
Host decorates and plans for food for evening.


Playing the game:

As guests arrive, the host gives them their instructions for the first round which will include things to say/do/ask.
After all actions are completed, instructions are given to guests for Round 2.
Repeat again for Round 3.
In between rounds you can eat or have activities based on the theme.


Ending:

Everyone discusses and says who they think the murderer is.
Each guest reads their final clue in order leading up to the murderer.
Winner are those that guessed the murderer.
If nobody guesses correctly the murderer wins.

name: Kingdom Duel
description:
There once was a Kingdom where precious gems where the most invaluable treasure, but as every treasure comes with wealth it also comes with tragedies. Wars besieged the kingdom, every habitant desire for these treasures was bigger than the love for peace.

Before the Kingdom perished in the hands of War, the king decided to take part in having the battle end in the best way possible. He and his followers decided to create some way to stop the war by allowing the combatants to face each other in a game where there was no bloodshed, so they invented Kingdom Duel.

Kingdom Duel is a Board Card Game where the players use their heroes, alongside Skill Cards to defeat the enemy.

In Kingdom Duel, there is a modular board which can be modified as you like. You also have Heroes that will help you win and defend your walls from the upcoming attacks. Every Hero has their own set of abilities that can be used against the enemy or to help your own party win the battle.

name: Paß gut auf und komm bald wieder
description:
There are 4 starting Points (Houses) for 4 different traffic participants: a car, a three-wheeled delivery van, a bicycle and a pedestrian. The first player to reach the wholesale supplier (Grosshändler) and get back to his starting point wins the game. Movement is determinated by a die. The players may choose their own way while minding the traffic rules. On some spaces events hinder or benefit the players.

The game was published sometime between 1945 and 1953 to promote Dreiring soap and laundry detergent.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Dance Off: Furry Fury
description:
Dance Off: Furry Fury is a competitive card game based on a dance competition. You play 3 cards face down and compare them to your opponent's, utilizing 12 different dance moves. Keep track of your score because after the 3rd round, the player with the lowest score at the end of the round gets eliminated. Be careful, because if your opponents use the same dance move, everyone loses value of that move, and hope you don't flub up.

There is also a solitaire version of the game so you can play alone. Try to get the best score you can to win 1st place on a pre-set scale.

name: Bella's Mystery Party Game For Kids: The Case of the Stolen Buckle
description:
From back of box: A Complete Mystery Party in a Box! Are your ready to throw the most fun-filled party ever? This will crafted mystery party does all the planning for you. Children dress up and role play outrageously fun characters, play lively games and challenge their logical thinking skills.

Theme:
Come to a Southwestern style cookout with Bella's family and friends after the Tuscon rodeo. Your friend Pedro won first place in bonco busting at the Rodeo and won the coveted buckle. But then while everyone was congratulating him, it vanished and one of you is the thief.

Includes:

2 endings so you can play twice.
Host Guide
Cassette
Real metal buckle
8 Name tags
16 Invitations
20 Scorecards
2 Recipes
3 Secret Clues


Game Play:
Host sends out invitations which describe each guests character along with costume ideas. Kids come to the party dressed rodeo-style and role play one of the 8 suspects. Play the audio tape to hear Bella's narrative. Players make several guesses as to who stole the buckle. In between guesses you can play fun activities. Finally the ending reveals who the thief is. Winner is person who correctly guessed.

name: Trinkets
description:
Description from the publisher:

Trinkets play like Wild tiles, except only YOU can play on your Trinkets! Use these to block the other players. Did I mention they are also immune to Shears and Gum? Trinkets make the game a little bit easier to play. This set includes 24 new tiles (4 tiles in 6 colors).
mechanics: Push Your Luck, Take That, Tile Placement

name: Beardsmith: Disconnected Ends
description:
Description from the publisher:

Disconnected Ends adds a new aspect to Beardsmith. Having a customer with disconnected beard pieces would bring shame on the whole establishment. To avoid this the Apprentices must work together to reconnect these pieces to the Start Tile. This expansion makes the game a bit more challenging, and a new collaborative mechanic. This set includes 24 new tiles (4 tiles in 6 colors).
mechanics: Push Your Luck, Take That, Tile Placement

name: Bathroom Break
description: When you gotta go, you gotta let the next player take your turn. Unpredictable hilarity ensues when you turn over your Bathroom Break tile and discover that nature is calling loudly! Run for the door and pray that your opponent take too much advantage of you. This set includes 6 new tiles, one for each color.
mechanics: Push Your Luck, Take That, Tile Placement

name: Parakeet
description:
Classic trick-taking perfected in a new deck!

A tropical fruit themed trick-taking card game deck including 2 ways to play:

The standard Parakeet game is for 4 players, with 2 partners. You bid to choose the trump suit. Points are scored by capturing certain point cards, not by counting tricks.

The Fruit Punch alternate rules use the Fruit Punch cards to change the card value orders and trump. The game can be played with 3 to 6 players, everyone for themselves. Points are scored by counting tricks.

name: Biblisches Namino
description:
A simple tile placement game in which players score points for completing biblical names. Each edge of the tile has letters printed on them, e.g. "Je", "richo", that is part of a name. In turn order players draw one or two random tiles and place them adjacent to the tiles on the table. Each completed name gives one point.

Their is a longer variant in which players might only place one tile per turn. Another variant awards players up to 3 additional points per name, if they can tell up to 3 sentences about the name.

name: A House in New Orleans
description:
A mansion in French Quarter has been the center of woe for 30 years. Its taxes are paid, and the power is on, but no one has seen anything in the house for years. Suddenly you have received an invitation that requests you to come for dinner at this address. "I know what you are looking for, and you will find the answers you need here on this night". You have just been invited to play A House in New Orleans A game for 2-6 players. Some will call it a player deduction game or a game with a traitor mechanism, but most will call it horrifyingly intense.
You are invited to A House in New Orleans come hungry.

The game takes place in an old mansion in New Orleans. Each room contains two item cards face down. Players select unique characters with special abilities and stats. They will move from room to room discovering items. Some may be traps that impede players, some may be special items that improve a character. You may only choose to carry one item, so every room will provide a new discovery and a decision.

Human Goal:
Players are attempting to find all three items that their character requires. When one player finds all three items the game is over. If all but one player has 2 items, the game is over as well. Each of the collected items has a point value and the points are totaled at the end of the game. You must be careful what items you choose to collect, if the items you collect are of too low a point value a player with fewer items may still win.

Vampire goal:
Did I mention a lonely vampire has disguised themselves among the dinner guests? The goal for the original vampire is not to acquire items themselves, but to "Turn" human players that have already acquired items. You see, nothing tastes as good as hope. If a human is attacked and can’t fend off the vampire, they are now secretly a vampire themselves looking for their victim. If the vampire is successfully fended off the vampire is not “revealed” and may become invisible (hidden player movement). If the vampire turns a player, the new vampire gains points for the items they have already acquired but give the Vampire that turned them points as well. They do not give their "Parent" vampire points from the new victims they acquire. The closer a human player is to completing their goal the more valuable they are, but the more human players you "Turn" the more competition you make for yourself. If you wait too long, they may be able to fend you off

The Clock:
The old grandfather clock gongs on the hour, at which time a new event card is turned over. These events are random but become worse for the humans as the game progresses. The humans may skip an event if they place an item that turn. Do you help the other humans even though it may mean losing the game to avoid the next horrible event..it is up to you.

Does it sound simple? It is simple to learn, and as complex as the mind of the players that you play against.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Pick-up and Deliver, Push Your Luck, Variable Player Powers

name: The Clockwork Conundrum
description:
In The Clockwork Conundrum, after each player receives 3 cards and 3 pawns, a modular board is formed 5 cards wide x 5 cards high (cards are left face down), surrounding a single victory card. All players besides the start player may examine their cards, and place these however desired. The start player may only see his cards after choosing which card to begin with. He places his pawn on this card.

Most cards have a L, M, R, or C in their upper right corner. These stand for Left, Middle, Right, and Choice. When the start player reveals his start card, it determines where the next player places his pawn. This unleashes a chain of events. The last player's pawn placement will indicate the two to four movement options for the start player. (These are indicated by direction markers on each card.) His subsequent move will indicate the next player's move and so on. This can be treacherous given the players don't know the cards they are moving to until they make their moves. It is entirely possible that a player may be forced off of the board, or onto one of the more bizarre action cards.

1) FREEZE: If a player settles on this card, the next player in turn order may not move. Instead whichever card he previously settled on will indicate the next player's movement options.

2) LAVA: If a player stumbles into a lava pit, he loses one of his three pawns and starts over on the start card indicated by the lava card.

3) MIRROR MIRROR: If a player settles onto a Mirror Mirror card, the next player in turn order will move across the board to the card in the mirror position.

4) +PAWN: If a player settles onto a +Pawn card, he adds a second pawn to the start card of his choice. This increases his movement options, since he will still only move 1 pawn at a time. Therefore, his likelihood of reaching his destination is significantly increased.

5) REVERSE: If a player settles onto a Reverse card, the turn order is reversed, and the player who preceded him must move in the direction indicated by the card on which he is currently settled.

The game only uses 37 cards. There are 41 in total. But the remaining cards are not totally useless. While increasing the variety of the modular board, the cards also help to resolve conflicts if a player has settled onto a card where his opponent is currently positioned. Each card, excluding the Victory Card, has a number 1-40. When players are involved in a conflict, each draws a card at random, and the player with the higher card gains the space, whereas the player with the lower card loses his pawn.

Usually any cards revealed are left face-up, but there is also a Memory Variant where after moving to a new location, any cards not currently active are flipped back to face-down.

Due to the unique design of the game, it may also be played cooperatively, as players work together to lead one to the Victory Card.

The Clockwork Conundrum is an intense puzzle game. And due to its featuring nearly 100,000 ways to set up, it is highly replayable. Who will gain the victory in a game where your next moves are triggered by your opponent?
mechanics: Action Queue, Memory, Modular Board, Player Elimination, Variable Phase Order

name: Ty Beanie Boo's Coconut
description:
Ty plush characters are playing hide and seek. Peek under the coconut halves to find them!
Ty Beanie Boos Coconut features 16 playing pieces that look like colorful coconuts halves. When players turn the Coconut playing pieces over, each piece shows either a blue or pink background color. Careful, don’t turn over the piece that shows the Bat, he’s trying to eat all your Coconuts!

Each turn, players push the die popper, which indicates whether the player needs to find a blue or pink Coconut during their turn. Choose your Coconut and turn it over. If it matches the die, it is yours. If a player turns over the Bat, they must put back one of their Coconut pieces and mix-up the remaining pieces. Collect the most Coconuts pieces to win. The chunky plastic pieces are easy to handle for young players.

name: Zagor: Odissea Americana – Molti occhi Promo Card
description:
Zagor: Odissea Americana: Molti occhi Promo Card is one of a set of 4 event cards to be added to those in the Zagor: Odissea Americana base game. The cards are simply shuffled in with the base game cards, adding more variety from game to game.

The first 3 italian versions of the cards (Molti occhi, Trampy and Icaro La Plume) were given to the visitors of Lucca Comics & Games 2016, a comics & gameplay festival in Lucca in 2016, and later during other promotional events with the 4th card (Insidie sul fiume). It's one of the first additional cards for the Italian edition of Zagor: Odissea Americana.

Text:

Molti occhi / Many Eyes
Ogni giocatore fuori dal battello sceglie se curarsi una ferita (simbolo) o pescare un oggetto (simbolo) dal mazzo
Any off the boat player chooses either to heal a wound (symbol) or draw an object (symbol) from the deck
categories: Adventure, Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Variable Player Powers

name: Say Cheese
description:
Say Cheese is a multiplication board game for students of grade 1 and up. It is designed to get them 14 times more multiplication practice than classroom.

Players take turns pulling a number out of a bag and places it in the play arena. The next player takes another number, checks to see if it is multiple of four (say "Cheese" if it is) and recites its multiplication fact. If correct, they receive all the tokens in play and puts them in their bag.

Game ends when one person has no more tokens and the person with the most wins.

name: Mickey's Poppin' Magic
description:
User summary:

Mickey's Poppin' Magic is a children's pop-o-matic action game with a Disney theme. Players move pegged stand-up tokens (Minnie Mouse, Donald Duck, Pluto, and Goofy) around the edge of a 3-D plastic popcorn bowl. The playing surface is a series of holes (designed to fit the pegs, of course) with a hidden trigger mechanism underneath. If the pop-o-matic die roller indicates a "popcorn" result the trigger is activated randomly, possibly knocking somebody off the pathway. Players also trigger a random poppin' event when they land on a popcorn space. First player to complete the circle is declared the winner.

Designed for 2, 3, or 4 players ages 4 to 8 years old. No reading is required to play. Spanish rules are included.

name: Too Big to Fail
description:
The stated object of the game is to "do everything you can to survive out-of-control government, corrupt unions and environmental weenies who want to destroy your business and livelihood." The object of the game is to be the last player with at least one franchise, or to be the first player to complete four circuits of the board and roll "some snake eyes"; failure to roll two ones on two six sided dice on completing four circuits eliminates that player from the game.

As with many games of this genre, the focus is on political satire rather than game play.

name: Garbage Day: Gen Con Promo Pack
description:
Pack of "Garbage" given out to attendees of Gen Con 2016.

18 new "con" related cards.
mechanics: Player Elimination, Push Your Luck, Take That

name: Mind & Emotions Board Game
description:
The Mind & Emotions game explores our head and heart. In the beautiful box is a playing board, 120 cards, and a single die.

The game is based on the idea that we all have positive and negative states of mind, and positive and negative emotional states. The playing board has 3 columns with mind states on the left, and 3 columns of emotional states on the right. The positive states are on the top, and the negative states are on the bottom.

There are 2 piles of cards - 60 mind cards with blue backs, and 60 emotion cards with maroon backs. On the top of each card is one of the 12 mind & emotion states. In the middle of the card is a word that is an example of that mind or emotion state.

Each player takes a turn picking a card, and uses the word on that card to add to a developing story that’s interesting and fun.

For example, let’s say the first player picks the word SHY and begins the story: "Ever since Barry was a little boy, he was always SHY and had trouble socializing in groups."
The next player picks the word: INVESTIGATE, and continues the story: "One day Barry was reading the newspaper about a neighborhood near where he lived. The article described houses that sounded like an excellent investment, and he decided to INVESTIGATE."
The next player picks the word NEGLECTFUL, and says: "When Barry arrived at the neighborhood, he saw that it was run down, looking as if the owners were NEGLECTFUL of the most basic repairs."
While telling the story, the players move their pieces on the board trying to get each of their pieces into a top or bottom end zone. We’ll now describe the rules of the game.

2 to 6 players can play. Each player gets two pieces that are placed on the start section in the middle of the board, one on the left mind side, and the other on the right emotion side of the board. Each player moves one piece up and down the mind side, and the other piece up and down the emotion side. The goal is to get each piece in either the top or bottom end zones.

On your turn:

Roll the die to see how many spaces to move either piece.
Then pick a card from either the mind or emotion pile, and say out loud the category and word you picked.
If you picked a mind card, move your mind piece. If you picked an emotion card, move your emotion piece. If the word you picked is positive, move your piece up. If the word you picked is negative, move your piece down.
If the die is 2, 4, or 5, move your piece that many spaces. If the die is 3 or 6, move your piece 3 spaces up OR down. If the die is 1, roll again right away, and on this move you can move up OR down.
So there are two goals of the game. The first goal is to tell an interesting and fun story together. The second goal is to be the first to get both of your pieces to an end zone. The end zones do not have to be reached by an exact number of moves.

Positive-mind cards:
Analyzing, Interested, Aware
Negative-mind cards:
Oblivious, Uninterested, Unaware
Positive-emotion cards:
Up, Outward, Warm
Negative-emotion cards:
Down, Inward, Cold

You and your friends will enjoy many hours together playing the game of Mind and Emotions!!

name: Iqbal Farooq's Kebab-matador
description:
Kebab-matador is base on Nørrebro, Copenhagen, Denmark. Here you have to buy all the stores and shops before the other players, so you can become the biggest gangster boss in town.

Unlike regular Matador (Monopoly) this game contains two alleyways where you can win big or almost lose it all!

The game is made from the idea of Manus Sareen who also wrote the Danish children book series "Iqbaal Farooq", and illustrated by Lars-Ole Nejstgaard.

The game is in Danish, and the first edition contains a free e-book on "Iqbal Farooq - og den sorte pjerrot"
categories: Children's Game, Economic, Humor, Territory Building
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Odessa 1941
description:
A small game covering the Rumanian Attack against Odessa in 1941.
Romanian player selects activation chits for his wings and then pull a chit one at a time. He has three wings and two chits for each wing. So, he can have six activations in one turn. But, more activations bring Russian player more command points. With them he can move or attack with one unit.
Victory condition for the Rumanian is to control or totally encircle Odessa at the end of turn six.

4 pages rulebook
60 counters
one map


Published in Command Magazine Japan #50 in 2003. Map was to be downloaded

Republished in Command Magazine Japan #109 in 2013 with full colored map and larger counters.

name: Magician's Club
description:
Description from the designer:

The year is 1921 and the Academy of Magicians has gathered once again to perform their greatest stage tricks. The competition to win the title of World’s Greatest Magician brings out the worst in these rivals who won’t hesitate at a chance to ruin the act. Fortunately, a good magician always has an assistant at their side and a trick up their sleeve…

Magician's Club is a "Trick-Breaking" game where players are Magicians who play Trick Cards for points. Moving around the table, the other players will try to "break" their trick by decreasing or modifying the Magician's tricks using conjure cards. The Magician can cancel out some cards by using his assistant cards but they are one-time use only cards, so play them wisely. When play returns back to the Magician, they can play one more card and then collect the trick for points (either positive or negative)

After all the players have had a chance to be the on-stage Magician, the points are totaled up. A second chance to score happens at the end of the game by counting up collected cards that have a similar suit. The player with the most points wins!
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Storytelling, Take That

name: Castle Climbers
description:
In Castle Climbers, players lay tiles to build up a fantasy castle that they climb with their hero character. As players scramble up the treacherous castle wall, roll dice to battle the grumpy guardians that bar their way. Use a magic sword or wish token to improve your luck. Win the battle to keep climbing. Lose and you'll drop back down! Special tiles help you climb faster or avoid the enemies altogether! Reach treasure chests to plunder the gems within. Whoever has the most points in gems and climbs the highest up the castle when time runs out, wins the game!

—description from the designer

name: Bolt Action: M18 Hellcat Platoon
description:
After the experiences of improvised tank destroyer vehicles such as the M3 half-track with 75mm gun, M6 truck with 37mm gun and the M10 tank destroyer (3-inch gun on a modified M4 Sherman hull), the US Army were keen to produce a bespoke tank destroyer to hunt enemy armour. An order was issued in late 1941 to mount a 37mm gun in the requested vehicle. This was to be upgraded several times to 57mm, 75mm and then finally a 76mm.

The result of this development would be the M18 Hellcat - the fastest US armoured fighting vehicle of the Second World War.

M18 Hellcats served in the invasion of the Phillipines and saw action in Europe during the landings at Anzio in Italy and in Northwest Europe.

Hellcats were also exported to China where they served in an infantry support role.

The Hellcat could be found in the service of several nations following World War II with the Yugoslav army still fielding them into the 1990s!
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Chit-Pull System, Dice Rolling, Variable Phase Order, Variable Player Powers

name: Bushido: Prefecture of Ryu Starter Set
description: The Dragon Clan won the rights to colonize the Westward Isles in a series of duels with their rivals, the Shiho Clan. However, when the Emperors vessel expired, and his young heir too young and inexperienced to concern himself with the pretty disputes at the fringes of his lands, the promise of sole settlement rights died with him. The newly formed Prefecture of Ryu found themselves yet again in conflict with their old enemies, the Shiho Clan. Now, the Prefecture’s grasp of power is weakened, due to the recent Tsunami. Their forces are in disarray, they are fighting on all fronts in the aftermath of the disaster. But still the men and women of the Dragon are ready to take their place at Destiny’s table, uniting the human world by defending it against all threats.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: 1893: Koln-Bonn
description:
This is the original game that was developed into 1893 Cologne by Marflow games. It is set in the same Cologne region of Germany. There are several differences including a differences in the map, stock chart, minor differences in the major and minor company contents, and a more restrictive tile set.

As with other 18xx games, players start with a set amount of money that they then invest in various companies. As the game progresses, these companies grow and earn income for their owners. Technology increases in the form of better trains with progression through more complicated track tiles. When the game ends, the winner if the player with the greatest net worth.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Network and Route Building, Stock Holding, Tile Placement

name: Monstra Maris
description:
Hushed tales of fantastic beasts under the dark waves have been told throughout the known world for centuries: a giant piranha-turtle with a trident, a sea serpent that swallows ships and crew whole, a bearded dog-lizard with two water spouts on its head... stories so wild as to defy the imagination. While untold sailors have met their grim end by these sea monsters, an intrepid few have welcomed the challenge of discovering them with timeless rumors as their only guide.

In Monstra Maris, 2 to 4 players each control a small fleet of ships, represented by wooden discs, that they sail across the board with the flick of a finger. Their goals are the changing locations on the board where the monsters are rumored to have been sighted. When a player flicks a ship disc onto one of these locations, he or she is awarded points for the discovery and granted an experience token for end-game scoring. Players also hope to avoid the storms and pirates that may come their way, thanks to their opponents. The game ends after one player has discovered twelve monsters, and the player with the most points is declared the winner.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Exploration, Mythology, Nautical, Transportation

name: Kardey
description:
Dice game with 12 dice using scoring elements from Yahtzee (with extra combinations) and Tutto (points for sets of 1's and 5's) at the same time.

Multiple scoring combinations per throw are possible, splitting the 12 dice into groups.

A bit of push your luck is also present. Players can either stop before all dice are used, scoring their total thus far or continue taking the risk to throw non-scoring dice, losing all the points of that turn.

First player to 100,000 wins.

name: Bedlam Cards: Unexpected Mini Expansion
description:
The Unexpected Mini Expansion was offered to Kickstarter backers in an update just as the base game was getting ready to ship.

Due to the layout of our printing there was a very small amount of space left on one of the sheets. So we went ahead and made a mini-expansion utilizing works of classic Mike Foxall art. AN EXPANSION BEFORE THERE IS EVEN A GAME, YOU ASK? Haha, we say, because we are mad. No, seriously, we had the space - why not use it?

Thus we are proud to bring you the 'Unexpected Mini Expansion'!

Including:

Evil Knievette - The only card that can take things from the Ditch! What a Buddy.
Sensual Simon - This troll who just wants to come in for "a coffee". He's one sexy Enemy.
Story Time - During this Event Uncle Morty tells truly terrifying tales.
Lynched By Witches - Something isn't right with this Ordeal. Shouldn't we be lynching the witches?
Think About Feet - An Effect to make your opponents think too much about feet!

We will bundle it with your game, so do it now before we send your game. There are less of these available than there are Bedlamites, so first come, first AWESOME. Second come, second MISSES OUT AND CRIES IN A CORNER LIKE A MINI EXPANSION-LESS LOSER.

–description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Humor
mechanics: Hand Management, Player Elimination, Role Playing, Take That

name: The Game of Ports and Commerce
description:
This 1899 card game has a Happy Families mechanic. The cards are organized in sets of four. They are dealt out evenly among the players. Each player in turn asks another player for a card that matches one of his own: if successful, he gets the card and another turn; if not, the turn passes. The winner is the player to collect the most complete sets.

What makes this game unique is that its cards feature actual early photographs of 13 U.S. cities: New York, Philadelphia, Chicago, Boston, San Francisco, New Orleans, Pittsburg (spelled this way), Buffalo, Richmond, Savannah, New Haven, Los Angeles and Honolulu.

Each set of four cards shows the same photograph, with the cards representing the city and three of its primary products.

name: Wise Cracks
description:
This is a Depression-era game of riddles with 100 numbered cards. Each player takes an equal number of cards face down. On his turn, a player turns over the top card; if he answers correctly, he keeps it; if he can't, other players in order get a crack, and whoever answers the riddle correctly keeps the card. The player with the most cards at game's end wins.

Riddles include questions such as: "What would you do if there was a horse in your bathtub? (#85); "If a bowlegged man and a knock-kneed man came along together, what word would they spell? (#77); and "If a goat swallowed a rabbit, what would be the result? (#1).

name: Scavenger
description:
Subtitled "A New Adult Card Game", this Depression-era publication requires players to a set of cards either by trading with other players or by "snooping" in the "gutter". The game has 45 cards. The five Scavenger cards each list eight items that the player drawing it must collect. The other 40 cards are the items to be collected.

Each player starts with 25 tokens, and antes one into the pot before each hand. The four players draw one Scavenger list card blind, and get dealt a hand of eight cards, with the remaining eight stacked face down in the gutter.

On his turn a player may either trade (offering one or two cards from his hand for an equal number from any player) or snoop by drawing one or two cards from the gutter, paying a token into the pot, and discarding an equal number of cards from his hand, face down, to the bottom of the gutter pile. Each player in a trade decides which card(s) to give up and passes them without declaring what they are. Players may not refuse a trade offer, even if they have to give up a card they need.

The first player to complete his full scavenging list of eight items wins the hand and takes the pot. The game can continue as long as players desire (and have tokens left). The game can be played with 2 or 3 players by eliminating one scavenger card and its set of 8 objects per player less than four.

name: Don't Tip The Bottle
description: Two bottles swing freely with a metal rod through them. Players compete to see who can place the most sticks on their own bottle before it spills over.

name: TRBO
description:
TRBO is a fast paced, racing, miniatures board game for 2-4 players. Playing in about 30 – 45 minutes, players in TRBO select a unique motorcycle club and race to either outpace their competitors or demolish their competition completely using weapons and dirty tricks. Inspired by retro boards games and cart racing video games of the 16-bit era, TRBO is a lighthearted and quick to play game with an incredibly low learning curve.

In TRBO each player takes control of a motorcycle club composed of 3 biker types: light, medium, and heavy. While each biker has different attack and health values based on their size, all bikes are capable of moving at the same speed. It is up to the player to decide what’s the best strategy for each member of their club.

Players move by rolling 3 custom movement dice. They can attribute any of the rolled results to any of their bikers. around the straight race track board is a number of special spaces that allow players to either get an immediate boost, which lets them roll a custom boost die, or pick up Tune-Up cards.

Tune-Up cards can buff a player's attack, give them special abilities, or disrupt their opponent's turns with a few nasty 'Take-That' type instant play cards!

The winner of TRBO is the player with the last active biker club on the track.
mechanics: Grid Movement, Roll / Spin and Move, Take That, Variable Player Powers

name: Warmonger
description:
Description from the designer:

The King is dead and the Kingdom of Meridia is at War!

As the crown's greatest Warlord, the Kingdom is yours by right. But first you must prove your worth by defeating the lesser Warlords that would claim your throne. You'll need to win the loyalty of many followers, build mighty fortifications, and devise cunning tactics to become the new ruler of Meridia... May the best Warlord win!

Warmonger is a simple yet strategic board game for 2-4 players, combining the structure of a deck building game with the direct player interaction of a war game.

In Warmonger, there are no dice; your deck controls every aspect of the game. The cards in your deck represent all of the resources at your disposal, and you'll use abilities granted by those cards to purchase new cards for your deck, recruit and move armies on the board, and defeat your opponents in battle.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Open Drafting

name: Masters of Deceit
description:
The race for land on Mars grows stronger! Catrem is a game for 2-4 players aging 13 and up. An average game takes about 30 minutes. The game takes place in an advanced technology era where players are trying to capture the most wanted territory on Mars, Catrem.
Catrem is played by using numbers and symbols on cards of certain meaning to defeat other players. The goal of the game is to destroy your opponent's’ defenses, and be the last faction standing!
categories: Card Game, Math, Number, Print & Play

name: Build Thy Kingdom!
description: The game was published online as a Print and Play and as of now, it is discontinued.
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Medieval, Print & Play
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Open Drafting, Push Your Luck, Set Collection

name: Best of British Trivia
description:
Description from the box:

How much do you know about the British Isles? Can you recognise a landmark from its silhouette, or make out a phrase from a particular dialect and translate it into common English?

This brain-teasing pack of quiz cards includes 150 questions in 5 fascinating categories. Play in teams or go head to head to prove who has the biggest British brain!

name: Two Tribes
description:
Based on the BBC TV games show that ran from 2014-2015 hosted by Richard Osman

Each turn players are split into two tribes (teams), a Yes tribe and a No tribe, based on their answer to a question (for example "I prefer dogs to cats"). Each tribe then answers trivial questions trying to win as many points as possible.

After a full round the two players with the most individual points compete head to head in a buzzer round, the first to answer 3 questions correctly wins.
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game, Trivia

name: Bushido: Silvermoon Syndicate Starter Set
description:
Description from the publisher:

The thriving port of Jima is the beating heart of the Silvermoon Trade Syndicate’s operations. In recent generations the merchants of the Silvermoon Syndicate have been the trade life blood of the Jwar isles. It’s famed arenas where Buto warriors clash in a brutal dance of Jumo, or the Flower Houses where ones wildest fantasies can become reality with the touch of a Rose, the Syndicate rules. Some would liken the Silvermoon to the flip of a coin; If lucky you come up in the sun with the Five Fortunes blessing, call it wrong or try and cheat them and you’re likely to end up face down in the dirt!
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Bushido: Tengu Starter Set
description:
Description from the publisher:

For countless cycles the elders of the mountain have watched and waited, their quiet vigil in the high places of the world unbroken. Silently they have over seen the rise and fall of innumerable clans, the petty squabbles of mortals bare no relevance to their goal. Gifted with generations of knowledge passed down through the written teachings of the Karasu Shugenja and oral histories of the Koroko Shisai the Tengu hold the secrets of the world in the their high homes.

Now stirred into action, one can only imagine the danger that looms that has rustled the Tengu to war.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Bushido: Jung Pirates Starter Set
description:
Description from the publisher:

When years passed without word of the Jung, they were considered lost, their return under the mon of the giant squid surprised everyone. They have reaped what they need from the traders on the seas of the Jwar Isles, forcing the Shiho to label them pirates. Their fleets are faster and their knowledge of the Isles’ waters are unparalleled by all but perhaps the Carp clan, allowing them to evade the larger, less experienced junks of the Prefecture. Long years away from the courts of the Jwar Isles have left the Jung rough around the edges but they have not forgotten their ancestry.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Batman Miniature Game: Commissioner Loeb & Gotham Police
description:
Loeb is commissioner of the Gotham City Police Department who enjoyed the company of Carmine Falcone and several other Gotham elites whether criminal or simply rich and apathetic. Loeb felt that Batman’s popularity was good as it gave the public false hope and kept them distracted them from the activities of the more sophisticated criminals such as Falcone.

The stat cards contain all the unique abilities and powers for the characters. These stats cannot be found in the rulebook and they determine the role of the characters in the game and the outcome of the battles.
categories: Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Expat Life
description:
Description from the designer:

Expat Life is a phrase-matching game designed around the unique lifestyle of global nomads. Expat Life is perfect for expats, diplomats, military, third culture kids, and social gamers.

The game consists of question cards and answer cards. Each round, a judge puts a question card into play. All other players select the best answer from their hand and pass it to the judge. The judge picks a winner for that round, and the judging duty rotates to the next player.

Expat Life features easy rules and quick set up so you don’t waste time. It’s a compact card game, so you can throw it in your bag and bring it to a friend’s house. The endless combinations of questions and answers will have you laughing right away. The familiar scenarios will have you swapping stories.
categories: Card Game, Humor, Party Game, Print & Play

name: Rekord
description:
This is a simple roll and move racing game, promoting Rekord-Briketts. Movement is determined by a die. The first player to reach "Ziel" wins the game. On some spaces, events hinder or benefit the players.

Published between 1961 and 1977 in Austria, where the Rekord-Briketts were imported from the GDR.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move
publishers: BRIKO Brikett- und Kohlenimport Großhandelsgesellschaft  Erwin Flemmer & Co. KG

name: Der Löwe auf der Schlange
description:
There are 3 wooden animals: Croco, Lion and Snake in this game and game cards where the animals are in different places and with different positions.

In turn one child is the gamekeeper who takes a card from the deck and looks at her secretly. The child left is the first detective and askes a question about the arrangement of the animals which must be answered "yes" or "no"

If the player responds "No", the next child is clockwise is a new detective.
If the player responds "Yes," he may continue his turn.


If a detective establishes the correct arrangement, he receives the animal card and become a new gamekeeper.
Player with the 3 card in the end of the round is the winner.

If the first child has three cards, the round is still ended.
If several children have three cards, they win together

Other variants included.

name: Magbago
description:
Magbago is the Filipino word for change.

Magbago is a Squava derivative, that is a Yavalath derivative.

Materials

8x8 board
2 players
Supply of Black and White stones

Definitions

Adjacent – Orthogonally or diagonally adjacent

Play

One player plays Black the other White

Board starts out empty

First player starts by dropping a Black stone onto an empty space on the board.

Turns now alternate

On a turn,

•Drop a stone onto an empty space on the board or
•Drop a stone onto an empty space that is adjacent to any number of stones, then you may optionally move any enemy stones that are adjacent to the stone just placed, into an adjacent empty space.

Object

Make a four in a row horizontally or diagonally in your color for a win, lose if you make a three in a row first or if your last move is pushing an enemy stone into a space that makes a four in a row for your opponent.

name: Der schwarze Diamant
description:
Each player choses a miner and sets them near one of the 6 coal product groups. The goal of the game is to produce coal from the mines and transport the coal to the 6 circular spaces of one’s product group. At the start of the game 36 coal cubes are placed into the mine tunnels. The players spin the wheel on the winding tower. The wheel segment that stops at the opening of the mining shaft, determines from which mining tunnel (1-6) the coal is produced and where is goes:
1 - factory (on the right side of the shaft)
2-5 - factory or storage pile „Teer“, „Koks“ or „Gas“
6 - factory
mound - from the tunnel matching the players product group to the mound (on the right side of the shaft) or if there isn’t any coal left, buy coal from the mound
joker - any of the above
If a player spins his own color, he may put the produced coal cube on one of his product spaces. If a player spins the color of another player, this player may take a coal cube from the factory or the storage pile assigned to his product group.
The first player to place an coal cube on every of his 6 product spaces wins the game.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Schüler im Straßenverkehr
description:
Each player starts at one corner of the game board with a car, a bicycle and a pedestrian. Movement is determined by a die. The players have to get their pedestrian to a space marked with a „Z“ and the car and bicycle to the opposite starting spaces (for example: A to B), while minding the traffic rules. By the roll of a 1 or 6 the player has to draw a card and answer the related question from the games rules. According to the answer positive or negative points are awarded. At the end of the game, the player with the most points wins the game. If 2 players have the same amount of points, the one who finished first is the winner.

The game was produced in the 1960s.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Maestro Fanfare
description:
A simple dice game that requires the music cards found in Maestro Ensemble & Symphony.

It was made as a special for Spiel 2016.

Aim of the game is to collect as many cards as possible by using 8 dice with numbers 1 - 16 on it.

name: B-Movie Showdown
description: B-Movie Showdown is a two-player game that pits factions of "B-movie" regulars against one another: ninjas vs. cowboys, martians vs. vampires, and so on. On a turn, each player chooses an initiative/action token, which determines who acts first and what the faction will do.

name: Batman Miniature Game: Rick Flag
description:
We're bad guys, it's what we do...

This first expansion to the 2 player Suicide Squad game box from Knight Models allows you to add Rick Flag to the Suicide Squad in the Batman Miniature Game.
categories: Comic Book / Strip, Dice, Fighting, Miniatures
mechanics: Action Points, Chit-Pull System, Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Mind Wreck
description:
Mind Wreck is a strategic, downright sexy board game that will spice up any bedroom. It’s a two-player game that gives special privileges to the winner. As you progress around the board, you’re given sexy tasks. Each task is designed to bring you or your opponent closer to climax. Seduce your way to the winning circle with two ways to win.

Primary way to win: Collect three “win cards”.
Secondary way to win: Drive your opponent to climax.

The win cards are collected by reaching the “g-spot” space on the game board three times. These cards in turn give all-powerful rules that remain in play until a winner is declared.

name: Global War 1936-1945: Might of the Reich
description:
First edition:

This expansion adds the plastic pieces and rules that allow the German player of Global War to build a variety of new, high power weapons after developing the necessary technology. The pieces come from America's Bring in the Heavies expansion.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Simulation

name: Global War 1936-1945: Manchuko – Puppets of the Empire
description:
Historical Background

Manchukuo was a puppet state of the Japanese Empire. The Japanese seized the area in 1931 on the fabricated pretext of Chinese aggression known as the Mukden Incident. In truth, the Japanese desired the region (known as Manchuria) for its extensive wealth of minerals. The Japanese attempted to bring large numbers of settlers into the area to colonize and farm and during the Japanese occupation Manchukuo’s industrial base expanded rapidly. Cities, factories and railways were modernized. Between 1938 and 1942 about 200,000 Japanese farmers immigrated to Manchukuo. The Soviets reportedly captured and repatriated 850,000 Japanese settlers after their invasion of Manchukuo in 1945. The Japanese used Manchuria to prepare for war, creating industry and infrastructure to support their planned conquest of Asia.

Resistance to the Japanese occupation grew with time. By 1935 a combination of anti-Japanese forces including Communists and Korean resistance fighters totaling about 40,000 men formed into armies. The Communist Chinese (CCP) operated guerilla units inside the occupied territory that targeted Japanese occupiers but also spread the social ideals of the party. Until 1937 resistance fighters engaged in anti-government operations designed to subvert Japanese governance. After the war began these fighters presented a serious threat to the Japanese and Manchukuo government who were continually forced to use their troops to deal with them. It took until 1942 for the Japanese to pacify the region.

The Japanese were not without competition; the Soviet Union had long had designs on Manchuria. The Japanese and Soviets fought a number of border skirmishes between 1935 and 1939.

Welcome to Manchukuo! A battleground of occupiers, liberators, and revolutionaries! In the expansion set Manchukuo your alliance will battle for the control of resources, industry and ultimately, the destiny of this important region.

SET CONTENTS

• Manchukuo Nation Roundel (x5)
• CCP Nation Roundel (x3)
• Infantry (x6)
• Motorized Infantry (x1)
• BA-6 Armored Car (x1)
• Cavalry (Painted) x1
• Artillery (x2)
• Militia Marker (x2)
• Manchukuo Imperial Guard Marker (x1)
• Kwangtung Army Marker (x4)
• Patrol River Boat Marker (x2)
• Minor Factory Marker (x2)
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Simulation

name: Turn of Phrase
description:
Turn of Phrase is an adult-themed drawing game that revolves around popular phrases. These phrases are split into two decks. An angel deck (with clean phrases) and a devil deck (with adult phrases).

Each team selects an artist. One artist picks up the top card from each deck, chooses one, and shares it with the other artists, who start drawing the phrase at the same time. The first team to guess the phrase wins the round. After every artist has picked a card to draw, a new artist is selected from each team.

The team that guesses the phrase correctly first wins a point. After players have played any desired number of rounds, the team with the most points is declared champion.

The game allows for multiple methods of play, such as acting out and playing as every person for themselves. There is even a kid friendly way to play using only the angel deck, and a more adult way to play using only the devil deck.

name: Operation Hercules
description: This tactical level game allows players to take the role of the British, Italians, or Germans and fight the battle of Malta. this game incorporates various tactical aspects while keeping to the familiar game mechanic of Axis and Allies. Over the course of 14 turns, the players battle to control key terrain and locations on the island. At the end of the game, whoever has scored the most victory points by controlling key point will win the game.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Simulation

name: For Want of a Nail
description:
Description from the publisher:

For Want of a Nail is all about leading armies, collecting armies from the deck, stealing armies from other players, or even persuading other players' armies to join you.

Everyone wants to be King. To secure your place as the rightful ruler, you’re going to have to kill your false-claiming opponents. Gather armies from all across the world, secure your castle, and crush your enemies. There’s only one throne. Make it yours.

Each players draws from a deck of 60 entirely different and original cards (with no repeats). Using these cards, players will set up there army, protect their King, and defeat opponents.

name: Himaya
description:
Himaya is a card game in which you drift through the sands of time, using famous historical figures and creating a grand empire of science, art, and religion. The game features 151 playing cards, 2 sets of 2 dice, 3 decks, and eats away about half an hour of your time.

The order of play in this game is very simple. Draw a card from the "Time" deck and play any one card from your hand. You don't have to play a card, but you may. There are a couple of exceptions to this order of play, but generally the game sticks to this format.

There are 20 different types of cards in this game. The card type is indicated at the top of the cards. On your turn, you can choose to play one of them. These cards are:

- Cities
- General
- Scientist
- Merchant
- Explorer
- Historian
- Spy
- Assassin
- Rebel
- Prophet
- Builder
- Building
- Artist
- Literature
- Song
- Painting
- Museum
- Ceiling
- Play
- Theatre

To win the game, you may choose the potential victory conditions for the game before play begins. Conditions are as follows:

1. Play until the "Time" deck runs out.
2. Determine a set number of victory points that must be reached.
3. Play until a certain amount of time runs out (i.e. 30 minutes)

name: Hangry Hippos
description:
Description from the publisher:

Hangy Hippos is a delightful combo-building card game for 2-5 players. It's easy to learn, simple to set up, and only takes a few minutes to play (a few minutes of pure FUN). The game consists of 120 high-quality 2.5"x3.5" cards in a tuck box.

You play as a chef, trying to cook up food for hungry costumers. You meet the 'orders' listed on customer cards in order to get points. But you have to watch out, because there is a famished hippo, who keeps getting more and more hangry until he eats someone's food!

Players not only try and get food card combos, but also try to sabotage their opponents. You can play actions cards ruin their meals and steal their food, or you can send the hangry hippo to them.
mechanics: Hand Management, Pattern Building, Take That

name: Makers
description:
MAKERS, the game of making incredible products.

Makers is a card game for 2 to 4 players, in which you will have to satisfy the largest number of customers by building the products that best suit their tastes and needs. Hurry up in making your products and meet as many customers as you can before the other makers. At the end of the game that maker with more product chips, will be our "handyman" winner!

PREPARATION
Distribute 4 product tokens to each player / maker: 1 coin (yellow), 1 Gear (blue), 1 flower (green) and 1 diamond (red). Leave the rest, next to the Fault tokens (black), within reach of all players / makers. Add the 4 service cards. Shuffle the customer cards and put them all face down on the table creating a series of 4 batteries. Turn over the first customer cards each of the batteries.
Shuffle the product cards and deal 5 to each maker. Leave the rest mouth down on the table forming the deck of products. On your side and on your back will create the battery discards, which we will call recycling pile. Whether exhausts the product mallet blends the recycling stack and forms with it a new product mallet. The maker who has recently performed some related activity with creativity or crafts begins the game.

MECHANICS AND GAME DEVELOPMENT
MAKERS is a card game that is developed in turns and in each one of them you can choose between several actions. At the end of your turn you must have at least 5 product cards in your hand, but you can only have 5 product cards in your playing area. In their respective shifts, the makers will try to complete products that demand customer letters using their own product cards.

PHASES OF THE GAME
PHASE 1)
In each round, the makers, by turns, can carry out any of the following actions in any order:
1. Place a product card in your play area.
2. Replace or send to the recycling stack any number of product cards you have on your play area.
3. Use one of the 4 service letters, spending the corresponding product token.
4. Discard any number of product cards in your hand.
PHASE 2)
Draw as many product cards as you need until you have at least 5 in your hand.
PHASE 3)
Turn to the maker on your left.
mechanics: Hand Management, Modular Board, Pattern Recognition, Set Collection, Team-Based Game

name: Starcall
description:
Description from the publisher:

Earth is boring. Long ago stars all over the galaxy went missing. People forgot how to look up and never bothered to ask what happened. You are a Starcaller, a student and astronomer, representing one of the six prime planets in the galaxy. Work with your fellow aliens to go on dangerous journeys and collect valuable star charms. No matter what happens, there's no going back to a world without stars.

Starcall is a highly interactive 2-6 player game of friendship and growth. You will have to strike deals with other players to restore the cosmos and become stronger. As you grow, the need for fellowship will fade. How much will you co-operate and how much will you go off on your own?

Players are tasked with completing journeys which are comprised of dangerous areas filled with monsters. Each character harnesses a unique elemental alignment giving them a large advantage on their planet type. Complete the journey safely by rolling elemental dice and using your special powers. Gain Charms and learn new abilities before attempting to adventure without any companions. The first Starcaller to collect a certain amount of Charms will be crowned the Star Leader.
mechanics: Push Your Luck, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Heartbreak EP
description:
Description from the publisher:

Welcome to the HMS Heartbreak, a luxury escape pod hurtling through the infamous Nobelle Quadrant- home of the largest Space Mall! Well, former space mall, now it's just a debris field filled with old junk from planet Earth. You are one of six passengers sharing a cozy, hi-tech escape pod. Try not to kill each other as you make your way to safety. While you're at it, why not pick up some retro Earth antiques along the way with the tractor beam? Heartbreak EP takes players to the darker side of moons with a punk-rock attitude. Space may be vast, but for passengers aboard the HMS Heartbreak, it's about to feel a whole lot smaller.

Heartbreak EP is a semi-cooperative game of passive aggression. Players need to work together to keep their vessel intact long enough to get to a registered safe planet. The only problem is, you've got frenemies. Each player harbors profound hatred towards another crew member for reasons that don't have to be explained. Can you work together despite your rivalries?

At the beginning of every round, all players will roll their action dice. All players are able to view the results of each die. On a player's turn they will assign dice to the growing number of events that threaten the ship or use them to power their station. Each station performs a function crucial to the operation of the escape pod. Share resources, take resources, or do nothing at all! You didn't choose to be stuck in a pod with them! Bluh.

Heartbreak EP brings new meaning to the expression "Give me some space", and includes play modes for solitaire, fully cooperative, semi-cooperative, team vs team, and traitors.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Team-Based Game

name: MasteRing
description:
User summary:

This is a Dutch game, published around the turn of the millenium.
The players have to answer questions in various categories about the different decennia between 1900 and 2000.

In each turn, a player is allowed to answer up to 3 questions about one decennium. The category of the first question is determined by the position of the spinning wheel on the board, the other two are chosen by the player himself. For every right answer the player marks 1 row on the triangle for that decennium. Three right answers make a 'golden triangle' and give the player the right to mark a row in the 2000 triangle.

Players can try to replace other players' markers by answering questions right in a decennium where the other player has already put markers.
Golden triangles might be overtaken by a 'coup'. The player can now choose the categories of all his 3 questions, but they all have to be right.

The game ends when a player has a golden triangle on the 2000 triangle.

name: Kerfuddle
description:
The object of the game is simple; score more points than your opponents by finding words they haven't found on the 14 Letter Cubes. With the added dimension of the "Shake It Up" cards and the Number Cube, each round is unique.

The "Shake It Up" cards throw players a new twist, and by rolling the Number Cube, the minimum amount of letters needed to write scoring words constantly changes.

name: Grim Reaper Hippopotamus
description: A 2-5 player elimination game. There are 15 cards (20 if 4-5 players are left) face down on the table. In turn order a player will choose a card and do the action on the chosen card. If they draw the reaper they are eliminated and the game is reset with the remaining players.

name: Ye Peculiar Game of Ye Yankee Peddler
description:
This game consists of a deck of 15 large cards, each bearing the name, picture and price of an item that might be sold by a wandering peddler, and four decks (cream, orange, red and blue) of 15 small cards, each with a typical farm product and value.

One player takes the role of the Yankee Peddler, while the others are farmers. On each turn, the peddler places one of his goods face up, while the farmers each play one of their goods cards. The farmer with the highest value card takes the peddler's item, and the peddler writes down the difference between the value of what he sold and what he accepted as his profit (or loss) on that card.

The play repeats until the cards are exhausted. At that point, the peddler adds up his net profit, while the farmers add up the total value of the goods they have purchased. If the peddler's profit is greater than the total value purchased by any farmer, he wins; otherwise, the farmer with the greatest value of products wins.

The rules say that for two players, both are farmers competing for peddler cards as they are turned over. For 5 or 6 players, the farmer cards are distributed equally, but it is suggested that the peddler again be a non-player, as otherwise the peddler will almost certainly win.

name: Wiry Dan's Electric Football Game
description:
This is another in a series of battery-powered outguess-your-opponent games published by Harett-Gilmar in the early 1950s.

The football game is even simpler than its 1953 baseball brother. Each player can touch a wire to one of 5 metallic circles at the ends of the field.

They are labelled for 5 offensive plays: Pass, End Run, Lateral, Line Plunge and Trick Play. The offensive player pushes a metal arrow down onto one of his circles. The defensive player does the same, simply numbering them 1-5. The results are shown on a table on the board. There is a second table for kicks and runbacks. The usual football rules apply and high score wins.

The game itself is undated, but it is very similar to Wiry Dan's Electric Baseball. Alex G. Malloy (American Games) dates that to 1953, but the football game simply as c.1950s.

name: Yacht Race
description:
This 1930s game is a rather simple and odd representation of a yacht race from Montauk Point to Bermuda. The game requires players to choose a point of sailing (Tack to Windward, Reach, Free Reach, Run with the Wind), and yet the game ignores the actual direction of the wind.

The course is a straight line of 30 spaces, and players use a 1-20 spinner. The spinner number gives a result from the table for each of the four points of sailing. So one player can tack to windward while his neighbour runs before the win - even though they are both moving in the same direction!

name: Twin Spin
description:
This undated but likely 1930s British title is an odd combination of two unrelated games using a single mechanism. It consists of a metal spinning disk on top of a spinning arm with a white pointer and circle on one end and a red pointer on the other, all mounted in a yellow metal bowl.

The first game is a dog race. The spinning wheel is divided in six equal and color-coded segments with an illustration of a running dog in those colors. Each segment is divided into four unequal pieces marked with different payout odds (2-1, 4-1, 6-1 and 8-1). Players place bets on a separate betting mat divided into the six color boxes and spin the wheel. Where the pointer stops, that dog wins at the indicated odds and everyone else loses their bets. The player ending with the most money wins.

Outside the dog segments, however, the wheel is divided into 32 segments, each with a single letter. Each letter of the alphabet appears once, except for the five vowels (which get 2 spaces each) and a final square marked "any letter". The rules for this game are not clear absent the instructions, but a box illustration says that "Every correct word scores", suggesting that players perhaps must come up with as many words as possible starting with the letter spun, or including both letters on the opposite ends of the pointer.

name: Military Decisions
description:
Military Decisions is a strategy game in the vein of wargames, but units have no stats. Each player dispatches 100 military units on their side of the board. There are land, naval and air forces. Players have a choice of either moving units or drawing a card that will dictate what the player must do. The card may benefit or penalize them.

Units are placed on the map's intersections, so every unit usually has six directions in which it can move in. You can capture (i.e. remove from the board) enemy units by encircling them. Any enemy unit(s) isolated by your own units or immobilized (no exit paths available) is automatically removed from the board.

The edge of the board, the shoreline for naval units and the waterfront for land units all count toward the capturing rule if they can't escape.

The game ends when either player occupies the opponent's Capital on the board or when the Supreme Command unit is encircled by enemy units.

name: Cat People
description:
Cat People is a card game for 3 - 5 players that will put you in the role of cat lovers. Through every round you will experience hilarious situations, you will adopt cats and will constantly play with them. But watch out! If you gather five felines, you will become an erratic and babbling crazy cat person, and you won’t be victorious.

During the match you will deal with a max of 5 cards in your hand. In these cards, you will find events, adorable kittens and rebel kittens.

Each event card has a unique and special rule.

Adorable kittens are loving felines willing to help you throughout the adventure by activating a special trick every time you play with them!

By contrast, rebel kittens are sullen animals, territorial, or simply chaotic. They always go against you by activating their special trick if you refuse to play with them.

On the other hand, there are also job cards that will grant you unique professional skills and toys for your kittens.

In order to win, you need to take advantage of your event cards in a way that benefits you as a player, while simultaneously overwhelming the rest of the players with kittens. When a player gathers five kittens, he or she will turn into the crazy cat person. The crazy cat person will receive no benefits from his or her job card resulting in victory being unachievable. Instead this player will now have the ability to throw cats at normal people, taking revenge from the players that led to his or her state.

The winner is the one able to keep him or herself mentally sane.
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Take That, Variable Player Powers

name: Cardgammon
description:
A game of Backgammon... with cards!

The game played for thousands of years known widely as Backgammon, now has its card game counterpart.

Players try to play cards matching their dice results and then gather them back in their hands.

A player rolls the dice and plays and/or moves up to 2 cards, then draws a card. Game play gives a new twist to the classic backgammon since it can be played with 2 to 4 players and cards need certain dice results to be played. A number of variants, boosts the game's replayability and offers new ways to play the game.

name: Beam Weapon
description:
Description from the back of the game booklet:

Beam Weapon is a futuristic battle scenario with orbiting killer satellites, tracked beam weapon transports and other high-tech space and ground battle systems. Beam Weapon is a fast, decisive action scenario that depicts the accuracy and sophistication of high-tech weaponry.

Game summary from review of the rules:

The game is a simple hex and counter war game in a futuristic setting, using a mix of space and ground units.

Combat is conducted using a standard combat table and a single die roll, based on the difference between unit offense and defense values. The die result can potentially destroy either the attacker or defender (but not both) based on the odds.

A simplified concealment rule is used for ground units (including bases), the type of unit remaining unknown by the opponent until engaged in combat or spied on.

The goal of the game is the elimination of the opponent's three immobile bases.

name: Cave People
description:
Cave People is a game of prehistoric progress. Match resources to win techs, mix it up with mammoths, or steal hard-earned cards.

Bazillions of years ago, cave people scrounged around looking for grubs and roots and stuff. Probably. Who could say for sure? We wanted to dramatize that struggle through the best story-telling medium ever created: card games.

The basic idea is simple: gather and combine different resources to create and secure technologies for your cave person. Trade with your opponents or steal their hard-fought technologies outright. But watch out - the prehistoric world is rife with dangers like stampeding woolly mammoths and fiery balls of destruction from outer space. Also, religion.

name: Imperium Chronicles: Grunts and Grav Tanks
description:
Grunts and Grav Tanks (G&GT) is a tactical wargame focusing on ground combat in the Imperium Chronicles universe. The game represents individual units (vehicles and infantry) fighting it out between the Imperium and the Magna Supremacy.

Each game can follow a pre-existing scenario or each player can use resource points to buy units. These units include anti-grav, tracked, and wheeled vehicles, as well as different types of infantry (regular, heavy, and jump) and artillery. Optional rules also include orbital bombardment.

Features

--Large full-color map (30" x 22.5”, divided into 9 sections)
--500+ unit counters (full-strength & damaged sides)
--Five scenarios to help introduce players to the game
--Straight-forward rules for fast gameplay

name: Captains and Kings
description:
What: Medieval Warband combat in the 9th to 13th Centuries.

Scale: Each 6 to 12 figure unit represents 40 - 60 actual combatants.

Your Role: Players start as a Captain in command of one unit. But if you succeed in battle, you gain fame and more units on your way to becoming King.

Playability: Designed for solo, same side and head to head play.

Captains and Kings can be played in a variety of ways and contains the following:
• Fourteen different armies, from Viking raiders to crusading Knights.
• Three complete Campaigns including the Kingdom of Jerusalem and Danish raids on England and Ireland.
• Complete rules for carrying out sieges.
• Ten unique but interlocking scenarios.
• Rules for fighting small raids to large battles, with up to 100 figures per side.

Captains and Kings can be played with any figures you already have whether metal, plastic, or paper. Play it as a Campaign where all battles are linked together or as a one-off game.
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling
publishers: Rebel Minis, Two Hour Wargames (THW Game Design)

name: Warrior Heroes: Warbands
description:
What: Fantasy Warband combat

Scale: Each six- to twelve-figure unit represents 40 to 60 actual combatants

Your Role: Players start as a Warlord in command of one unit. But if you succeed in battle, you gain fame and more units on your way to becoming King

Playability: Designed for solo, same-side, and head-to-head play

Warrior Heroes – Warbands can be played in a variety of ways, and contains the following:

Fourteen different armies, including Dwarves, Elves, Orcs, Trolls, Knights, Vikings, and much more

Three complete Campaigns

Complete rules for carrying out sieges

Ten unique but interlocking scenarios

Rules for Wizards (Fireball!), Demons, and Heroes
