Rules for fighting small raids to large battles, with up to 100 figures per side

Warrior Heroes – Warlords can be played with any figures you already have, whether metal, plastic, or paper. Play it as a Campaign where all battles are linked together or as a one-off game.

name: By Savvy & Steel: New Market Round
description:
In New Market Round we give you a large town to adventure in and loads of pre-generated NPCs for you to interact with.

Inside New Market Round you'll find:
50 Professions to help make your characters and the NPCs that you will meet,unique.

New rules covering Doctors, In Sight, and Stunned.

New rules for Fluctuating Rep based on your success or failure.

New rules for interacting with NPCs to build and expand your stories.

Two new Gentlemanly diversions - Three Cards and Horse Racing.

Circles - A quick and easy way to generate NPCs and storylines.

A complete town to adventure in.

Fifteen Encounters that can be played together or separately and much more.
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Renaissance
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Role Playing
publishers: Rebel Minis, Two Hour Wargames (THW Game Design)

name: Advanced Tobruk 2016: Expansion 6 – Tunisia II
description:
From the company website:

Near Cape Bon, Tunisia, 22 April 1943: During mid-April, a series of Allied attacks were launched against the Axis positions in the hills of Tunisia. The US 2nd Corps (now commanded by General Omar Bradley) attacked Hill 609 in “Mousetrap Valley", with the objective of advancing to Mateur. The British 5th Corps attacked “Longstop Hill” and “Peter’s Corner” and the British 9th Corps attacks between Boubellat and Bou Arada. Part of Operation Vulcan, the final Allied offensive to clear Axis forces from Tunisia, particularly the Cape Bon area, saw the Hermann Goering Division sitting astride positions at ‘Cactus Farm’. The elite German paratroop formation would be challenged by the British 4th ‘Mixed’ Division, an infantry unit reconstituted after Dunkirk as an infantry division incorporating a brigade of tanks. As the unit’s Churchills approached the farm, their supporting infantry was shot to pieces. The tanks continued the advance without infantry support and were then attacked in close combat by enemy soldiers. Twelve Churchills were knocked out and the attack was abruptly halted.

TOBRUK 2016 EXPANSION 6: TUNISIA II includes 8 scenarios in color format, a selection of new AFV counters in the new colorway, including AEC I, Churchill I, Churchill III, Tiger I, Pzkw IIIL, Pzkw IIIn, Bishop, and more -- including new camo schemes! Each new AFV type also includes a new, matching AFV Card in the TOBRUK 2016 format and Tiger I turrets!
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II

name: Football
description:
This ca. 1940 football game consists of a thin cardboard field with a single fold and an attached metal spinner; three wooden tokens for marking downs, yards to be gained and quarter; a metal football on a stand; a cardboard 10-yard marker; a results sheet; and line-up and scoring sheets for individual games.

Players choose between 5 offensive plays (line plunge, end run, off tackle, trick play and forward pass). The spinner has numbers from 1-15, and each of these numbers has a result under each play. There also are results tables for punt, kick-off received, and run back of kicks and punts.

The usual rules of football apply and highest score wins.

name: Post Office
description:
Subtitled "The game that sends the message with the mail", this roll-and-move affair was produced as a propaganda vehicle by the American Postal Workers Union.

Players move wooden mailbox-shaped pieces along a track from their home to the post office, and each space is marked with a message such as "Postal Workers Call for Legislation to Save the Postal Service (An extra throw for a good idea.)"

Along the way, players also land on mailbox spaces, where they read a card from a deck of letters. Example: "Dear Mr. Sucquor, We found your package in Poughkeepsie. Should be here in a couple of weeks! Fly-By-Night Private Delivery Inc. (Go back 1 space to learn your lesson)."

name: The Oil Game
description:
This is a rare dexterity-based game published in Scotland in the mid-1970s and themed on the discovery of North Sea oil.

A raised map of Scotland and the UK-side of the North Sea is mounted inside the game box. Four wooden poles, 6.75 inches long and with horizontal holes drilled through near the top, are placed into holes on the corners where wooden feet support the board.

On each of the east and west sides, a string is run from a central hook (metal mounted on a wooden ball and plastic base with holes for the string) up to one of the corner poles, through a blue plastic bead, across to the other pole on the same side, and then back down to the hook.

Six wooden cylinders, each with a letter on top and horizontal openings near the top, are set into holes in the map of Scotland. The players must manipulate the beads so that the hook catches a cylinder, lifts it up, and then moves it over and into its corresponding hole in the North Sea (e.g. the N cylinder goes into the Ninian field).

The player who successfully moves all the pegs in the fastest time wins. The rules suggest the game can be made even more challenging by having players work in teams, with each manipulating one side of the hook.

While the game is undated, it is likely 1976-77, since the latest oil field named on the map is the Argyll, discovered in 1975.

name: Harper's Ferry: September 12th to 15th 1862
description:
Description from the publisher:

This is the twenty second battle in our series of the American Civil Wargames in 3D. The Confederate Army is attacking the outpost of Harpers Ferry.

Historically Major General Thomas J “Stonewall” Jackson has been assigned with the capture of the outpost of Harpers Ferry. It is a Federal arsenal that the Confederates need to acquire in their march across Maryland.

Harpers Ferry is a single day battle that has a time limit of 14 bounds. The Confederates must capture Harpers Ferry and disperse the Union forces. The games design allows for a fast, fun and realistic game within a 1-2 hour period of continuous play. The game gives a flavor of the American Civil War period and a simple chain of command solution adds intrigue to the game, keep the chain of command together and everything is fine, lose it and it could cost you the game?

Combat is designed around the three factors that appear on the unit counters, these indicate the Range, Attack and Strength of the represented unit. You don’t even need any dice to play the game since a dice tile system is included with the game, but if you want to roll dice then it’s the simple six sided variety that you will require.

The game board is designed to be used either 2 dimensional as a straight print and play or 3 dimensional, this takes a little more time to construct but it is well worth the effort for the impressive game board you get at its completion. The final 3D game board gives you a realistic feel to the terrain and shows the tactical dispositions of all the game counters.

Included with the download is the 3D Game Board in two halves, the Harpers Ferry seven page Battle Rules, the Gaming Counters, a simple guide on how to build a 3D Game Board, the Brothers At Arms twenty one page Rules Booklet with Playsheet, a twenty four hour Timeline Table and finally a set of Tile Dice. The game rules are fast and easy to learn and will be the same throughout the full series of American Civil War in 3D.

Can you continue this great series of battles with another victory? Play North or South in this the twenty second game of the American Civil War in 3D series of board games.
categories: American Civil War, Print & Play, Wargame

name: Soccardo
description:
A two-player soccer simulation cardgame.

Players draft their squad of 11 from the 22 available players (whose names are parodies of famous professionals) each rated in 6 offensive and defensive categories. They then pick their 7-man formations, consisting of one keeper and from 1 to 4 players in defense, midfield and attack.

The objective of the game is to move the ball between your players so that you can score a goal. A successful pass moves the ball along the player line or up 1 player line. A successful thru ball or Long pass moves the ball up 2 lines. A successful shot is a goal. Simple right? But if you are unsuccessful in any play, your opponent gets possession and starts their attack.

Once a play is selected, the managers will roll against each other in the battle box to see who wins that challenge. Turning over the game cards may just be the difference as they influence the play.

name: The British Army Desert War Game: Mod Wargaming Rules (1978)
description:
68 page softback book

From the back of the book:
These rules were written in 1968 to wargame, at a tactical level, the desert warfare battles in a potential invasion of Iraq in the mid-1970’s. They are a piece of wargaming ‘archeology.’

The Land Rules for a Wargame in a Desert Setting in 1978 are an example of a military map based wargame. Written both for training and analysis, they have detailed information on matters important to the military and often ignored by hobby wargamers.

Deployment times, lead times for preparation of assaults, ammunition constraints, shadowing retreating units and communications are all dealt with by the rules.

Military wargames are traditional heavily umpired, with a large supporting case of assistants to help run the game, but this book contains guidance on how a modern wargamer can recreate the original game in a practical form on a single map.
publishers: John Curry, The History of Wargaming Project

name: Speed Demons
description:
Speed Demons is a racing game for 2 - 4 players, ages 7+.

Play time is about 20 min.

1 - 8 x 16 checkerboard
16 - Race Tiles, 3 per player in 1 of 4 colors

The player who navigates all 3 of their race tiles around the track and across the finish line first, is declared the winner!

Movement of pieces is controlled by numbers printed along rows and also by the number of pieces within columns.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Children's Game, Print & Play, Racing
mechanics: Grid Movement, Point to Point Movement, Tile Placement

name: Dargammon
description:
Dargammon is a game that takes the classic game of backgammon and gives it a new spin. Play backgammon like you've never played before in this clever card game of modified moves and devilish twists.

To play the game you need a classic set of Backgammon.

The objective, as in classic backgammon, is to remove all of one's own checkers from the board before one's opponent can do the same. Whoever achieves the objective first, is the winner.

The game consists of some classic backgammon variants and cards that modify gameplay by playing one card during a regular turn. The basic backgammon strategy of trying to move pieces along the playing area remains the same, but many elements may change, from dice results to pieces and their allegiance. Each card in Dargammon has that element of twist and take that, which makes the game even more strategic than before.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Print & Play

name: Golden Gate Park
description:
At three miles long and half a mile wide, San Francisco’s Golden Gate Park is a sprawling patchwork of venerable buildings, gardens, meadows, lakes, and paths that go in every direction but straight. It would be nearly impossible to see all of the park in a single day—but let’s try!

Golden Gate Park is a fast-playing board game for 2-4 players. In the game, each player assumes the role of a married couple spending a day visiting historic Golden Gate Park during their trip to San Francisco.

Players begin the game having just arrived from their hotel to the Music Concourse at the heart of Golden Gate Park. The time is 10:00am on a gorgeous weekend morning. Players will take turns traveling about the park visiting its varied attractions, ending the day at 5:30pm sharp for the trip back the hotel.

Every action taken by a player takes a certain amount of time, which must be spent wisely throughout the game. Walk, shuttle or taxi to places like the bison paddock, Stow Lake, Shakespeare Garden, or the California Academy of Sciences. In between attractions you will need to find time to eat—perhaps at the famed Beach Chalet—and to answer the call of nature. And you don’t have unlimited funds so be sure to mind your budget for the day.

You will accumulate—or possibly lose!—valuable experience points along the way, with the player having had the best experience for the day declared the winner.

Components:
• a 17” x 44” mounted board
• one sheet of die-cut tiles
• four custom dice
• 84 wooden cubes, discs and meeples in four player colors
• wooden time tracker
• cloth bag
• rulebook
mechanics: Area Movement, Turn Order: Time Track

name: Game of Baseball
description:
This 1930s Canadian baseball game may be the only existing baseball title that actually features a Canadian maple leaf on the chest of a player on the box top.

While undated, it was probably issued around 1936-7, when a foundering Toronto Maple Leafs baseball team was rescued from a buyout and transfer to Albany, NY, by a group of local investors headed by former Ontario Lieutenant-Governor William Donald Ross.

The game itself is rather basic. It has a folding thin cardboard field and 18 small wooden player disks (9 blue, 9 red). While there are circles on the field and bench for these pieces, their only real function is to mark baserunners.

To bat, players simply roll 2D6, and read the resulting play off a 2-12 table in the rules. The odds are not realistic: the most likely result (7) produces a double, and a batter will get on base almost half the time (17/36). Normal baseball rules apply, with the player scoring the most runs after nine innings winning.

name: College Football
description:
This mid-1930s title was probably the last American football game published in which the drop kick and place kick were shown as different ways to attempt a field goal or extra point - with the drop kick being more likely to succeed. The standard football was made more pointed at the ends in 1934 to make it easier to pass, but the new shape made drop kicks much less reliable, and almost all scoring attempts since have been place kicks.

The game uses the sum of 2D6 to resolve each play. The offensive player has 10 play options (Left End, Left Tackle, Left Guard, Center, Right Guard, Right Tackle, Right End, Spinner Play, Trick Play and Pass). Each of these plays, along with Drop Kick, Place Kick, Punt, Punt Return, Kickoff and Kickoff Return) has its own results column showing yards gained or lost along with possible fumbles and interceptions.

The board has an unusual mechanism for recording the game's progress. It comes with just two pawns, one for recording downs, the other the number of plays. The field has four groups of lines stretching from one end of the field to the other to mark the downs (single, double, triple and quadruple lines), and the ball marker is moved from one to the next to mark downs as well as back and forth to show line of scrimmage. The second peg marks off plays at the end of the board, with a quarter ending after 25 plays and the game after 100. Usual football scoring applies, with most points after 100 plays winning.

name: Pijamas: Omaha
description:
Pijamas stands for the french "Papa Il Joue Avec Moi Aux Soldats" (Daddy plays toysoldiers with me). It is a family of miniatures rulesets which are simple, quick, efficient, educational and fun, with the youngsters as primary target. They all provide a core ruleset which can be completed by optional rules when players see fit. These optional rules add historical flavor and more tactical choices but no complexity.
The system uses only D6.

The first installment in these series is Omaha which was published in the Vae Victis magazine 116.

Omaha covers the famous D-Day landings with two scenarios which can be played alone or in campaign mode: Dog Green; Vierville.

Sequence of play:
1-Player A : Movement
2-Player A: Firing and Melee
1-Player B : Movement
2-Player B: Firing and Melee

name: S.O.S.
description:
Numerous dangers await you as you set out on the journey to the final tower. The sharp teeth of the shark are wating for you to fall into the water. Challenge your friends - see who can outwit the shark and reach the finish first.

Gameplay: The players move forward from tower to tower, across numerous gangplanks, by throwing the dice. Beware! At any moment the shark can move into action; the gangplanks will fall through and the players will be in the water. The player who gets to the final tower with the most counters is the winner.

name: sconos
description:
Two triangles or three blue?

In sconos, you can see your own game pieces only from behind, but you want to know which symbol is visible on the front. Information about these symbols will be made available with each roll of the dice, and whoever can smartly combine those details quickly will reveal the mystery of their pieces first.

name: Banana Spit Card Game
description:
It’s spit and speed–two fast-action card games for fast-thinking kids! In both games get rid of your cards as fast as you can and without going bananas!

Object:
To be the first player to get rid of all of the cards in your stock piles.

Set Up
Shuffle the cards and deal them equally. Each player should have 26 cards. Each of you lay out 10 cards in 4 stock piles in a single row in front of you as follows:

Stock Pile 1 – 1 card face up
Stock Pile 2 – 1 card face down and 1 card face up on top
Stock Pile 3 – 2 cards face down and 1 card face up on top
Stock Pile 4 – 3 cards face down and 1 card face up on top

Place the remaining 16 cards face down in a pile to the left of your stock piles. These are your Spit cards.

How to Play
Together, count down 3, 2, 1, and shout “banana!” and take the top card from your banana pile and place it face up in the center between you.

As in Spit, play cards in sequence up or down onto the 2 center card piles. Only in this version, play cards from your hands. Play as many cards as possible from your hand and then
draw cards from your stock pile so there are always 5 cards in your hand.

If both of you have 5 cards in your hand and neither of you can play a card, count down from 3, shout “banana!” and turn the next banana card face up on a center card. Continue
playing.

If your banana pile runs out take a center pile (leaving the top card in the center), shuffle it well, turn the cards face down and start a new banana pile. Continue playing. When your stock pile runs out continue playing cards from your hand without replenishing.

Game End
The first player to play all of their stock pile cards wins.

name: Ichi Matsu
description: In Ichi Matsu (市松), two players compete to create the largest area of their color by placing tiles of either half-and-half black/white or black/white checkered tiles on a 3x3 cloth board. Tiles can be placed on top of other pieces as long as there are no gaps underneath. When no legal move can be made, each quadrant of your color of the tiles counts as one point. Most points wins.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Grid Coverage, Tile Placement

name: Spell Wars: Collectible Card Game
description: From the publisher: "NEW CCG From MediaStream Press: Spell Wars is a CCG like no other! It removes a lot of the annoyances of other games, with fast action and just enough luck and randomness to make it truly exciting! Use magic sources to put down summoning circles. Use summoning circles to draw forth minions from 7 different elements: Spirit, Air, Fire, Dark, Earth, Water, and Light. Attack and defend with your minions, using standard d6 dice. Empower your warriors with powerful buffs and enchantments. Strike down your enemies with curses and spells! Defeat your rivals with strategy, luck, and your dice-rolling skills! All you need is this book, some d6, and some counters. All the rules you need to play are included in this full-color book with 270 cards! Unlike other card games where you have to go buy pack after pack to get decent cards, they're all included here! No more tapping, no more waiting for the right card, no more watching the rich kid win because of rare cards, no more boring stats comparisons to watch monsters die... This is an innovative system with a LOT of fun updates to classic card games. Use dice to do combat, always have a hand of cards to play, and no more wasted mana and holding back. This is a SLUGFEST type battle. Check it out now!"
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling

name: Kapibara Barabara
description:
When Kapybara-san was playing outside, he was confused and became annoyed.
You have the tremendous ability to help him out!
Let's restore Kapybara-san!
What was the original figure like?

The game is about collecting capybara parts and
Players can take three actions.
· Moving
· Draw cards
· Use Capybara's special abilities
Please select 3 of these and act.

When Capybara returns to their original form, they will use their special special abilities to support them!
Even if you make a new creature, you only draw a special card once. Bonus points are also included.

The game ends once someone has trained six Capybara. The player with the highest score wins.
Using the capability of Capybara well disturbs other players.
Let's collect Kapybara-san sooner!

_________________________________________________________

どしーん★ぶつかってばらばらになってしまいました。

　カピバラさんたちがお外で遊んでいると
どっしーん★　ぶつかって
ばらばらになってしまいました。

そこへ通りすがったすごい能力を持ったあなた！
カピバラさんたちを元に戻してあげましょう！
あれれ？　元の姿はどんなだったのかなぁ？

概要
　バラバラになったカピバラさんたちを集めて錬成しよう！
　元の姿に戻ったカピバラさんたちの特殊能力を使ったり、新しい生き物を作ったりして、得点を競おう。

name: Don't fall in the Mead Hall: Allies and Drunk Guys
description:
This is an expansion and requires the original game "Don't Fall in the Mead Hall."

This game includes a brand new Action Die that you may use instead of the original on your turn. It also includes a medium-sized bag so you can take the game anywhere with ease. This expansion brings in another table with 5 pawns so now you can play with a 5th player. Also included are 5 brand new Skál cards that you can add to your Skál deck (if you have it) and the optional Tipsy card deck.
In addition to the drinking, toasting and fighting of the original Don't fall in the Mead Hall, players now have a chance to sober up (passed out Vikings can wake up) by rolling the feast symbol. Every player will sober up by two (the drunk die will go down two). If you roll the turkey legs symbol your table sobers up by two and you choose another player to sober up by two. Vikings can now bring a sword and shield to the battle mat for a fight to the death. It's double the pain if you roll the new double "Skal!". Every tables drunk die will go up by two. Watch out because there's a chance Vikings at your table will get into a fight with each other if you roll the double fist. The Tipsy cards (optional, if you want to use them) add some extra mystery to each round and can make the game go faster. At the end of each round flip a Tipsy card and see if one of your Vikings can't hold his own.

The last table with at least one Viking standing wins.
categories: Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Party Game

name: Rhyme Time Tabletop Game
description:
Team 1 chooses a card with a word on it. They give Team 2 a word which rhymes with the chosen word. Team 2 has to guess the chosen word, but can express themselves only by acting. When Team 2 mimes the correct word, Team 1 cheers to indicate that they got it right. Play proceeds with the teams alternating roles.

The team that guesses the most words, wins.

name: Freak Out!
description:
The Original Dope Smokers Game

A board game similar in play to Monopoly i.e. Move around the board, passing start, prison and opportunity cards (Freak Out/Contact).

There are 4 concentric circles on the board, Smokers/Dealers/Suppliers/Growers) the aim being to deal your way to the Growers Circle.

name: Brain Game
description:
From the box:

BRAIN GAME is an exciting memory game.

The cards show well-known landmarks - but each card only shows half the picture. The object of the game is to find the matching pairs.

To start, place all the cards face down on the table. Each player in turn turns 2 cards face up. If they make a pair (they are the two halves of the same picture) that player takes the two cards and scores one point. If they do not form a pair, the two cards are turned face down once again and the next player takes a turn.

The game continues until all the matching pairs are found and the player with the most pairs wins the game.

name: Rund um die Welt
description: Up to 7 players travel around the world by different means of travel: car, sailing yacht, bicycle, train, horse, airplane and whaler/dog slet. Each means of travel has it's own colored travel route and it's own travel guide. Movement is determined by a die. On some destinations, events hinder or benefit the player. The first player to reach his starting point wins the game.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Batman Miniature Game: Penguin's Crew
description:
"Ahh... the Batman. While I have an affection for most flying creatures... the winged rat is not among them." - The Penguin

Oswald Cobblepot, known as Penguin to most of Gotham, is one of the best villainous businessmen around. If you want a weapon, he has it. Want someone taken care of, he knows the perfect person to call.

Cobblepot started life teased as a child because of his short stature and bird-like nose earning him the nickname 'penguin' and when his father died of pneumonia, his mother made him carry an umbrella wherever he went which did not help with the rest of the worlds view of him. This led to Oswald becoming a nasty, resentful person that wanted to prove he could be better than those around him while he was growing up.

Cobblepot has a genius level intellect, amazing business sense, he's a tactical mastermind, oddly skilled fighter for his build and has obsessions with birds and his trusty umbrellas.

All of this has made him into the Penguin that now runs most of the crime in Gotham.

The Penguin can out-plan and out-think his opponents with ease but if things ever go wrong he has an entire arsenal of trick umbrellas to fall back on. Everything from guns and grapples to gas, hypnosis and even one that can fly.

His plans, schemes and crimes are often run using money from his legitimate businesses like the Iceberg Lounge and Iceberg Casino. If he needs help, he won't shy away from hiring the best in the world but only if he thinks he will come out better off in the end.

In the Batman Miniatures Game, the Penguin crew is all about money, resources and using them as best as you can to get the job done.

Oswald himself much more dangerous than he looks. Armed with an Umbrella Cannon and Umbrella Blade, he can dish out a lot of damage when he needs to and even has a bulletproof vest under his fine jacket for extra protection. He real strength though is getting his crew and others to do the work for him.

Penguin is Charismatic and a Lord of Business so can hire more Free Agents than most, better equip his own men and even take extra Loot Objectives.

The Penguin thugs are cheap but that also makes them numerous. Throw enough men at a problem and it can be solved. The Penguins extra equipment reserves let him arm his hordes well though. Assault Rifles, Automatic Guns and Grenades are not uncommon to see in the middle of the Thugs.

If the hulking Sickle joins him as a Sidekick, he can also bring along some more Elite Penguin Thugs when the extra skill is wanted.

Instead of hordes of Thugs, Penguin also has the options of hiring almost any Free Agent he needs with his Charisma and $$$ letting him choose people like Deadshot and Deathstroke on a regular basis as deadly assassins.

A couple of very good choices though are Catwoman and Mr Freeze. Freeze adds to the ranged threat of the well armed crew while Catwoman can jump around when your opponent is dealing with all the Thugs. Both also have Loot on their mind so the Penguins extra Loot Objective can help you bump up your VPs.

Overall, a Penguin crew is about strength in numbers. Either the number of bodies you have at your disposal or the number of deadly weapons and skilled assassins you throw at your opponent.

A great starting crew with several options and ways to play for the more experienced players.

Contains:
4 metal miniatures:
- Penguin
- Penguin Emperor
- Royal Penguin
- Blue Penguin
Stat cards for the characters
categories: Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Andoria
description:
A unique take on both the card combat genre of games like Magic the Gathering and Hearthstone, and deck building games like Dominion and Legendary, Andoria is a fast paced game of tactics and diplomacy for 2- 4 players.

The object of the game is to gain the most “Power” by doing the most damage to enemy player's Kingdoms - but they're not going to make it easy. You will have to strategically use Gold to buy different Tactics, Equipment, and Battlefield cards from a shared center Row to fit your play style and adapt to your opponents, recruit Units to aide your chosen Hero that you’ll level up over the course of the game, strategically block, attack, move between Zones, use Abilities, and most importantly decide not just how and which of these to do, but the order in which to do them with our dynamic Round System.

name: Konstellation
description:
The game is played with coloured dice on an 8 x 8 board.

64 wooden cubes are marked with a different colour point on each side. Each player chooses one of the six colours and the dice are evenly divided among the players.

The game consist in two phases:

Phase 1. The players alternate turns playing one die on the board and trying to form 4 in a row.

Phase 2. If no player has reached the previous goal the next phase begins. Now each turn consists in turning the dice on the board. The winning condition changes to be 5 in a row.

name: Mutant: Helldrivers' Siege
description:
A small postcard game based off the Mutant: Year Zero franchise.

The players are members of the motorhead gang called Helldrivers and they're pillaging an Ark for the artifacts contained therein.

Every turn, you get to choose to send more 'drivers to a specific section of the Ark or spend your grub to command them to pillage the artifacts contained on that zone.

Whoever gets more artifacts is the winner.

name: Fairy Rade
description:
Fairy Rade is a card game for 2 to 4 players. Each player is the leader of a Fairy Parade, trying to trick unwary humans into becoming part of their procession. Play continues in a series of rounds, until one player has tricked enough mortals to be declared the new Fairy King or Queen!

Through a series of rounds, players take turns leading a trick by playing one of the cards from their hand, and other players must play a card of the same suit if they have one. The highest ranking card played wins the trick, but there are surprises in the form of Royal Favor and Escape cards!

name: Global War On Terror
description:
Global War On Terror (GWOT) is a low complexity, global geo-political war game for 2-5 players, or just one player using the solo bot cards.

One player controls the terrorist mastermind and his / her lieutenants (subordinates); their identity is unknown. The overall goal of the terrorists is to carry out major attacks on population centres, and to inflict maximum terror to achieve their political, religious, or ideological goals. To achieve this, the terrorists will recruit jihadists (to provide manpower), collect funds (to finance plots), and collect materials (e.g. bio-toxins), all of which are required to launch terror attacks.

The other players in the game control the opposing counter terrorist agents. Their primary goal is to work cooperatively to disrupt terror plots by collecting plot-specific Intel (intelligence). Counter terrorists may also carry out surveillance, drone strikes, and deploy special forces to eliminate jihadists, terrorist cells, and training camps, thereby impeding the progress of their plots.

VICTORY CONDITIONS
The game ends and the winner(s) declared when any of the following apply:
• The Global Terror Track marker reaches 10 (terrorists win).
• The counter terrorists identify and eliminate the terrorist mastermind (counter terrorists win).
• If the Global Terror Track marker has not reached space ‘10’ after ten game turns, the counter terrorists win.

This game has been entered into the 2016-17 war game print and play contest:
https://boardgamegeek.com/thread/1626631/2016-17-wargame-pri...

This game won 3rd Prize in the Best Strategic Game category.

Note:

The components and rules in this game are prototypes for play testing, and therefore subject to change.
The game designer claims no copyright on any of the photographic images appearing in the game.
categories: Modern Warfare, Political, Print & Play, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Point to Point Movement, Simulation

name: Iron League: Black Stadium – Nuke Tracker
description:
With 3 miniatures: Paul "The Legend", Nora "The murk" and the Mech "Little guy", 1 Misionbook with 5 missions, 10 new equipment cards and 5 building tiles. Cooperative without Master.

Expansion for Iron League: Black Stadium
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction

name: Beyond the Pale
description:
It is the year 1173, the Normans have invaded Ireland and King Henry II has laid claim to the island. But beyond Dublin, the old ways still rule and the ancient houses of Ireland hold sway. Take up the mantle of a young chieftain as you work to build your clan, expand your kingdom and gain the loyalty of your fellow Irish. Beyond the Pale tracks the Norman occupation and the Irish resistance over three centuries, spanning the invasion of the Bruce from Scotland, the Black Death, and the Norman retreat to their last vestige of power, the Pale of Dublin.

Beyond the Pale is played over five rounds. Each round players work to expand the influence of their clan by conquering neighboring lords, making alliances with Norman nobles and gaining the loyalty of the Irish people. The player with the largest territory and greatest loyalty at the end of the fifth round wins and is named as the High King of Ireland.

name: Grill Time
description:
A quick and easy real time dice rolling game for any number of players.

The box includes enough materials for 2 players, but more components can be added.

You'll be rolling, rerolling, and locking dice during a three-minute countdown to grill more food than your opponents.

Each player gets 6 dice with both charcoal faces and food faces. Dice can be locked on the player mat and charcoal added to "cook" that food item, which can then be scored.

name: Fahnen-Spiel
description:
Each player starts with 14 soldiers and 1 ensign on the 15 spaces between two castles. Movement is one space in any direction. The river can only be crossed on the three bridges. Enemy pieces can be captured by jumping over the piece onto an empty space behind it. Capturing is alowed in any direction but backwards. To win the game one has to capture the enemy ensign or move one's own ensign onto one of the enemy's starting spaces.

On the backside of the game board, there is an "Nine Men's Morris" board.

name: Unkindness of Ravens
description:
"Out of curiosity... Amelio Gonzolez... stuck a flaming candle... in the protruding ear of... Maria Sanchez... and smiled wickedly."

Uncover an act most cruel by revealing six story elements that together describe the treachery and spell the word UNKIND.

Careful though, your opponents are equally devilish, so you'll need to use your letters, corvid tokens, and perhaps summon a black raven to stop them. 2 to 5 players and plays in about 20 minutes.

The Corvid Tokens can also be used to expand your options and deepen your strategy in Murder of Crows.

OBJECTIVE:
Be the first player to spell the word UNKIND in front of you and then read the Act Most Cruel along the bottom of the cards aloud to win.

PLAY:
On your turn you draw 1 card and play 1 card in front of you in order to spell the word UNKIND.

When played, a card's ability is activated:

Undo: Pick a player, they must return the last card they played into their Unkind to their hand.
Need: Draw 1 card and 1 corvid.
Kill: Remove one letter from an opponent’s UNKIND
Investigate: Draw 2 corvid Tokens, then look at a player's hand.
Drag: Collect 1 corvid Token from another player.


Alternatively, a player can acquire a Corvid Token:

When casting a spell, a player may instead draw a corvid token. Spell does not occur.
When drawing a card, a player may instead draw a corvid token.


Countering Card Abilities:
When a card is played, another player may prevent its effect from affecting them (alone) by discarding a card from their hand. The discarded card must have the same number of Crows in the top left corner as the card played.

Using Corvid Tokens

When playing a letter card, a player may spend corvid token(s), to increase the crow value of the card by 1 crow per token.
When countering a spell, a player may spend corvid token(s), to increase or decrease the crow value of the card by 1 crow per token.
Before ending their turn, a player may place corvid token(s) on any empty letter spot(s) in another player’s UNKIND. Players may add to spots with corvid token(s), but no letter spot may every contain more than 5 corvid token.


Corvid Tokens in your Murder

When there is one or more corvid tokens in your murder, you may only play a letter card into that spot if you over come the total number of Birds in the spot. The player can do this with just a letter card, or it may require additional crows added to the card (An empty spot with 5 corvid tokens, could be removed with a 3 Crow Letter card and 3 corvid tokens). Once overcome, all the corvid tokens are removed.
A Wild Crow/Raven card may be placed in a empty spot regardless of corvid tokens. The corvid tokens are all removed.


Wild Ravens Cards
In Unkindness of Ravens, each Raven card has a unique ability written on the card.
mechanics: Hand Management, Set Collection, Take That

name: Battles from the Age of Chivalry
description:
Rob Markham returns with 12 Battles from the Age of Chivalry. Using his famous R&R system, updated and modified for these battles. The battles included are:

Hastings
Lincoln
Bouvines
Marchfield
Stamford Bridge
Kalaura
Bannockburn
Lake Peipus
Legnano
Leignitz
Virkov
Brunkeberg

Of medium complexity, rated a 4 on a scale of 1 to 10, 10 being hardest, the game is well suited to solitaire play. Recommended for ages 12 and above.

Projected Contents:
12x 22x17 full-color maps
6x full-color, die-cut, counter sheets of half-inch counters
1x Rules Booklets
1x Scenario Booklet
Charts and Tables
Dice

name: Edge: Clans of Icosara
description:
Lore.
...Your Shieldbearer falls, shield broken and stomach pierced by the Sword of the opposing champion. You move your Archer into the frontline – Encouraged by your Priestess, he shoots an arrow at the Magician, covered against melee attacks. With an arrow in his chest, he falls. You watch as the Warlord frowns at the result. The loss of his Magician was not part of his plan. Desperately, he orders his Conqueror to battle to face your Monk

With an empowered, overwhelming strike your Monk puts the Conqueror in the grave, exposing the opposing strategist. Rising to the occasion enters your Champion. He charges the Strategist and with a single swing of his sword the Strategist – The Savages only hope – is decapitated, securing your victory. Icosara is yours.

Game Concept
Edge Is a tabletop card game where two players wage war on each other using cards, dices and tactical formations. The game has a heavy emphasis on strategy and calculated tactics and plays both like a boardgame and a living card game.

It is very easy to get into the game and the rules seem almost simple, but don't let that fool you. The more you get play it, the more advanced formations you and your opponent will come up with.
Through different tactics and different setups, you will delve into the over 14.000 different ways to set up your army.

Though playing it gives a similar vibe, Edge is not Magic or even a rework of the game. No more arguing about obscure rules or different versions of the same. This game combines elements and inspiration from multiple games, that most gamers will recognize, but the mechanics are utilized in such a way that the game forms it's own new genre.

So choose your tactics and strategy!
How will you choose to play and how will you ensure victory? Do you want to charge at your opponent with brute force, or do you want to slowly lure him into your traps to weaken him before the deathblow. The choice is yours.

Goal of the Game
Most points win!
So in the normal game you will need to accumulate more points then your opponent in a 2 matchs/battles setup.
There are variants but even for those most points win

Resources
This game as stated in the game concept, is about resources. your card/pawns, dices, re-rolls and everything else is a limited resource and you will need to think about when and when not to use them or you will quickly find yourself with any way to protect your army and lose.
categories: Card Game, Dice, Mythology, Print & Play
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Player Elimination, Variable Player Powers

name: Panama (パナマ)
description:
User summary
パナマ (Panama) is a investment card game for 4 players only, which uses a deck of traditional playing cards and 20 card stands made with a 3D printer. The rules are available in Japanese and English. (In Japan, the standard deck of Western playing cards is known as a 'Trump' deck. Hence the designer explaining the game as a 'Trump Extension' game.)

Cards numbered A, 2, 3, 4, 5, and two jokers are investment cards. Five cards each are dealt to the players. Cards numbered 6-10 are tax haven cards. Players try to earn positive tax haven cards by playing investing cards.

When you invest on a tax haven card, you place a card stand along a border of the tax haven card and insert an investment card you want to play, so that one player cannot see how much you invest. Up to four players can invest on a tax haven card, and the highest investor earns the face value of that tax haven card. But one pre-determined suit counts negative, and a joker also inverts the sign if involved. You should speculate about hidden cards and try to let negative points go to other investors.

You can co-operate with one of other players by sharing complete information about what you play. But to win the game, you have to part ways in the end.

Jacks, Queens, and King are agent card. Each player has one of these at the beginning of a game, and can use it once for one shot effect, such as reversing order or skipping a player.

Publisher's summary
トランプ拡張ゲーム「パナマ」

トランプ(Playing Card)を
・投資カード　・タックスヘイブンカード　・工作員カード
に分け、場に出されたタックスヘイブンカードの周囲を
投資カードを付属のカードスタンドで立てていき、点数を稼いでいきます。
情報漏洩事務所(Panama paper office)への投資は減点となるため、他人におしつけます。
トランプを立てて置くと、４人の内１人からは必ず絵柄が見えなくなるため
プレイヤーは常に誰を騙すか選択することになります。
協調することで点は増えますが、最終的には出し抜いて１位を目指します。
categories: Abstract Strategy, Bluffing, Card Game, Economic

name: Zagor: Odissea Americana – Trampy Promo Card
description:
Zagor: Odissea Americana: Trampy Promo Card is one of a set of 4 event cards to be added to those in the Zagor: Odissea Americana base game. The cards are simply shuffled in with the base game cards, adding more variety from game to game.

The first 3 italian versions of the cards (Molti occhi, Trampy and Icaro La Plume) were given to the visitors of Lucca Comics & Games 2016, a comics & gameplay festival in Lucca in 2016, and later during other promotional events with the 4th card (Insidie sul fiume). It's one of the first additional cards for the Italian edition of Zagor: Odissea Americana.

Text:

Trampy
Cico non tira dadi azione. Nota: Sacrifica un dado azione giocatore
Cico does not roll any action die. Note: Sacrifice one action player die
categories: Adventure, Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Variable Player Powers

name: Zagor: Odissea Americana – Icaro La Plume Promo Card
description:
Zagor: Odissea Americana: Icaro La Plume Promo Card is one of a set of 4 event cards to be added to those in the Zagor: Odissea Americana base game. The cards are simply shuffled in with the base game cards, adding more variety from game to game.

The first 3 italian versions of the cards (Molti occhi, Trampy and Icaro La Plume) were given to the visitors of Lucca Comics & Games 2016, a comics & gameplay festival in Lucca in 2016, and later during other promotional events with the 4th card (Insidie sul fiume). It's one of the first additional cards for the Italian edition of Zagor: Odissea Americana.

Text:

Icaro La Plume
Quando entra in gioco, Icaro La Plume viene preso dal timoniere. Puoi associarlo a un movimento per spostarti in qualunque spazio. Dopo averlo usato, passa Icaro La Plume a un altro giocatore. Nota: Questo evento non può essere scartato
When it comes into play, Icarus La Plume is taken by the helmsman. You can associate it with a movement to move in any space. After using it, pass Icarus La Plume to another player. Note: This event can not be discarded
categories: Adventure, Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Variable Player Powers

name: Zagor: Odissea Americana – Insidie sul fiume Promo Card
description:
Zagor: Odissea Americana: Insidie sul fiume Promo Card is one of a set of 4 event cards to be added to those in the Zagor: Odissea Americana base game. The cards are simply shuffled in with the base game cards, adding more variety from game to game.

The first 3 italian versions of the cards (Molti occhi, Trampy and Icaro La Plume) were given to the visitors of Lucca Comics & Games 2016, a comics & gameplay festival in Lucca in 2016, and later during other promotional events with this card (Insidie sul fiume). It's one of the first additional cards for the Italian edition of Zagor: Odissea Americana.

Text:

Insidie sul fiume / Perils on the river
Scopri i pericoli dietro il battello. Ogni giocatore può pagare un gettone (simbolo) per scartare un pericolo. Se restano almeno:
due eventi: rimuovi segnalino scafo (simbolo) più a destra
una pianta carnivora: il battello subisce danno (simbolo) pari alla velocità attuale
una rapida: avanza il battello di uno spazio e svuota la cambusa
Find out the dangers behind the boat. Each player can pay a token (symbol) to discard a danger. If there are at least:
two events: remove the rightmost hull marker (symbol)
a carnivorous plant: the boat takes damage (symbol) equal to the current speed
rapids: the boat moves forward one space and empties caboose
categories: Adventure, Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Variable Player Powers

name: Batman Miniature Game: Bane Crew
description:
In the Batman Miniatures Game there are a couple of different versions of Bane to run your crew.

Arkham Origins Bane is a skilled fighter and a skilled planner. A danger to anyone that gets too close to him.

This Bane is often followed by a team of Mercenaries. These Mercs are well trained and very well armed. Bringing a selection of weaponry, they are all Veteran combatants and each also wears a Bulletproof Vest for protection.

This set contains four new miniatures and their associated character cards. Now you can build an army of mercenaries for the Batman Miniature Game.
categories: Comic Book / Strip, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Scrum Card Game
description:
The Scrum Card Game supports learners of agile framework SCRUM. Players act in a collaborative team environment during game play. Multiple teams are playing against each other. The objective of the game is that a team of players plan and work on a product's abstract working packages aiming to complete as many working packages as possible. The more functional the product gets the better the players perform in a team. Best team with most functional product wins. Teams with less functional product will lose. A team acts in collaboration while the teams have a competition against each other.

The card deck of the Scrum Card Game consists of four types of cards:

Story cards describing features the team wants to create for a product,
Event cards with positive, neutral, or negative impact on game play and progress,
Problem cards describing permanent obstacles on planned Stories, and
Solution cards helping players on occurred Problems.


By rolling two dice on each player's turn an amount of working hours per day spent on a working package is determined. This way if a full round (each player finishes an own turn) has finished a working day is simulated. Each three simulated days (which is called a Scrum Sprint) the players replan their work in a agile way. Game ends after three Scrum Sprints.

The card game is used so that players experience work in a simulated SCRUM sprint scenario. It allows reflection of many aspects and topics that happen in real life while working in
a SCRUM team, too.
categories: Card Game, Dice, Educational, Print & Play

name: The Great Whee Race!
description:
The Great Whee Race is a tabletop racing game set in an alternate prehistory where our Human ancestors – the Archaic Homo sapiens, or Ahs for short – rub elbows with Neanderthals, Dino sapiens (dinosaur men), Florz (small Ahs), & other species. Dinosaurs still roam the Earth & magic actually works! A sub-species of early Humans called Neuro-Evolutionary Rostral Developers (abbreviated as N.E.R.D.s) has recently evolved, & N.E.R.D.s have been busy inventing all sorts of amazing “cavepunk” stuff.

One of their most popular inventions is the downhill racer, popularly known as the Whee in Cave-Speak. Many different styles of Whees have been invented, & the N.E.R.D.s who invent them almost always claim their design is the best.

A bunch of prehistoric Clans have gotten together to test these claims. The Great Whee Race is about to begin! Each player chooses a Whee Racer, & then purchases a Crew & Cavepunk inventions. The racers then vie to be the first to cross the finish line in a race down a big hill. And just about anything goes in The Great Whee Race, so you’ll have to outmaneuver, outfight, & outwit your opponents in order to win!

The Great Whee Race is played on a track overlaid with a square grid. From 2 to 5 racers vie to make it to the finish line first. Each racer - called a Whee in Cave-Speak - is controlled by 1 player (or team of players), A variety of prehistoric-ish species serve as crew members, & give various bonuses. Whees can be outfitted with melee weapons, missile weapons, or both, as well as cavepunk inventions.

Once the downhill journey begins, a simple card-based simultaneous movement & action system is used so that players don’t know where anyone else is going when they choose their movement. This has 2 nice effects: players are all active throughout most of each turn, & perhaps more importantly, there are usually LOTS of collisions.

A unique “game mechanic” is used to resolve all actions: the Rok Draw. Every time they attempt an action or have a contest with another player, a player draws from a pool of tokens consisting of 3 kinds of Roks. Bonuses & penalties add to or subtract from the number of Roks drawn. Most actions have the same target for success, so they are resolved quickly. Players can use 1 of 6 pre-made Whees & crew, or can customize their own using a simple point build system. There’s another PDF included with track sections, templates, Whee Racer stat cards & models, & all the tokens you’ll need.

name: Exile In The Forest
description:
An adventure game of ancient India set in the world of The Mahabharata.

The five Pandava brothers are exiled to the forest for 12 years before they can claim the throne of Hastinapura. But there is no doubt their evil cousins will not relinquish it when they return and so those 12 years must be spent gathering allies and weapons to prepare for war.

You'll be exploring a map, dealing with events as you move, and defending against attacks with lots of dice. There are four kingdoms whose allegiance you seek and you can do quests for each one of them as well as personal quests to improve yourself for the coming war.

Each player character can upgrade their number of attack and defense dice as they complete quests and survive events.

There are only twelve years to get prepared for the war.

Each turn you have three movement you can use. For each step, though, you might have an encounter. These can be combats or skill checks or stat loss. Your turn ends when you can't go any further, or don't want to. Many areas can only be utilized if you begin your turn there.

You'll work together to build up reputation with four neighboring kingdoms. There are a variety of ways to do that and they can be different each game. You must also complete a personal quest. To win the game at the end of twelve years (three turns per player per year) you must have ten reputation with each of the four kingdoms and every player character must have completed his personal quest.

name: Payoff Pitch Baseball: 1954 Cards
description:
Payoff Pitch Baseball: 1954 Cards is a set of 662 cards — including players and parks — printed on high-gloss heavy cardstock for use with the Payoff Pitch Baseball base game.

L/R splits on batter cards as with all Payoff Pitch Baseball sets.

name: Payoff Pitch Baseball: 1948 Cards
description:
Payoff Pitch Baseball: 1948 Cards is a set of 550 cards — including players and parks — printed on high-gloss heavy cardstock for use with the Payoff Pitch Baseball base game.

L/R splits on batter cards as with all Payoff Pitch Baseball sets.

name: Payoff Pitch Baseball: 1940 Cards
description:
Payoff Pitch Baseball: 1940 Cards is a set of 565 cards — including players and parks — printed on high-gloss heavy cardstock for use with the Payoff Pitch Baseball base game.

L/R splits on batter cards as with all Payoff Pitch Baseball sets.

name: Payoff Pitch Baseball: 1933 Cards
description:
Payoff Pitch Baseball: 1933 Cards is a set of 525 cards — including players and parks — printed on high-gloss heavy cardstock for use with the Payoff Pitch Baseball base game.

L/R splits on batter cards as with all Payoff Pitch Baseball sets.

name: Payoff Pitch Baseball: 2012 Cards
description:
Payoff Pitch Baseball: 2012 Cards is a set of 1,325 cards — including players and parks — printed on high-gloss heavy cardstock for use with the Payoff Pitch Baseball base game.

L/R splits on batter cards as with all Payoff Pitch Baseball sets.
publishers: PT Games, Inc., Sideline Strategy Games

name: Dog Magic
description:
A 2-player, interactive, deductive reasoning and dexterity game for all ages.

Play requires one Overlord to set up the board, hiding the treasure within the specially constructed pockets. The other player manipulates the board, searching for the hidden treasure(s) by dislodging the pocket covers.

The object of the game is to recover all hidden treasure, and either consume it or exchange for victory points.

Play time varies, depending on player aptitude and general intelligence.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Action / Dexterity, Animals, Deduction, Puzzle, Real-time

name: Spaceman Adventure
description:
Spaceman Adventure is a strategy board game for 3-8 players with quick turns and deeply convoluted strategy. Players take on different roles round after round as they tactically move spacemen and aliens around the game board to maximize their rewards. Every round players choose from a panel of tactical actions and character cards, all of whom earn crystals in different ways. Your reward will depend on what you do, what your opponents do, what you think your opponents will do, what you think your opponents think you will do, etc. etc. At the end of 6 rounds, the player with the most crystals wins. The game has a retro sci-fi feel, simple gameplay and deeply complex strategies.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Open Drafting, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Phase Order

name: Achievus
description:
Achievus is a cooperative board game of positive interaction. The game is about achieving a common goal together with an alliance while reviewing and discussing the 17 Success Principles written by Dr. Napoleon Hill (author of the classic book Think and Grow Rich). When the alliance collects more than 2,000 PMA (Positive Mental Attitude) points together they win the game by accomplishing the highest achievement level. If a player in the alliance loses all of his or her 11 Opportunity Time Tokens the game ends for the alliance. As a result, the players compare their alliance’s PMA (Positive Mental Attitude) point total with a range of achievement levels.

This Achievus board game base set includes two games in one, “Achievus Junior” A.K.A. “Achievus Mind-Set” (2 to 4 players, Ages 7+) and “Achievus Original” A.K.A. “Achievus Challenge” (1 to 4 players, Ages 14+). Achievus game includes 112 Cards, 4 Conscious/Subconscious Mind Boards, 4 Golden Rule Applied Tokens, 60 PMA Point Tokens, 44 Opportunity Time Tokens, 2 Token Bags, and the rules for both original and junior game variations.

Achievus Junior – Game Play Overview

While playing Achievus Junior each player takes a turn in clockwise order to complete a round of play. A player takes his or her turn by following these 5 steps;

Step 1) Draw Step - Draw up to 6 cards, if needed.
Step 2) Call Step - Call out a card to a player for a possible match.
Step 3) Give & Take Step - Give and Take a card with a player.
Step 4) Play Step - May play down any needed pairs for the player’s collection of the 17 principles,
Step 5) Redraw Step - Redraw up to 6 cards.

If the players don’t have a match during Step 2 then the calling player will lose one of his 11 Opportunity Time Tokens. When it’s a match both players add the needed principle card to his or her collection of 17 principle cards. Then they read the principle meaning from the card aloud and discuss it with their alliance. The goal of Achievus Junior is for each player to help one another to collect a card of all 17 principles, without losing all of his or her Opportunity Time Tokens. Only then will the players earn the Golden Rule Applied Tokens, the ultimate achievement of the game.

Achievus Original – Game Play Overview

While Playing Achievus Original, players will experience prosperity and adversity events throughout the game, earning PMA points and Action Stars. All players’ follow these 6 consecutive steps together, each step before the next, to complete a round of play.

Step 1) Draw Step - Each player draws five cards, resolving any adversity or prosperity events.
Step 2) Sacrifice Step - Each player may or may not choose to sacrifice his turn, discarding his cards and losing only one Opportunity Time Token this way.
Step 3) Collect Step - Each player may choose to collect the cards they have previously played in their Conscious Mind Section to earn PMA points and Action Stars or may choose to continue gathering without collecting at this time.
Step 4) Play Step - Each player plays his or her cards in consecutive order in any players’ Conscious Mind Section, earning PMA points for giving.
Step 5) Missed Opportunity Step - Each player loses one of his or her 11 Opportunity Time Tokens for each principle card not played then discards them.
Step 6) Read Step – Read the top discarded principle card. Players then share aloud how they have applied this principle in his or her life with their alliance.

The goal of Achievus Original is to strategize among the alliance to make the best possible plays. Players need to prepare for Adversity Events that may take away the Principle Cards in a player’s Conscious Mind Section. Players work together to gather all 17 Principle Cards in one player’s Conscious Mind Section. When this is accomplished, that player collects the cards (During Step 3) which includes all 17 principle cards. Only then will the players earn the Golden Rule Applied Tokens, the ultimate achievement of the game.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Hand Management, Memory, Set Collection, Storytelling

name: Pijamas: Operation Cobra
description:
Operation Cobra is the first expansion to the Pijamas: Omaha miniatures ruleset published in the magazine Vae Victis #116.

It covers the offensive launched by the First United States Army seven weeks after the D-Day landings, during the Normandy Campaign of World War II.
The intention is to provide simple and quick additional rules to simulate the fierce fighting of Operation Cobra in taking into account the specificities and the constraints of the bocage country.

name: Nailbiter Football
description:
The flagship title of Nailbiter Games, Nailbiter Football is a simulation designed for the solo player. Instead of resolving a game through an extended play-by-play process, you will experience all the scoring, drama, tension and heartbreak of a pro contest through a series of game highlights and crucial turning points.

The player will compete against a Ghost Coach who calls plays based on a roll on a Play Selection Chart based on down and distance. There are 14 Offensive plays to choose from, and three special Defensive plays.

The outcome of each possession is determined by cross referencing the roll of two six-sided dice with the appropriate chart.

I've tried this game and Soren Narnia's Coach's Call Football and both are easily modified for a quite realistic representation of the pro football game. In fact, with some modifications they play better and easier than much more costly games that bog down in individual player detail and an over-abundance of charts.

Definitely worth checking out.

name: First Division Football
description:
First-Division Football (FDF) is a quick-play solo soccer simulation, designed to allow recreation of entire league fixture lists in a short amount of time (typical playing time for a match is 2 minutes). The back-and-forth nature of game play makes each match a suspenseful event, allowing for early blowouts, late comebacks and everything in between.

FDF is designed to produce realistic results in the following categories:

Club won-draw-lost records
Halftime and Fulltime match scores
Goalscorers
Home/Away club performance


- Home/Away goalscorer performance

FDF is available as a free Print and Play download, which includes team statistics for the 1992 French League, the 1992 Italian League, and 1998 English Premier League.

Three ten sided dice are needed to play, which are cross referenced with the team charts to determine goal attempts, scorers, and the end of a half.

name: Stinger!
description:
Description from the back of the box:
"Stinger! is a two-person game between Yellow Bees and Black Bees.
Move, jump, or push bees on each turn...But beware of Stingers!

It us Easy-to-Learn, Quick-to-Play, and Lots-of-Fun!
Capture your opponent's Queen or capture your opponent's Home to win!"

Rules intro - "Stinger! is played on a hexagonal board with yellow marbles (Yellow Bees), black marbles (Black Bees), and red marbles (Stingers). Each set of Bees includes 6 Worker Bees and 1 Queen Bee. Stingers are used as you play.

The object of the game is to capture your opponent's Queen or capture your opponent's Home."

name: CardFit
description:
Description from the publisher:

CardFit is a card game that blends exercise and strategy together into one fun, addictive product.

There are two primary modes of play: 1st to 40! and Bid War.

In 1st to 40!, players take turns drawing exercise and repetition cards, then performing the movements that are described on the cards. Starting in the second round, players may begin to use modifier cards, which can do anything from change the exercise, skip a player, increase the amount of repetitions, and even make other people perform additional exercises.

A player earns the number of points listed on the card for successfully completing a round. The first player to earn 40 points, wins.

In Bid War, players divide the repetition cards equally between them and draw 3 modifiers. Each round, an exercise card is drawn. Players then bid by using their rep cards. The highest bid gets to do the exercise for the number of reps they bid. In the case of multiple players bidding the same number, those players may all do the exercise or they can play an additional bid--that additional bid adds to the number of reps that they have already played. After the bidding, players may use modifiers to alter the workout. Players earn the points listed on the card for successfully performing the exercise. The player with the most points after all the rep cards are done, wins! In groups of 4 or more, it is acceptable to reshuffle and re-deal the rep cards once or twice in order to extend play.

CardFit brings friends and family together in a fun and competitive environment while enabling them to exercise at the same time. This game is child friendly

name: Horde of the Strings
description:
It began long, long ago (last year), when Sour John moved into our quiet town of Little Worth. At first all of us were excited, because a silly string store was opening in town, and Sour John’s dad was handing out free samples to all the kids in the mall. We had a blast! But the spoiled brat “Sour John”, as we would later come to call him, wasn’t satisfied. He wanted to rule the entire mall, and eventually all of Little Worth. Sour John was a child genius, and he soon opened his own weapon store, “More Gore!”, in the mall. This is where he conducted his late night experiments to perfect a can of silly string that would be unbreakable, unending, AND impossible to resist. One night he went to the fountain in the greenery section of the mall, “Fount Bloom”, and discovered that Fount Bloom’s special mixture was exactly what was needed to craft his most diabolical creation – “ONE STRING TO RULE THE MALL!”

Fortunately for us all, he misplaced The One String before he was able to wield it. It was found by a good kid, nick-named “Seagull”, but it quickly corrupted him. He started using The One String as deodorant and calling it “my freshness”. (Yeah, it was weird.) Seagull took up with the wrong kids, the “Redheads”, and later changed his name to “Gold Thumb” (based on his newfound obsession with the James Bond movie “Goldfinger”). But again, as fate would have it, “Billy Bob” Braggin found The One String in Gold Thumb’s discarded lunchbox, and he kept it safe for a while. Most recently he just gifted it to his younger cousin, “Fro-Gro” Braggin. But Sour John has just discovered that the Braggin family is in possession of The One String. He has dispatched his scariest goons, the “Nostrils”, with robes and skateboards of black, to retrieve The One String and bring it back to “More Gore!”

The two groups of good kids in Little Worth Mall, “Yellow Ship” and “Lean & Green”, have just held a secret meeting at “Livin’ Well”, a natural supplement store owned by “Spell Wand’s” parents. They have decided that Yellow Ship will undertake the dangerous task of taking The One String all the way (downstairs) to Fount Bloom, the only place where it can be dissolved forever. Meanwhile, Lean & Green will serve as a distraction to keep the Redheads and the Nostrils away from The One String. Secrecy is of the utmost importance. Each of them grabs their can of silly string and prepares for battle.
The “horde of the strings” has been set loose in Little Worth Mall! Who will deploy their forces the most efficiently, and what will become of The One String?

"Horde of the Strings" is a simple game with 42 unique cards representing the characters in the story, 1 map, and 1 rulebook.

OBJECT OF THE GAME: To draft and then play your cards effectively so that you have as FEW points as possible at the end of the round. (Normally the lowest score possible would be 0.) Also, be aware that at the end of the round if one player has BOTH the “Sour John” and “The One String” cards in their hand, they get to SUBTRACT 50 points!
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Deduction, Humor, Novel-based, Party Game, Print & Play
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Take That, Variable Player Powers

name: Make One
description:
While the instructions say that two or more may play, each player needs 5 cards and there must be a draw pile, so, with 72 cards in the deck, there is a limit in how many may play.

The purpose of the game is to find "units" in your hand. A unit is

fractions that add up to 1
percents that add up to 100%
fractions and percents that together add up to a unit.


Each card can be added either as a fraction or a percent. Some cards give the percent as the larger number, with the fraction as the smaller number, and some do the reverse. Each card also has a circle with a "pie wedge" that shows the given percent/fraction.

The cards are shuffled and each player is dealt five cards. The rest of the cards form the draw pile. The top card is turned face up to form the discard pile.

On their turn, a player takes one card, either from the top of the draw pile or from the top of the discard pile. With their cards, the player tries to make a unit. Each card can be used only once.

If a player finds a unit, they lay it down, face up, and explains how it makes a unit. Then they put the unit into their "unit pile".

If a player lays down a unit, they draw from the draw pile until they have six cards again (if they did not make a unit, they will have six cards, and will not need to draw).

Lastly, the player discards a card on the discard pile. Then it is the next player's turn.

When all of the cards are gone from the draw pile, the players continue to play as long as they can, drawing from the discard pile only. They cannot fill their hands and do not need to discard.

The winner is the one with the most units in their unit pile. Alternately, the winner may be the one with the greatest number of cards in their unit pile, whichever is agreed upon beforehand by the players.

name: COMPUS
description:
COMPUS is a game for 1 to 4 people (estimated minimum age to play: 8 years and older).

In COMPUS each player will simulate being a computer program and try to get the desired result (a combination of bits) before the others.

To do so, players will use operation cards (not, or, and, xor, rotate left/right, increment, decrement, copy of bits) on the shared registers of the CPU board or copy register values to their RAM board.

Every turn, each player must do the following:

1) Know how much CPU time is available rolling the die to get 1, 2, or 3 units of time.

2) Play as many operation cards as time units have been asigned in the previous step. It is not mandatory to play all of them, it is possible to yield the CPU.

3) Take as many operation cards as they have been played in the previous step (they can not be used until the next turn).

The operation cards perform computational operations on the A, B, C and D registers of the CPU. All players can modify the values of all the bits in all 4 registers of the CPU, but they will not be able to read or modify the values stored in the RAM of other players.

name: Goblins Breakfast: Extra Helpings Promo Card
description:
Special Action Card

"Take two extra actions"

name: The Jomar Real Estate Agent Game
description:
Description from the insert:

"The goal of this game is to be the most successful REAL ESTATE AGENT, to become a "SILVER AWARD AGENT" then a "GOLD AWARD AGENT", then to buy the "JONAR CAR", the "JONAR BOAT" and last but not least the winner by being able to buy the "JONAR ESTATE"

Essentially, this is a roll-and-move game where players draw a matching card dependent on the square their pawn lands on. This card may allow them to make a "deal" or find a "prospect", or even get into "trouble". By the end of the game the player who has the most money (and can buy that "Jonar Estate" will be the winner).

What exactly is a Jomar? It is the combination of the first names of the two designers: John Pos and Mary Duggan.

name: Word Ravel
description:
Description from the publisher:

A little bit slide puzzle, a little bit word find, Word Ravel is a puzzely word game with an ever changing tableau.

In the spirit of the classic word games, Word Ravel is a casual affair of rotating rows and columns of letter in order to spell words.

name: Strato Checkers
description:
Strato Checkers is a retro futuristic view of what Checkers could become. Made by the same folk that brought us Strato Tac-Tics. It's made in the same acrylic plastic with oversized board.

Strato Checkers differs from regular checkers in that there are stacking and unstacking rules. Lower pieces in the stack also effect movement of the stacked piece, helping pieces move forward, backwards, or sideways.

name: World Wide Travel
description:
User summary
World Wide Travel is a light push your luck card game for 2-4 players about travelling the world.

Players take turn in a clockwise order. On a players turn, the player can take actions as follows.

(1) Open a card from deck. If you draw the same location twice, you bust and take only the last card.
(2) Get cards. Decide to stop and take all revealed cards.

If you went once through the deck, the round ends and points are scored. Whoever has the most travel days is the winner of the round and scores one victory point. Play several rounds until any player collects two victory points and wins the game.

The game uses artwork from public domain.

Publisher's summary
10分間で世界旅行が体験できる、簡単バースト系ゲームです。各プレイヤーはカードを好きな枚数めくり、同じカードが出なければ全てのカードを、出れば最後のカードを獲得します。カードの滞在期間を合計し、最も多いプレイヤーが1点を獲得します。2点獲得したプレイヤーが勝利します。

name: Developers VS Managers: The Boardgame
description:
WORLD'S FIRST BOARD GAME FOR DEVELOPERS AND MANAGERS

You are working for one of the most promising tech startups in Silicon Valley. Everybody expects the release of v2.0 of your product. This could be a huge leap for the whole company, or it might destroy it if the deadline is not met. The CEO has offered $100 000 to the team that contributes most for the new release. This will be either the developers or the PM team claiming the credit.Who will be the hero of the day? And which team will be remembered by history? It’s all up to you and your friends to decide!

Developers vs Managers is an entertaining / educational board game. The game is designed for IT Specialists by IT Specialists. The purpose of the game is to improve the soft skills of everybody involved. Developers vs Managers is ideal for play when you are on a team building event, having fun in the office or just breaking the ice with new people.

How to play:
First - gather 5 to 10 friends or colleagues
Draw your role and keep it secret until the end of the game! Are you a developer or a manager? The others will judge you by your actions, not just by what you are saying!
Pick-cards
Then: You are the one in charge of who is taking part in the release or not! But you also need to win the trust of the rest of the players that you are leading them to the win...
Pick-a-team
Now vote! The twist of the game is executing the sprint. Is it successful thanks to the effort of the development or management team?
Hint: developers trust only other developers. managers know someone needs to "manage the resources"
If the developers execute 3 successful sprints they win! Unless! The managers guess correctly who the CTO is. Then they win!

The gameplay is extremely addicting because the longer you play, the more you fall into it and the more intense the game gets.

name: Broek 18
description:
A boardgame for two tired parents trying to keep their household running. Fighting against the clock and the little overlord of chaos, will they manage to have any happiness points by nightfall?

Two parents play one day or 17 hours against one little toddler who moves randomly in the house creating mess each turn.Each hour is one turn in which the parents have to spend action points to move around the house to clean, to do the household chores and toe spend time on 'events', some more chores or unexpected chaos or activities with the toddler, leading to more mess but also to happyness.

The mess arrives in a spot due to an event, a chore not managed or the little toddler moving around. If this is not removed before more mess arrives at the location, it becomes harder to clean and in a next level breaks that location so no chores or events can take place.

A clean house, rest and fun activities give happyness points, a too messy house and not managing the chores leads to less happyness. So both parents have to work together to plan the best schedule, when to be where in the house, who does which activity and who runs after the toddler to balance the keeping the house in order and to score happyness points.

name: EnKetsuKouGeki
description:
User summary
煙血鋼撃 (EnKetuKouGeki) is a military-themed game for two players.

At the beginning of game, players have six units of infantry and six armored vehicles each, from which they form a squad of four infantry and an armored vehicle.

Each turn, they choose an command card from their hand and reveal them simultaneously. Each card has a speed factor and card effects. Resolve them in the order of speed factor, and try to damage opponents' squad.

You win the game if your opponent loses all four infantry, or opponent's vehicle is destroyed.

Publisher's summary
歩兵と機体を編成し、敵部隊の撃退を目指す
ミリタリーテイストな対戦ゲーム。

編成した部隊に命令カードで指示を与え、
様々なスキルを駆使して敵部隊に損害を与えたり、
自部隊の支援を行います。

最目標は、敵部隊の歩兵を殲滅あるいは敵部隊の機体の撃破。

name: ButouShoumon
description:
User summary
武当掌門 (ButouShoumon) is a game for three players with a theme of power struggle in a Taoist temple in ancient China.

At the beginning of the game, players are dealt four cards each. One of these cards is the spy, meaning the player holding the spy card has to be in second place to win the game.

During the course of the game, players place their workers and exchange their cards to train themselves (increase their statistics), and gain victory points when you have enough statistics. Note that the spy card can be exchanged so you should keep track of it.

At the end of the game, if the spy player is at the second place, the spy wins. Otherwise the non-spy player with higher victory points wins the game.

Publisher's summary
武当山の道士達が次期掌門を巡って
争うゲームです。
そして、道士の中には朝廷のスパイが潜んでいます。

道士達は日々修練し、時には下山して外界の事件を解決し
名声を高めます。
最終的に名声が最も高い道士が掌門となり勝利しますが、
スパイが2位になると武当山の情報が朝廷につつぬけとなり
スパイの勝利となってしまいます。
mechanics: Hand Management, Set Collection, Worker Placement

name: Usagi no Seiryaku Kekkon
description:
User summary
