ウサギの政略結婚 (Usagi no Seiryaku Kekkon) in English means 'Rabbits' Political Marriage'. It is a two-player co-operative game. Two rabbit nations, which have been hostile to each other, try to form a marriage between their prince and princess before the hostility leads to a war.

Five event cards are placed face-up on the table, so you know what happens in the next five turns. Events can be positive or negative, and some events even raise hostility level under a certain condition. Each turn, a player play an action card. An action card has two options. One is to gain a positive effect, such as gaining resource, or spending resource to collect victory points; and the other is to avoid a bad event, such as changing event order to avoid a hostile condition. You cannot always take positive effects. How you accept negative events is the key to victory.

If the hostility level is raised to seven, citizens' anger leads to a war and both player lose the game. Before that, players have to collect six victory points (intimacy level) to win the game.

Publisher's summary
仲の悪い2つのウサギの国が
戦争を回避するために、
互いの国の王子と姫君が政略結婚をするゲーム。

民衆の対立度が最大に達する前に、
王子と姫君たるプレーヤーが協力し、
物資を蓄えたり需要を回したりして
勝利点に変換し、政略結婚を成功させることを目指します。

name: LIVEBOARDGAME: Football
description: LiveBoardGame makes watching LIVE sports more fun for everyone. When participants play along with the game live on TV, everyone gets involved. Suddenly the party gets a lot more exciting. Live Board Game is entertainment designed to bring families and friends together to watch live sports. As you watch a live sporting event, you and your friends play along using the game board, which presents many possible outcomes for the next play. Before the next live play begins, participants predict the play’s outcome by placing chips on the board. The participant who predicts the next play correctly collects the losers’ chips. The player with the most chips at the end of the game wins.

name: Target Control
description:
Abstract strategy game.

Glass board, 3 metal circular pawns:
Blue = player A
Yellow = player B
Black = base
The colour on these pieces is only marked on a quarter of the circular top of the playing pieces.

Players try to touch the common black base piece with their own piece by sliding and turning their piece on a 5x5 grid (excluding the corners) from a set starting position to win the match.
Players either slide orthagonal along the dots or turn their piece 90 degrees in their turn.
Touching has to be done between the coloured parts of your playing piece and the common base (hence the importance of turning).
An extra turn can be earned by ending your move on one of the four open dots on the board.
Jumping over other pieces is not allowed.

name: The Queen and Shoe Makers
description: In The Queen and Shoe Makers, players are challenged to combine upper cards and heel cards to make nice-looking shoes for the Queen.

name: Happy Birthday Party Game
description:
Description from the back of the box:

"Anytime is party time in this delightful game of birthday surprises! Each player selects a character piece, choosing betweeen a doll, a jack-in-the-box, a tin soldier and a stuffed bear. Players then take turns spinning the spinner and moving their character piece around the colourful board. Colour recognition and memory skills are featured. No reading required to play!"

"Object: to be the first player to collect all four pieces of one birthday cake and one of each of the four different party treats.
mechanics: Memory, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Barnstormer
description:
Includes 6 different colored shooting marbles of 1" glass (one per player) and one straight block of wood with 5 arches one next to the other.

Place the wooden arches on a flat surface a distance away from the players, based on player skill. Each player takes turns shooting their marble towards the arches, from the same spot and distance away. Marbles that make it through an arch earn points based on the value marked on the the top of the arch.

A player with more skill can take a 'handicap' by shooting from further away.

The first player to 50 points wins.

name: Mario Golf 64 Board Game
description:
In this board game adaptation of Mario Golf 64 from the Nintendo 64, players play through a full course of golf (18 holes), or the half-course (9 holes). Players assemble large cardboard tiles to make each of the 18 holes as well as assemble the plastic putting green.

Once the hole has been assembled, players in turn take control of a 4 inch tall mechanical Super Mario figure. Players choose the golf club (drivers/irons/putter) they wish to use for each stroke on each hole.

Once the appropriate club has been placed in Super Mario's hands, players pull back a lever to make Super Mario hit the small golf ball down the cardboard course. Players take turns on each hole, choosing their club for each stroke, and hitting their golf ball towards the green. The player with the lowest stroke count at the end of the game is the winner!
categories: Action / Dexterity, Sports, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Modular Board, Point to Point Movement
publishers: Nintendo Co., Ltd., Tomy Company, Ltd. (Takara Tomy)

name: Baggage Train
description:
The fate of four empires rests in the hands, and the reins, of the men and women in charge of the Baggage Trains. They race their fleet of wagons against their rivals, striving to reach the battlefield and resupply their armies.

Players draw cards which help them to scout the field ahead or sabotage their rivals, and then calculate their advancement towards the battlefield. Random events affect the players progress, and relics may be gained which will invoke the favour of the gods granting bonus victory points.

However, as a Baggage Train is always on the move, resources are scarce. You can only use what you can carry with you, and the more you carry, the slower your progress will inevitably be.

The player with the most victory points at the end of the game is the winner Points are earned for the cargo carried in your baggage train, as well as for having the most scouts or the most saboteurs. The first player to reach the battlefield is awarded a generous victory point bonus, but this alone will not win you the game.

This is the baggage train, where getting there is half the battle.

name: Knot Tying Game: Fisherman's Challenge
description:
Challenge your rival!
Learn & Mater 44 Knots, win points.
Knot Tying cards range in difficulty from 1 to 5 points.
Play it as a game for 2-4 players, of brush up on your Knot Tying skills.
Each player selects one length of tying rope and one tying bar. From a deck of cards, one card is turned face up and players race to be the first to tie the Knot. The first player is given the knot tying card with its point value. Cards are played, one by one, until all the cards are used. The winner is the player with the highest sum of points.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Educational, Real-time

name: El joc de Terrassa
description: El joc de Terrassa ("The Game of Terrassa") is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board representing the streets of Terrassa, one of the biggest catalan cities. Emblematic places like the Masia Freixa or the palace tower are represented in the board, along with all the city propierties that the player must buy to win.
mechanics: Events, Income, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Linnumäng
description:
Educational game about Estonian birds.
Cards have photos, names, nests, eggs etc.
There are several game variants in this game.
You can play memory variant trying to guess what nests belongs to what birds. Player who finds correct pair gets it as a point.
If there is no cards left on the table player with the most cards is the winner
categories: Animals, Card Game, Children's Game, Educational

name: Body Count
description: From the rules: "The object of the game is to predict the final BODY COUNT in an action video. Teams or individual Players advance from their predictions to the final BODY COUNT by answering question cards. The first player to advance from the final BODY COUNT to the center of the game board is the winner"

name: Alamo to Appomattox
description:
Description from the publisher:

Alamo to Appomattox. A2A is a grand strategy game of the American Civil War in the style of Krieg! Maps of the Eastern and Western Theaters include terrain, Strategic Objectives, roads/rail, naval zones, navigable and non-navigable rivers, cities and locales, supply centers and other features affecting the game. Counters represent the corps and armies of the war. Cards provide the strategic-political-economic direction for each side.

Strategies are many and varied but the ultimate goal is to demoralize the opposing faction’s population through military, economic and political victories while sustaining your own population’s will to continue the fight. The players each choose a Strategy Card and an Addendum Card before each new season and may opt to play an additional card as a diplomatic response to certain events. These cards lead to new military units, leaders, and replacement steps and result in socio-economic and political events. The events include the declaration of Emancipation, the elections of 1862 and 1864, and the possible intervention by European nations.

Events are often double-edged swords, sometimes providing a military advantage while negatively affecting the popular will to fight. In addition, both sides may attempt to develop and manufacture new technologies, both historical and speculative, such as ironclads, submarines, torpedoes, observation balloons, repeating rifles and Gatling guns. Both sides can introduce espionage and even sabotage, which can have many unexpected consequences, including assassination. Scenarios are included for each year as well as the entire ACW.

Beyond the ACW proper, there are two introductory scenarios: Alamo, a mini-game of the War for Texas and Manifest Destiny, a Mexican-American War mini-game. These short campaigns will give new players an excellent place to start playing and veteran players will have two scenarios that can be finished in an evening. In addition there is Crisis & Compromise, a card play oriented game of the period from the end of the Mexican-American War to the start of the Civil War. Though little combat occurs, the card play covers the actions inspiring events, leaders and regional positions (Border States) that affect the allegiance of states to a region and the ability of military leaders at the start of the Civil War. Crisis & Compromise can be played alone or used to create alternative starting situations for the ACW.

name: Double Double Talk
description: Teams take turns giving hints and guessing double words (e.g. "chop chop" or "twenty/twenty" vision) from clue cards.

name: Spy or Die Trying: Code Blue
description:
Spy or Die Trying: Code Blue is an expansion that replaces the board and adds rules for underwater infiltration.

The defender plays the villainess Cutlass, who is terrorizing the Mediterranean with her weapon, the Kraken. Peacekeepers must gain entry to the base, obtain incriminating evidence, and destroy the Kraken.

The Box Set also contains 16 unpainted white metal 28mm-scale miniatures with slotted plastic bases. Includes: Harry, Anna, Kim, Cutlass, 4 x Frogmen, 2 x Sharks, 6 x Sailors

name: Blindes Huhn Extrem: Umsortieren
description:
Blindes Huhn Extrem: Umsortieren is a promotional card for Blindes Huhn Extrem that allows you to resort your hand, if desired, something that's normally not allowed during the game.

Designer Michael Schacht released Blindes Huhn Extrem: Umsortieren as one-half of his 2016 Christmas card, thereby making the promo available before the game itself was published.

name: To The Coop!
description: Chicken coops, check. Helmets, check. The chicks are now ready to fly! Flick your rooster at the right angle and speed to send a chick sliding back to their coop. In To The Coop!, the first player to return four chicks to their matching color coop wins the game!

name: Austerlitz, 2 December 1805
description:
Description from the publihser:

Napoleon's most decisive victory was brought about by a successful French deception causing the Coalition armies to overextend their lines. This game would recreate the uncertainty faced by both sides with variable deployment, hidden entry, and optional orders of battle. Four maps, seven counter sheets.

name: Operation Mars
description:
Description from the publisher:

Zhukov’s Grand offensive to destroy the German 9th Army still at the gates of Moscow. It would encompass the battles centered around Rzhev. Smaller scenarios would depict the offensive on both the western and eastern sides of the Rzhev Salient, while the larger campaign scenarios would show the operation in a larger scope using multiple maps. 4-6 map game with 16 counter sheets.

name: Quatre-Bras, 16 June 1815
description:
Two days before Waterloo, the French left wing under Mashal Ney encountered Wellington's army at the crossroads of Quatre Bras. Unknown to Ney, he faced only a thin line of troops as the bulk of Wellington's army raced to the front.

Uncertainty, compounded by conflicting orders from Napoleon, delayed the French advance for several critical hours. Both sides need a quick victory to enable intervention, perhaps decisive, at Ligny, where Napoleon and Blucher have come to grips. Multiple strategy choices for both sides ensure an element of doubt. Two maps, three counter sheets.

name: Planet Explorer
description:
Players try to manipulate the movement of the shared space ship to avoid the space pirates and to land on the planets of the solar system.

In order to land, the players need to have collected the resources required for that specific planet.

At the end of the game, the player who collected the most points from experience certificates is the winner.

name: Frankia
description:
Description from the publisher:

This is an historical game for three or four players. Each of the eight Rounds represents a long period of northwestern European medieval history, from 20 to 75 years. This game uses a simplified and shortened version of the systems developed for the game Britannia. Each turn, the player moves and attacks with new factions in an effort to score points by achieving that faction’s goals.

There are three scenarios, starting in 406 AD (Merovingian Rise), 843 AD (Carolingian Collapse), and 1215 AD (Rise of the Nation-state). The Merovingian Rise scenario follows the barbarian assumption of power from the decrepit West Roman Empire, including the rise of the Merovingian dynasty and the succession of the Carolingian dynasty. It ends with the era of Charlemagne (Charles the Great), the new western Emperor.

The Carolingian Collapse scenario, which chronicles the collapse of the empire built by Charlemagne and his father and grandfather. The scenario begins in 843 AD with the Treaty of Verdun dividing the Frankish empire following the death of Charlemagne’s son, emperor Louis “the Pious,” and ends in 1215, the date of the great Battle of Bouvines.

The three-player Rise of the Nation-State that begins in 1215 is a relatively static situation. Many of the nations can be seen as the precursors of modern states such as Britain, France, Italy, Spain, and Germany.

name: Rails to Victory
description:
Description from the publisher:

Take charge of America’s World War II struggle to run its railroads so as to win the war most quickly and efficiently.

Players vie to build a rail system that can move the most men, weapons and supplies needed for the Allies to win in the European and Pacific Theaters of Operations.

Objectives for each turn are generated by Operation cards (such as the buildups for D-Day and the Manhattan Project). The design is based on actual World War II US Army railroad doctrinal publications, and the map is divided into the historic transportation zones, showing critical cities and track lines.

The game can be played by two-to-six, and cooperation becomes necessary because, if certain operational requirements are not fulfilled, the Axis wins World War II and the players lose.

name: Kanji Game
description:
A card game for teaching or learning Japanese kanji!
How to play: Each player receives 5 cards initially. The first player puts a card on the table, then the next player has to choose a card with a kanji that either has the same reading, the same radical or that forms a new word with the last opened card. If a card cannot be played the player draws another card. The first player to play all their cards win.

name: Joyland
description:
People are going missing all over a Mississippi swamp, a massive reward is offered for the suspected giant gator. Bounty Hunters from around the world flood in to compete for the prize, but what they find unites them as the hunters become the hunted.

Joyland is a Co-op game for 2-5 players ages 12 and up. 1-4 players control Bounty Hunters and one player controls Shiv The Killer Clown.

Players face 4 phases all with different objectives. 2 phases take place "above ground" in the park (board one) and 2 phases occur below ground in the "Freak Show" caverns (board 2).

In order to "win" players must reach Shiv and defeat him.
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling

name: Bibi & Tina: Tohuwabohu Total
description:
In Bibi & Tina: Tohuwabohu Total, the players play together with Bibi and Tina to successfully hide Adea from their relatives.

They have hidden cards in front of them, and during the course of the game, the players try to figure out which cards they have, then exchange bad cards for better ones. But they do not have unlimited time as the pursuers are on their heels. In order to win the game together, at the end of the game the value of the good cards of all players must be higher than the value of their bad cards.

name: Together Balloon
description:
Game consists of cards with various tasks to be solved on time, all involving a balloon. All tasks have three levels of difficulty to be attempted, awarding 1-3 points. The first team to reach 10 points wins.

Can be played together with the original Together or alone.

name: Brigadier General Commands
description:
World War II Strategy Wargame For 6mm Scale Models

These war-game rules for Second World War battles are designed for re-creating historical battles with miniatures in 1/300 or 1/285 scale. The size of forces on each side are typically a combat command or brigade. Such battles were frequently commanded by Brigadier Generals, hence the name of the rules. Some of the most interesting battles you can play with these rules have a number of commands on each side, each directed by a different player.

These wargame rules were written primarily for play with two or more players, however the rules were specifically designed for the possibility of solo play. Starting from a historical set up, if you play alone, you will find the command rules make it easy to be logical about what orders should be given to each side.

The game includes the rules book, two summary rule sheets, armor penetration table sheet, ready to cut order chits and unit identification markers. Optional extra time and event cards can be purchased separately, which facilitate play and speed the game.

name: Qube: Gott & lyxigt
description:
500 questions about food and luxurious things in five different category's (Fragrances, Good tastes, Things that cost, Beverage and Miscellaneous).

In the box you will find:
100 question cards (5 questions on each)
49 category cards
Rules
15 sample question cards from other Qube games.

name: Brainy Puzzle Pack
description:
A collection of 4 challenging Puzzle-Games. Rules to play a co-op game with each puzzle is included in every package.

Egg Cetera
The basic solution is an Egg Shape but as the pun in the title suggests, there are many other solutions to try. We offer some such as Faces, Foods, etc. & then you can create your own. Play alone or with as many as l2. 24 pieces, 8x10 finished. 8 to Adult.

Messages
The pieces are collections of signs, symbols and pictures. Put them together and a message appears. We have a variety of solutions, but the beauty of the puzzle is you can create your own messages - if you are clever enough! Play alone or as a group. 21 pieces. 7 to Teen.

Turnovers
Co-operative Tic Tac Toe. Try to get 3 pieces of the same color in a row. Sometimes you have to turn them over and colors change. Sometimes pieces get piled on. Keep your wits about you or you soon have a tangle. A challenge indeed for a young thinker! Play alone or with as many as six. Playboard 5 x 5 in, 12 tokens. 8 to Adult.

The Blot
The pieces start as an ink blot. Rearrange them carefully and you can make animals, faces, letters, numbers, birds, ships, etc. We provide a booklet of 60 silhouetted shapes to try. Do ours, then create your own. Play alone or as a group. Rules for a game included. 7 pieces. 8 to Adult.

name: Rainbow: Thunder tile
description:
For buyers at the Tokyo Game Market Dec 2016, an additional tile "Thunder" was added as a give away to create even more variety.

Rules:
The Thunder tile is flipped over and shuffled to the other 9 tiles, so the starting grid changes from a 3x3 grid to a 3-4-3 grid.
When you turn over the Thunder tile, the player to your left may randomly draw and keep one of your completed rainbow cards (unless you only own one card, or none).
If more then 3 cloud cards were flipped over, they are shuffled and put back to the other cloud cards keeping the general layout.
If 3 or less cloud cards were flipped over, these are shuffled with additional randomly chosen cloud cards in a total of 4 cards and then all put back to the general layout.

name: Hollywood Movie-Bingo
description:
This bingo-style game has a spinner with the letters of the alphabet, and 10 player cards, each bearing the names of three '30s Hollywood stars, one with 5 letters, one with 6 and one with 7.

After each spin, players put tokens on top of all examples of that letter on their card. The first to cover all letters on two of the names on a card shouts "Hollywood". The names are checked and if correct, that player wins; otherwise that player is out of the game and spinning continues. The rules say players may agree to play until all three names on a card are covered.

The cards are a who's who of Depression-era stars: Astaire, Garbo, Chaplin, Gable, Cagney, Hepburn, Karloff, Jolson, Ruggles and many more.

name: Silver Scream
description: Bring the iconic 80’s slasher movie to life in this intense, immersive board game. The innovative story-board mechanism puts you in front of the camera as the scenes unfold, leading you and your fellow cast members through a terrifying night in a variable wilderness setting. Use cunning to survive until dawn or stand and fight to stop the Killer once and for all. Gather Plot Points to maintain your Courage in the face of horror as your Supporting Cast is slaughtered around you. Will you be able to reveal the Killer’s vulnerabilities and face him (or her) down before the mayhem of Act 3 begins? Or will you simply run for your life, never knowing where terror will strike next? Either way, the Story Board will track the choices you’ve made and tell your tale of woe (or heroism) to all who dare to watch the Silver Scream...
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Storytelling

name: A Race to the Moon
description:
A children's space themed board game played by moving playing pieces along numbered squares till they reach the moon. Starting from earth, the first to get to the moon is the winner. Along the way players will encounter picture squares which have either set back or speed up their travel.

Playing pieces are simple counters and the board has graphics very similar to the British Dan Dare space caricature. Published about 1957 by Emu Series in the U.K.

name: Race.Thru.Space
description:
The purpose of this spin and move vintage space exploration game is to travel to as many planets as possible on the playing board starting at the rocket launching platform spot. The planets are located around the edge of a Monopoly style layout. Each player receives the celestial currency called Celestros upon visiting a planet. Players can encounter setbacks and benefits along the way by landing on specific squares. The game is over when all players return to the Launching Platform. The player with the greatest amount of currency wins the game.

The game has beautiful box graphics typical of the 50s era. The board has the spinner built into it and the playing pieces are colored plastic rockets very similar to that produced by the Lido corporation and seen in the board game Rocket Race to Saturn (1953). Rules are printed on the inside of the box lid and the game was produced by the E-Z game Manufacturing Corporation, New York. Another version of the game is all but identical except the title was changed to 'Race to Planets'.
publishers: E-Z Game Mfg Corp, E-Z Play

name: Space: A Race to the Moon
description:
A roll and move electronic space race board game starting at the Woomera rocket range in Australia. The first to reach the moon is the winner. Two players each have a wired playing piece (electrode) that they move by the roll of the die. The electrode piece advances along small holes in the board towards the moon passing planets along the way. Each player has to follow a separate route to the moon made of these small holes. At certain contact points along the way the playing piece sets off one of a series a colored warning lights on the board that indicates a penalty sending them back to a planet. On reaching the moon a yellow light in the moons center indicates the winner.

Unknown publisher but most likely Australian or English considering the unique launch zone where rocket testing was conducted during the 1950s

name: Space Pilot
description:
A space exploration spinning top board game. The object of the game is to spin and steer four capsule travel tops into the solar system game board and attempt to land on planets to win points. To win, tally up all points to make the highest possible score.

Each player spins three yellow tops. The yellow capsule tops spins on the playing board and the player tilts the board to make the tops travel into the solar system and stop in a circular hole representing a planet and score points. This is repeated with one red top to score double points. Trouble if you land on the sun, either losing half your points if it was a yellow top or all points if your red capsule stops on the sun. The player having the highest score after spinning all four tops is the winner.

name: Scratshow
description:
Description from the game insert:

During the same sitting, you can find yourself at the Casino, at the race, at an auction, or playing a friendly game of poker... all the while scratching cards to find out if you have a chance to win or if you have lost your bid. Scratshow starts with a roll of the dice telling you where your pawn will land. Are you on a Poker square? Take a scratch card marked Poker and discover your hand. Place your bet, bluff, raise... Your pawn takes you to the races? Place your bet, scratch a card and find out if your horse is in the Win, Place or Show category. The first player who gets to be a millionaire wins the game.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Betting and Bluffing, Roll / Spin and Move

name: The Great Dictionary Game
description:
Description from the box insert:

A game where the scholar is not necessarily the winner. A game where wits provide for hilarity. The Great Dictionary Game is a fun-filled search for the definition of a word picked out of the dictionary and starting with one or more of the letters appearing on a card chosen at random. Proposed definitions can be absolutely accurate, a figment of the imagination, incoherent, plausible, misleading or humorous. The winner is the player with the highest score of points obtained either from his bets on accurate definitions or from votes of players.

name: Fissure
description:
2 players.

Materials
A hex board having 37 cells, 4 hexes to a side, and 37 stones in a single color.

Setup
Place a stone, in each of the 37 cells of the board.

Definitions
Group - one or more adjacent stones.

Object
The player with the most stones wins.

Play
Choose a starting player, turns alternate

On a turn remove 2 non-adjacent stones from a line of adjacent stones. Removed stones are used for endgame scoring.

If a group is split into 2 or more groups, the player that caused the split takes the smallest group, but if the smallest groups are of equal size, the player then decides which one to take.

The game ends when a player cannot take his turn.

name: Commanders of Land and Sea
description:
Description from the publisher:

You are a young Captain, in charge of your own fleet of ships, seeking fame and fortune.

In Commanders of Land and Sea you take the role of the Captain of a fleet of ships that seeks to expand its domain, your goal is to take over as many islands as possible, placing your boats in them, claiming their treasures and increasing your power; At the same time you must eliminate the other players, destroying their ships and taking possession of their main ports.

You have found an area of the ocean where there are several islands that are not under any kingdom or country, it is your duty to land on them and reclaim them along with their wealth as your own. But be careful, other corsairs, have also established themselves in nearby ports, and are also in search of new domains, you must face them and prove to them who is the most powerful, using your ships and wealth to eliminate their ships and drive them away.

What are you waiting? Have fun sailing your ships, conquering islands landing in their ports and increase your wealth; face your opponents and if necessary send them flying by exploding your traps. Who will be the most successful Captain? You will have to play to find out.
mechanics: Action Queue, Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement

name: Quatre Bras
description:
Using the Napoleonic version of the March into Battle system, this game portrays the Battle of Quatre Bras in a furious, fast moving two turn game. Part of a group of mini-games on the battles of the Waterloo campaign, with Ligny and La Belle Alliance.

In this system as in reality, units will become ineffective from fatigue and disorder long before they run out of men - unless you, in command, can manage them effectively and maintain their edge. A turn lasts as long as the typical historical time to arrange and execute an assault - every move counts.

Map scale: 1km per hex
Unit scale: divisions, 1000 men per strength point
Time scale: 3.5 hours per turn

name: Dicecapades! 2nd Edition Expansion Pack: Kids
description:
Description from the publisher:

Dicecapades! 2nd Edition is the same great game as the original version but now with more cards! Think you can stack dice on your face? Will you dominate in arm wrestling? How about obscure facts? With a mixture of dice games, physical challenges, artistic creations, and trivia questions that will exercise both sides of your brain, you'll see why DICEcapades isn’t just the luck of the dice - it’s the smarts of the roller!

Need more cards? No problem, get the DICEcapades Expansion Packs. Each expansion pack comes with 45 new cars to boost your Dicecapades! 2nd Edition game.

Expansion pack 1 is kids themed and includes 45 more cards for Dicecapades! 2nd Edition game.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Math, Party Game, Trivia

name: Signature: The Handwriting Analysis Game
description: This is a small box that contains several tear-off pads of sheets of several types, as well as 48 numbered cards with samples of famous people's handwriting on one side, and three choices as to whom the handwriting is on the opposite side. Also included is a booklet that goes into some detail about how handwriting analysis works, what can (and cannot) be deducted from it, as well as rules for three variants of games that can be played, two of which use the cards included.

name: Tenbin ni Kakero
description:
User summary
天秤にかけろ (Tenbin ni Kakero) in English would mean 'Take a Balance'.

The whole nation is divided by two sides: republicans and monarchists, and it's time to determine which side will rule the nation. You have some connections with national magnates who have a certain extent of influence on both sides. Your future will be bright if you have strong connections with the winning side.

In the game of Tenbin ni Kakero, players secretly vote for one side or two, and when the winning side is determined, a player who has the card with the most influence on that side wins the game.

At beginning of the game, players have several magnate cards and backing cards. Each magnate cards has a different number (1-20) to indicate how much influence that magnate has on which side. Backing cards are either vote card or special cards. Vote cards are numbered 0-3 to indicate vote values, and special cards have a specific power to manipulate votes in play or magnate card in one player's hand.

During your turn, you may place one vote card on one side face down to add some votes, or play one special card for a special effect.

When all backing cards have been played, reveal all vote cards and determine the winning side. The victory goes to the player who has the magnate card with the most influence on the winning side.

Actually, the two sides are not necessarily the republicans and the monarchists. This game has two blank cards so that players may name two sides by their preference, such as pro-Brexit and anti-Brexit, cat person and dog person.

Description from the publisher:'
今この国は「君主制派」と「共和制派」に分かれて争っている状況です。(これは説明の為です。実際は「離脱派・残留派」「犬派・猫派」等、グループで楽しめるものにしてください)
・「有力者カード」は1〜20の数字が振ってあり、1が共和制派の最有力者、20が君主制派の最有力者となります。
・「共和制派」は1に近い方がより強力な有力者ですので、共和制派が実権を握れば、20は最弱となります。
・「君主制派」は20に近い方がより強力な有力者ですので、君主制派が実権を握れば、1は最弱なります。
・ゲーム開始時に配られた「有力者カード」を見て、どちら側の有力者と繋がっているかを確認してゲームをプレイします。
・どちらかの陣営に「数字カード」を裏向きで置くことで、その陣営を支援（投票したと考えると分かりやすいかも知れません）をしていきます。
・全員のすべての手札がなくなったら、「数字カード」を集計して合計が多かった陣営が実権を握ります。
・「実権を握った側の有力者カード」で最も有力なカードを持つプレイヤーが勝利です。
・例えば「君主制派」が実権を握った場合は、20に近い有力者カードを持っているプレイヤーの勝利となります。
・ゲームに変化を持たせるために、「リムーブカード」と「ニューリレーションカード（鞍替えカード）」が用意されています。
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Memory, Party Game

name: Hikari to Yami to (光と闇と)
description:
User summary
光と闇と (Hikari to Yami to) in English is 'Light & Darkness'.

In the game of Hikari to Yami to, players play cards to score points, and the highest scorer wins the game.

At the beginning of the game, players have the same number of cards. Each card belongs to one of two sides: light side or dark side, and players' sides are determined by majority of card by side. If you have more light cards than dark cards, your side is the light. You are neutral if you have the same number of cards for both sides.

Players take turns playing a card from their hand, and the card affects all appropriate players written in the text. Most cards refer to the side of players, so you should be conscious of your side. The affected players lose or gain points by the card effect. Then the played card is discarded, which may cause the player to change their side.

The game ends when all players have played all but one card. Apply the remaining card effect only to you, and the highest scorer wins the game.

Publisher's summary
・手札となるカードには「光のカード」と「闇のカード」があります。
・どちらのカードが手札に多いかによって自分の属性が決まります。
・「光のカード」が多ければ、「光の者」です。
・「闇のカード」が多ければ「闇の者」です。
・「光と闇のカードが同数」の場合は「中立の者」となります。
・カードを使用すると効果が発生し、同じ属性のプレイヤーすべてに影響します。
・例えば「光の者」に効果があるカードが使用されると、自分だけでなく他のプレイヤーも含めて、すべての「光の者」に効果が及ぶことになります。
これを繰り返していく、とてもとても簡単なカードゲームです。だけど、ちょっとしたジレンマも発生します。
「自分だけ」に得点を入れようとしても、他の同じ属性のプレイヤーにも得点が入ってしまったり。
他のプレイヤーが何気なく使用した効果で、自分が大きな得点を得たりと、もどかしい感じのゲームになっています。
categories: Card Game, Deduction, Memory, Party Game

name: Spy King
description:
The team-based social deduction game Spy King includes three royal families as well as a family of spies who wants to defeat the royals. If the spies defeat all the kings, they win; if the spies are defeated, then the family with the highest value wins.

A moderator is needed to play Spy King, but this player can also be part of a family.

name: HEROS Stacking Game: Tower
description: In this exciting tower building game, players take turns rolling the dice to determine what pieces will be added. The player who makes the tower fall loses the game! Crafted from sustainably forested beechwood, this game is suitable for children over 3 years old, but is fun for the whole family!

name: Ke-ki Baikingu!
description:
User summary
In Japan, a buffet-style restaurant is called "Viking Restaurant". ケーキバイキング! (Ke-ki Baikingu) means 'cake baking' but it is phonetically equivalent to "Cake Viking" and Japanese would understand the pun if you pronounced it that way. The designer suggests an English title Dessert Buffet!.

In the game of Dessert Buffet!, players are a group of girls who have come to a all-you-can-eat cake buffet. Actually, all of them are on a diet so they don't want to eat too much. That's why they began to foist fattening cakes to one another!

Each player initially has three cake cards. Each turn, you pass a card from your hand to any other player. If it causes that player to have a pair of the same cake, that player has eaten the cake and takes the calories written on the card.

Some cards are special. They can make you or another player gain or lose calories. When you draw such a card, follow the instruction written on it.

At the end of each turn, players with fewer than three cards must fill their hand up to three cards. If that causes a pair, more calories are added as well.

When the draw pile runs out, the player with the lowest calories eaten wins the game.

The game is packaged like a cake, 10cm round and 4cm deep.

Description from the publisher:
プレイヤーはケーキ食べ放題の店にやってきた女子グループになります。
しかし、全員こっそりダイエット中なので、あまりカロリーを摂取したくありません。
手札（皿）にある高カロリーのケーキカードを、他のプレイヤーに押し付けましょう。
同じカードが二枚揃ったプレイヤーはそれを食べたことになり、カードを場に出します。
山札がなくなった時点で一番摂取カロリーの低いプレイヤーが勝者です。
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Take That

name: Presidentialness
description:
In this fast playing, opponent-crushing card game featuring The United States’ most popular political figures, players take turns strategically building their presidential asset sets until someone completes three sets and wins the game.
The deck contains event cards used to destroy your opponent’s reputations and press cards used to leverage your assets and steal voters! Don’t forget to watch your own back as your opponents can do the same to you and your destinies will change in an instant!

name: Sherlock Holmes and the Case of the Silver Bullet: Murder Mystery Game
description:
The players sit around a table for dinner (a real dinner) and each one is assigned a role within the game, and is given an envelope with a letter indicating something that only his character knows, as well as some instructions in the form of a menu that indicates how the dinner will be taking place. The game includes a DVD that seems to contain some instructions on events that will be happening during the dinner.

As the dinner progresses, players have to find out who has been the killer of a girl.

Everyone's a suspect when murder is on the menu. And with a Classic Detective Murder Mystery you have everything you need to serve up a perfect murder dinner party. First the invites, you choose which of your friends play which devious character. Then the shopping list, menu suggestions and recipes. Plus of course .....a really tasty murder to solve. We guarentee that it will be drop dead fun, and by the end of the evening one (or more) of the suspects, your 'friends' will be caught out as the murderer.

The night of March 1905 saw a full moom rise over the remote Hampshire village of Thor Bridge. Here there are still some prepared to celebrate the coincidence of the old pre-Christian festivals of Eostrara and Lady Day. For weeks the village has been rife with rumours of pagan rituals, tales of the spitits and demons that would stalk the Earth.

But even on this haunted and mysterious night, no one could have predicted the form that evil was to take. Until the body of Maria Gibson was discovered. The Brazilian wife of the millionaire who lives in the big house, she has been shot dead with a single silver bullet.

Only one man can solve this bizarre case that seems shrouded in the folklore of three continents. And now Sherlock Holmes has gathered the suspects together to uncover the truth of what happened that terrible night.

The Suspects are:

J Neil Gibson - The American gold minig tycoon who moved into Thor Place five yeasrs ago with his exotic wife.

Mary-Lou gibson - J Neil's daughter from his first marriage.

Rev Marlow Bates - The vicar of Thor Bridge, an authority on the old religion and it's most implacable foe.

Grace Dunbar - The beautiful young governess who looks after the two children of the Gibsons.

Chastity Darling - A chilhood friend of Grace who has come to visit her in the old manor house.

Juan Pinto - The younger brother of the murdered woman, he is visiting England from his home in Brazil.

Countess Von Orlock - A Hungarian noblewoman who has know J Neil Gibson for many years.

Jack E Jackson - A South African gold miner who has made and lost his fortune many times over.

name: Executive Producer
description: In Executive Producer, players take control of a Hollywood movie studio, buying Scripts and hiring Actors and Directors to appear in them with the goal of earning box office profits, critical acclaim and prestigious awards! Players can also use their unique studio abilities to gain an edge, or play Hollywood News cards to improve their movies - or sabotage opponents!

name: Dragon Whisperer: Kickstarter Promo Cards
description:
These promo cards for Dragon Whisperer function as a mini-expansion. They function similarly to Dragon Rage cards and feature unique artwork and new icons.

From the errata:
"The Promo Cards are used like the Dragon Rage cards. The difference is that, when used, the person who plays the last promo card wins the trick instead of it just cancelling the round."

These promo cards were available to certain tiers of backers during the Kickstarter.

name: Count up MAMBO!
description:
Description from the publisher:

The Fastest Card Game!! (maybe). MANBOU(Sunfish) x MAMBO!! High speed battle in 60 sec. >

You must place your cards quicker than other players on the rules to the field.
And you bring up a MANBOU(Sunfish) from an EGG to an ADULT FISH.
You win if your card’s points are less than other player’s when GAME is OVER.

name: Toon-in Radio Game
description:
This mid-1920s game can be used in two ways. The board has six concentric tracks, one per player, each named after a popular radio set or circuit brand: Neutrodyne, Armstrong, De Forest, Crosley, Radiola and Super-H. There also are six D6, marked with the starting letters of the six brands. The board is divided radially into 16 spaces, each with the call letters and city of a major radio station.

The first game is a simple roll-and-move affair. Each player gets a small metal radio horn or "loud speaker". All the dice are thrown at once, and each player moves ahead as often as his or her starting letter shows up. First player to complete the circuit wins. (This appears to be closely replicating one of All-Fair's top sellers of the period, 1922's Spe-Dem Auto Race Game, which - tellingly - also features a board with parallel colored paths labeled in brand names, as well as an identical method of play.)

The rules booklet also suggests a second game called Toon-In Radio Golf. This requires an actual radio set as well as a copy of the game for each player. Players have to use their radios to try to tune in each of the game's stations in turn, waiting until an announcement of the call letters to verify that he has it right. The first person to successfully tune in all of the stations wins.

The game includes the call letters, city, wavelength and power of each signal. (Even the biggest stations used only 1,000 watt0s!) The rules note that in those days, listening to radio was like golf, with all sorts of hazards like static, amateur transmitters and lightning interfering with clean reception.

name: Battle on Deck!
description: You're the Pirate Captain, and you live or die by your Ship. Your field is the deck of your Ship. Your opponents' fields are theirs. Each player draws cards to form a hand consisting of crew, cannons, field effects, and outside influences, and attempt to use the cannons to sink the other ships. Crew can fire the cannons, shoot pistols at opposing crew, repair the ship, and bandage wounds. Using each crewmembers special skills and talents, you have to keep your ship afloat while doing your best to send everyone else to the bottom of the sea.

name: Les Quatre-Bras & Waterloo 1815: The Empire's Final Blows – Davout in Command, 18 June 1815: What if? Scenario
description:
This scenario offers players an alternative to the historical conditions of Waterloo. What would have happened if Davout had been present at Waterloo.

This scenario was included in C3i magazine, issue #29.

The contents are the two sided scenario card and the single Davout counter on the magazine countersheet.

name: Grand Prix Electric
description: A simple car-racing game with electric lamps from the `70s. If you step on a red lamp, you have to back to the start line. If the yellow lights up it means you miss a turn, but if it`s the green, you can roll the dice again.

name: Nugget goes to school
description: Roll dice and move piece board game.

name: Umehira
description:
Buriiri is an arrangement type board game where all the players cooperate and fill with the character [hiragana] to which 5 × 5 squares are distributed [hiragana]
The player first decides the number, the first person freely places one letter
The game master randomly distributes two letters to the player who is turning the turn
The active player selects one of the two characters and fills it in the square

Filling conditions
1, it is in contact with the character already existing in the square
2, it is established as a word of two letters together with the character in contact
3, It is possible to explain the meaning of the word to the game master
If conditions are met, you can fill in that square
Repeat as you decided this, if you can fill all the trouts is victory
Unusable vocabulary
Proper noun including place name, family name, character name, etc.
Foreign languages and dialects
There is an item of reading aloud and kun reading in the meaning of the dictionary

name: Kingmaker: The Reluctant Coronation
description:
Description from the publisher:

Kingmaker: The Reluctant Coronation is a turn-based, tile drafting, anti-set collection game where the goal is NOT to become king, but to instead be responsible for forcing another player to the throne. Being the leader of this cantankerous village is difficult work, best left to someone else. Still, the time has come for a new monarch to be crowned and as the wisest elders still around, one of you will surely become the new person in charge/scapegoat to blame for all the kingdom's problems. To decide who will ascend to this awesome responsibility, you'll present the accoutrements of power to your opponents hoping to ensnare one of them (ANY OF THEM!) with all five: the ring, the robe, the sceptre, the crown and the throne. Be careful! Each item given to another player also gives them a powerful advantage in a future turn. If they survive the round, revenge will come swift and hard.

Every round, each player presents one gift of power to another and then in turn, each player can assert the powers granted by their previously acquired artifacts. These powers can refuse gifts, trade them, introduce new ones or shuffle them around. When a player is bestowed the fifth item in the set and is unable to avoid accepting it, they become king and the player who gave them that item becomes the kingmaker and wins the game.

name: Dokugasu Zangousen
description:
User summary
毒ガス塹壕戰 (Dokugasu Zangousen) in English means 'Poison Gas and Entrenchment'.

A Government kidnapped unemployed, NEET, and homeless people, and sent them onto a deserted island. These people were given outdated firearms, and were forced to kill one another. There were two reasons for the Government to do this: one was to collect battle data through the experimental battles, and the other was as an easy way to dispose such troublesome people.

Dokugasu Zangousen is a three-dimensional chess-like board game. In a 7x7 square grid board, you may make a hump (place a cube) or dig an entrenchment (remove a cube) to avoid lines of fire or to hinder enemy's movement. But entrenchment is vulnerable to poison gas which tends to go downward into holes.

Players initially have two soldiers each. At the beginning of each round, players place two action cards face-down in front of them. Then first player takes all actions they have placed.

During your turn, you may do two of the following actions as you have programmed:
1) Move: Move one of your soldiers one square orthogonally, or advance the soldier two squares forward.

2) Turn: Turn the direction of one of your soldiers.

3) Construct: Place a cube on a square adjacent to one of your soldiers. Or remove a cube from in front of the soldier.

4) Fire: Fire a gun from one of your soldiers orthogonally to kill an enemy or destroy a cube. Or throw a bag of poison gas to kill soldiers within an affected area, which is determined by wind direction.

5) Dig: Dig an entrenchment at the exact square of one of your soldiers.

6) Item: One of your soldier wears or takes off a gas mask. While wearing the mask, the soldier gains protection from poison but is unable to advance two squares, construct, or move cubes. Or one of your soldier takes a drug for two extra actions.

7) Camp: Retrieve one or all action cards you have played so far.

You score one point when you kill one of your enemies, or when you move one of your soldier outside the board across the opponent's border. You win the game if you score two victory points.

Publisher's summary
政府は無職、ニート、浮浪者などを拉致して無人島に送り込み
旧式武器を支給し、殺し合いをさせていた　生身の人間による有益な戦闘実験データを入手できて、犯罪者予備軍をも駆逐すできて一石二鳥だからである

多人数による立体的なチェスです
積み木で高低差を表現。それらは自由に回収したり設置が可能。
銃撃したり風向きに影響される毒ガスをばらまいて戦います
遮蔽物（立方体）を置いて敵の進行を阻んだり、攻撃から身を守ることが出来て、塹壕を堀り（地面の立方体を取り除く）、中に潜んでいれば相手からの銃撃を避けつつ相手を射撃することができる

カードを裏向きに提出し、
コマの行動をプロットして動く
使用したカードは捨札になり、カード回収行動するまで使えない
categories: Fantasy, Horror, Wargame, World War I
mechanics: Action Points, Action Queue, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Player Elimination, Simultaneous Action Selection
publishers: Offkaio ga Tsukutta Game (オフ会王が作ったゲェム)

name: Objective: Vietnam
description:
Description from the publisher:

Objectives: Vietnam is a cooperative, competative card game for one to six people where players compete against the game to take objectives by battling the NVA forces.

The cards

Objectives: Vietnam runs with three decks of cards. The first deck is the Objectives deck. These cards are places and events that the players must collect before they accumulate in the “War Weariness” pool. Objectives are guarded by a number of NVA cards as designated by the NVA score on the Objective card. Each Objective card also has a Value. This is the number of points the players receive when they take the objective. NVA cards are the second deck and represent the North Vietnam Army. These cards come in different strengths and have varying abilities. The last deck is the Free World deck. These cards are dealt to the players face down and represent the resources they have to take objectives and affect the War Weariness pool. Players may not share or expose their hands to other players during the course of the game.

Setup

Shuffle each deck separately and then deal out a number of Free World cards face down to each player as determined by figure 1 (Number of players). Play starts with the player to the left of the dealer and moves clockwise around the table.

Sequence of play

When a players turn starts they draw one Free World card. If the player has less than their starting hand in Free World cards they draw up to their starting card total instead. Once the player has drawn their cards, the top Objectives card is turned over and placed in the middle of the playing field. This is mandatory and will always happen each players turn. This is the War Weariness pool. The player now has the option of attempting to take the objective (see combat) or take an additional Free World card and pass his turn to the player to his left. If you do nothing in your turn you can always draw one Free World card and this can bring your total cards above your starting hand size. There is no upper limit on the number of cards you can have in your hand.

Combat

When a player decides they are going to take an objective they deal out a number of NVA cards equal to the NVA score on the Objective card face down. Starting with the attacking player, each player “bids” the cards they will use in the attack by placing them face down in front of themselves. Once all players have bid their cards, the player cards are revealed and then the first NVA card in line is revealed. Add up the strength value of all exposed NVA cards each reveal phase and compare it to the total of the Free World card strength. If the NVA total is double the total strength of all the exposed Free World bid cards, the objective is overrun and lost (See losing combat). If the total is not double the attackers strength and there are more NVA cards to be revealed, the players go around again bidding more cards for the next reveal phase. This continues until all NVA cards involved in the battle are face up. If the attacking players have a higher total Strength than the strength total of all NVA cards in play then they win the objective and it is placed to the side. If there are four or more players, the attacking player now draws a number of Free World cards equal to the NVA value on the Objective that was just secured and can now give them to the other players as reinforcements. The player may only keep one card for himself and he may not look at any of the cards being distributed. This may take the player over his starting hand limit. He may then attempt to take another objective or end his turn. If an attack is declared and the players feel they can’t take the objective they can call off the attack but the player that called the attack must discard his entire hand and his turn ends. The objective is treated as if the players lost combat.

Losing combat

Should the players be defeated by the NVA, the objective is placed back in the War Weariness pool and a token is placed on the card. Objectives that have tokens on them add one to the NVA value for each token on the card. This is cumulative with any other effect in the game

War weariness

As the game progresses, cards will begin to build up in the War Weariness pool. The more cards in the War Weariness pool the more difficult it will be to take objectives. Starting with the third card in the War Weariness pool, add one to the NVA score for every Objective card. Once you have six cards in the War Weariness pool you add one more and finally when there is nine cards in the War Weariness pool you add one more for a total of +3 to the NVA score on all Objective cards. If a duplicate Objective card is added to the War Weariness pool it is shuffled back in to the deck and a token is added to the original card in the War Weariness pool instead.

Ending the game

If there are 10 cards in the War Weariness pool at the end of any players turn the game wins. The players win if they accumulate a total of ten points per player, 15 in a single player game. (IE a 4 player game needs to get 40 points in Objectives). The player that initiates the attack keeps the points of the objective if the players win the objective. The player with the most points when the players win is deemed the winner of the game. Note that if the game wins, no one wins.

name: Mad Match
description:
Mad Match combines strategy, memory, and cut-throat game play in a fun and exciting new card matching game.

Like in classic Memory, players try to collect pairs (and triplets) of cards to score points. Action cards will cause cards in play to be frozen face up for the rest of the game or allow players to remove or steal cards from opponents.

The basic set includes 54 cards with hilarious and quirky art right out of the Mad Science The Card Game Universe and is perfect for two players. Pull a few cards out of the deck and you can play a classic matching game with children of all ages, or get addicted to our unique Mad Match solitaire variation.

name: Mad Match: More Madness
description: More Madness is an 18 card expansion (15 Monster / 3 Action cards) for use with the basic Mad Match deck.

name: Mad Match: Hive Mine
description: Special Limited Edition Exclusive Bonus Action Card. For Kickstarter backers.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Memory

name: EndQuotes: Footnotes to Plato
description: A 52-card Kickstarter Collector's Edition Deck featuring some of the most provocative memes you've ever seen.

name: Mensch, sei kein Frosch!
description:
Each player has to get 4 meeples from the starting space to the 4 destination spaces of his color. 2 meeples use the left side and 2 meeples use the right side of the game board. Movement is determined by rolling a die.

If a meeple gets on a free green space, the Player shouts: "Mensch, sei kein Frosch!" and takes the next opponent meeple in front of him back to the starting space. If the green space is already occupied, the player sets his meeple on the space in front of it and pays a token into the cash box.

Whenever a meeple gets on a free red space, it changes places with the next opponent meeple in front of it. If the red space is occupied, the player sets his meeple two spaces in front of it and pays a token into the cash box.

If a meeple gets on space 80/81 the player has to miss a turn. If the space is alredy occupied, the first meeple is moved 6 free black spaces backwards.

Space 100 must be reached by exact count. Only meeples that are standing on space 100 may move onto the destination spaces. If the player rolls too many points, the surplus points must be moved backwards.

The first player to get his 4 meeples to his 4 destination spaces wins the game and two thirds of the cash box.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: American Geography
description:
Description from the publisher:

Introduction

Learningames offers a new and exciting way to have fun while learning geography. Through these innovative and easy-to-play games players master important information about the political and physical geography of the world. A valuable experience for young and old, novice or expert. Learningames are unique, informative, and always enjoyable.

Overview of play

Two to six players sit around the Map Playing Board. The map may include political centers and/or geographical areas. In place of the names of the political centers (including cities, states, and nations) and geographical areas (including physical features, regions, and cultural and economic centers) normally found on the map are numbers 1-50.
To begin the game a player draws a Card form the deck. Each card has the name of a political center or geographical area on one side (Side “A” with the blue background) and a number with important information about the named center or area on the other side (Side “B” with the white background).
In the Basic Game players win cards by locating and naming different political centers or a geographical area on the numbered playing board or by correctly challenging incorrect answers. When playing the Advanced Games, players master important information about the political centers and geographical areas identified in the basic games. Players always find Learningames fun, and best of all, they learn about the world around them.

name: Circumnavigation
description:
This is a very unusual Japanese travel game published by the Osaka Mainichi newspaper in 1926 (Taisho 15), quite unlike the typical Mawari-Sugoroku board, which has a path of pictures spiralling toward the center.

This game is a huge map of the world surrounded by flags. It measures about 43" tall and 30" wide. It is oriented (no pun intended) toward the East at the top, with North to the left, South to the right and West downwards. Japan is centered in the upper half, with the Pacific and Americas above it, Australia to the right, Asia/India in the middle and Europe/Africa at the bottom.

The map shows a wide variety of destinations linked by numbered routes. Each player starts from Japan and travels in the direction indicated by a die roll (with a 6 going nowhere). The objective is to reach London by travelling either east or west, with North America at the top connecting to European/African destinations at the bottom.

The period illustrations are wonderful, including a bust of Lenin in Leningrad (with a train heading back to Germany), Charlie Chaplin being filmed as the little tramp in Hollywood, a cannibal eating a white man in Indonesia, a hookah-smoking Turk, a kilted Scot, an arrogant European waiter, a Dutch girl in clogs and a Spaniard fighting a bull. There also are drawings of all the famous sights, from Niagara Falls, the Taj Mahal and the Pyramids to the Kremlin, Statue of Liberty, Westminster, and a biplane flying over the Eiffel Tower.

name: Artem
description: Artem is a game of risk taking, careful strategy and a board that's constantly changing. Every turn players take turns either manipulating the position of color tiles or claiming a row of colors. In order to claim a row, you just need a claim card of the same color.

name: The Resolution Race
description:
This game is from January 2017's 24-Hour Contest!

The premise is simple: You and a group of your friends stink at keeping New Year's Resolutions. You all decide to pitch in $1,000 to see who's the most dedicated to their resolution. The most dedicated player wins(dedicated= most progress made on their respective board)!

Game play: the majority of the game is spent trying to manipulate the decisions of your opponents, by playing cards to improve yourself and sabotage others!

name: Chevy Chase
description:
This rare game is one of only two published by Hamilton-Meyers Co. of Middletown, PA around 1890.

The game is a fairly routine roll-and-move affair, with players having to move four pawns from the castle in their corner of the board toward the center. The tracks are separate and colored red, yellow, blue and black, but they do cross over one another, with a picture of various bridges in the spaces where they do.

The artwork is fabulous, featuring medieval knights in battle, castles and heraldry, all in pastel tones, with an elaborate wreath in the middle awaiting the winner.

name: Paola
description:
This 2-player game with an 1893 copyright has a very unusual board. On each side, a rainbow of half-circles reaches most of the way to the fold in the middle. In between is a ragged checkerboard pattern of white and blue squares, with two large red squares overlapping some of the regular ones at the fold, and five orange squares on each side that connect to the outer arc of circles.

Starting at the center, the arcs are colored brown, black, blue, green, yellow, orange and red, two white lines and three rows of white hollow circles run from the middle to the edges. Within the green, yellow, orange and red bands are additional white circles, with the ones in the outer red band having white lines connecting them to the orange squares on the checkerboard.

It is not clear from the board what the rules were, but it was obviously a game of maneuver with circular and radial as well as checkerboard moves.

name: MolecuWars
description:
Description from the publisher:

Collect and battle to build a massive MolecuRing and destroy your opponent in a strategy game loaded with science facts and learning. Atomicals are at war to build the most massive MolecuRing and gain ultimate valence control! Strategy is the key element in this chemistry battle. Create your attack plan, partner your Chemicals, master your Labs and Energies, and destroy your opponent’s MolecuRing while defending your own!

This card battle game is based on the elements of the periodic table and science facts related to chemistry and physics.
CAUTION! You may accidentally learn about element groups, chemical bonds, oxidation states, chemical reactions, states of matter, energy transfer, scientific theories, and material properties.
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Vanished
description:
Description from the publisher:

You are a wizard's apprentice, thrust into a thrilling quest to find your master who has mysteriously disappeared. Do you venture into an ominous lair, or use some warpdust to teleport to a cliff-side cave? Will you defeat the devious Dark Fairy by conjuring a catapult, or is it better to drink a super-strength potion? Your journey unfolds with every choice in Vanished, a spellbinding Cardventure in which the correct path may just be an illusion!

name: Mission Selfie London
description:
A family of tourists arrives in London. Their objective: Explore the city and take as many selfies as they can in front of the main monuments. This race to take selfies won't happen smoothly because they'll need to answer the questions correctly — making use of vocabulary, grammar, culture, etc. — to advance and escape the traps laid by other players. Each character will have a special power.

Mission Selfie London makes learning English into a game for young players. Different difficulty levels allow the whole family to play together.

name: Musketeer 1500-1660
description: Wargames Rules for Renaissance - Early Modern warfare (1490-1690). Includes rules for movement, fire, melee, morale, and optional campaign rules.
categories: Book, Miniatures, Pike and Shot, Renaissance, Wargame

name: Faeries
description:
Description from the publisher:

Faeries race from opposite ends of the board for the safety of the central line while bombarding each other with cheese. Helpful trolls blunder about, collecting up the cheese to replenish the faeries' cheese stock, but also impede their faerie friends' progress.

The game comprises a leather board (11 x 5.5”) and hand-finished wooden pieces; with plastic dice. Each player has six faeries, one troll and six wedges of cheese. In a turn a player rolls four dice - one pink, one green and two yellow. Using the number rolled on the pink die, the player moves a faerie towards the middle safe line on the board. With the green die the player moves the troll, who can pick up cheese that has been thrown by the opposing player. Using the two numbers rolled on the yellow dice as co-ordinates, the player ‘throws’ cheese into their opponent's half of the board. Any faerie this lands on is eliminated from the game; cheese also blocks the movement of faeries towards the safe line.

Each player aims to move as many of their own faeries as possible to the central line and off the board, while eliminating or blocking the movement of their opponent's faeries by throwing cheese at them. The winner is the player who, once one player has no more faeries to move, has most faeries safe. If the result is tied, numbers of remaining faeries and cheese on the board can determine the winner.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move, Square Grid

name: Space Castle
description:
Description from the designer:

Space Castle! The game of the future! (or is it the past?) It takes just 5 minutes to learn how to play and so much longer to master. Fortify your castle with 16 Warriors before the Alien ships above destroy your kingdom with "Mr. Gotcha Bombs".

You play the game alone for 20 minutes and count how many hands you have won. Afterwards, you can pass the deck to a friend and see if they can beat your score. Who will be the Ultimate Defender of the Space Castle!?

Cards are full color and printed with a spot UV on a thick 14pt stock. Includes 43 card deck, rule book, and carrying pouch.

name: Give and Take: The Game of Soil Building
description:
This is a spin-and-move affair published in 1928 by the National Fertilizer Association. The square board is divided into quadrants, each with illustrations and spaces related to a different kind of farm: Dairy Farm, General Farm, Grain Farm and Truck Farm.

The reward and penalty spaces in each quadrant have distinct explanations. In the Dairy Farm, for instance, C = "Turned cattle in pasture too early in spring. Lose 1 Spin, while on the Truck Farm this space reads "Soil very acid; limed adequately. Go Ahead 1, Take 1 Spin."

There is a separate booklet that provides more detailed information about the good and bad practices flagged on the board.

The 16"-square board itself is lavishly illustrated, although on plain beige cardboard, with images related to each kind of farm. The game was distributed in a plain brown envelope.

name: Build or BOOM Expansion Card Pack
description: Build or BOOM Expansion Card Pack is a set of twenty new blueprint cards for use with the Build or BOOM base game as well as a sticker pack that allows you to create custom cards.

name: Battle of Britain
description:
Description from the rulebook:

This is a two-player scenario for the Europa system of conflict simulation [...]. It requires the use of maps/counters in the Europa game Their Finest Hour and the air rules and OB/OAs (Order of Battle/Order of Appearance) which are part of this package. It also requires that a number of air counters be made/modified to show the different sizes of air units used (squadron/staffel, wing/gruppe, group/geschwader) and base units. Battle of Britain simulates the air war over England and the attempt by the Luftwaffe to prepare for the possible invasion of England (Operation Seeloewe) in the late summer of 1940. It involves air combat only and is therefore suitable for assimilation of the unofficial 'Bro'Air Rules, which differs considerably from the originals. Use of the original air rules is not recommended for the purpose of this scenario.[...]

The game begins with the Aug II 40 ('Adlertag') turn and ends with the Oct 40 turn, lasting five full Europa turns.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II

name: Jim's LectraMatic Football
description:
This is a very large and unusually sophisticated electric football game that appears from the photos on the box and rules to date from the early to mid-1960s. It uses metal player pieces that are inserted into holes on the board both to set a hidden defensive formation and to run offensive plays.

Behind a cardboard shield, the defensive player places 11 men into his choice of the 29 holes on the defensive side of the playing surface. These are arranged in 7 lines: Deep Back (3), Back (5), Quarterback (3), Scrimmage (7), Beyond (3), Short Pass (5) and Long Pass (3).

The offensive player then decides both on the play and a risk factor (that adds to both gains and losses). He then inserts a man into appropriate holes, one at a time. A Backfield Run must start in a Fullback or Half-back hole, then either Deep Back or Scrimmage, then Beyond. A QB Sneak starts at the QB hole, then to Scrimmage, then to Beyond and to a Breakaway hole. For a pass, the QB starts in his own hole, then to Deep Back, and to any hole in either the Short or Long Pass lines.

In essence, the offensive player is trying to guess where the defending players are and navigate a path through them. If there is no defensive player in the hole he uses, he carries on to a hole of his choice in the next line for the play; if there is, a red light goes on and the play ends, with the results coming up on an electric spinner and multiplied by the risk factor table. If he reaches the breakaway hole, a green light comes on, leading to a big gain.

The game thus enables the defense to be shaped for any situation, from guarding against a long pass to running a blitz by placing a defensive player in the QB hole and/or one or more Deep Back holes.

There are rules for tracking time, using time-outs, and penalties (for instance, when the offense uses an illegal sequence like QB - Scrimmage - Long Pass). The positions of the football and the 10-yard sticks are marked on a strip running along one side of the playing field.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Secret Unit Deployment

name: CarmaBoard
description:
CarmaBoard is a Print-n-Play game featuring 3D papercraft cars and a modular board. The race track can be adjusted every game to include any number of tiles that join to make any shape the players choose. Each game will also feature a different number of pedestrians that the players can run over for points.

Each player receives 50 credits at the start of the game. Credits are used to repair damage to a race car at the cost of 100 credits per 1 damage repaired. More credits can be earned by ending a turn on a square that provides credits. Cars are completely destroyed if they ever have 5 damage, so repairs are critical to stay in the race!

Other squares on the race track include:

Pedestrians (must be hit to win the game)
Explosives (cause damage to race cars
Bonus squares (provide free repairs, extra turns, damage immunity, etc)
And many more


Players can attack other racers directly or indirectly. Ramming is always an option to damage other racers, but cars can also drop mines behind their car that explode when a car lands in that space or release a pool of oil that will cause a player to spin out and miss a turn.

The game ends and the winner is determined when one of the following conditions is reached:

A player finished the race by completing 3 laps
All pedestrians have been killed (the player with the most kills wins)
All other racers are damaged beyond repair
categories: Print & Play, Racing, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move

name: MiG Alley
description: Mig Alley expands M&M into the jet age. This not a stand alone game but uses the same scale as M&M. The expansion covers the Middle East and Korea from 1948 to 1956.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame

name: Putin Vs. The Dragon: The Coming Sino-Russian War for Siberia
description:
This is a wargame in which solitaire play can be fudged, but it's more usually played by two, whereby one (the "Russian player") commands the Kremlin's forces and the other (the "Chinese player") commands the Chinese forces opposed to him. Mongolia is the only other nation in the game. It starts as a neutral that may be invaded--and thereby brought actively into play--by either Russia or China.

This isn't a simulation of the "opaque" or "gray war" techniques recently used by the Russians in the Crimea and eastern Ukraine and by the Chinese in the South China Sea. Rather, it's designed to facilitate the examination of the strategic possibilities inherent in this potentially much larger and more violent situation.

The potential conflict being modeled here, though its possibility isn't yet discussed much in the border media, might best be thought of as the "war after next." That is, with the Chinese efforts to push into the Western Pacific and Indian Ocean being increasingly blocked by new alliance structures, and the "New Silk Road" across Central Asia being inescapably long and therefore vulnerable, Beijing has only one more direction in which to go to secure the natural resources needed for its hungry economy: north to Siberia.

Such a strategy has two inherent advantages for the Chinese. First, Siberia is relatively close by and, once secured, the resources extracted from it need not be shipped overseas in order to get them to Chinese factories. Second, Putin's foreign policy adventurism has left Russia with no friends other than Iran--so no other country would be likely to come to his aid.

Of course, there's one major disadvantage in a Siberian strategy. That is, Russia, like China, is a major nuclear power, with all the danger for a potential holocaust that implies.

Each full turn represents two months of real time. Each hexagon on the map represents 37.25 miles (60 km) from side to opposite side.

name: Die drei ???: Das verfluchte Schloss – Das Kartenspiel zum Film
description:
Description from the publisher (translated):

Uncover the secret of the cursed castle! Help the three investigators search for hints that move you forward: a headless ballerina, a dancing hatrack and a magic carpet lead you to the well-guarded secret hiding behind the ancient walls! Combining the hints correctly is essential for success...
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Der Seekrieg
description:
This is a lavishly illustrated German roll-and-move game from early in WWI that, possibly for the first time ever, showed the emerging role of aviation in naval warfare.

The overall narrative of the 90 space inward spiral track is of navies grappling to find one another, with ships firing and sinking, distressed sailors being rescued, and even a school of fish watching a U-boat launching its "fish" underwater, all culminating in a furious central battle scene.

However, there are six panels showing aircraft in a reconnaissance role. Two of these are Zeppelin-style rigid airships, one is a somewhat Bleriot-like two-seat monoplane, and the remaining three are early seaplanes with floats.

The game board has no indication of the game's actual title, publisher or date. However, the seaplane pictures include one that appears to be a Friedrichshafen FF33, which had a unique tail shaped like a fletched arrow, and which first flew in 1914. Since this looks like the most modern aircraft shown, the game was probably published in 1915.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Nautical, Wargame, World War I
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Race, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Wheel of Fate
description:
Wheel of Fate is a racing/war game for 2-4 players.

Inspired by the Aztec board game Patolli, the goal of the game is to be the first player to move 3 of their 5 tokens across the circuit from their start square to their end square.

Use accelerators to quickly traverse the board, ambush your opponents to send them back to the start, engage in wars between multiple players, and more!

The game comes hand packed in a cardboard box and includes:


1x Aztec Calendar game board
1x Drawstring Pouch
1x Printed Rules
5x Two-Sided Fate Dice (Only has 0 and 1 on the dice)
32x Player Tokens (8 of each color: Red, Green, Blue, Yellow)


Only those with the favor of the gods and the skill to use it will claim victory!

The board is 18"x18" when unfolded (9"x9" when folded) and the playing pieces are approximately 3/4" each. All dice and tokens come in the drawstring pouch and the board and pieces are packed inside a 9"x9"x2" cardboard box.

This is the first game produced by Garsidian Games. Each game is made to order, numbered in the order it was crafted, and comes with a hand written thank you note.
mechanics: Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: World At War 85: Red Lightning
description:
Description from the publisher:
