Red Lightning is the SIXTH volume in the World at War 85 Series of games of fast and furious platoon-level combat. The series is set in 1985, in an alternate history of World War III. With the Warsaw Pact armies driving deep into Western Europe, the Soviets open another front in the Arctic Circle. Sweden, Norway and - in an unexpected and lightning strike - Iceland are invaded. Surprised by Polish and Soviet marine and parachute forces reinforced by ship-bourne Polish and Soviet armor, the Scandanavian and NATO/Icelandic defenders are hard-pressed.
The World at War 85 system features a unique combat system that involves die rolls by both attacking units and defending units, which keeps both players engaged throughout the game. Die rolls are compared and hits applied quickly, as all the information you need to fight your units is on the counters. No combat results table is necessary. Initiative, formation activation, random turn length, close air support and air cover are all smoothly integrated.
It’s all here:


Basic, Advanced and, for each Volume, Optional Rules.



Units include:
SWEDISH STRV-103 and Centurion Main Battle Tanks
SWEDISH JA-37 Viggen Close Air Support Aircraft
NORWEGIAN Leopard 1-A1 Main Battle Tank
NORWEGIAN F-104G Starfighter Air Cover Aircraft
US MARINE (of the ICELANDIC DEFENSE FORCE) M-60 Main Battle Tank
US F-15 Eagle Air Cover Aircraft
POLISH T-62 and T-72 Main Battle Tanks
POLISH MIG-23 Air Cover Aircraft
SOVIET T-64 Main Battle Tank
SOVIET MIG-25 Air Cover Aircraft
…and many more.

name: Buy British
description:
Description from the box:

A New Map Game.

An exciting world race and one which will teach the players -
Trade within the Empire. Exports and Imports.

The object of the game is to complete a voyage to the largest of the British Dominions and land imports and take away exports, and the winner is the one who first gets home to his starting point.

name: Jumble Word Spin-Off
description: The Jumble Word Spin Board Game has three difficult levels. You can play against your family or friends with an added time twist. The game includes 100 double sided cards, one notepad, one pencil, one timer, and 100 tokens. You will beat the clock, solve the puzzle and find the hidden word. The object of the game is to be the first person to solve the most jumbles. un-jumble each puzzle and beat the clock. You can get hints by risking a token. You want to be the person with the most tokens to win!

name: MASSIVE!! Blue Invasion
description:
User summary
マッシヴ！！ Blue Invasion (MASSIVE!! Blue Invasion) is a standalone expansion for MASSIVE! Attack of the Tyrant (マッシヴ!Attack of the Tyrant), a battle between two monsters as seen in monster films like Godzilla and Gamera. Players control their own monster to defeat their opponent. No tricks are needed. Just slam it, kick it, and blow it away!

Unlike the original game whose monsters are human-shaped, this expansion introduces dinosaur-shaped and insect-shaped monsters. New monsters have their own deck of action cards, and have their own super attacks.

Publisher's summary
男子なら誰しもが経験したであろう怪獣ソフビやアクションフィギュアでのごっこ遊びを完全再現したテーブルゲームが、このマッシヴ！シリーズです。
ゴジラやガメラといった怪獣映画でお馴染みの巨大怪獣同士の喧嘩をイメージし、「殴れ、蹴飛ばせ、吹っ飛ばせ！！」をテーマにした、これまでのボードゲームの常識を覆す、全く新しいプレイ感覚のゲームです。
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Mythology, Science Fiction

name: Grey Duck
description:
Description from the publisher:

Grey Duck is a lively, fast-paced game. The custom pyramid deck structure is a unique break from the 52-card deck paradigm.

Grey Duck is played in tricks where players follow patterns of sets of cards (forms). Grey Ducks are cards that can be played out of turn to extend previously played forms.

Points are scored based on the order in which players plays all the cards from their hands.

The person with the highest score after 12 hands is the winner.

name: Tendrils
description:
2 players Black and White

Materials
A hex board having 91 cells, 6 cells per side and a supply of black and white stones

Tendril - a group of connected like color adjacent stones

Object
Player having the largest “Tendril” at endgame wins

Rules of Play
Board starts out empty

Black starts turns alternate

On black's first turn he places one stone, hereafter on a turn players place two stones into empty cells

A stone cannot be placed in a cell which does not have 4 adjacent empty cells

When no more moves are possible, the game ends
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Enclosure, Tile Placement

name: Rol-It
description:
A fast crossword game.

Each player tries to form a crossword pattern with 10 letter cubes. A dice shaker and sand timer are used to roll the letter cubes and form a crossword pattern using all 10 letter cubes in the time the sand timer empties. If a complete crossword pattern is accomplished before the timer empties, the player may place all the cubes back in the shaker and try again.

After the timer empties the shaker and letter cubes are handed to another player.

Scoring is determined by words and the amount of times a complete pattern is accomplished.

name: Nations at War: Tigers in the Snow
description:
Description from the publisher:

Tigers in the Snow depicts the nail-biting combat during the Battle of the Bulge in our Nations At War series. In December of 1944 Hitler launched Wacht am Rhein (Watch on the Rhine) catching the Allies completely by surprise. The plan was to surprise the Allies with an encirclement attack which would force the allies into a peace treaty with terms favorable for the Axis. The end result would what would be the last German offensive of World War 2.
Designed and developed by veteran Sean Druelinger, Tigers in the Snow will recreate some of the famous battles fought around Eisenborn Ridge in the north to Bastogne in the south, during the Battle of the Bulge. In the game, you can expect six gorgeous map boards with new terrain. Four counter sheets of 3/4" counters and various player aid cards. Special module rules covering limited fuel, German Commandos, and weather to name a few.

name: Nations at War: Victory Stalingrad
description:
Description from the publisher:

It’s the fall of 1942, and the fight for Stalingrad is in full swing. In Victory Stalingrad, you will command either German and Soviet forces to recreate some of the most bloodiest battles of World War 2. Victory Stalingrad will take Nations at War fans into and around Stalingrad. Victory Stalingrad will feature the drive, and retreat from Stalingrad. This is the 5th core game in the Nations At War series.
We are expecting this game will include 5 to 6 map boards, 4 to 5 counter sheets of 3/4" counters and numerous player aid cards. Stalin’s Triumph uses the newly developed v2.0 Core Rules Edition and also includes our new design your own scenario generator. This will add hours of play to your game.

name: Van Gogh Walks into a Bar
description:
Description from the publisher:

It's the XIX century and famous Vincent Willem Van Gogh is up to party. Players will define his movement from bar to bar and will try to make him pass through their food stands to earn points. A game created in México during the Global Game Jam 2017.

During the set up, each player will place 6 food stands on the map, which is compounded by 3 sectors of 5 tiles x 6 tiles. Then, players will take turns to define 15 of Van Gogh's erratic movements. Each round, one of the players will play secretly so the other players won't know for sure where Van Gogh is located.

Players can get points if Van Gogh passes through one of their Food Stands or if Van Gogh wavelike movement matches one of the Path Cards that the players have. If Van Gogh would leave the table, players may lose points.

The game ends after each player had the chance to play secretly during a round. The player with the most points wins.
mechanics: Grid Movement, Hand Management, Line Drawing, Pattern Building, Pattern Recognition, Tile Placement

name: Fall Grün
description:
September 30, 1938. British Prime Minister leaves Munich with no agreement and no piece of paper to wave at a adoring crowd. In Prague, President Benes meets with his government and the decision to resist is made.

This game covers a hypothetical invasion of Czechoslovakia in October of 1938 after a failed meeting in München.
The Game OB's has all forces present in Oct of 38 plus those that appeared up until Dec of 38.

Contents:
560 counters
2 maps
Rulebook

name: Dust 1947: Red Ace & Red Star
description:
The youngest rising star in the SSU, Leytenant (Lieutenant) Eva Koroutchenko is already a legend. She is famous throughout the bloc for her emerald eyes and long hair, every young man in the SSU keeps a picture of her near his heart for good luck and to protect him from harm. Eva is a hell of a pilot who has already scored more than 30 air victories in her short career. Axis pilots on the Eastern Front have already placed a large bounty on her head: they need her down as soon as possible!

Eva flies a unique helicopter modified to her specifications: the Red Star. She is very capable of taking the reins of any other flying vehicle in the bloc, but prefers her helicopter over anything else. Eva and the Red Star are currently stationed outside Baku. From there she flies many specials operations for Spetsnaz forces in the region.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Modular Board

name: Extinction Crisis
description:
Description from the publisher:

Extinction Crisis is a Co-operative board game for 1-6 players. Working together as a team, players must stabilize the global populations of amphibians, birds, mammals, and reptiles before time runs out or the damage done to the planet’s biodiversity is beyond repair.

Using unique character skills, combined with team strategy and a bit of luck, players travel the globe encountering real-world destruction events and conservation strategies as they try to bring an end to the worldwide Extinction Crisis. The overall health of the global animal populations is tracked on the Population Growth Index (PGI) chart on the board. For victory, each animal population must be “stabilized” by raising its PGI marker above the zero value. The primary method to do this is for a player to successfully complete a Reaction card during their turn. These scientifically accurate cards are a major determining factor towards the team’s overall success.

However, at the start of each player’s turn an Occurrence Card is drawn. These cards guide the story and introduce real-world events and challenges that must be overcome. But be careful… Just when you think you’re in the clear you could be hit with a Destruction Event, causing an entire species to become endangered or a local habitat to be destroyed. Other actions allow players to meet these challenges and progress towards their final objective. Players must also pay attention to the health of the world’s waterways, invertebrates, and plants. Neglect any of the 3 main charts (PGI, IP, and Ocean) for too long and the consequences could be disastrous: a smart team balances the needs of all 3 charts continuously throughout the game to achieve victory.

Extinction Crisis presents players with a daunting task and requires them to find solutions, adapt to challenges, and overcome the very real crisis facing the planet. With only 10 turns each, how will you rise to the occasion?

name: Robbi, Tobbi und das Fliewatüüt: Die Roboterprüfung
description:
Description from the publisher:

In Robbi, Tobbi und das Fliewatüüt: Die Roboterprüfung, Robbi and Tobbi are ready for the next robot test and now have to find new mysterious and hidden places and persons. Sitting in the helicopter cockpit, the players set course and head off on their journey — but is the triangular castle in the north or rather to the east? With skill, luck and good memory, the players will discover the places they seek and move the Fliewatüüt in the right direction.

name: Creature Quest
description:
Description from the publisher:

Creature Quest is the board game that teaches kids how positive & negative numbers work. Just pick up a card, follow its instructions, and go. Be the first to reach the treasure in the castle - but don't get turned to stone by Medusa!

name: Valtaa hansalaiva
description: Valtaa hansalaiva is Finnish and translates into capture Hanseatic Ship. The game is part of Finnish Public Television's (YLE) historical educational series covering the pirates on the Baltic Sea in the early 15th century. Players are divided in two crews led by historic pirates Klaus Störtebecker and Birgit Fleming. The game is won by the crew that is able to first capture half of the 13 cabins and the captain's cabin. You are capturing cabins by rolling 5 or 6 with D6 while in the conquer space of a cabin. Member of the opposing crew in the same room can counter your capture attempt by rolling a 1.

name: Bushido: Aiko & Gorilla
description:
The Temple of Ro-Kan gain some real punching power, the mighty fists of a Gorilla. Fiercely protective of Aiko, the Gorilla is a fearsome opponent at the best of times, when he is imbued by Aiko’s blessing he becomes almost invincible.

Blister contains two miniatures, one 30mm base, one 40mm base and two full colour profile cards.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Bushido: Shisa
description:
The guardians of the temples, these silent sentinels have stood for eons outside many a shrine or holy place. Now with the realised threat of another wave they have been reanimated from their long slumber. Always fighting in pairs, the links between the two run right to the very core of their being. In this time of strife, the return of the Shisa is a timely relief.
Blister contains two miniatures, two 30mm bases and full colour
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Bushido: Riku
description: A favourite of the temple elders and new initiates alike, Riku personifies what it means to be a Monk. His mastery over water allows him to achieve awe inspiring feats on the battlefield, creating walls of water out of the very air to hinder his opponents.
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Dust Tactics: ISU-203 Heavy Assault Gun – "Sergei Shtemenko"
description: Since 1943 the ISU format, a heavy self-propelled gun mounted on a tank chassis, has become a staple of the SSU armored forces. Easy and cheap to build, efficient and deadly, these vehicles are now found everywhere on the planet where the SSU fights. The “Sergei” is the latest version and mounts a 203mm D-30S very heavy gun, capable of knocking out any enemy armored target. The vehicle is presented here in its Babylon pattern camouflage, as observed around Mesopotamia circa 1947.
categories: Miniatures, Science Fiction, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Modular Board

name: Bushido: Koji & Koji's pack
description:
Koji has been waiting as patiently as he could for his time to protect all he holds dear. Since he turned away a lone ninja Koji has finally been allowed that chance by the temple elders. Individually Koji and his macaques would fall quickly but united they stand. The shared love and loss of Kita has cemented the bond between boy and monkeys to something akin to brotherhood, each willing to fall in place of the next.
Blister contains four miniatures, four 30mm bases and two full colour profile cards.
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Bushido: Master Po
description:
Master Po’s return has caused quite a stir in the halls of the temples of Ro-Kan. His jovial presence has lifted morale of every monk from the initiates, to his fellow masters. Po’s manipulation of Ki belies his rotund appearance allowing him to be deadly in close combat, many have been caught cold as the big man lands hammering blows.
Blister contains one miniature, one 30mm base and one full colour profile card.
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Bushido: Minor Kami of Fire and Water
description:
The extent of the unbalance facing the world is highlighted by the emergence of these minor Kamis. While they are a mere shadow in comparison to their godlike brethren they nevertheless have brought their not insignificant powers to bear in the name of the Temple of Ro-Kan. They allow the monks to do what they do best.
Blister contains two miniatures, two 30mm bases and two full colour profile cards.
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Bushido: Kintaru
description:
As trouble and unrest sweeps across the Jwar Isles the unlikeliest of heroes are emerging to support the Temple of Ro-Kan. Kintaru is one such man, a peasant more at home fishing the rivers and lakes of the mountains than fighting. Nether the less he has given the strength of his arms and his keen eye to protect that which he holds dear.
Blister contains one miniature, one 30mm base and one full colour profile card.
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Spy Tactics
description:
From DriveThruCards.com

Spy Tactics is a secret agent themed MicroGame for 4-9 players who will form 2-3 teams of agents. Agencies are Chimera, Tachyon, and Vex. Each agent receives an Alignment card, a point tracker card and 8 code cards. (The same 8 code cards are given to each agent.) After examining their code cards, each agent will choose one to discard. The other 7 form a player's hand, though only 6 of these will come into play.

Agents activate their cards simultaneously. Some have repercussions or rewards if other agents activate the same card simultaneously. In addition to scoring points for your agent team, you may attempt to eliminate opposing agents, though there is also a chance of eliminating team mates. In the end, remaining agents on a team will add their victory points. The highest scoring agency wins.
categories: Card Game, Deduction, Print & Play, Spies/Secret Agents
mechanics: Hand Management, Player Elimination, Simultaneous Action Selection, Team-Based Game

name: Operation: Overfur
description:
Operation: Overfur is a family friendly card game where players take turns playing cards that match the species or class of the card on the top of the discard stack.

However the game has various special cards that can be played to trip up your friends and family.

Persevere through the special cards and be the first player to place the last character card in your hand on the pile to win the game.

name: Bushido: Kawa No Rojin
description:
Description from the publisher:

Kawa no Rojin stampedes his way across the battlefield trampling any that get in his way. Considered to be a lucky animal by the Monks of the Ro-Kan, his presence drives them on to courageous acts of valour.
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Escape from the Black Hole
description:
Game in The Black Hole Annual 1981, a Disney Corporation film.

A simple race game. The track has 100 spaces. Most spaces are fine. However, if you land on a white space, you find that the gravity force has cut your engine power. You must stay on that space every turn until you throw a 6 which boosts your engine power and allows you to carry on with your journey. If you land on a black space, this represents extra power by the Black Hole and you must return to the Start space and start again on your next turn. The rules say "Care should be taken to avoid the white and black hazard squares". Well, that would be great but seeing you have to move with just a die roll, it is imp0ossible to "take care".

The winner is the first to reach the Clear space at the end of the track.
categories: Book, Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Racing, Science Fiction

name: Bushido: Minor Kami of Earth and Air
description:
Description from the publisher:

The Kami can no longer sit by and watch the Balance be thrown further from its natural alignment. Whilst the Temple benefit greatly from the advantages these Kami grant their forces, the stirring of the elements is a further sign of how much work is to be done.
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Bushido: Fisherman of Rokan
description: Long have the Temple of Rokan and the peasants lived in symbiotic harmony. In times of great turmoil the two continue the alliance. The Fishermen who make their lives from the great Sune-Kudansu, fishing from her many tributaries now add their talents to fight. Whether slipping through terrain without trace or calling upon of their cormorant allies they stand opposed to all enemies of the Temple.
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Dust Tactics: First Sergeant James Murphy – "Crazy Jimmy"
description: The Marines have arrived in the Middle-East! And First Sergeant James Murphy of the United States Marine Corps is going to lead his armored force into whatever situation arises, and come out on top as usual. This amazing pilot is a ferocious foe for anyone who stands in the way of the might of the Allied army.
categories: Miniatures, Science Fiction, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Modular Board

name: Dust Tactics: Master Sergeant Frank Stone – "Quiet Jack"
description: The Marines have arrived in the Middle-East! And Master Sergeant Frank Stone of the United States Marine Corps is going to lead his men into whatever situation arises, and come out on top as usual. This rugged veteran is a ferocious foe for anyone who stands in the way of the might of the Allied arm
categories: Miniatures, Science Fiction, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Modular Board

name: Women in Space
description: Women in Space is an expansion pack for Women in Science, adding 8 female astronauts (a new type of scientist), 4 Discovery cards (protects a lab against Prestige cards) and 4 Prestige cards. These 16 cards are added to the regular Women in Science deck.
categories: Card Game, Educational, Expansion for Base-game

name: Hissy Fit: the Thinking Drinking Game
description:
Description from the publisher:

It's Hissy Fit'', a new kind of party game for adults featuring creativity, vice, and reckless behavior! Oh, and also drinking and gambling.

We present, for your entertainment, a new sort of party game for adults. Fair warning, though, it contains drinking, racing, expenditure of petty cash, and all manner of chicanery. Have you ever wondered if you were the fastest thigh-poker around? Are you confident that you could portray the most convincing withered crone? Do you excel at eloquence while inebriated? Want to win money from your friends? Do you enjoy judging the wit and skills of your peers? If you answered affirmatively to any of these, Hissy Fit is the game for you!

Oh, and it also pays for itself the first time that you win, provided you play for real money. Now that's value!

A game of Hissy Fit consists of players dividing into teams and competing against each other in bizarre and humorous challenges. These can be anything from “First person to reach the Great Outdoors” to “Best Impromptu Facial Hair” to the dreaded “Slurgeon General”, where a player will be forced to navigate a tricky tongue twister. After judgement is passed, losing players pay a dollar in tribute, and the winner flips their coin to determine how the drinks are administered. If they’re lucky, all the losers will drink, but if fortune turns against them, they drink instead. After much competition, the besotted winner gets a huge pile of cash, and the losers go home happy.

What's with the name? Well, in Hissy Fit, outbursts of laughter are both constant and contagious. Naturally,we decided to reward and punish it simultaneously. When the Hissy Fit token is invoked, all laughter is forbidden and only good-humored hissing is permitted. This effect persists only until someone screws up, but it is truly a sight to behold. As it happens, trying not to laugh is in fact more hilarious than just laughing, and the copious hissing adds tremendously to the fun.

It's a game that pits subjectivity against objectivity in winners. Want to win a "Best" challenge? You'll have to convince the judge of your superiority. Want to win a "First" challenge? Well, the only things standing in your way are your own limitations. It's truly the best of both worlds!
mechanics: Acting, Betting and Bluffing, Role Playing, Singing, Team-Based Game

name: ABC: Animals
description:
On turn players choose a letter and try to write down on the block mammal - bird - fish - bug - reptile/amphibian on for each box.
Round is over if first player has filled all 5 boxes in row or players agreed to end the round.
Each word not written by others scores 2 points, each other word scores 1 point.
After 8th round add up the points and the player with the most points is the winner.

name: Ultraz
description:
In Ultraz, you're a team captain. Build your team of 15 Ultraz and defeat your opponent.

On your side, you'll have 6 active cards. The front 3 cards serve as offense while the back 3 serve as defense. With these cards, you'll attempt to pass, black and shoot.

First person to 3 points wins the game.

name: Dust Tactics: USMC Recon Squads – "Force Recon"
description: The Marines have arrived! Deployed in front of any USMC force, the Recon Squads provide intelligence and are able to communicate efficiently with fire support units should they encounter any threat. These are sneaky, and deadly, Marines!
categories: Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Modular Board

name: Dust Tactics: USMC Anti-tank Squad – "Hot Shots"
description: The Marines have arrived in the Middle-East! And they bring with them some deadly new weapons, just out of Detroit's arsenals. The recoilless rifles give these soldiers an incredible firepower against anything on the battlefield. And you can be sure Marines will make the most of it! They are presented here in their Babylon camo, as used by USMC forces in the Middle-East, circa 1947.
categories: Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Modular Board

name: Critter Combat
description:
Description from the publisher:

Critter Combat is a 2 - 4 player battle and capture card game with cool critters that have even cooler abilities. This game is played with one of 4 included 26 card decks, and a set of 18 habitat cards. Play your cards for abilities to set back your enemy or bolster your positions, use them to capture habitats, or take on your opponent in adorable battle.

Your army of fuzzy critters has been pushed too far! Take your cute, furry, and fuzzy animals to war on a no–holds–barred mission to destroy, decimate, and humiliate your enemies. Take back the trees and land that are rightfully, and not so rightfully, yours!

name: PORTAS
description:
User summary
PORTAS is a two-player card game with a theme of treasure hunting. Players are competing treasure hunters, and at beginning of the game, each player has the same deck of cards, and each card is numbered 1-6. Two treasure cards (valued 11-15) are revealed on the table.

Players take turns placing a card from their hand on either of the treasure cards revealed. When the total value of the cards placed on the treasure equals to the treasure value, the current player takes the treasure and scores points. Then a new treasure comes on the table.

All cards in players' hands are public information except the one they would draw at the beginning of their turn. So you should play cards so that your rival doesn't take a treasure next turn, but sometimes you are forced to play a bad card, and there's some chance the rival would draw the exact card they want.

The game ends when all treasures are taken or both players passes in a row. The highest scorer wins the game.

As long as a child can count to 15, the game is easy enough for the young. The game uses original art and public domain artwork.

Publisher's summary
PORTAS （読み方は「ポータス」。造語。日本語でも英語でも同じです。）

二人のプレイヤーはトレジャーハンターとなり、宝箱に眠る宝を取り合います。
宝箱の底には魔法の鍵があり、宝はその鍵を手に入れないと数分の内に消えてしまうのです。
宝箱の中身の残りの数を考えて、「丁度最後の一個を手に入れる」事を計算しながらより多くの宝を手に入れるのが目的のゲームです。
バケツやバッグ、木箱等の入れ物を使い宝を自分のもとに運び出します。その中で最後の一個である「鍵」を自分が手に入れられるように、計算をしましょう。
相手の手札（バッグなどの入れ物）は全て公開情報です。明かされた情報と、そこから少しだけ絡んでくる運。そして先を読む頭脳で戦うシンプルな「足し算」ゲームです。
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Educational, Math

name: Schaper's Cat and Mouse Game
description:
Theme: For the tricky little mouse to get into any one of his three cheese holes without being caught by the fast sly cat
Game Play: Mouse is moved by using magnetic "mouse" wand underneath the game board. Cat is moved by using magnetic "cat" wand across the top of the game board. Start the cat on one of the starting circles, the mouse is placed in the other starting circle. The game starts when the mouse player says "go". Cat scores when he catches (touches) the mouse anywhere on the board. Mouse scores when he eludes the cat and enters any one of the three cheese holes. As mouse and cat score, they advance one square on the scoring board. After each time the cat or mouse score the players switch, mouse becomes cat, cat becomes mouse. First to score 6 times and land on the house on scoring board wins.

name: Bushido: Suchiro
description:
Description from the publisher:

Suchiro, is the embodiment of determination and persistence. With a goal or objective in his mind nothing can stop this quiet and thoughtful monk from reaching it. In battle he fights resolutely, anchoring the forces of the Temple and proving to be an unbreakable bastion for the defenders of Jwar. Many strive to understand the riddles of the Kami of Chikyu’s Rock but this monk of the Temple of Ro-Kan has and in doing so brought the teaching to bear on those that would seek to upset the balance. Suchiro’s wrath may not be quick but like the mountains and earth it is inevitable.
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Bushido: Sojobo
description:
Description from the publisher:

The martial skills of the Tengu are legendary across the Golden Empire. Although few in number these avian Yokai long lives give them ample time to gain mastery of not only the martial but also to learn the secrets of the kami who call the mountains their home. Hidden away in their mountain top cities and guarded by the devoted hill tribes few have ever seen these mysterious warriors. What has brought Sojobo down from the mountains and to the aid of the Tengus' old allies the Temple is not known. Sojobo’s skills in combat are equalled by very few. Now he has spread his great wings and left his mountain home the spirits and prospects of the people of the Rokan can only be lifted as a result.
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Bushido: Tsutsumi
description: This venerable monk is a seasoned defender of the Temple. Though his sight left him at a young age his senses and awareness of his surrounding remain sharp as a fox. Like most monks of his age there is little left in this world that can cause fear in this wandering warrior of the Temple. In battle Tsutsumi carries with him the ancient Guqin, carved from an ancient wood and passed down from monk to monk since the first rays of sunlight rose over the mountains of Ro-Kan. When his lithe fingers strum its strings as he has done for many decades, using the sweet sound and combining it with his deep voice to create powerful prayers, Shomyos. He uses these to inspire his allies, or suppress and distract his enemies. Tsutsumi can also use the Guqin to channel a powerful wave of sound, knocking hapless enemies to the ground.
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Bushido: Hisao
description:
Description from the publisher:

For centuries the Temple and the people of the Ro-Kan have lived in symbiotic harmony and for centuries the secrets of the Kami and the mountain have passed between these two allies. Misao, like all village elders has for decades made the decisions for his village and acted as apothecary using the secrets passed down from elder to elder. When his special mix of herbs, found on the mountain, are burned in his censers it clears those of aliments, clears the mind or soul. The peasants in his village follow his every word without question and although physically weak his strength lies in the wise words he draws upon to inspire those around him to great feats of combat prowess in the defence of their lands and peers.
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Bushido: Seiji
description:
Description from the publisher:

Like all monks of the Temple of Ro-Kan, Seiji is following a path and element that he was always destined to. Still in the early years of his training this calm and relaxed monk is already showing signs that he will become a great defender of the Jwar Isles, and an asset in the struggle against the chaos. It is told that Seiji sat under the Grand Father tree for a full cycle in meditation, quietly becoming as one with the forest around him and in a deep communion with the sacred Kami. The secrets he learned now enable Seiji to seek out the help of the natural world around him, it comes to his and the Temple’s aid. Enemies find themselves rooted to the spot, held firm as they are bound and restrained by the very ground itself. Along with this ability Seiji has also achieved a higher level of understanding and attunement with his own body, enabling him to focus his energies and recover from even the most severe of wounds at an astounding rate.
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Home Alone 2: Lost in New York – "Talking" Electronic Game
description:
Theme: Harry and Marv chase Kevin, with actual situations from the movie.
Game Play: As Harry and Marv get closer, Kevin taunts them by saying 3 different phrases. Draw a card and move characters according to the color spaces and traps on the card. If the burglars catch Kevin they win the round.
categories: Card Game, Dice, Electronic, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Grid Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: It's Not Your Turn!
description:
A fast paced card game where players try to score the least points at the end of the game. The game ends once a player is down to two cards. Points are the number of cards in each player's hand plus 'It's Not Your Turn' cards.
Players take turns either playing the correct card from their hand (if they have it) face-up, playing a card face-down in an attempt to either bluff or reverse-bluff, or being honest about not having the right card and taking a 'It's Not Your Turn' card. Players can even use a house rule where they can try to steal another player's turn(s) by playing certain number cards at the right moment.
The game has a lighthearted spoof theme of the stereotypical gamer elitist as shown on the different suit cards and on the game box.

name: Dust Tactics: USMC Command Squad – "Mustangs"
description: The Marines have arrived! The USMC Command Squad is charged with leading the Marine Forces in combat. Like its Ranger counterpart, it brings a whole lot of new options for your army. It changes drastically how you can control your troops, making sure you'll get the best of every unit!
categories: Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Modular Board

name: Bushido: Ashinaga Tenaga
description:
Description from the publisher:

Ashinaga Tenagis are usually sited in streams or rivers and it seems that they have a deep connection with the water, able to commune with the water around them to turn the land into a sea of mud. These yokai, long a legend amongst the peasants of the Ro-Kan, exact motivations for joining the fray are unknown but they are a welcome boost to the morale of the villagers they appear to protect, their presence imbuing a sense of belief in the common people enabling them to fight harder in defence of the balance of Jwar. To look at them individually one would think that they lack any combat skill, but once combined, one astride the other, the pair are a tricky opponent. With a snaring net in one hand which they use to either entangle an enemy up close or from afar, in the other a diamond sharp fishing spear handled with great precision.
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Bushido: Master Akari
description:
Description from the publisher:

The legendary Master of the Temple’s slow and thoughtful nature with his students is the exact opposite when on the battlefield. The diminutive Tanuki is a cyclone of energy, flying between enemies in a flurry of blows, dashing from melee to melee. Nigh impossible to target at range the enemy must close in an attempt to deal with this furry thorn. The Temple do not exclude any who hold the needs of the many and protection of the realm above personal gain as their ideals, Master Akari & Kuma are perfect examples of this mentality.
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Bushido: Kaito
description:
Description from the publisher:

What the peasants of the Ro-Kan lack in weapons and armour they make up for with their knowledge of the lands they are defending and with the ingenuity born from the necessity to survive in these times of war. Kaito’s tenacity on the battlefield is inspiring to those around him, allowing those imbued by his courage to shrug off lesser wounds. Knowing the lands like the back of his hand, allows Kaito and his allies to pass through the foliage unimpeded, meaning the Temple can pick their battles where the terrain is most advantageous.
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Bushido: Kyuubi
description:
Description from the publisher:

Unlike the female Kitsune the males of this mysterious and seclusive yokai race cannot shapeshift and instead keep the form of an anthropomorphic fox. Kyuubi is a skilled warrior and hunter of those his people feel are to blame for the current imbalance in Jwar. He serves a swift and decisive punishment to those Shisai and Shugenja abusing the spirits for their own ends. Waiting silently in the cover of the foliage before striking like a vengeful spirit against the enemies of the Temple.
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Bushido: Oki Shisa
description:
Description from the publisher:

The defence of the oldest temples and most sacred shrines is often entrusted to the great Oki Shisa. Mountains of ever watchful stone, still and silent for decades but always ready. None know how many Oki Shisa there are but these holy wardens are the bane of those who would attempt to manipulate their Ki against the Temple or hold sway over the land. The enchantments that gift the Shisa protection also imbue the stone with a keenness akin to a Masamune blade.
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Bushido: Master Enos
description:
Description from the publisher:

None have managed to attain such a deep and wide understanding of the world as the venerable Master Enos. His body now old but his mind and powers have never been stronger. His knowledge of the elements enable him to exploit the very Kami themselves, drawing on their energy to transform himself into a conduit of nature’s strength. The other Masters however question how much this unique ability damages the balance and relationship the Temple holds with them. It is certainly obvious that Enos’s mastery of the Void has enabled him to unlock knowledge of the element thought lost and forgotten. Some powers though are better left lost.
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Bushido: Kira
description:
Description from the publisher:

Kira is an able and astute student, keen in practise and eager to study. Although slight in frame and few with words she is more than capable of holding her own against much larger foes. She spends hours each day in quiet meditation listening to the rocks and the stones and learning their secrets. From this knowledge she has started to unlock the power that lies silent within her, able to change her body for a short time into an impenetrable and unmoving barrier.
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Bushido: Kuma
description:
Description from the publisher:

Kuma is the rock on which the water breaks the solid and resilient constant of the Temple. With Bo staff or claw he strikes out and floors foes with swift and brutal strikes. Despite his mass it is difficult to pin him down or outnumber him and with a practiced mediation Kuma can reach out to the roots of the earth to bind and hold firm those would overrun him.
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Plezant gezelschap
description: Boardgame like Game of Goose, where you have to collect coasters by solving riddles, while racing to the end of the track. Bottle caps are used as player markers.

name: Chinese Zodiac Card Game
description:
This is a traditional card game from the southern parts of Taiwan and Penghu County. The game uses 10 sets of 12 cards depicting the 12 Chinese zodiacs, namely the Rat, Ox, Tiger, Rabbit, Dragon, Snake, Horse, Goat, Monkey, Rooster, Dog and Pig.

Players are dealt 11 cards each, with the banker dealt an extra card. The goal of the game is to form sets of 3, either in sequence or of the same zodiac. It is also possible to form a set of 12, i.e. all 12 zodiacs. The player who manages to go out first, i.e. 胡牌, receives a certain amount of chips from the other players.

name: Het Groot Denksport Puzzelwoordenspel
description:
Finally a game to play out your knowledge of spelling against others! This game requires you to draw cards with letters on them. Clues guide you through the spelling of words, like 'it starts with a P' or 'It has 8 letters'.

Who knows the most puzzlewords? Who draws the joker? Who can claim the words with the required elements? Never was a word puzzle so amazing!

name: BEEctionary
description:
BEEctionary is a hex tile placement word game. The game allows players to play in 12 various languages - English, German, French, Russian, Turkish, Arabic, Persian, Italian, Spanish, Portuguese, Dutch and Azerbaijani (all letter tiles are included in one box).

The goal is to create in each round the longest word no one can beat by placing only one letter tile each turn. The game starts with bee hex that could be used as any letter during active player's turn. The word can be in any direction as long as all hex tiles to be used are adjacent and in proper sequence. After each round winner of the round takes all hexes he/she used on his longest word. Next round starts with the next player and with all tiles left on the table after winner of previous round gets his tiles.

Player scores 1 point for each letter and 3 points for bee hex. The one who reaches 20 points first is the winner of the game.

name: Gunship Crew: A Solitaire Game of Helicopter Gunship Combat in Viet Nam (1965-1973).
description:
Gunship Crew is a Game where you are a Commander of a Helicopter Gunship in a Helicopter Assault Company in Viet Nam. Your Goal is to manage your aircraft and crew and Complete a Campaign consisting of a series of Missions and score as many Victory Points (VP) as possible to assist the war efforts. Campaigns can be Short (8 Missions), Moderate (12 Missions), or Long (16 Missions). If the Player takes too many losses before their Campaign is complete, the Enemy will gain the initiative and win.

Missions include rescuing downed crews, helicopter assaults, convoy escorts, river patrols, hunter-killer and general fire support.

The Combat system is similar to the one used in Patton's Best by Avalon Hill. This method best captures the feeling of flying a single Helicopter and resolving combat.

GUNSHIP CREW can be found at the following URL:
http://www.berserkergames.net
categories: Aviation / Flight, Print & Play, Vietnam War, Wargame

name: Omen Quest
description:
Omen Quest is a slight trick taking card game based around 5 rounds, where two players or a 4 player co-op on two teams try to out do their opponent with effective card combinations to win each round with the objective to win best out of 3 before the game ties into a death match in the 5th round.

Players maintain 5 cards or 3 cards for 4 players and expense coins to play card combinations. With some luck, and a bit of strategy of how you maneuver through your guild of cards that you burn haven cards to gain better hands, you must avoid burning too many of your haven cards or you instantly lose. Some players take risks, some play conservatively, if you have a good stride with your style it may work for you depending on the player you play against or it may fail you every time.

There are other strategies to win the game that may deplete your opponents coins disabling them from playing effective card combinations to win or playing your hand right forcing your opponent to burn a lot of haven cards. The tone switches drastically from a contemplative 2 player game to a very social 4 player game of banter and psyching as players trade cards and manage wins without doubt of winning the game.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Hand Management, Rock-Paper-Scissors, Trick-taking

name: Bushido: Golden Sentinel
description:
The Golden Sentinels are the bodyguards of the Emperor’s clan, guarding the family on their travels, in their homes and in court. They also serve as escorts to his Teishin as they journey his Empire spreading his holy word. If the Teishin of the Imperial court are the Emperors voice in distant more barbaric lands, then the Golden Sentinels serve as his shield, all proven warriors, sworn to protect their charges with their lives if needed. However, such is the size of the Golden Empire that Imperial missions and postings can often take many seasons to complete not taking into account the travel across the great empire and so often the Sentinels can sometimes take on the local customs and in rare circumstances become embroiled in the affairs of locals.

Blister contains one miniature, one 30mm base and three full colour profile cards.
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Bushido: Yukio Koshimori, Imperial Envoy
description:
Yukio Koshimori is one of the shrewdest, craftiest minds in the empire. Many question his recent arrival in the Jwar Isles, some suggest his appearance a bad omen; that the Empire’s interest in the isles is piqued whilst others claim it can only lead to prosperity. What is certain is that when Yukio speaks, he speaks with the authority of the emperor and whether he is questioning a samurai’s honour, chastising an underling or barking orders, he cannot be dis-obeyed. Yukio is a representative of the Imperial Court and can issue a decree in their name should those in his presence displease him. This single action leaves those who oppose him with their plans in tatters, their troops powerless, having no choice but to obey the word of the Emperor.

Blister contains one miniature, one 30mm base, three full colour profile cards and an enhancement card.
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Bushido: Mikio
description:
Mikio is a moving mountain on the battlefield. Jumo wrestling skills honed in the pits of Jima enable him to push, pull and throw opponents of the Prefecture at will.

Blister contains one miniature, 30mm base and full colour profile card.
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Bushido: Daisuke
description:
Once washed up, Daisuke now washes away the pain of battle from his allies. He has become a specialist, channelling his Ki to heal and support the forces of the Prefecture. He is never far from the fray and can often be seen ensuring members of the Takashi family return home.

Blister contains one miniature, 30mm base and full colour profile card.
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Bushido: Tenchi
description: Tenchi, Seishin na Goei are an ancient order of highly skilled warrior women sworn to protect not only the bodies of the lords of Ryu, but also their souls. Offering their lives in service of their clan, fearless in the face of death and cold steel for those that oppose the Takashi.
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Bushido: Fujitaka
description: When the tide of the battle is changing and the will of the Prefecture’s soldiers is waning, Fujitaka is there waving his banner and rallying the troops. His bravery in the face of impossible odds is well known and his fellow Ashigaru find their own inner strength in his presence. Fujitaka also shares his own strength to enable others to continue the good fight.
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: The Man from U.N.C.L.E. Annual: No Man's Land
description:
The game pits two players in a race to reach the 'safe' farmhouse. Each player rolls a die and moves along his line. You go back and forth until you land on a circle. The circles might send you up a line or down a line. If you land on a red square entitles you to another throw. Land on a green square and you miss a turn.

The game appeared in The Man from U.N.C.L.E. Annual, published in 1969.
categories: Children's Game, Comic Book / Strip, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Racing

name: Dash Through the Dungeon
description:
Dash Through the Dungeon is a fast-paced game of dungeon exploration for 2-6 players ages 6 and up. Each player takes on the role of a brave adventurer, making their way through a series of dark dungeons. Your goal is to find treasure while avoiding creatures and other obstacles, like traps and locked doors. You’ll have some help along the way in the form of useful equipment and beneficial encounters.

Contents:

60 Dungeon Cards

21 Equipment Cards

Set Up:

First step is to separate the Dungeon Cards and Equipment Cards into two decks and give them both a good shuffle. Next take the Dungeon Cards and deal out the first dungeon, laying 20 cards out face down in a 4 x 5 grid. This will be the first dungeon that the players will take turns exploring.

Next deal out three equipment cards at random to each player. This is your starting equipment. Players are free to look at these cards. You can place them either face up or face down on the table in front of you. Playing with them face down adds a bit of additional suspense to the game since other players won’t know if you have the equipment needed to get past a particular encounter until you reveal it.

Now you’re ready to play.

Taking a Turn:

The game is played in a series of turns. A player starts their turn with 6 action points or APs. Once its decided who goes first, players one begins their dash through the dungeon. They select and flip over any card on the 5 X 5 dungeon grid, then subtract the AP cost of that card from their remaining APs. In some cases, like flipping over the Pit Trap, the card may tell you that you must “lose all remaining AP and end turn” which means you’re turn is done. Some equipment cards, like the Float-Up Potion, can be used to cancel out these cards. A card that’s canceled in this way costs 0 AP. Some equipment cards can also be used to reduce the AP cost of certain cards, like Bandage, or even reduce them to 0, like Freeze Bomb. Your turn ends when your AP reaches 0 or you flip over a Treasure. When your turn ends you take any cards you flipped over, keeping Treasure cards separate from the other dungeon cards.

Then it’s the next player’s turn to explore. Players continue until all the cards of the first dungeon have been flipped over. When the last card is flipped, the AP of the player who flipped it is reduced to 0 and their turn ends.

Another 4 X 5 grid of Dungeon Cards are then laid out and the next player’s turn begins. Play continues in this order until a total of three dungeons have been explored.

Winning the Game:

Once all three dungeons have been explored players add up the value of their treasure cards. They then count up all the other Dungeon Cards they’ve collected and add the amount to the value of their treasure cards. Whoever has the most points wins.

name: Bushido: Genji & Eiji Takashi
description: Born to fight, there was never a doubt that these twins would take any path other than that of the samurai. Genji strong and quiet, Eiji quick to anger but equally quick to laugh, on the battlefield when fighting back to back they fight with an unmatched unity.
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Hull Breach!: Bank of The Galaxy
description:
Originally released as part of Hull Breach!'s Corporate Wars box set, this individual deck has been revamped and improved for the current edition of the game.

Our enemies think their production and their weapons make them strong. We know better, Commander. A well-placed spy can be worth more than a fleet of warships and a well-placed bullet can defeat whole armies of Marines. You have the immense resource of the Bank of the Galaxy behind you. Use them wisely to divide them and turn them against one another. Profit from their stubborn attempts to rule the galaxy through force of arms. Then, when they have been suitably bled, deliver the finishing blow.
categories: Card Game, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Push Your Luck

name: Bushido: Katsumoto Takashi
description: Sensei at the Koryu school in Ryu, Katsumoto has for many years passed his exceptional tactical skills on to the sons of the Takashi clan. It is recognised that much of the military success in the Dragon wars was down to Katsumoto’s cunning. Katsumoto spent much of his formative years in the lands of the West, studying in the further flung schools, tirelessly researching the local teachings of warfare, always hungry for knowledge. On the battlefield Katsumoto is the personification of calm, every move is considered, every order weighed. Those who have faced the old warhorse know that there is never an easy victory when Katsumoto Takashi is your opponent.
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Dust Tactics: NDAK Command Grenadier Squad – "Fox Cubs"
description: The Afrikakorps is finally back to where it belongs! The NDAK Command Grenadier Squad is a special unit of field officers whose skills are invaluable. They are equipped with submachine guns and a machine gun, and their presence on the battlefield can change the entire course of battle, thanks to their invaluable skills. A wise general should take care to protect these experienced officers.
categories: Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Modular Board

name: Bushido: Guardsman of Ryu
description:
Whether with yari or the fabled Arquebus the ashigaru stationed at Ryu are staunchly loyal to the Takashi and will defend their clan to the death. They are trained and drilled relentlessly to ensure that in battle they act and react instinctively, unflinching as they wait for orders from their Gunso or samurai commanders. The Arquebusiers see it as such an honor to be picked into the regiment that it is said that they even take them on their final journey to Hantaisoku. The fear their weapons create is rightly deserved as there is little that can stand up to raw power, steel, wood and fire fused into this fearsome device.

Blister contains one miniature, one 30mm base and one full colour profile card.
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Bushido: Akio Takashi
description: Akio Takashi is a legendary sensei of the finest sword Gakko in Ryu. The majority of the Takashi line has learning under his excellent tutelage. Now in the twilight years of his life and with the need for all able body warriors to answer Hida’s call, Akio has put down his Bokken and stepped forward to offer his life in service to his lord. Still a fearsome warrior but the real advantage he offers any fighting force is his expert knowledge of combat. His ability to instruct the samurai around him with either a point to a chink in a seemingly impenetrable suit of armour to a swift reminder of the techniques he taught them on the dust training ring of the Gakko, he is another strong commander to join the Prefecture of Ryu’s ranks.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Brain Parasites
description:
STORY
Your ship has crashed and suffered serious damage. It's up to you and your crew-mates to traverse the corridors to repair the ship's core systems and call for help, but be careful because your ship has been invaded by BRAIN PARASITES!

GAME PLAY
Brain Parasites is a tile based game where you explore your ship to complete the goal. Play as one of 6 crew members each with unique stats. Work as a team until the enemy reveals itself.
Open one of 36 rooms each holding a new surprise as you fight for tech and increase your skills. Will your team survive, or will the alien creature claim the vessel?
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Tile Placement

name: Sausage Sprint
description:
Simple race game. Roll a die and move along the track. The track is a string of sausages. Obey the instructions should you land on a designated space. First to reach the dog's hide-out, wins.

The game features two characters from the Disney film Oliver & Company, Oliver and Dodger. It appears in the Disney and Me Annual 2000.
categories: Animals, Book, Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Umsteigen bitte!
description:
English (German follows below):

The city is a Card Game.

Everybody knows UNO: Just put cards of the same colour or the same number on top of each other to be the first without cards.

Now there is the Vienna-Variant: The colours symbolize metro-lines, the numbers bus-lines. Therefore each card stand for another station in Vienna and its transfers.

~*~

Die Stadt ist ein Kartenspiel

Jeder kennt MAU MAU oder UNO: Legt Karten gleicher Farbe oder gleicher Zahl aufeinander um als Erster alle Handkarten loszuwerden.

Jetzt gibt es die WIEN VARIANTE: Die Farben auf den Karten stehen für die Wiener U-Bahn-Linien und Zahlen für die Bus- und Bim-Linien. So bietet jede Karte - je nach Station - mehr oder weniger Umstiegsmöglichkeiten.

name: I've Brought You Back a Baby Dragon
description:
Board game in which people go off on a trip and have to bring back ice cream, postcards and purple dragons. You go round the board (with some choice as to where you go), nip into shops picking up souvenirs, and head home when you have a full set.

The other players are both racing against you and can occasionally swap what you have with someone else.

The board is a work of art, and the pieces are typical tourists with flowery hats and cameras.

The game comes with a dice for movement and to help you escape the task of browsing in a shop.

The board has symbols, so the game should be playable in any language with a set of rules in that language.

The rules are simple and complete. You can learn the game in about 2-3 minutes, and there are no surprises (e.g. odd exceptions) so the game flows well.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Sexy Ninja Death Squad
description:
Description from the publisher:

Sexy Ninja Death Squad (or SNDS for short) is a fast fire card game designed for 2+ players than can last from 15-25 minutes. Players furiously attack each other and defend themselves in order to be the last ninja standing. Each card can be used in attack or defence and placed in the Head, Body or Legs position depending on it's tabs. There is an Active Character Token (or A.C.T.) which signifies the active player. On receiving this you draw one card and can play one card on the players sitting next to you. They then have to block this attack with a card of their own OR give you a hit token (you have 3 of these in the standard game). When you lose a hit token you recharge your hand back up to 5 cards. Lose all 3 and you are defeated.

There are three special indicators which can appear on the cards and these signify 'Flurry', 'Riposte' or 'Ninja Star' cards. When a Flurry card is played in an attack you immediately draw another card and can play another attack card. If another Flurry card is played then you draw and play another attack and so on...

When a Riposte is played in a defence you immediately draw another card and can play an attack card on the player your attacker. If a Flurry card is played then its free second attack can hit any valid player.

The third type of card is the Ninja Star which can attack anyone.

Flurry and Riposte cards chain without limit which means your games get very hectic very quickly. The more people who are playing the more fun it becomes because more players means more ACTs!

It is not uncommon for other players to attempt to kill steal by lobbing a ninja star across the table, or you having to change tactics when your carefully prepared Flurry chain gets blocked and you have Riposte attacks to survive. Sometimes it is better to take the damage, lose a hit token, recharge your hand and come out swinging.
mechanics: Hand Management, Player Elimination, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Kings Watch
description:
A co-operative medieval crime fighting game, it is a strong story driven co-operative experience, where you take on the role of watchmen trying to find and arrest criminals. When you sit down to play, you pick a case to attempt, some are for beginners while others challenge even the most experienced players.

During your turn you must prioritise either gathering clues, following up leads or hunting out information. Working together is important, as there is limited time to find and arrest the guilty before they escape and you lose. After you’ve finished your turn, a story card is drawn. These cards change the game, moving the suspects, adding special rules and generally making the game tougher.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Hand Management, Worker Placement

name: Double Picks
description:
User summary:
ダブルピックス (Daburu Pikkusu) is the risk-taking card game Double Picks.

Each turn, you reveal a card from the deck, and when you reveal the same card as one of the cards revealed so far, you must take all of them. Instead of revealing a card, you may take the last card revealed.

Cards are numbered 1-9, and there are more cards with higher values than those with lower values. Cards with lower values are colored blue and are counted as one negative point each. Other cards are red and counted as negative points equal to their face value. You should consider the risk of taking negative points while making your decisions.

Description from the publisher:
1～9の数字カードがあり、大きい数字ほど枚数が多く、小さい数字ほど枚数が少ない構成になっています。各プレイヤーが山札から1枚ずつカードをめくって場に出していき、すでに場に出ている数字と同じ数字が出たら場のカードを失点として引き取ります。失点を避けてカードをめくらずにパスをすることもできます。パスをするときは直前にめくられたカードを1枚だけ引き取ります。数字には赤と青の2色が存在し、赤の数字はカードの枚数が失点となり、青の数字はカードに書かれている数字が失点になります。いかに失点を減らすか、リスクを考えてカードをめくるギャンブルゲームです。

name: MATEVO
description:
User summary
マトエヴォ (MATEVO) is a Japanese deduction game with a graph to plot opinions.

At the beginning of the game, players are dealt X and Y axis cards, which are placed on your personal board face-down to form an X-Y graph that represents evaluation criteria such as hot/cold and good/bad.

Each turn, you give a word card to another player, and that player plots the card on their own graph at their discretion.

At the end of the game, players guess other players' axis cards from the word cards they have plotted.

User summary
各プレイヤーに、物事の評価基準を示す「縦軸」「横軸」のカードが配られる（例：熱い／冷たい、善／悪）。ターン毎に、他プレイヤーに対し「ワード」カードを渡し、渡されたプレイヤーは自分の（秘密の）評価基準で、自分のチャート上どの位置になるかを示す。
各ワードの配置を見て、縦軸、横軸の評価基準を当てるゲーム。

name: Ricky Dillon's Twisted Truth or Dare
description:
Social media influencer, Ricky Dillon creates his first ever card game in Twisted Truth Or Dare.

Written and created by Ricky, the game includes 300 unique playing cards - 150 Twisted, 75 Truth, 75 Dare.

Separate your cards into 3 decks: Twisted Cards, Truth Cards, and Dare Cards

1. The card-puller picks a Twisted Card and identifies the specific person in the group it most likely represents.

2. Once that most likely person is selected, he/she pulls a Truth or Dare Card and completes the card.

3. Once the most likely person completes the Truth or Dare, they pick a new Twisted Card and the round starts over.

4. The person to have 10 Twisted Cards loses. Whoever has the fewest Twisted Cards wins.

name: Bin'Fa: Enhancement Set
description: The Bin'Fa Enhancement Set is an aesthetic upgrade for the Bin'Fa: The Tao of War Abstract Strategy War Game. It includes 6 sets of Army Unit Decals, using artwork from the flags on the box cover, 6 Tetrahedron Terrain Markers (to replace the black checker pieces), 6 Black Vortex Triangles (to replace the white checker pieces), and the weather die, which adds an exciting new rule element to game play.

name: Frog Family Fun-Pack
description: Frog Family Fun-Pack is an educational game for children, with various math and reading modules, all using the same rules and board. Players take turns choosing a card and attempting to answer the question on the card. If the answer is correct, they move their pawn on a track the number or spaces printed on the back of the card. If the answer is wrong, the card is placed back in the middle of the stack. Extra turn spaces and shortcuts also appear on the track. The first player to reach the end wins.

name: Dust Tactics: PanzerKampfLäufer IV-E – "JagdWotan"
description: The JagdWotan is one of the deadliest walker on the planet. The latest version is armed with four brand new laser guns that can punch through anything the SSU or the Allies have. This walker will serve the Axis Army for many years to come. It is presented here in its Babylon Camo Pattern, as used in the Middle-East, circa Summer 1947.
categories: Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Modular Board

name: Big Hero 6 Action Game
description:
Big Hero 6 is a "6 in 1" game - it has 32 cards which are used in six different games, based on classics children's card games.


Action Game - Win by getting ride of your cards as soon as possible.
Action Game Snap - Win by getting all the cards.
Pairs Game - Win by collecting the most pairs.
Double Pairs Game - Win by collecting the most double pairs.
Donkey Game - Win by not having the "Donkey" card in your hand at the end of the game.
Happy Families Game - Collect the most Happy Families.


First published as part of a collection of promotional card games for Morrison's Supermarkets in the UK.

Contents:
32 Playing cards
2 Rules cards
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Memory, Science Fiction
mechanics: Hand Management, Memory, Open Drafting, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Dust 1947: Mobelwagen Ausf. B
description: Since the invasion of Normandy by the Allied forces in 1944, the Axis have been in trouble with their opponent's air superiority and the sheer number of planes they can have in the sky at any given time. While they were developing jet powered aircraft, they also worked a lot on ground vehicles that could protect the troops. The Möbelwagen Ausf B (Model B) is the latest generation of these vehicles, built on the venerable Panzer IV chassis. But with six brand new guns. It is presented here in its Babylon Camo Pattern, as used in the Middle-East circa 1947.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Modular Board

name: True Story
description: True Story is an adult party game where you use cards prompts to inspire stories of extraordinary experiences or legendary lies. One player draw a card, tells a story involving the prompt on the card, and the other players guess whether or not the story is true or false. If the majority of players guess incorrectly the storyteller keeps the card. Play continues until one player has three cards.

name: Dust 1947: Panzerspahlaufer I-K – "Luft Hans"
description: This airborne operations ready walker is used in the Luftwaffe Ground Divisions. Thanks to its thrusters, it can be parachuted directly on the battlefield, joining the action as soon as the rest of the invasion force arrives. This model is tasked with destroying enemy strong-points and heavy armor, with the help of its powerful short range rockets.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Modular Board

name: Ready Set Train!
description:
Description from the publisher:

Ready Set Train! is a card game which consists of several exercises which combined will give you a workout (and a lot of fun!) while trying to beat your opponents. Draw cards, finish your exercises and complete your secret mission. But don’t forget to keep an eye out for your opponents. You can use special cards to help you finish your secret mission before your opponents do or draw cards to block them from completing theirs. Don’t forget to keep in mind you might need their help at some point in this game!
categories: Card Game, Humor, Party Game, Sports

name: House of Whispers
description:
England, 1940. Claire and her little brother James flee the bombing of London to stay in their late grandparents' abandoned mansion in the countryside. During their first night in the house Claire wakes to find James missing. As she searches for him she begins to realize the house is haunted, but luckily the spirits are not all bent on doing harm. The ghosts of her ancestors are there to whisper into her ear the dangers that lie ahead so she that may avoid them and find James.

House of Whispers is a cooperative game in which one person plays Claire and the rest play the friendly spirits. As a spirit, communicate what information you can to Claire. As Claire, you must make the right decisions to avoid the terrors of the house and save your little brother!

At the beginning of the game all players choose one word. The spirits communicate to Claire with facial expressions and by saying their word in such a way to communicate any information they can about the cards they draw. For example, if your word is "beware" and you draw a zombie, you might say "beeewwaarrre" in a slow grating voice while rolling your eyes and fixing a dead stare on your face. Claire may then decide if she wants to run from this threat or push on and try to deal with it as she searches for James.

Search the house for clues as to James' whereabouts and discover items that may help you locate him. You must save James before 8 rounds are up, otherwise he will be lost to the house forever.

name: Dice Trek: A Space Battle in a Tin
description:
To boldly roll where no dice have rolled before.

Dice Trek: A Space Battle in a Tin is light and fast 2 player duel, in which you will be trying to be 'last ship floating'. You will collect power and damage your opponent's mother ship by pushing and pulling two custom dice on a five card space battlefield, by deploying cards with units of various strength and influencing both dice simultaneously most of the time.

Designed for 2016 Mint Tin Design Contest

Best Overall Design - 8th
Most Innovative Mechanic - 9th
Best Theme - 8th
Best Artwork & Graphic Design - 3rd

Guest Judge: Caroline Berg - Top 3 Picks
2nd pick
"Dice Trek: A Space Battle in a Tin, while I'm not a person for two-player games, I couldn't resist the theme. The game is more than just Star Trek: The Dice Game - it mixes in many Sci-Fi tropes, creating a feeling of nostalgic Sci-Fi action. The rulebook is well done, covering all the information the players need, and the graphic design is top notch."
categories: Abstract Strategy, Dice, Print & Play, Science Fiction

name: Mowgli
description:
Mowgli is a cooperative tile game based on the characters of the immortal novel The Jungle Book of Rudyard Kipling. It has a cooperative playing mode and a competitive mode.

The game includes different scenarios, inspired of different episodes of the tale. Every player represents one of the main characters of the tale: Baloo, Bagueraa, Kaa or Akela and will try to help Mowgli to hunt, to escape from the Lost City or to fulfill his destiny, banishing the fearsome Shere Khan from the jungle.

The game is based on the principles of the tile games. We will create a template of tiles on the table, which simulate to be the jungle. The players will move their animals by turns, trying to avoid the dangers of the wilderness, to obtain enough food or to move Mowgli to a safe location.

But every turn Shere Khan will be stalking and getting closer to his prey, Mowgli.

name: Batman Game
description:
"A thrilling dice game for any number of intrepid players! You'll need a dice (sic) and a counter for each gamester - and nerves of steel as you encounter the arch-villains of Gotham! Are you tough and lucky enough to reach the Batman at Wayne Manor?"

A simple dice game. Move along the trach and obey the special squares should you land on them.

Published in the British book called Batman Official Annual 1981.
categories: Book, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Racing, Science Fiction

name: Putzroboter
description:
Publisher's summary
Putzroboter is the German name for a robotic vacuum cleaner.

Divide and clean up the mess of paper clips on the table.

When the game starts, there should be four different colors of paper clips spread out randomly on the table. Deal the paper clip cards to assign each player a particular color of paper clips to clean up. Take turns pushing around the robotic vacuum cleaner to collect the paper clips.

There is a magnetic ball contained within the robot. When the robot comes close to a paper clip, it will be able to pick up the paper clip. Collect your own paper clips but beware of picking up the clips belonging to a color of another player. If you do, you must give them the paper clip.

It’s important to move in a manner in which you pick up only your own color of paper clips as much as possible. Sometimes the robotic vacuum cleaner will move somewhere you didn’t think it would go. It’s difficult to balance your thinking between the degree of strength, direction, and other factors required to progress as planned.

The first player to pick up all the paper clips of their own color is the winner.

Publisher's summary
テーブルの上のクリップを手分けしてお片付けしましょう。
ゲームスタート時のテーブルには4色のクリップがたくさん散らばっています。

ゲームの最初にクリップカードを配り、それぞれどの色のクリップを片付けるかを決めます。

順番におそうじロボットを押して発進させ、クリップを取りましょう。
ロボットの中には磁石球が入っており、ロボット本体にクリップがくっ付くと、クリップを取ることができます。
自分の色のクリップを集めるのはもちろん他の人のクリップもくっ付くと、そのクリップを他の人にあげなければなりません。なるべく自分のクリップだけを取れるように発進させることが重要です。

また、思わぬ方向におそうじロボットが行くことも。向きや力加減のぐあいも思いのほか難しいものです。

いち早く自分の色のクリップをすべて取った人の勝ちです。
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Party Game

name: Unicante 2007: Das Spiel zum Chor
description:
Unicante 2007 is a German card game based on the student's choir Unicante, specifically its concert season 2007 and the choir members of that year. Cards represent singers, songs, events etc.

Players compete to collect cards forming a choir and line-up of songs to gather victory points. They have to manage the balance of the vocal parts in their choir and the overall mood of their group, take into account the abilities of their choir members, and use event cards to improve themselves or impede the other players.

A "concert" card mixed into the lower part of the deck announces the end of the game and victory points are counted for the final tally. The player with the highest total wins.

name: SUGAR DROP (シュガードロップ)
description:
User summary
In the game of シュガードロップ (SUGAR　DROP), you are one of a group of teen girls, and your goal is to brighten your life by dressing up and getting rid of stress.

Although the game features girls, what they show is not just sugar-coated cuteness. The theme of the game is the cuteness and the slyness of girls.

They are 'frenemies' who work against one another while pretending to be friends. For example, they sometimes don't invite a certain girl to a tea party. A girl's slyness like this adds cuteness to themselves.

Each turn, you may take one action from these options:
1) Buy a dress card
2) Activate a dress effect
3) Remove a stress card from you
4) Give a stress card to an opponent
5) Suppress one of an opponent's cards
6) Recover one of your suppressed cards

You need to have a certain coordinate points to buy a dress, and a certain appeal points to remove a stress. These values are changed by some card effects.

At the end of the game, total those values and subtract the remaining stress values from the total. The highest scorer win the game.

Publisher's summary
プレイアブルキャラクターがすべて年頃の少女であるカードゲームです。
少女たちが主役となるゲームですが、彼女たちが発揮するものはお砂糖のようなかわいらしさだけではありません。
このゲームのテーマは少女たちの「かわいらしさ」そして「おそろしさ」です。
一人だけ仲間外れにするティーパーティー。
普段は仲良しの友人として振舞いつつ、影では足をひっぱるフレネミー。
みんな友達で、みんなライバル。
少女たちの少しおそろしい部分が刺激的なスパイスとなり、かえって少女たちのかわいさを引き立てます。

ドレスカードで着飾り、ストレスカードをなるべく排除し、ライバルたちよりも輝かしい自分を目指していきます。
さまざまな役割を演じるアクトレスカードを追加して、難易度を調節することも可能です。

足の引っ張り合いが主眼となるゲームですが、協力プレイモードもあるので、フレネミーな関係に疲れてしまったら、少女たちの仲良しな甘い関係もお楽しみくださいね。
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Take That, Variable Player Powers

name: 4 Verita-Spiele
description:
This game includes 4 dice-games with a game board to document the winning points with wooden counters (blue=100, black=10, red=1). If a counter gets on a red or white number the player gets a penality (retreat a number of spaces or pay game token).

1. Die 999
The first player to roll 999 or higher wins the game. Each player rolls 3 dice. The lowest number is multipled by 100, the next highest number by 10. If a sequence is rolled (1-2-3, 2-3-4, 3-4-5, 4-5-6)the player pays 2 token into the playing till. By the roll of a triplet he has to pay 2 token the player to his right. If he rolls "Kanone" (2-1-x, 3-1-x, 4-2-x)he has to pay 2 token to the player to his left. In all 3 cases, the numbers don't count for winning points.

2. Die lustige Sieben (The funny seven)
The Players rol 3 dice. The first to reach 999 wins the game.
Rolls that include "7" (all 3 or 2 dice) or "14" (all 3 dice) get special points. There is a rise- and a descent-phase. During the rise the player who rolls the lowest number gets the Points of the player who rolls the highest number and vice versa. During the descent it's the opposite.

3. Hunderteins gewinnt (101 wins)
This game is played with 1 die. The player to exactly reach 101 wins the game. If a player rolls over 101, the surplus points are substracted. Each turn the player may roll as often as he choses. But if he risks to much and rolls a 1, he only gets 1 point for the turn.

4. Max & Moritz
This is a combination of game 1 and 2.

name: Biblical Buddies
description:
From the box

"Biblical Buddies draws both child and adult alike into a land where 20th century meets biblical history. Experience the exciting journey from the Garden of Eden to the Promised Land. Meet Adam and Eve, Noah, Moses, David and Goliath and all the Biblical Buddies characters. Players begin in the Garden of Eden and embark upon an adventure through major events of biblical history including Noah's Ark, David and Goliath, the Parting of the Red Sea and many more. This journey includes both setbacks and rewards with the ultimate goal of reaching the Promised Land."
