The XP can be used to eventually gain up to three Levels. Each new level has three Skill Cards you can choose from. You place the acquired Skill Card below your Adventurer Card.

Each Encounter displays from one to three Impact Icons, which signify how dangerous, horrifying, and taxing the encounter is to resolve. Unless the adventurer immediately avoids (or escapes) the encounter, s/he will be impacted by interacting with it.

The Encounter Impact will add to the character's Personality, which in turn, affects how effective s/he will be during subsequent encounters.

In addition to encounter impacts, there are Event Cards that come into play for different durations that also display Impact Icons on them.

Whenever conditions in play match those specified on active Event Cards, the event impacts the adventurer. The Event Card is then placed under the Adventurer Card, with the Event Card's bottom section visible from the appropriate side of the Adventurer Card.

A possible outcome of the event is that the character becomes mentally afflicted, emotionally disturbed, or physically maimed.
Thus, as the adventure continues, the character may become too emotionally, psychologically, or physically weak to continue to pursue his or her End Goal. In this case, the adventurer loses the game.

Conversely, the adventurer wins the game by enduring encounters and events (some of which are positive), and by attaining his or her End Goal.

Each End Goal lists varying levels of success, so you always try to score higher in subsequent gaming sessions.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Card Game, Dice, Exploration, Fantasy, Print & Play
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Push Your Luck, Variable Player Powers

name: Sportsnørd
description: A quiz game by Michael Szymanski. 4,500 questions.

name: Mir
description: A quiz game by Michael Szymanski. 20,000 questions

name: Tibetan wedging game
description:
西藏夾棋 (Tibetan wedging game) or 青海藏棋 (Qinghai chess) is an abstract strategy game played on a 5x5, 7x7 or 9x9 Alquerque-style board.

Players take turns to place their stones on an empty intersection until the board is full except for the center intersection; then they take turns to move a stone to an adjacent empty intersection. When a piece of one color is trapped between two pieces of the opposite color, or between an opposing piece and the edge of the board, that piece changes to the opposite color as in Othello.

When one player has no legal move, the player with more pieces on the board wins.

name: MARS WARS
description:
MARS WARS is a game of military conflict between Chinese and US space forces comprised of Infantry, drone tanks, and artillery.  It is also a game of military conflict between Chinese and US space forces against an alien Martian life. 

Using a modified version of Worthington Publishing’s HOLD THE LINE system you get scenarios giving you battles that will stand out in Chinese and US history --- Assault on Base Armstrong, The Defense of Ride Ridge, and more.   Once the aliens appear you’re going to have to fight to hang on against the hordes of aliens, and then root them out of their tunnels.
Each battle lays out your forces, objectives for victory, and the game board.  Each turn you receive action points that allow you to order your forces to move and fight.  The action points you receive vary from battle to battle and for each side.  No two turns or battles will play the same. 

Each type of unit moves, attacks and defends differently so using your forces properly is critical to victory. 
The game comes with wooden blocks and labels for three armies (China, US, and Alien), a hard-mounted double sided game board, terrain tiles, rules, battles, and dice.  Designed for 2 to 6 players (it is playable easily solo by playing both sides as things happen that frustrate the best laid plans).  Insignias on the pieces designate at least 3 squads per country that can be played by separate players, plus someone can be the aliens. 

Scenarios are playable from 45 – 90 minutes.  Ages 10 and up.
categories: Dice, Fantasy, Science Fiction, Space Exploration, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Hexagon Grid, Modular Board, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers

name: King Cat: Feed Me
description:
A Trick Taking Game of Winning Cat Friends and Cat Fights

Play offering cards of different values and houses to earn a range of blessings from the Houses of Elder Cats across multiple seasons

Each season you will strategically play your 5 blessing cards, play one per round, to earn better rewards or deny your rivals resources.

At the end of a season, new offering cards are dealt, repeating the process.

Use these offering cards to secure Lesser and Crown Blessings from the Houses of the Elder Cats to stock your Fiefdom with food, entice wild cats to your Fiefdom's Court, increase your share of Catnip, and gift your food stocks to wild cats to turn them loyal to your fiefdom.

Newly recruited cats can offer significant powers to your fiefdom. Other cats can add new powers when are fed.

Use your newly fed loyal cats to "trump" your opponent's offerings or fight off your opponent's cats to secure your reward.

The first player to feed 3 wild cats and make them loyal to his/her fiefdom wins the game.

NOTES: Offering Cards are now Mini Sized! - not Micro as depicted and also now all cards and player spaces include texture and uv coating!

name: Touhou nimensou ～　reversible Night (東方二面相 ～ reversible Night)
description:
User summary
東方二面相 ～ reversible Night (Touhou nimensou ～　reversible Night) is a fan fiction / alternate universe card game based on the video game series Touhou Project produced by Team Shanghai Alice.

Each card has 3 suits and effects. A special characteristic of this game is that two cards can be combined into a single double-faced card.

Players should initially be given 2 cards of each of the 9 types for a total of 18 cards. Each player should then proceed to freely combine two differing type cards, back-to-back, to create a total of 9 double-faced cards.

Every card has three suits (Power, Speed, or Brain). The suit that wins or loses the current trick is decided at the exact moment the first player or the winner of the previous trick plays a card. Once the suit has been decided, the card of that suit with the highest value wins the trick.

If there is a tie, all cards with the same highest value are flipped face down and the next highest value is calculated again from the remaining cards in play for the trick. If all players have the same value and the tie cannot be broken, no player is declared as winner for that trick.

The winner of the trick claims the points that were decided at the beginning of the game for each trick. All players, excluding the winner of the trick, may choose to turn over one card in their hand (which gives them a better chance to strategize in secret against their opponents).

Repeat for a total of 9 tricks. At the end, the person with the greatest amount of points is the winner.

A second edition 輝針城編 (Kishinjou edition) was released in 2016, with a new set of cards. Both sets can be mixed together.

Publisher's summary
「東方二面相 ～ reversible Night」は上海アリス幻樂団様制作「東方Project」作品の二次創作カードゲームです。
カード毎に３つのスートと効果を持ち、2枚1組で両面表のカードとして扱うのが特徴です。
プレイヤーはそれぞれ9種類2枚ずつ、計18枚のカードを持ち、種類の異なる2枚の裏を自由に組み合わせて1組にし、両面が表の1枚のカードにします。
カードはそれぞれ３つのスート(パワー・スピード・ブレイン)を持ち、先攻または前トリックの勝者がカードを出すと同時に、このトリックでの勝敗を決めるスートを指定します。
指定スートで数値の大きいカードがそのトリックの勝者ですが、もし引き分けならば、引き分けのカードを全て裏返し、再度数値を比べます。
1度裏返しても同じだった数値のカードは勝敗に含めません(全員が同じ数値だった場合、そのトリックは勝者無しとなります)。
トリックの勝者はゲーム開始時に決めておいたトリックごとの点数を得て、それ以外のプレイヤーは自分の持つカードを1枚裏返すことができます。
9トリック繰り返し、獲得した点数の多いプレイヤーが勝ちとなります。
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Trick-taking

name: Frappé ! A Miniature Wargame of Tactical Maneuver in the Napoleonic Era
description:
A simple set of rules for tactical combat with miniatures set in the Napoleonic era.

Ground scale figure scale 1:10.
No ground scale given.
Designed to be played on a hexed terrain board.

44 pages of rules and army lists.

From an idea by Duke Seifried, developed by Ray Johnson.

First volume in the Wargamers' Library line.

name: Flipmode
description: A chess-like board game with a twist. Every turn you can move a piece and possibly capture enemy pieces, or you can choose to change the movement or capture capabilities of some pieces on the board.

name: Delmer E. Esau's Blak Dragon
description:
Description from the publisher:

Fight for survival during the Solar Conflict. This is Delmer E. Esau's Blak Dragon.

The Techno-Communists have razed the Earth. The former NATO group, now known as the Rogue Army, face the Cyborg Uprising in a thrilling 3D competitive tactical board game series. Also play as the Techno-Communists, the Zero-G Mafia, the Corporates or the Settlers.

This is a biopunk cyber-tactical military board-game. At the dawn of the 22nd century the ambush assault at the hands of the Machine Communists destroyed much of the planet Earth. NATO and others hold on to honour while others like the Zero-G Mafia and Corporates do it for cash. The Settlers, Martians and other Solar communities fend for their land titles and spatial positions.

This game features cutting-edge game technology like layered board modules, dry erase record keeping, character units and multi-theatre elements. Fight it out in orbit while waging a ground campaign at the same time. Large Junkspace orbital cities are often the battleground depicted by map-tile layers that players can record damage, fuel and ammunition supplies on. Virtually any hotspot in Sol system will be supported with full mapping and engineering information; in-game attributes provided on the boards.

Typically a Blak Dragon mission has players' fielding a capitol vessel, with garrisons and hangers bays, against each-other. Players field these capitol ships complete with square 3D map-boards that depict the vessels deck plan and attributes on cards provided (attributes like space travel movement). Also, capitol vessels are represented by a large unit piece on hexagonal map-boards that has three layers that allow three-dimensional fighting in outer space. A vessel's action is planned three moves ahead with secret Command and Network cards being played face down. The vessel's movement, weapons, and network abilities are declared this way. Players will have to guess ahead to what their opponents Commands will be, simulating slow-acting-commands and fog-of-war. Network digital hacks can be assisted by netrunners deployed along with other space infantry units in boarding parties.

ALL vessels from capitol ships to fighter craft are combined with dry erase playing card markers. Fuel, ammo and air are recorded and spendable. Fighters, gunships, mecha, all can move on the main board.

Genre conflict elements include nuclear weapons, cluster missile pods, recoiless A.I. automatics, lasers and hand-to-hand blade and martial arts. Fighter-craft, robotic weapon systems, gunships and stealth units are deployable. Send fighter craft, gunships and mecha to assault enemy vessels in zero gravity space and wage infantry battles with your boarding parties. Die rolling and skill attributes compared with die-rolling, armor and dodge determine damage and or loss of units.

Also, the Uplift Community, everyone from the Dolphins to the Dawgs, will be represented. Dolphin Settlers have a stake-hold on Mars with their backs to the Earth investment, now vital. Dawg mercenary infantry companies are deployed across theatre. The space breather group once known as shipbuilders rebel at lost fees and exile and are now called the "Zero-G Mafia". Cockroachers stake-held Saturn as well having better fared the scourge of stolen ships.

Characters exist in Blak Dragon with special abilities and strengths. You will recognize them from the novel Blak Dragon released in 2013.

Look forward to more incredible news about the Blak Dragon Era in the "Infantry" expandable hybrid media universe soon.
categories: Mature / Adult, Print & Play, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Action Queue, Area Movement, Area-Impulse, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Hexagon Grid, Modular Board, Point to Point Movement, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Phase Order, Variable Player Powers

name: Hurra, ein Parkplatz!
description:
Contents: 16 cars in 4 colours, 1 number die, 1 letter die, 1 board, and rules.

Each player has a set of 4 cars in their colour. They must use a car until it has parked and then they can use their second car, and so on. First to park all 4 of their cars, wins.

Roll the number die to move your car. You can go in any direction. A parking space must be reached exactly. When you park a car you must roll the number die again together with the letter die (this is called "paying the parking metre"). The throw will probably refer to a parking space somewhere on the board, the number die reveals the area and the letter die reveals the actual parking place in that area. Any car in that space must be moved back to the start. Should a blank be rolled on the letter die any cars in the parking places must 'feed the meter again' i.e. roll the number and letter dice again.

The game is undated but an educated guess would be around 1960. Interestingly, even with fewer people around, it was still difficult to find a parking space!

name: Libido
description:
Libido (リビドー) is a board game released during the Game Market 2016 Autumn (ゲームマーケット2016秋) in Odaiba Tokyo on December 11th 2016.

In Libido, all the players are brothers living in the same house.
Being a young adolescent, your 'libido' is without equal.
That's why you go out and buy erotic magazines secretly from your siblings and hide them carefully in the house so no one else can find them. Neither by your brothers adventuring in your room while you are out nor by your mother cleaning frenetically her lovely child's room.

Unlike the title might suggest, the art is absolutely safe for all players : only the 'concept' is perverted. The game is mainly aimed at a male audience, nostalgic of their youth.

name: The Receptionists
description:
Description from the publisher:

In The Receptionists players compete to reach as much money as possible by checking in guests and selling them extra services. Each player is a receptionist and their goal is the same. Once the guest deck is empty the game is finished and whoever collected the most money wins the game.

While the players take turns in the reception each player can intervene by playing Challenge cards to stall the progress of other players, who can counter these with Rescue cards. You gain these cards by spending action points which are also used for checking in guests and selling extra services and you can get them depending on which type of guest you choose to check in the hotel. There are Penniless, Fishy, Lovely and Rich guests each with their own abilities and available money. The guests also have preferences in terms of rooms and extra services. In case a guest doesn't like the room you choose for him/her they might get offended which will cost you!

The game will contain the following parts:
one large board,
5 decks of cards (Guest cards, Room cards, Challenge cards, Rescue cards and Extra services cards),
4 receptionist figures,
48 coloured wooden discs for each player (action points),
4 dice,
a rule booklet
20 playing money notes of each type (500, 100, 50, 10).
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Simultaneous Action Selection, Take That, Trading

name: Vigilante
description:
Your town — your life — hasn't been the same since HE came to power. He rules with fear and violence, and no one dares stand up to him. No one but you. Starting with nothing more than righteous indignation, you acquire the training, resources, equipment, and experience needed to take down the Nemesis and get back your life. You move in the shadows. You let nothing and no one stand in your way. You are a vigilante!

Objective:
In Vigilante, the goal is to become the first player to reach 40 Experience Points, then defeat the Nemesis.

Player Ability Slots
Your playmat lets you keep track of your progress as you complete your costume. You can have 1 Head Equipment, 1 Body Equipment, 2 Arm Equipment, and 2 Signature Moves/Weapons. If you acquire Equipment, but there is no room for it, you gain the E.P. from it, but then must decide which card will stay on your playmat. The other card is removed from the game. It also states your character bonus. This bonus can be used once every turn and represents your area of expertise.

Turn Overview:
Each turn you will be using your skills (dice) to increase your experience and bring you closer to facing the Nemesis. Each turn consists of three phases:
1) Upkeep Phase.
2) Roll Skill Dice.
3) Use Skill Dice.

Using Skill Dice:
Once you have finished rolling your dice, you may engage them to further your plans. Dice can be used to Obtain Equipment, Steal Equipment, Discard an Equipment Card, Train, Gain Resources, trade one color of cubes for the other (Focus Intent) Obtain New Skills, or Patrol the City. You can do as many of these actions each turn as your dice will allow, in any order you want. If you cannot or do not want to perform any of these actions, you may just pass your turn.

Game End
The game ends as soon as one player can defeat the Nemesis. To challenge the Nemesis, you must first reach (or pass) the 40 spot on the Experience Point Track. Once this is done, you can challenge the Nemesis. You must declare that you are challenging the Nemesis at the beginning of your turn after the upkeep phase, but before rolling any dice. Move your maker off the board and place it next to the area marked “Level One” on the Nemesis card.

To defeat the Nemesis, you must be able to overcome all three levels on their card. You do not have to overcome all three levels in the same turn. If you overcome a level, you may move your marker to the next level and end your turn. You may also press your luck and attempt to overcome another level. If you do so, you gain the reward from completing the level. You can then re-roll your dice up to three more times, but none of the equipment you’ve used so far is refreshed. If you ever fail to complete a level, you lose all of the progress you made this turn and must move your marker back to the level it was on at the beginning of your turn.

You do not have to challenge the Nemesis each turn after acquiring 40 Experience. You can still use your turns to gain more equipment, experience, or training before attempting to challenge the Nemesis.

name: Joy'n Force -ジョイフォース-
description:
User summary
Joy'n Force -ジョイフォース- (Joi Fo-su) is a game where you collect characters in the 3 attributes to get Event Cards, and gain Victory Points.

Under special conditions, grabbing cards from your opponents (and vice versa) also happens. To spice up the mood, you must shout out "Joy!" when claiming cards.

Publisher's summary
３種類の属性に分かれたキャラクターを集めて
イベントカードを手に入れ
ポイントを獲得してゆくゲームです。
特殊な条件でカードの奪い合いもできます
また、気分を盛り上げるために、カードを獲得するときは
必ず「じょい！(Joy!)」と言ってください。

name: Fest der Hexe
description:
User summary
Fest der Hexe is a battle-type card game with beautiful illustrations from many different artists.

Players draw cards from the common draw pile, and discard them by matching colors. The player whom emptied their hand first wins.

Whenever discarding, some combinations may trigger effects. Some effects may disrupt your opponent, while some may boost you to victory.

Publisher's summary
美麗なイラストが特徴の、対戦型カードゲームです。
プレイヤーは共通の山札からカードを引いていき、カードの色をあわせて捨てていきます。そして一番早く手札を0枚にしたプレイヤーが勝利します。
ただし、手札を捨てる際に、そのカードの組み合わせによって、そのカードに書かれた様々な効果を発動させることができ、それによって他のプレイヤーを妨害したり、自分を勝利に近づけたりすることができます。

name: Hero's Journey
description:
From the back of the box

Hero's Journey is a game for children ages 6-12 years to teach them about women's abuse and domestic violence. It is done in a safe, child-friendly, educational way, using "knowledge" and "strategy" cards to inform children about best practices and response to violence. It also gives children a platform to speak about abuse and violence.

Each player moves on the board by the roll of a die. The goal is to complete the four "Rites of Passage" in order. Each Rite of Passage is completed by collecting cards, depending on the space that the player landed on. These cards are either Reward Cards (where the player immediately receives some sort of benefit) or Strategy Cards (where the player must answer a question about what they would do in a real-life situation). It is suggested that the game is moderated by a licensed practitioner, who is responsible for rewarding the players who have made good choices.
The game was commissioned by "Victim Services of Peel [Ontario]", a municipal organization that deals with families and children of abuse. It was made specifically for practitioners working in that environment. It is recommended that the game is played only with a licensed professional, as it is used mainly as a teaching and healing tool for victims of domestic violence.
mechanics: Role Playing, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Big Boom... or Golden Age
description:
This Cold War game seems to have been propaganda for the brand-new United Nations. It's a roll-and-move affair, but with one player playing the Atom Bomb and moving around a doomsday-clock circle while the other 1-5 players move Nation pieces cooperatively on a spiral toward the goal of a single world government through the UN.

The components include 8 lettered Nation pieces, 34 Vote cards, 36 Goodnews cards, 36 Badnews cards and markers for the A-bomb and the number of its trips around the clock. The Nation players on their turns roll two dice and can move any of the pieces by either or both dice. Each starts with a single Vote card and adds another each time a Nation piece reaches the center or when a third Nation is moved onto a space with two others. There are spaces marked with a "?", and when a Nation lands on such a space, the Nations players each get to draw and act on a Goodnews card.

The Bomb player also rolls two dice, and can use them either to move the bomb forward or to move one or two Nations backward onto a "?" by exact count. If the Bomb player does so, all Nations players must take and act on a Badnews card.

If the Bomb player completes a number of circuits that varies with the number of players, the world blows up and the Bomb player wins. If the Nation players get all of the nations to the middle to spell "One World", the UN brings all the peoples of the world together in a new Golden Age, where "taxes are a joke, starvation and illiteracy are gone, disease is conquered, you still have money to burn... and your workday is cut in two. Yippee!"
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Team-Based Game

name: Rotolette Foot-Ball
description:
This 1930s game came in a solid wood box. The lid lifted off to form the playing field, with individual yard markings and eight lines running the length of the field lettered A-G. A wooden bar on a slider is used to mark the position of the ball, and there is a metal 10-yard marker that slides up one side of the lid.

The base has a large mechanism in the center, with a brass spinner embedded in a wooden wheel with 19 spaces numbered in a random order. The wheel in turn has a knob that is used to rotate the wheel against numerically ordered numbers on the surrounding board. There are six small windows on each side of the wheel, with the offense to the left and the defense to the right.

The offensive player has three play options (line buck, forward pass or end run) as well as three kicking plays (kick-off, goal kick and punt). The defensive player has a matching set of windows.

The offensive player calls a play, spins the spinner, and then rotates the wheel so that the spun number on the wheel aligns with the same number on the outer circle. He then reads the initial results of the play from the appropriate offensive window. The defensive player then spins, using the wheel to produce additional results in the matching window. For instance, an offensive pass play might read "25 yds A", a gain of 25 caught at the sideline. The defensive window would then indicate whether the pass was complete, incomplete, intercepted or triggered an offensive or defensive penalty.

The game proceeds and scores using normal football rules. The intricate double spinner and interlocking wheel mechanism is unusual, as is the solid wood construction. But except for the limited offensive play calling options, the results are essentially random.

name: Villains and Vigilantes Card Game: Destroyers and Daredevils
description:
Description from the publisher:

The Destroyers and Daredevils expansion to the Villains and Vigilantes Card Game includes the long-awaited and much-feared, most sinister group of supervillains: the Destroyers. And who will stand against them? This expansion also includes the original heroes of V&V – the amazing Indestructibles.

Skylark and Blastar and the entire team will face off against the the Annihilator, the Iron Maiden, Behemoth, Ratman, Electrocution, and the elusive Shapeshifter.

This box includes all 6 villains from the Destroyers and the 6 heroes who comprise the peerless Indestructibles. It includes cards for all of their signature abilities, characters stands for each, as well as new plots, missions, and powers to insure you can make the most of their incredible array of uncanny abilities.
mechanics: Action Points, Hand Management, Variable Player Powers

name: Villains and Vigilantes Card Game: Mentalists, Masterminds, and Marvels
description:
Descrition from the publisher:

The sinister schemes continue in the Mentalists, Masterminds, and Marvels expansion for the Villains and Vigilantes Card Game.

Forge the future with the Gauntlet‘s amazing inventions or the interplanetary assassin, Rune. Ride the skies with Stormbringer or master the elements with Madame Frigia. Show off your peerless mental powers with the master of manipulation: Motivator.

This expansion is packed with new technology, elemental, and mental powers that explore the far reaches of the imagination. It contains a dizzying array of options sure to satisfy evil geniuses and heroic leaders everywhere.
mechanics: Action Points, Hand Management, Variable Player Powers

name: Villains and Vigilantes Card Game: Crusaders and Criminals
description:
Description from the publisher:

The Crusaders and Criminals expansion for the Villains and Vigilantes Card Game comes packed with heroes and villains.

Manta-Man, Laserfire, and the remaining Crusaders are here. Explore magic and mystery with the mystical powers of Dreamweaver, Doctor Apocalypse, and the Pharaoh. Experience destructive energy powers with Lady Armageddon. Align yourself with Axiom, the world’s most powerful hero. But will even he be powerful enough to stand against the fearsome Spyder and the deadly Mirage?

This expansion greatly expands the array of mystical and energy powers. It introduces new missions that will have your heroes battling giant demons summoned from the abyss and put your villains in pursuit of the secret of ultimate power.
mechanics: Action Points, Hand Management, Variable Player Powers

name: WordChance
description:
Description from the publisher:

In WordChance, players can easily make large words using the 16 tiles in their hand. The score for the word is based on the product of the number of letters in the word played and the value on a multiplier chance card selected during the player turn. The multiplier cards have values of 0 to 10, -5 and -10. Hence playing a large word may be a good thing, or a bad thing.

The game board has 676 spaces for word forming (26x26 spaces).

There are also other types of chance cards:


Bonus word cards that allows the player to play a second word during their turn.
A swap tiles card which causes the players to switch their game tiles with that of the player to their left.
A bankrupt card which sets the total score of the player to zero. If chosen early in the game, the player can recover. This card is only put in the card deck if there are three or more players.


We think that the ability to make larger words and the addition of chance makes WordChance lots fun to play.

name: North Star Games 2017 PAX promo pack
description: PAX East 2017 promo questions for Wits & Wagers

name: Tour de Suisse
description:
This is a simple roll and move game. The players have to roll "1" to get from one of the starting circles to space 0 (Zürich). The first player to reach space 100 (back in Zürich) wins the game.

If a player gets passed on a yellow space he has to go back to the last square space. But if a player gets passed on a red space, he has to start again at the beginning. On a space with an arrow the player has to move forward or backward as shown by the arrow.

The game can be supplemented with additional cyclists to form équipes of 3 or more cyclists or for Play with more than 4 players.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Folia
description:
Description from the publisher:

In the effort to find the best plot-theme, produce the most beautiful costumes and allegorical floats, each of the players represents the president of their Samba school and should manage their resources, rehearsals, events and hiring samba personalities. For this, each of them has a carnival team to help them.

Folia is a resource management game with worker placement and set collection and supports 2-5 players. Having characteristics of a classic eurogame, and lasts about 35 min/ player, Folia will surely be your main night game.

name: Not My President: The Board Game
description:
Description from the publisher:

What is Not My President?

I bet you’re asking yourself, what is this? Let me start off – I love games. I do. I do. Don’t let anyone tell you otherwise: nobody loves games more than me, and when it comes to games, I love them. I do. I’ve made plenty of games – I’ve provided more games to the American people than Obama ever will, ever has been, will go, games. And this one – it’s the greatest game of all time, mark my words. The best. Anyone that says different – we’re fighting a war here, ladies and gentlemen, a war, against fake news. If this game doesn’t get funded, we’ll know – it’s phony, America. This game is going to be huge. *Small loans of a million dollars are accepted and encouraged.

How It Works?

Based off the popular game Mafia, Not My President is a high-energy, 3-12 player game of deception that lasts 5-10 minutes per round. Using your best poker face, diversionary tactics, and a lot of finger pointing, the goal of Not My President is to either find the Trump Supporters amongst you, or, if you are one, to keep yourself hidden through any means necessary. Lying, spreading chaos, and blaming others are highly encouraged tactics. The game begins when players randomly select and privately view a “role card,” dividing the party into two groups: Trump Supporters and Reasonable People. Players then close their eyes for the election night. During this phase, the free app guides you through the special abilities of your assigned roles. Players secretly swap cards, change identities, and cause more mayhem than a private email server. When everyone has taken their turn, players open their eyes, and the accusations begin. After 5-10 minutes, players vote for who they believe to be the most likely Trump Supporter. If they’re wrong, the Trump Supporters win. If they’re right, it’s probably fake news, and the Reasonable People win.

Narration:

Because this game is so great and since we don't want anyone to feel left out of the party we have made a free downloadable app to narrate the game! Trust me its not Skynet, an extremely credible source told me so. Includes adjustable settings and soundtracks for those of you who like to spice things up a little.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Humor, Party Game, Political, Real-time
mechanics: Acting, Cooperative Game, Player Elimination, Team-Based Game, Voting

name: DOSUKOI
description:
User summary
DOSUKOI is a game based in the world of Sumo wrestling, using a game board, cards, and chips.

A player acts as the Oyakata of a Sumo-beya (the Master of a Sumo family/group - essentially a training school). The wrestlers must have good Chanko-Nabe from the kitchens (Chanko casseroles, a typical food for Sumo wrestlers). You must recruit new Rikishi (wrestlers), and they visit the Ozashiki (parlours) to gain support from Geisha and Oiran. Ultimately the wrestlers will gain victory at the Dohyo (Sumo ring) by pushing off the opponent, sometimes with support from Ninja actions.

This is a 2 player game of comparing numbers in three areas, the Dohyo, the Kitchen, and the Ozashiki. Each section gives you a different victory bonus which you can use further on. Play RIKISHI cards face-down from your hand against these sections, apply any extra actions (such as revealing cards or moving cards) and then compare strengths. The winner of the section advances their chip and this helps them further.

Winning in the Dohyo is crucial to victory, but without Kitchen and Ozashiki support, you would eventually fail there. Secure your strength, and aim for victory.

Publisher's summary
DOSUKOIは相撲を世界観にしたゲームとなっておりゲームボードとカード チップを使用したゲームになります。

世界観
プレイヤーは、相撲部屋の親方となり、台所で美味しいちゃんこを作り新しい力士をスカウトしたり、
お座敷に通い芸者や花魁の応援をもらいながら、時には忍者を暗躍させ、土俵で勝利し相手プレイヤーを押し出し最強を目指す。

このゲームは土俵と台所、お座敷というそれぞれ勝利ボーナスが違う3つの場所で、手札から出すRIKISHI達の数比べが基本的なシステムとなっております。

土俵で勝つとゲームの勝利に近づけますが、台所やお座敷で自身の相撲部屋を強くしないと負けます。うまく強くしながら、土俵での勝利を目指します。
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Secret Unit Deployment, Simulation

name: Color Code
description:
User summary
'Color Code is a Karuta-like card game. Someone reads the hexadecimal RGB color-code (the kind that is used in web pages), and players aim to be the first to grab the corresponding color card.

In Japan, there is a a 400-year-old card game for two players, named Hyakunin Isshu (100 Poems by 100 Poets) (Wikipedia: Karuta), for example "Iroha Karuta", or Ogoola Karuta: 50 English Classics. Two players kneel on the floor opposite each other, with cards arranged in front of them. On each card are small pieces of text from classic poetry, and typically with a small illustration.

A separate Reader chooses from a random deck and sings a phrase out loudly. The players must search to find the matching couplet on their cards and either grab or block the appropriate card. Whoever snatches the most cards wins. Play is very swift and physically as well as mentally demanding.

This game, Color Code, is basically the same. The difference is that there are no illustrations on the played cards, but instead a single color is printed on them. The Reader doesn't read a phrase, but calls out an HTML color-code, like #FFFFFF or #FF0000. When the Reader calls a code, the players must know which color it is and make their play. So if the Reader calls "#FF0000", players must grab the red card.

Publisher's summary
WEBページの色を指定する１６進数のRGBカラーコードを読み上げ、該当する色カードをとる速度を競う、かるた風カードゲームです。

name: Revealations
description:
Description from the designer:

Revealations is an easy to play party board game which tests your knowledge of Movie, TV show and Song titles in a fun and unique way. The titles have to be guessed by seeing only the initial letters of titles printed on the various category card decks.

Revealations has simple rules, is quick to set up and the game play involves a race to the top of the game board. Players earn points depending on how many initial letters are revealed before the player can guess the title. The game combines knowledge of Movie, TV and Song titles with a hint of anagram/code breaking skills.
categories: Deduction, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Music, Party Game, Word Game

name: The Black Badge of the Galaxy
description:
The Black Badge of the Galaxy is a wargame in which each player puts himself in the shoes of a commander sent to one of the thousands of solar systems at war to consolidate the power of his species in him. Tercants, Humans, Hormínids, Talians and Aknumis will fight to the devastation and the death by winning the one that is the greater war in the galaxy in centuries. The war that will forever change the history of and the becoming of all the races of the galaxy.

Conquest, economic and social development, and strategic vision will be fundamental to victory. Who will win? Who knows. What is certain is that everyone will return home with the black badge of the galaxy in their memories.


Es un juego de guerra en el que cada jugador se pone en la piel de un comandante enviado a uno de los miles de sistemas solares en guerra para consolidar el poder de su especie en él. Tercantes, humanos, hormínids, talians and aknumians lucharán hasta la devastación y la muerte por ganar la que es la mayor guerra en la galaxia en siglos. La guerra que cambiará para siempre la Historia de y el devenir de todas las razas de la galaxia.

La conquista, el desarrollo económico y social, y la visión estratégica serán fundamentales para lograr la victoria. ¿Quién ganará? Quién sabe. Lo que es seguro es que todos volverán a casa con la negra badge de la galaxia en sus memorias.

name: End Days: Atlantis
description:
Description from the publisher:

End Days: Atlantis is a cooperative, dungeon crawler deckbuilding game for 3 players. You have been called upon as champions of New Atlantis to save the city from Armageddon. Lost knowledge capable of redeeming the city is kept in a sacred, ancient tome affixed with multiple seals. Each player assumes the role of 1 of 3 characters with unique classes-- Warrior, Witch, or Wizard. Your quest is to break each seal, which binds the ancient tome, in order to reveal the mystical knowledge and save New Atlantis from catastrophe. But it isn't easy. To break each seal, the party must leave the safety of the city and travel to a dangerous land to vanquish the evil inhabitants within. Only then, can the seals be broken,the book read, and New Atlantis restored.

Games may be played from 1 to 5 seals, each seal taking about an hour each. Each seal contains 5 enemies. When injured by an enemy, players add a wound card to the top of their deck. Each class has a certain number of cards and abilities that must be played each turn, and the party is defeated if any player is forced to play a wound. Special abilities and attacks require charges from crystals, the major Atlantean power source. Loot and experience are awarded after each battle which can be used to upgrade weapons, crystals, and cards within each player's deck. After each seal is completed, the party can return to Atlantis to receive special benefits such as removing all wounds of one color from their deck, trading in loot, and recharging all of their crystals.
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Fantasy, Fighting, Mythology, Nautical, Science Fiction
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management

name: Chuckin' Bugs
description:
The Big Stream has been taken over by Invasive Species! Join Olive and her friends from the popular children's book series on an adventure to meet the local stream residents and clear out the invaders! While it may be based on a book series for kids, the gameplay appeals to a much broader audience.

In Chuckin' Bugs, you collect an assortment of flies in your "fly box" (your card hand) and make casts to The Big Stream where you encounter 10 species of fish, Invasive Species, and hazards that get in the way of your fishing! Match fly colors to the fish's preferences and roll dice to reel them in! You also get to cooperate with other players to get Invasive Species out of the river and prevent them from completely shutting down the fishing.

Gameplay:

On their turn, players draw a card to their fly box (hand) and either make a cast with a fly of their choosing, or play one of several special "helper" cards. When making a cast, the player places their fly on the table and declares which card in The Big Stream they are casting to. The Big Stream card is turned over revealing either a fish, invasive species, or hazard. If a fish is revealed, it shows its fly preferences, which dictates how many dice you get to roll and what number is needed to succeed in catching it.

The game includes two card decks: The Big Stream and Camp Tightloops. The Big Stream contains fish, Invasive Species, hazards, and weather events. Camp Tightloops contains three different types of flies in four different colors and special cards to give you an edge when you need it. Some high points fish in The Big Stream require very specific flies to have a chance at them, just like big fish int he real world! But, if you don't have the right fly in the box, you have the option of playing your special cards, wild cards, or creating a "wild" out of playing different fly type/color combinations with multiple cards. Invasive species yield points to both players who cooperate in defeating them, and the player who cleans out the most invasives gets a bonus point token at the end of the game.

Is the best strategy to go for several smaller fish or take a chance on the larger high point fish? Should you go after the growing invasive species threats hoping they will pay off, or go immediately for the easy fish you know are there? Do you take chances on netting another player's fish to split the points with them or hope they fail their roll? Every time you play Chuckin' Bugs, The Big Stream has changed like your favorite fishing river. You never know what lurks under the surface!
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Memory

name: Scorched Kingdoms
description:
Description from the publisher:

Get ready for one of the most brutal war games, as you take the role of a lord, and fight your way through the Scorched Kingdoms. Choose your clan, build the perfect deck, and create a seamless strategy for the ultimate 1-vs-1 battle to rule the nations of Ethalios. Dominate kingdoms, obliterate armies, and claim the throne as all others bow before you.

You will have to learn countless strategies for every situation, and always stay ahead of your opponent. One wrong move can end entire wars.

Each of the 11 Nations are broken up into multiple kingdoms and clans. They will have entirely different armies and strategies for battle, ensuring that two battles are never the same.

Scorched Kingdoms is a standalone, tabletop card game for 2 players to battle head to head. It takes advantage of many deck building elements, where you create your clan with different characters, equipment, and environment cards, to strategically defeat the opponent’s clan, and capture their throne.

It also has a resource management system, used to collect the essence of the nation, which creates legendary tiered cards. These can include giant mechanized titans, terrifying abominations, or rulers from other realms.
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management

name: Régalez
description:
Publisher's summary
Régalez is an art game with motifs of heart shaped leaves. Grow trees and score by cutting branches. Luck and intuition and intelligence will decide victory and defeat. It is an art to play Régalez!

During the game, players place tiles showing various patterns in six colours, such as hearts or clovers, good or bad fruit. Players make connections and grow the plants, and then score points by cutting off branches. But avoid taking bad fruit, which will lose you points.

The intent is to be artistic and make patterns while scoring points. Try not to interfere with your opponents with dead leaves or flowers. Deciding where to branch out, and which branches to cut needs intuition, intellect and some luck.

The game can be played solo and even if you don't know the rules, you can still connect beautiful tiles and play!

Come on, Régalez together!
mechanics: Pattern Building, Pattern Recognition, Tile Placement

name: CON521: The Game Convention Game
description:
In CON521: The Game Convention Game, players race to claim seats at 42 game events over the three days of the CON521 gaming convention. The events are represented by hexagonal tiles on a board showing the three levels of the Meepleton Convention Center, as well as four hotels where the players start each day.

Each player's limited stamina restricts the number of games they can attend, but stamina refreshes daily. Claiming a seat at an event requires at least two turns: one to move to that event hex, and one to claim the seat by spending stamina. There is only one open seat per day at each event. Each game event has a type, such as board game or cosplay, each with its own section of the board; within that area, the seven events of that type are distributed randomly for every game. Each game also has a theme, such as zombies or space wars, and one of each theme in each type are spread across the board.

Money is used to pay for hotel rooms and for cards in the exhibit hall. Players can also buy food at food stop locations, with food providing extra stamina. Money does not refresh, and the initial supply must last the entire convention. Exhibit hall cards give bonus actions or points, but the exhibit hall is only open for certain hours each day. The exhibit hall also contains one demo per game type. These events do not have themes. A time track advances one hour per round, from 8 a.m. to midnight, and then from Friday to Saturday to Sunday.
Players win by accumulating the most "Nerd Cred", which comes from two main sources, scored at the game's end:


Event Types — The player who claims the most of each type of event scores that many points (0 to 8, including demos.) Two-way ties split the points. Ties of three or more players score no points.
Themes — All players receive Nerd Cred based on the number of events played in each theme (0 to 7), according to a progressive scale.


A few bonus points can come from exhibit hall cards or unused money. The game includes a scoring sheet for easy calculation.

name: Bushido: Nezumi & Small Swarm of Rats
description:
The latest recruit to the Cult of Yurei, Nezumi is fleeting on the battlefield, transforming into a rat and scurrying away when the time is right.

Blister contains one Nezumi miniature, three small rat swarms miniatures, four 30mm bases and two full colour profile cards.
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Tsolo
description:
A Mancala game played on a 4x6 array of "holes" (shallow cardboard dishes). Plastic "cowrie shells" are supplied as pieces.

On each turn the player takes all the shells from one of their holes (the twelve holes in the two rows nearest them) and sows them one by one clockwise around their twelve holes. If the last shell lands in an occupied hole, they take all the shells from that hole and carry on sowing. If the last shell lands in an empty hole in the front row (the row nearest the opponent), they capture all shells in the opponent's holes in the same column.

name: Rhyming Bingo
description:
From the publisher's website:

Kids can’t get enough of this TREND original! A favorite of children, parents, and teachers since 1969, TREND Bingo turns skill practice into an exciting game. Our unique 6-way format adapts to all skill levels, keeping play exciting for everyone. Perfect for small groups, the entire class, learners with disabilities, and anyone learning English.

• Ages 4 & up
• 30 pairs of rhyming words
• Photos for real-life learning
• Play 6 ways
• Sturdy cards & storage box
• 36 different playing cards, 6½ inches x 9 inches
• Caller's cards & mat
• Bingo chips
• Answer guide
• 3 to 36 players
• Made in USA

name: Dragonheart Fantasy-Card Game Book
description: This is a book made to celebrate the movie Dragonheart. It includes a summary of the movie, pictures and profiles of major characters, and a set of 24 cards portraying these characters. The book contains the rules for 3 games to be played with these cards: "Battlefield" and "Duel" are simple games of direct combat, and "Siege," which is a solitaire game in which you are trying go through an entire deck of challenges.
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Hand Management

name: Shukatsu! (就カツ！)
description:
User summary
就カツ！ (Shukatsu!) is an educational game aimed at helping graduates prepare for the job market.

Until recently, it was very unusual for people to switch jobs, as many employers would be very loyal to their staff and effectively provide a job for life (evidenced by the ubiquitous Japanese 'salary-man'). You try to get into a good company on your first go and prosper for life, or get hired by an unknown small company and you are doomed. Changing jobs suggests to employers that there is something wrong with you.

Therefore, for pre-graduates, the process of landing your first job became hugely important, really defining your whole future. This process is called 就活 (Shuukatsu),from two words: 就職 (Shuushoku) meaning 'to get a job' and 活動 (Katsudou) meaning 'activity'.

This game Shukatsu! is a co-operative game to simulate the experience of winning a job offer. The game was designed and published by a professional career advisor. He says "Experience an year of job hunting, in an hour. The game is based on 20 years experience as an advisor, you would have a live experience. You may try to beat it purely as a game, but also it may be used as an job-hunting support tool. In that case, the creator may act as a facilitator to gain the best effects."

The game uses various types of cards, for example, for the job-hunters:
Activity card - study companies, attend ability training session.
Weakness card - don't study for unknown matters, habitual latecomer, impatient.

For the employers:
Company card - industrial newspaper press, internet brokerage.
Hiring requirements - co-operativeness 3+, aspiration 3+.

Also, some cards have Bad Events, for example:
- too busy on part-time job.
- suffer burnout.

On the setup, lay out some company cards and assign them requirements cards. These would be the goals of the game for the job-hunters.

Each of the players will be assigned some parameters, and some Weakness cards. By using the Activity cards, players work together to overcome those weakness, and eventually meet the requirements of those companies.

Every once in a while, some Bad Events occur. Players must also work together to beat them too. At the end of the game year, if all of the players have managed to meet the requirements of some of the companies, they are hired and they win. If anyone fails to get a job, they all lose.

Publisher's summary
キャリアアドバイザーが作った「就職内定」のためのゲーム。
1年間の就職活動を、1時間で体験することができます。20年間のアドバイザー経験をもとに制作したので、ゲームとは思えないリアルな体験が得られます。
純粋なゲームとして攻略してもいいですが、制作者がファシリテータとなって、就職活動支援のコンテンツとしていただくことで、より高い効果が得られます。
publishers: Career30.net (キャリアサーティードットネット)

name: Isle of Domination: Tabletop Version
description:
Isle of Domination is a turn-based Strategy-Economy Board Eurogame.

The game starts with random map creation. Several hexes build up the map in any shape. There are also resource-tokens placed on some hexes those add more randomness to the map.
Players can build cities, armies on game map.

Gameplay goes around resources. There are two types of resources:

Countable resources like food, wood, stone, ore, test-tube and gold.
Special resources like horse, iron, fish, wheat, marble, diamond and mana are used to develop (science) or build (building) something.


There is no storage for resources, a player needs to have access (by having a city near the resource) to certain number and type of resources to build something. Food is the most important resource, each city, extra population and army eats one food. You need food-surplus to build a city/army/extra population, but no problem if your food production goes under your food production (no starving to death).

Each player has an Economy Page (like character page in RPGs), that shows the state of his empire. Players use small markers for recording various things.

Player's turn have 4 phases:

Money Phase: Player adds the number of his/her gold production to treasury. (Gold is the only resource in Isle of Domination, that is storaged.)
Army Moving Phase: Players can move their armies by grid lines of hexes. Combat system is very simple: if attacker's army is stronger than defender army, defender army has to be withdrawn. No die rolling this time. Army power is based on sciences, and have modifiers by terrain, city or buildings.
Dismiss Phase: Player can dismiss any number of cities, armies and extra population to create the needed food-surplus to build something.
Building Phase: Player can build a City (on a hex edge occupied by an army), increase Population, build an Army, develop a Science and/or build a Building in this phase.


The goal of this game is to reach one of the six Victory Conditions. It is possible that all other Players have stronger economies, stronger armies and bigger empires, but still you win because you reach one of the Victory Conditions.
There are 6 different types of Victory:


Territory Victory: You dominate by having a large number of cities.
Military Victory: You dominate by having a very strong and large army.
Population Victory: You dominate by outnumbering others in population.
Science Victory: You dominate by knowledge. (You develop Future Science 2.)
Cultural Victory: You dominate by your people's cultural influence. (You build Cathedral.)
Magical Victory: You dominate by magical superiority. (You have a city near every Mana resource.)


Randomized map preparation may make some of the Victory types easier than others. But when several players pursuit the same victory, it will be much more difficult to achieve it.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Hexagon Grid, Point to Point Movement

name: Hier kommt die Maus
description:
Hier kommt die Maus is a simple die-rolling game for children that features the main character of a popular German children's TV program, "Die Sendung mit der Maus" (The Program with the Mouse), which first aired in 1971.

Players take turns rolling the die and moving accordingly. If they end up on a spot showing two arrows, they they have to move forwards or backwards according to the colour of the pips. Additionally, on two spots players can fall back. The first player to reach the last spot on the board – the tv studio – wins!

This game shares its designer with Mausefalle (1980) and re-implements it.
categories: Children's Game, Dice, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Run Gangs Out! Game
description: Educational game in which players roll and move around the board. Each space has a stack of cards players read, gaining information about gang activities and how to fight them (and points). First player to 315 points (or circle the board 5 times) wins.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Water: The deckbuilding water-cycle game
description:
Water is an introductory deckbuilder based on the water cycle. Game play is symbol based to enable younger children and language independent play.

In Water, players build their deck by purchasing cards from the river using rain and snow tokens. The game ends when all the snow tokens are removed from the cloud, so strategy of when to buy and when to collect comes into play. Other deckbuilding mechanisms such as getting rid of weaker cards help new players lean the basics of this mechanic.

Thematically, cards can move rain or snow between the cloud, a player's reservoir, and other players' reservoirs. Cards can also change the state of the water from gas in the cloud to liquid or solid in the reservoirs.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Educational, Environmental

name: Demolish
description:
With a mixture of skill and luck, players will build up their own map of landmarks while trying to stop others from doing the same.

On your turn you will aim to build new landmarks by playing landmark cards, while demolishing other people's landmarks by playing attack cards. Jules the tourist visits each landmark in turn. If you succeed in demolishing an opponent's landmark while Jules is visiting it, that player is eliminated.

To win a player must either build a winning number of landmarks, or eliminate all other players.
mechanics: Hand Management, Player Elimination, Take That

name: Freedom of the Forest
description:
An entertaining board game that familiarises you with the Royal Forest of Dean in Gloucestershire and acts like a guide book telling you about the area. It will help you find your way around and enhances your further visits.

Each player chooses an empty town on the map along with a marker of the appropriate colour. Each player receives 15 cards appropriate to their starting town and must make their way around the map visiting attractions and avoiding diversions.

name: Cry Monster!
description:
You and your monster friends are worried as the villagers have finally had enough of all of your shenanigans and are hunting you all down one by one. It's every monster for themselves in this game of deduction, deception and survival.

In Cry Monster! each player is a classic monster like Frankenstein's monster, The Invisible Man or Dracula. Each round the villagers put up a reward poster for one unlucky monster. Your job is to pierce the disguises of your fellow monsters and determine who is who. Once you know, you have to decide if you throw them to the villagers or help them by deceiving everyone into thinking it's one of the other monsters. Of course, if you are the wanted monster it's time to pull off your greatest act of deception. You have to work fast because the pitchfork and torch crowd is growing quickly and starting to Cry Monster!

name: Flow: Tales of Odea
description:
Flow is a 2-4 player card game set in the fantasy world of Flow.

Goal: Get the highest score by the end of the game. In case of a tie, last player wins.

End Game : Number of the decks equal to the number of players runs out. e.g. 2 players = 2 empty decks, 4 players = 4 empty decks.

Gameplay: Every round, players do 3 available actions in any order they choose.
A - Activate card abilities
B - Buy
C - Card Draw

name: Ictus
description:
Wage War in the Steampunk Apocalypse
The world has changed. Over a hundred years have passed after the American War for Independence was interrupted by the opening of the first rift and the Legion of Damned poured though. Humanity was facing extinction at the hands of the demonic and undead. Finally the Angelics arrived and set a stop to the expansion of the rifts and halted the free roaming Legion hordes. Once on the brink of extinction humanity has surged back, forging new countries and technologies. Now after decades of rebuilding the uneasy peace is starting to fracture. Skirmishes are becoming more frequent along the borders and nations turn to warmongering.
Titan Zero Industries LLC presents Ictus, a table top wargame set in the Stempunk apocalypse of 1909. Ictus features high quality miniatures, six unique factions, an all-new stacking rule set and multiple game scenarios including cooperative play.
In standard Skirmish or competitive game scenarios the goal is to eliminate the other player(s) officers. However, in cooperative play scenarios the goals of the game can vary to include eliminating the enemy, surviving for a number of rounds or achieving a set goal.
Each unit is a paintable miniature that comes with a corresponding card that details the abilities of that character. While many abilities are set, conflict is resolved by the rolling of six sided dice (D6), with rolls of 5’s and 6’s being considered successful. Stacking is the major game mechanic. The Shield Warden unit, for example, provides a +1 defensive bonus to all allies within 1”. If there are three Shield Wardens within 1” of each other the bonuses stack and each unit would receive a +3 defensive bonus.
There are six different factions to choose from; the British American Colonies, Mercenaries, United American Territories, Legion of Damned, Republic of Cascadia and Empire of Castile. Each faction has a unique look and play style.

name: The Map Game: Australia
description: Roll and move race game around a map of Australia. The first to Tasmania wins. Along the way are hazards and bonuses. Printed in water-based inks on fabric. The playing pieces are wooden disks stamped with Australian animals.

name: England Expects...
description:
Description from the designer:

This simple set of card- and dice-driven “Fast-Play” rules is designed for use in re-fighting naval battles in the ‘Age of Sail’ (early 1700s to early 1800s), involving small or large numbers of ships, in a tabletop situation. There are also a series of Scenarios to accompany this game: In the Spirit of Trafalgar, Chesapeake Bay, Battle of the Nile.

name: Northern Moat: Wargames Rules to Recreate Naval Warfare on the Great Lakes in the War of 1812
description:
Wargames rules to simulate naval warfare on the Great Lakes in the War of 1812.

Fast play rules for Napoleonic period naval warfare - which Napoleon had nothing to do with! While Britain and France fought a bitter war to decide the future of Europe, across the Atlantic another war was being fought, borne of American ambition and British disdain. On the long wilderness border between the United States and British North America, hardy frontiersmen and colonial militia hacked fleets out of the virgin forest, fleets to contest the Great Lakes, fleets to decide the future of a continent.


Includes the historical background to the war.
A description of the main campaigns on all three main theatres.
Detailed rulebook and ready ref sheet.
Examples of play.
Ship cards for all warships known to have been active in the conflict (Note these are also sold separately, but this full rules set includes all ship detail sheets).
Bonus scenario: the battle of Put-in-bay.

name: Lookee: The Clue-Solving Scavenger Hunt Card Game
description:
Lookee is a new spin on the scavenger hunt. It allows kids to have fun and learn critical thinking skills at the same time.  The object of the Lookee game is for player(s) to solve clues, the answer to those clues provides player(s) with information about where to find their next clue. You decide how many clues and where the adventure takes the player.  Lookee can be played as a single player, team or multi-player game. Lay out separate “paths” of clues for multiple players, or have everyone work together to solve the same path and win as a group!

Directions

• Determine how many clues and locations your scavenger hunt adventure will have.
• Choose one card to be the “Starting” point.
• Layout the cards based on the answers to the clues; for example, if the answer to the clue is the refrigerator, the next clue should be placed in, on or near the refrigerator.
• Once you’ve placed all your clue cards, direct player(s) to the “Starting” Point. Give player(s) the first clue and send them on their way.

Have ideas for your own clues? Lookee also includes blank cards, so you can write your own. Have fun and get creative!
categories: Children's Game, Party Game, Word Game

name: Spillet om Bamsens Fødselsdag
description:
The players travel around the board revealing hidden animals and then matching them up with the birthday cards on the side. The player with the most collected cards at the end of the game is the winner.

Bamsemor has made birthday cards for Bamsens birthday. All the animals of Hakkebakkeskongen are invited, and you must help Bamsemor to find them.

You'll need to check behind every blueberry bush, and remember where each animal is hidden when you find them.

It's not easy as they keep disapearing back into the forest. Once you find an animal and have the birthday card that matches you can place the card out infront of you.

The player with the most birthday cards at the end of the game wins, and gets to go to the party.


Bamsemor har laget fødselsdagsskort til Bamsens fødselsdag. Alle dyrene i Hakkebakkeskogen er invitert, og du må hjelpre Bamsemor med å finne dem.

Du må lete bak hver en blårbærbusk, og huske hvor dyrene skjuler seg når du finner dem.

Det er ikke alltid så lett, forstadig vekk forsvinner de i skogen. Finner du et dyr og har fødselsdagsskortet som hører til, får du straks legge kortet foran deg.

Spilleren som har flest fødslsdagskort til slut, vinner spillet og får være med på festen.

name: GINGA
description:
This is space card game.
Player is God.
Gods fight with strength of star as card.
In this game, God can rob and break down other God's star for advantage.
God with stronger star will win at the end of game.

name: Strandead
description:
It’s been 14 long years since the virus took over. You and your only friend are stranded on an island, overrun by zombies. Avoid zombie attacks, backstab other survivors and fight to be the last remaining survivors!

Each player receives seven cards from the Prime deck and two survivors with ten health each. Each round, a player can discard a Set (1, 2, 3, 4, 5 or 6 of a Kind), a Run (3-7 consecutive cards), or Scavenge cards and finish their turn with 7 cards in hand. The next player in turn must respond to the play by matching or raising the Set or Run to avoid a zombie attack (indicated by the amount of zombies visible on the table). If Scavenge cards have been discarded, the players must respond accordingly. When a survivor is killed, they turn into zombies, increasing the amount of zombies in an attack. The game is over when there is only one player with survivors.

In essence, Strandead is a trick-taking card game. Players must choose their plays carefully, in order to survive the next attack and backstab other players in turn. Every survivor has a unique ability that can shift the game in their favour. An ever-growing number of Zombies continue to make the attacks more vicious as the game progresses, leading to a fast paced, hectic and unique experience.

Strandead is designed for 2-4 players, with an average playtime of 20 mins.

name: FIRED
description:
Description from the publisher:

Yours and three other offices has been acquired in a hostile take over, your new parent company only has the intention of keeping the employees of the best office! Your job is to make sure your office survives the merger!

FIRED is a quick 2-4 player card game where players compete to fire their opponent’s boss. Each employee in your hand has a different ability that will help you fire employees from the other offices, zero in on their boss and fire them!

From the Axe Man to the Fall Guy, you can work to ensure that your office makes it. Be the Hero, Save the Day and Get Someone FIRED!

name: Triangles: Original
description:
Description from the publisher:

Triangles is a series of 90-card decks of playing cards. Each card represents a piece of a triangle, numbered 1-3. The triangles are "cut" in one of three ways (horizontal, vertical and centered cut) which works as suits, and the numbers 1, 2 and 3 of the same cut make a complete triangle.

There are 81 triangle pieces and 9 whole triangles (jokers) in each deck.

Each installment in the Triangles series has a distinct visual theme and rules for two games: a base game titled "Triangle Mayhem" and a bonus game only introduced in that particular installment, however any Triangles game can be played with any of the decks.

The bonus game in "Triangles: Original is titled "Triangle Tricks", and the deck features photographic artwork from the world cities of Sydney, Los Angeles and London.

TRIANGLE MAYHEM: Complete triangles by playing cards (triangle pieces) at the center of the table. The table is free for all meaning anyone can start a new triangle, continue an existing triangle, or complete a triangle by playing the final missing piece. Multiple triangles can be in the making simultaneously and whoever completes a triangle scores its cards.

TRIANGLE TRICKS: A trick-taking game with a twist where the highest number (1-3, joker) takes the trick. In the event that two players are tied the same trick continues and all players - even those who played a low card - are still in the game. Points can can quickly stack up and experienced players will know when to play low cards, trusting that other players will tie to keep the trick going for another round.

name: The Genpei War: Taira vs Minamoto 1180-1185
description:
The Genpei War: Taira vs Minamoto 1180-1185 is a 2 player wargame set in 12th century Japan. The Imperial court has come under the influence of the powerful Taira clan. The Minamoto clan, enemies of the Taira, start a revolt that will eventually annihilate the Tairas and found the first Shogunate in Japanese history.

Players control one of the two rival clans, moving their armies (composed of novice and samurai cavalry and infantry, as well as leaders) and fighting battles. A common deck is used that contains events, combat and action cards and Bakufu cards. Bakufu cards are small objectives that allow for a political victory.

The Genpei War: Taira vs Minamoto 1180-1185 is a freely downloadable Print-and-Play game!

name: SimplyClever.Cards Arithmetic
description:
SimplyClever.Cards Arithmetic combines traditional playing cards, math flash cards and the multiplication table from 0 to 12. The deck has 52 cards in 4 colours numbered 0-12, and 4 jokers.

The jokers have mathematical operators *, +, - and = so you can make your own calculations using the cards.

Designed to function like a regular deck of cards, SimplyClever.Cards Arithmetic allows you to play any regular card game you want to - but with a mathematical twist! Game examples: 500, Blackjack, Bridge, Casino, Crazy Eights, Durak, Egyptian Ratscrew, Go Fish, Hearts, Memory, Old Maid, Poker, Rummikub, Slap Jack, Snap, UNO, Whist

The key mechanic is that each card lists 5 multiplication products at the bottom, below the main card value (ranging from 0 to 12). Mathematical versions of regular card games are created by combining three cards such that the product of two card values can be found among the 5 listed on a third card.

E.g. if you take one card numbered 11 and one card numbered 12, you need to match these with a third card that has the product 132 at the bottom. These three cards can represent different equations such as multiplication 11x12=132, division 132/12=11 or even fractions 1/12=11/132.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Educational, Game System, Math, Number
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Hand Management, Memory, Push Your Luck, Set Collection, Trick-taking

name: Game of Stranger
description: This game was designed by Stranger & Stranger as a holiday gift.

name: Bio-Logic
description:
Description from the publisher:

Just beneath the surface, where few are brave enough to venture, there is a war raging out of control. You are a biologically engineered "Super-Bug", and must fight for survival. Dive inside the human body to experience the combative microcosm inside all of us.

Basic Overview

Bio-Logic is a fast-paced, hybrid tile-placement/dungeon crawler game that allows 2-6 players to infect and manipulate the world around them for ultimate domination. 6 unique "Super-Bugs" are pitted against one another in a battle to the death, inside the human body. Your goal is to infect as much of the body as possible and destroy all the other invasive Bugs. Ensure your survival by utilizing choice character development, performing combat, and strategizing tile placement. The game's system is balanced enough for anyone to jump in. At the same time, it's deep enough to offer, nearly, infinite potential for strategy. In Bio-Logic, resources are limited and foes are many, so you must adapt and evolve or you will certainly fade from existence.

Unique Character Development

All players begin with a choice stat bonus and a special inherent traits These traits can grant special boosts and bonus rewards, manipulate player or enemy stats, or protect oneself from the reactive world. Every Bug has its own advantage/strategy with the capacity to evolve new abilities.

Combat/Infecting....Vs. World, Vs. Players

Developing ones Bug, involves infecting the world around you for stat boosting rewards. Some tiles are infected instantly. However, greater rewards are reserved for combat. Those who attempt to infect the vital organs, must use combat. There are 3 levels of tiles for a player to choose from as they grow. Each tier offers greater obstacles but with greater rewards for the victor.

Players also have the option of fighting one another to steal resources and abilities. Some Bugs are better made for this than others. You can use this feature to sabotage the lead players advance, steal your favorite choice abilities, or monopolize a tile type. Bio-Logic is all about choice and strategy, but you must push forward at all costs, for hesitation will bring only certain defeat.

Tile-Placement/World Manipulation

While building your character and fighting for resources, the human you infect is also attempting to eradicate you. Special enemy tiles have the ability to instantly alter many in-game stats. But it's not totally out of your control, you have a choice in how you reveal the board. The way you place tiles plays a big role in how the game progresses. Some enemies have effects that can activate as soon as the tile is put into play, while others wait until they are infected to cause a reaction. Not only does your development need attention, but so does the evolving world in which you live. Bio-Logic is always changing and you must learn to adapt if you are to survive.

Final Words

Bio-Logic takes you into an environment unlike any other. With 3 random draw piles, choice tile placement, special abilities, and limited resources no game is ever the same. On any given turn you must make decisions that affect the entire game world, altering everyone's future. It's a delicate dance where you must evaluate every aspect of development to ultimately claim victory over your friends. In Bio-logic, you must master your universe or get wiped from existence.

name: Stone Saga
description:
User summary
Stone Saga is a puzzle game where you draw some magical gemstones from a drawbag, and place them in a 6 by 6 grid. Connect four or more of the same colored stones to remove them. Place three of the removed stones to your opponents' play area to hinder them, and the remaining stones to your spell-casting area.

Stones in your spell-casting area may be moved to the "used" area to trigger special effects, such as, using two white stones may trigger an effect of "swap any 2 stones", or "move 1 stone to an adjacent space". The first player to place 10 or more gems to their spell-casting area is the winner.

This game was produced with help from the artists group ぐったりにゃんこ (Guttari Nyanko), who provide free material for game designers and publishers.

Publisher's summary
黒い袋の中からランダムに魔法石を取り出し、６×６マスのフィールドに配置していくパズルゲームです。同じ色の魔法石を４つ以上つなげると消すことができます。消した石のうち、３つを対戦相手のフィールドに配置して妨害し、残りを自分の詠唱領域に配置します。詠唱領域にある魔法石は未使用から詠唱済に移動することで、色ごとに異なる能力を使用することができます。たとえば、白の魔法石なら、２つの魔法石の入れ替えか、魔法石の１マス移動を行うことができます。最終的に、自分の詠唱領域に、最初に10個以上の魔法石を置いたプレイヤーが勝者となります。
publishers: Narumiya Entertainment Company (なるみやエンターテイメントカンパニー)

name: Deadeye: Hunter Trivia
description: Challenge your family and friends to a fun and educational game about whitetail deer and deer hunting. Over 350 questions of varying difficulty, great for hunters of all ages. Score points and become the most knowledgeable whitetail deer hunter!

name: The Spectre Inspectors
description:
Description from the publisher:

The Spectre Inspectors is a 2-4 co-op, ages 10+ game where theres only ONE way to win but 5 ways to lose. Players are members of a secret society named the spectre inspectors, who's lives has been dedicated to demonology and spirituality. The aim of the game is to help a struggling hotel stay open by dispelling spectres from the hotel and finally cleansing it.

Overview
To win, all players must expel spectres and cleanse every room in the hotel. There are 7 rounds to reach this goal. Each round different types of spectres will manifest the hotel at night and terrify guests. To defeat these spectres players will collect items during the daylight from the freak shop, drink moonshine at the speakeasy to boost courage and rip out pages from sacred books in the library, all before the week is up, or the hotel will be forced to close!

Gameplay

Game play is split into two phases, the daytime phase and the nightfall phase.
On every turn, do the following things in this order during the daytime phase.

1.Manage the hotel.
2.Choose a starting location.
3.Take up to 4 actions (move-buy-share-cleanse)

Daytime phase:

Manage the hotel - Relocate guests - If possible relocate terrified guests to any vacant room and then add 2 guests tokens to the board.

2. Choose a starting location - players may choose to start their turn in one of these locations: the hotel, the speakeasy, the freak shop or the library, each location offers opportunities to take an advantage in the game.
the hotel - you can cleanse rooms before the nightfall

the speakeasy - drink moonshine to boost your courage, so when you encounter spectres, you are harder to terrify. When you enter the speakeasy the first drink you take is always free... To drink more you will roll the moonshine dice to see how many more drinks you take.

the library - do some research in sacred books, and then rip that page out so you can say the sacred words to obtain special abilities, you can activate one special ability per round, once activated turn the card 90 degrees to show which is affect Upon the next round it will remain active if not unactivated (turn back to an upright position)

the freak shop - here you will purchase items necessary for your encounters with the spectres. The items will be spent each time you encounter a spectre

3. Take up to 4 actions - players can take up to 4 from these available actions, either once per action or one action multiple times, in any of the locations during the daylight.

Move =1 action - Share =1 action - Buy =1action - Cleanse =2actions

Once all players have completed these steps, the nightfall phase begins and on every turn, do the following things in this order

The Scattering
The Manifestation
Take up to 4 actions

The Scattering - will be skipped in the first round as no spectres are present till after the manifestation, during rounds 2 till end
the scattering will happen, what you must do is move the spectre tiles which are marked with orthogonal or diagonal icons, those spectres will move on the board in the direction of the nearest un terrified guest.

2. The manifestation - when the manifestation occurs add 4 spectres per round in an 2 player game.

in a 3-4 player the same will occur, but, with in the spectre tiles there is a demon tile present, when this tile appears the demon will manifest a further more 4 spectres will manifest in the locations which are iconified on the tile.

3. - Take up to 4 actions - players can take up to 4 of these available actions, either once per action or one action multiple times.

move =1action - encounter/expel =1action - cleanse =2actions
mechanics: Action Points, Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Tile Placement, Variable Player Powers

name: Jagd nach dem Dieb
description:
One to three policemen (blue wood meeples) try to catch one or two thieves (red metal meeples). Movement is determined by a die. The players start at space 1 and move toward space 70.
