The thieves get a head start of three turns. The policemen catch the thieves if they get on the same space as the thieves. The thieves escape if they get beyond space 70.

On some spaces the metal thieves close an electric circuit and light a lightbulb which alerts a ranger (green wood meeple). The ranger gets each policeman an extra chance to catch the thief, by rolling a 1.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Mars: Chimneys and Sleighs
description:
A re-imaging of Snakes and Ladders which came on the back of a box of Christmas chocalate bars.

First you must cut out the board, three playing peaces and the spinner if you do not have a dice.

Throw a dice in turn and move your peace, if you land on a sleigh you must answer a question, and if correct you may take ride to the correcting space, but if you land on a chimney and get the question wrong then you return to a earlier space. The first player to space 25 is the winner.

Description based on the 2016 "Mars and Friends" box set of Christmas choclates bars (Milky Way, Maltesers, Mars-Snakesize (x2), Twix and Snickers).
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: The Hunt for Blackbeard's Treasure
description:
Description from the designer:'

The Hunt for Blackbeard's Treasure is a family friendly game where players have to roll dice and move around the board to accumulate resources (buying & stealing from other players) in order to leave harbour and set sail to Hammerhead Island (the supposed resting place of Blackbeard's hidden treasure).
Once there, they follow their own chosen treasure map around the island to where the map states that they can now dig up the treasure chest and find out if they were lucky to discover the treasure and win the game.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Net Worth
description: This fun money game combines the popular game mechanics of crazy 8’s (a classic card game children know and LOVE) with financial issues we all must face in life such as debt, asset accumulation, and managing the risks of financial peril. Playing the game creates an opportunity for you to teach, discuss, and reinforce positive financial concepts with younger players which will help them become financially successful in their adult life. (After all, there is more to life than longing for your next payday to take care of never ending bills and expenses.) Winning the game requires players to: think strategically, learn to minimize debt, accumulate assets (money), and protect themselves against financial hardships. The player with the highest net worth at the end of the game wins! Net Worth, the FUN money game is a fantastic financial education game for kids because they will have so much FUN playing they won’t even realize they are learning! EASY to learn and FUN to play.
publishers: Arizona Game Co., Santa Maria Group LLC

name: Animal Safari 3 in 1
description: Animal Safari 3-in-1 card game contains everything you need to play Go Fish, Old Maid, and Arizona Game Co's Animal Safari match game-- all in one convenient deck. Game cards are easy to read and illustrated with a fun selection of familiar African animals kids will love. All three games are easy to learn and fun to play. This safari will be a hit with the whole family!

name: A Guerra dos Planetas
description: A Guerra dos Planetas is an introduction-level sci-fi wargame in which 2 to 4 players fight for control of a massive space station that has been hijacked by an unknown assailant.

name: Junge wenn du willst
description:
Game 1
One half of the players use the big pawns (male) and the other half use the small pawns (female). Each player has one pawn. Movement is determined by a die. The win the game a pair of pawns (male + female) has to reach the doublespace "bb". If a male pawn gets on a space with another male pawn, the later gets thrown out and has to start again. The same goes for the female pawns. Each pawn has to round the game track, before advancing to the center space.

Game 2
Only the pawns of one sex are used. The Goal of the game is to reach number 1 at the center space. First the players have to reach space 7. From there They may advance from number to number at the roll of a 1 till they reach space 1.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Triangle Maker
description:
Triangle Maker is an abstract strategy game in which two to four players compete by forming triangles. Players use the thirteen pieces to make triangles to score points. This educational board game is a fun way to hone players’ creativity, spatial awareness, critical thinking, and concentration.

The two movable pieces are the game changers of Triangle Maker. Clever use of these pieces can tip the balance to your side and name you the ultimate victor!

The goal of the game is to make the most and/or biggest triangles with the pieces available to earn the most points. Every newly formed triangle adds to your score. However, there is one rule: You cannot place pieces where the same colored lines overlap.

There are four different ways to play Triangle Maker:

1. Card Game

a. Shuffle the cards
b. When it is your turn, draw the first card and place the corresponding piece onto the board. (Earn tokens based on the number or size of the triangle made)
c. You can use either of the movable pieces during your turn instead of drawing your next card.
d. Whoever gets the most points wins!

2. Strategy Card Game

a. Shuffle the cards and draw two cards.
b. When it is your turn, use one of the pieces on the drawn cards and place it onto the board. (Earn tokens based on the number or size of the triangle made)
c. During the next turns, remember to draw a card to replace the one used and then repeat the above step.
d. Whoever gets the most points wins!

3. No-Card Game

a. When it is your turn, place any piece onto the board. (Earn tokens based on the number or size of the triangle made)
b. Whoever, gets the most points wins!

4. Obstruction Game

a. While keeping only the movable pieces, transfer all your pieces to another player.
b. When it is your turn, the other player will choose the piece he/she wants you to place onto the board. (Earn tokens based on the number or size of the triangle made)
c. When it is the other player’s turn, select the piece that would be most disadvantageous for him/her.
d. You can use either of the movable pieces during your turn instead of accepting the other player’s pieces.
e. Whoever gets the most points wins!

Scoring

1. Small triangle is worth 1 point each.
2. Large triangle is worth 4 points each.
3. Giant triangle is worth 9 points each.

It is possible to earn more points by forming multiple triangles in one turn.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Children's Game, Educational, Party Game, Puzzle

name: Henolfs Verkehrserziehungs-Würfelspiel
description: The players start at "START" and move through spaces 1 to 80 towards the parking lot "P". Movement is determined by a die. On the red spaces events or traffic signs hinder or benefit the players. On each space the player has to explain the pictured traffic sign or traffic situation. The winner is the player, who had to pay the least penalities while traveling to the parking lot.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Hex Shogi 41
description:
Hex Shogi 41 is a Shogi variant adapted for play on hexagons in a rectangle, arranged in 9 rows each containing either 4 or 5 hexes.

Rules are similiar to Shogi, except that setup and movement is defined for the alternative board geometry, including additional restrictions on pawn drops.

name: Hex Shogi 81
description:
Hex Shogi 81 is a Shogi variant adapted for play on hexagons in a 9x9 rhombus.

Rules are similiar to Shogi, except that setup and movement is defined for the alternative board geometry, including additional restrictions on pawn drops.

name: Hex Shogi 91
description:
Hex Shogi 91 is a Shogi variant adapted for play on a hexagon of 91 hexagons, 6 per side.

Rules are similiar to Shogi, except that setup and movement is defined for the alternative board geometry, including additional restrictions on pawn drops.

name: GeoMundi
description:
GeoMundi is an educational game that attempts to teach players about the countries of the world.

"Ten games that bring far away places home. Actual data of 229 countries and territories - wrapped in 10 games of action and strategy."

The game comes with 229 cards containing data about various countries. The rulebook contains rules for 10 different games which can be played with the included cards.

1) GeoMundi (2+ players)
This is essentially War. One player chooses a category on the cards (like Literacy). All players compare the value on their card. The player with the best value collects all the cards.

2) GeoMundi Double (2 players)
This is played like GeoMundi, but both players choose a category. One player must win both categories to win the cards. If neither player wins both categories, each draws a new card and chooses a new category. This repeats until a player wins both selected categories and that player then wins all the cards used up to that point.

3) GeoMundi Open (2+ players)
Played like GeoMundi but the lead player selects any of their cards and then chooses any category. Each player may then select any of their cards to use in the battle. Best value in the category wins the cards.

4) Handicap (4+ players on 2+ teams)
Teams take turns. One player on one team picks a card and then must give clues so that their team can guess the name of the country. The clue provider may not use any of the words on the card or give clues related to the country name, although rhymes are allowed.

5) Touch! (2+ players)
This game is similar to Slap Jack. Each player turns over a card on their turn. If two consecutively played cards are for countries which neighbor each other the first player to yell "Touch" wins all the cards in the pile. Islands are "wild" and are considered to touch all other countries.

6) Clue-in (2+ players)
Players decide on an order for the card categories to be used. Players take turns as the clue giver. That player reads the data on the card in the order decided upon. The first player to correctly guess the country name wins the card. Each player is only allowed one guess during each round and if they guess incorrectly the clue giver gets a random card from their stack.

7) Flag Wizz (2+ players)
This is played like Clue-in but only the flag is given as a clue.

8) The Capitals Game (2+ players)
This is played like Clue-in but the players must guess the country's capital city. Or the players can only use the capital city as the clue and the players must guess the country name.

9) Take Your Pick (2+ players)
This is played like Clue-in but the clue giver draws two cards, states the name of each country, and chooses a category. The players must guess which country has the better value or if they match.

10) Map-it
This is played like Clue-in. The clue giver states the name of the country and the first player to find the country on the included map and state the country number wins the card.

name: Summoning
description:
The most powerful summoners are gathered to use their powers in an endless battle to prevail and survive.
Players are in control of characters, supporting creatures and
their abilities.
Each player is in control of a deck of cards with powers that are divided in 3 major aspects: Strength, Mind and Spirit.
Each aspect has it's own champions. For example, Strength has
Fighters and Rogues, while Mind has Wizards and Enchanters.
The game features 3 innovative mechanisms:
The first: Grey Magic. There is a category of magic that may be
used by the use of any power. Grey Magic can be harnessed by
either Strength, Mind or Spirit.
The second: Agendas. Agendas are powerful cards that change the
flow of the game, but, in order to enforce an Agenda, a player
must have influence in the Summoners Council.
The third: 3 gems of power help players acquire the proper kind
of power required to use their cards. These gems are divided in
the same aspects as their deck cards: Strength, Mind and Spirit.

The game has many game modes:
2 players: 1 vs 1 or co-op
3 players: free-for-all or co-op
4 players: 2 vs 2, free-for-all or co-op
5 players: free-for-all, arena or co-op
6 players: 3 vs 3, 2 vs 2 vs 2 or co-op
mechanics: Hand Management, Player Elimination, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Colossal Deathblow
description:
Description from the designer:

In Colossal Deathblow, players are would-be Heroes charged with defeating a mighty Colossus plaguing their City. Wielding a deadly weapon and pure elemental energy, each Hero brings his own unique abilities to bear on one of the monster’s vulnerabilities while distinguishing themselves from the other Heroes.

As Heroes unleash their spectacular attacks, the people of the City marvel from across the river. After the battle, Heroes burnish their reputation--and increase their silver--by visiting among the people to increase their renown. After all, real Glory comes from the adoration of the people!

Between the unpredictable attacks, Heroes have downtime to visit the bustle of the City and buy new weapons, learn new abilities, and replenish their elemental energies in preparation for battle.

The Soothseers foretell that the Heroes will vanquish the Colossus after five grueling battles. Though all contribute, only the Hero with the most Glory in both deeds and renown can take credit for the Deathblow and be declared Savior of the City!

Gameplay

Colossal Deathblow is a rules-light, Euro-style, majority control game with unique placement eligibility mechanisms. There are three main phases in each of the its five rounds.

First, while preparing for the Colossus attack during each round (and while the outcome of each battle is still uncertain), players must make hard choices about which of the majority-control areas on the board they might want to use in a later phase.

Second, during the attack, players secretly choose which vulnerability of the Colossus to target using one of their weapons, and which type and how much elemental energy to use to boost the damage. Players are then ranked according to the amount of overall damage they do to the Colossus. The player who does the most damage goes first during the next phase, but also becomes a target when the Colossus strikes back.

Finally, after the battle, players must decide where to place popularity tokens from their limited supply, subject to their eligibility decided earlier. Tokens represent renown, which is converted to VPs (Glory) via majority control at the end of the game.

While players can choose to place as many or as few tokens as they wish during a round, choices are final and there is a hard limit to the number of tokens they can place over the course of the game. Deciding when to double-down to gain a majority and when to conserve tokens are major considerations during each round.

The game is medium-weight and plays in 75-120 minutes, and (despite the impression the name might give) has minimal direct player interaction. It thematically combines the deliciously agonizing choices of classic area control and hand management games (El Grande, Auction 2002) with resource management and simultaneous action selection mechanisms.

name: Senior på spil
description:
A "business game" about making your company attractive to senior employees.

Much of the game is trivia about the Danish labour market, but you'll also achieve points through discussions about company politics regarding the attitude towards older co-workers.

name: Verdun
description:
This is a late-WWI or early post-war German game depicting the struggle for Verdun. The game board shows an oblique overhead view from the south of the town and citadel of Verdun, surrounded by hills, forts and batteries, and with airships floating over the distant northern horizon. The game appears to be one of point-to-point manoeuver, but the rules are not clear from the board alone.

The playing grid consists of 36 numbered Forts or Batteries joined by a number of straight black lines (from 3 to a maximum of 8 leading to Fort de Belrupt. Each of these defensive positions is numbered from 1 to 12. The numbers are shown in groups of three, starting with three number 1s on Fort de Houdainville, Fort de Pozellier and a battery in between in the southeast corner of the map. These connect to three number 2s to the north, and so on, circling Verdun in a web of lines in a counter-clockwise direction.

While the place names are in French, and no publisher or date is indicated, the board bears the phrase "Gesetzlich geschützt" (legally protected), indicating a German manufacturer. Also the back of the square board has four smaller game boards, a chess/checkers board and three named Festung, Mühle (Nine men's morris) and Wolf, suggesting that this was part of a Spielmagazin or box of games.

name: Slam Punk Hockey
description:
Slam Punk Hockey is a hockey themed (!), perfect information abstract strategy game for 2 players, in which you'll be waging ruthless sport war in tight rink by using several movement/shooting tactics on your turn. Pick your team of two out of four pairs of characters with unique abilities and lead them to victorious 7 points by smartly combining available tactics, scoring valuable assisting combos, and delivering bloody knock-outs.

Gameplay
Inspired by Shogi, Chess, Duke and most recently Onitama.
Most notable differences it brings to the table:

puck: piece movable by both players (kind of pick up and deliver mechanism),
up to 4 movements per turn (2 actions per piece),
common abilities, usable by any skater
8 distinctive changeable personalities with special ability for player's team pieces.
scoring
all packed on 9 cards with 9 tokens

name: Landmarks
description:
In Landmarks, direct the growth of a city by drawing buildings on the shared map at the locations indicated by rolling the dice. When you roll coordinates for already claimed land, you get to draw more details, creating buildings that score more, while changing the skyline for all players. Manage your budget carefully to adjust the dice and pay for major landmarks. Each page tells a different chapter in the life of a city from rural village to capital city, using a different set of buildings each game to score points for adjacency, sets, groups and more.

Landmarks is the third in the line of Spiel Press roll-and-write game books.

name: Krona
description:
Krona is an abstract board game played on a infinite square grid. You can use the Go board or play with a set of stones (checkers) on any flat surface. The goal of the game is to deprive the opponent of all available moves. To do this, you need to block all the stones of the opposite color. In this game there is no war or direct confrontation of pieces. All the stones are interconnected and constantly depend on each other. During the game, the position passes through various metamorphoses and, having exhausted all its energy, freezes as a result. This game is inspired by the ancient philosophy of the Far East...

You can play with:

16 stones - If you prefer quick tactical games.
36 stones - If you like the balance of tactics and strategy.
64 stones - If you have a worthy opponent and a lot of time.

Average game length - 100-110 plies (with 36 stones). Strategy is more important than tactics. The first player has no advantages. The game can begin with any compact arrangement of stones. You can play with a handicap, if necessary. It is possible to eliminate draws by changing one rule. Connectedness of the position and irreversibility of the game is the basis of krona.

Rules:

Each player has an allocated color, Black and White. Players alternate turns, starting with Black. The stones must all stay connected in a single group. You cannot pick up a stone to move if doing so disconnects the remaining stones, even if they would be reconnected after putting the stone into its new location. Each stone always has neighbors. Their number can be from 1 to 8. Stones are considered to be neighbors if they stand on the nearby squares. Neighbors are divided into two types - diagonal and orthogonal. The stone can be moved to any empty square, where the number of neighbors are less than it is now. Their color does not matter. The stone can also be moved to any empty square, where the number of neighbors does not change, but orthogonal ones among them become less. The game ends when one of the players has no legal moves on his turn. If his opponent also has no moves it's a draw. If he has any move, he wins the game. In this case, the winner does as many moves as he can and earns one point for each move.

name: Death Race Arcade
description:
Death Race Arcade is a futuristic vehicular combat game that plays up to 8 with low downtime. It features simultaneous action selection, outlandish sci-fi weaponry, a scrolling race track with powerups, and respawns instead of player elimination.

Each player is a driver in the Death Race. The primary goal for all players is to cross the finish line (or to be as close as possible to it by the time someone else does). There are a number supplementary scoring metrics involving simple accumulation and set collection. So finishing first, while important, does not guarantee the win.

In each round of the game, all players simultaneously play 2 of their control cards face down. These cards "program" the movements of their vehicles. Cards are then simultaneously revealed, after which each player takes a turn to resolve their vehicle movement, activate powerups, and fire weapons.

Death Race has 2 modes of play: a symmetrical mode in which all vehicles have 9 identical control cards, and an asymmetric mode in which each vehicle has 4 or 5 (of 9) cards that give it unique abilities.
mechanics: Action Queue, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Push Your Luck, Set Collection, Simultaneous Action Selection, Take That, Variable Player Powers

name: Koukyuu Gekokujouki (後宮下克上記) (こうきゅうげこくじょうき)
description:
User summary
This Japanese game has a Chinese title 後宮下克上記 and a subtitle ～利用せよ、出し抜け、結果得るのは、敵意、そして、権勢なり～.

In Japanese, the main title would be こうきゅうげこくじょうき (Kōkyū gekokujō-ki) (Koukyuu Gekokujouki). 'Ki' means Chronicles and Gekokujou means a junior overthrowing a senior (as in a servant overcoming its master, or a warlord being usurped from within its clan). The publisher offers an English title 'Mistress Dominating Royal' but a more literal translation would be 'The Inner Palace Insurrection Chronicles'.

The subtitle ～利用せよ、出し抜け、結果得るのは、敵意、そして、権勢なり～ translates as ~ Manipulate, outmanoeuvre, and reap what you sow, all in the name of enmity and influence ~.

Koukyuu Gekokujouki is a set collection game that involves penalties, designed for players who are looking for a sense of satisfaction from their game play. Combine cards for reproduction on a regressive scale.

Setting and Goal of the Game

Enter the inner palace, seek the king’s favour and gain influence — the battle between consorts is not an uncommon setting. The kingdom is overrun by a rabble of consorts at the present... but from this rabble there are those who scheme to manipulate others in possession of power, outmanoeuvre their rivals, and expand their control over the Inner Palace.

Players become consorts of the Imperial Court, vying for influence over the Inner Palace. This influence is represented by points, therefore the player with the greatest amount of points at the game is the victor. But take heed, as you outwit and steal influence from other consorts, they will retaliate with distrust and hostility to hinder your pursuit of power.

Publisher's summary
セットコレクション
ネガティブフィードバック
納得の行くゲームを欲しい方に

縮小再生産を組み合わせたセットコレクションです。

ゲームの設定と目的
　後宮に於いて、王の寵愛と権勢を求め、妃達が相争うのは珍しい光景ではありません。そう、とある王国でも、現時点では有象無象でしかない妾妃達が、有力な妃達を利用し、出し抜き、自らの後宮での権勢を高めようと画策しているのです。
　プレイヤーは、妾妃となって、後宮での権勢を得ることが目的となります。権勢は点数で表現されますので、ゲーム終了時に１番点数の高かったプレイヤーの勝利となります。なお、出し抜いて権勢を奪った妃達からは警戒心や敵意を持たれ、行動し辛くなるので気を付けましょう。
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Set Collection

name: Championship Formula Racing: Driver Supplement #1 – The Ligier
description: This page does not exist. You can edit this page to create it.
mechanics: Action Points, Action Queue, Variable Player Powers

name: Championship Formula Racing: Driver Supplement #2 – The Tyrell
description: This supplements adds materials to support four additional drivers in games of Championship Formula Racing. It also includes Historical Driver cards and Strategy cards, which allow for the use of non-player controlled drivers in the race. These drone drivers can be used for solo play or for expanding the driver field in group play.
mechanics: Action Points, Action Queue, Variable Player Powers

name: Seconds to Midnight
description:
Description from the publisher:

Each player starts with a deck scientists and politicians, and then starts to build their countries arsenal. At this same time your opponent begins to do the same. Then tensions begin to rise as each player builds their arsenals. Can you stop the world from falling into chaos and destroying itself, or have you built a arsenal powerful enough to destroy your opponent while still surviving. Does the nuclear fallout and war just end everything, only the players can decide these outcomes?
categories: Abstract Strategy, Bluffing, Card Game, Educational, Modern Warfare, Political, Spies/Secret Agents, Wargame
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Secret Unit Deployment

name: HexCON
description:
HexCON has a board of 4x4 hex-diamonds of 4 hex side length and a scoring hex-diamond of the same size. Each hex diamond is called a subboard. 2 sides of each subboard are associated with the color white and 2 with the color black. The subboards are alternating in the direction of these sides on the board.

Goal:have the biggest connected area of subboards
How:connect the sides of your color of a subboard to win it. Placement of stones in the subboard determines where your opponent can place the next stone on the board. When you win a subboard you get a bonus turn in which you can place your stone freely anywhere on the board. That stone determines the subboard for your opponents turn. It is possible to chain such wins. Is it impossible for a player to place a stone in a certain subboard, she can place her stone freely on the board. Won subboards are marked on the scoring board in player color.
Game end: as soon as one player controls an area on the scoring board that can not be surpassed in size.

name: Stop the Road!
description:
Each player moves by a die roll. Should you be first to reach or pass a 'cross-road' can close it by putting a marker on it. Should another player now reach the same cross-road they must stop. The next turn(s), that player must roll a 6 or they cannot move. This continues in future turns until they roll the 6.
First to reach 'Home' wins.

Game found in the Toby Twirl 1953 Annual.

name: Meister Petz und die Bienlein
description:
Vintage board game made in Germany about 1900.
One player plays in Bear role with black pawn. Other players play in Bees role with yellow pawns. Bees are traveling around the circle game board looking for new flowers and the Bear is trying to catch them and steal the honey. If the Bear catch all Bees - this player wins the game.

name: Meeple Factory
description:
A Victorian factory build founded on player trading that works!

In Meeple Factory, players use tile and worker placement to build up their factory room by room. The catch is players can only operate and expand their factories by trading resources with other players. Fortunately everyone needs your resources just as much so a rich market economy emerges.

Players win by ultimately having the most coin generated from selling products and expanding the factory.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Commodity Speculation, Open Drafting, Simultaneous Action Selection, Tile Placement, Trading, Worker Placement

name: Politics: The Debate
description:
Politics: The Debate is a card game for would-be political leaders. Players take on the role of politicians and try to convince each other they, and they alone, can solve socio-political issues. If you enjoy debating fiscal responsibility one turn, and the feasibility of solving homelessness by imprisoning the homeless the next, The Debate is the game for you.
Players begin by separating and shuffling the two decks – ISSUES and POLCIES. The issues deck should be placed face-down on the table, and each player takes five policy cards to form a hand. The youngest player starts as the dealer, and they turn over the top issue card. This represents a particular problem that all the players, as politicians, want to look like they can solve. Players do this by playing two Policy cards from their hand. Each player does this going clockwise around the group, starting with the player after the dealer. Each player plays his/her two cards and explains briefly (30ish seconds) how the two Policies they have played solve the particular issue.
After each player has played his/her two Policies, players debate each other in a calm and collected fashion, gently critiquing each other’s policies while defending their own. When that’s done, go for the jugular – mercilessly attack your opponent’s stupid policies, compare them unfavourably to your fiscally-sound utopian masterplan, and suggest they’re like Hitler somehow. Maybe bite someone. When this is done, vote for a winner – the player whose Policies were the best. Remember to vote for the player who did the best at explaining, justifying and defending their Policies – not the player who suggested Policies closest to your personal ideology.
Once you’ve voted, take a note of the score and continue. The player to the left of the dealer becomes the new dealer, he or she deals two new policy cards to the player (bringing their hand back up to five), and turns over a new issue card. The whole horrible mess goes on like this until players either run out of issues or, if they want to reshuffle the issues and keep playing, until a pre-defined end time (or when you’ve had enough). Then the player with the most points is declared winner. Players should take this time to congratulate him/her, and re-visit contentious debates from the game.
categories: Card Game, Educational, Party Game, Political

name: Bushido: Mo Ises
description: How Mo Ises was drawn into the cult is unknown. He is though a deadly foe, often misjudged by his opponents they remain unaware of the threat he poses until they feel the cold of steel at their backs. The power of his words have been enhanced by whatever bargain he made with Yurei.
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Bushido: Harionago
description: Harionago is a truly terrifying addition to the ranks of the Cult. An ancient evil that for generations has preyed on unwary travellers across the Jwar Isles, her new found purpose to further the goals of Yurei is a frightening prospect.
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Bushido: Gaki
description: The Gaki are cursed, once greedy and conceited men, now damned to lurk in the dark. Constantly driven by the gnawing pain of a hunger that cannot be satisfied no matter to volume of meat this foul Yokai consumes. Those rare peasant who survive the steel like claws and razor sharp teeth talk of a cloak of dense, cold mist enveloping them before the assault.
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Bushido: Nezumi Kun
description: Little is known about the origins of Nezumi Kun, even the scholars of the Blue library could only guess at the occult rituals and black magic used to create this “Son of Nezumi”. The savage Yokai appears more wild and feral than its “father”, striking from nowhere, only a rank stench left to mark its passage before it scuttles away into the darkness. Waiting and lurking in the shadows waiting for instruction from a faceless unseen evil.
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Friendly Farmers
description:
Description from the designer:

Friendly Farmers was created as an entry in the 2016 Children's Game PnP Design competition.

Friendly Farmers is a worker placement game. Each turn players assign the workers on their farm different tasks depending upon the weather and other factors influencing crop management. When crops are harvested they can be sold immediately or stockpiled for sale at a later stage.

In the basic game market prices are fixed and there is always a fully available labour pool. In the advanced game the size of the labour pool and the value of each crop's market prices are subject to variation each turn.

Players race to grow and sell their crops and be the first to reach 50 points.

name: TRIPLEX: the 3D Strategy Board Game
description:
Description from the designer:

TRIPLEX is three games of Tic Tac Toe, all played at once, on the same board with movable pieces. The goal is just as simple as that of Tic Tac Toe: to form alignments of three in a row. The goal is also to form one alignment of all three types of pieces all at the same time.

In turns, players play any one of their pieces into any open space. Once all pieces have been played onto the board they may then be moved from where they were played into any open space. The first player to form all three types of alignments at the same time wins.

TRIPLEX is a board game that designers have been trying to create for over a century. TRIPLEX is the worlds only easily comprehensible, highly enjoyable and truly three dimensional strategic board game.
mechanics: Area Movement, Grid Movement, Pattern Building, Pattern Recognition, Tile Placement

name: Card Clash
description:
Description from the designer:

Card Clash is a quick game that sees 2 players attacking and counterattacking with cards whose type preference beats the previously played card. If your opponent can't counter your attack with any of the 4 cards in their hand, you win the round! But each successive round adds a new set of stronger cards into both players' decks, so try to get the first attack in to knock out your opponent before they get a chance to play a devastating attack! The first to win 2 rounds wins the game.

name: Total mania junior!
description:
Family board game including 12 different games:


Quiz!
Sketch!
Blind sketch!
Sculpture!
Pantomime!
Stand up comedy!
Song!
Spelling!
Scrabble!
Hangman!
Inverse reading!
Vocabulary!
mechanics: Acting, Dice Rolling, Push Your Luck, Singing

name: VIXIV: The Game of Survival
description:
Description from the publisher:

VIXIV is a strategic card game based on ecology and the people who manage it. You are new interns with the Department of Wildlife Management. Tasked with maintaining a specific area, you must create a thriving ecosystem while simultaneously thwarting your peers as you compete for limited space and the coveted attention of professional mentors.

Once you have built your map and draw your cards, you begin laying out your species and building your ecosystem. As the game progresses, your species will grow and thrive, earning you points and hopefully the attention of a mentor. Be warned though, everything can change with frightening speed. In just a few moments you may find yourself combating wildfires, succumbing to disease, or butting heads with your rivals.

Things quickly grow competitive as free space shrinks and your peers force your hand with actions capable of affecting the entire board. If you stay dedicated to your goals and you may wind up leading the group. Stay too focused though, and you may find yourself falling behind as the changes overwhelm your carefully laid plans.

name: Capture the Grid
description:
This action-packed game will have children racing to complete all the zany challenges to win the game! Players can also work in teams to complete missions to allow them to capture spaces on the grid. The team with the most spaces once the grid is full wins the game.

Description from the publisher:
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Educational, Number, Puzzle, Word Game

name: Spacedogs
description: A fast & furious flipping card game. Quickly flip over the top card from your pile and place it onto the center pile. Slap the center pile when you spot one of three things - two of the same cards in a row, two of the same separated one that is different, or one of the Meteor Shower cards. The first player to slap the pile collects all the cards in the center to add to their pile until all have been collected.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Animals, Card Game, Science Fiction

name: Under the Sea
description:
Description from the publisher:

The Outrageous and Sneaky Bluffing Card Game. Get rid of the cards in your hand by laying them down in sequence. If you don't have the next card in the sequence, bluff by laying down another card. But don't get caught. If your opponents call your bluff and catch you in a lie, you get all the cards in the pile!

name: Shadow of Wolves on a Moonlight Night
description: This is the second game of Kilovolt Design's tactical mini wargame series "Winning or Losing". The theme is U-boats attack on Convoy SC 104 during World War II. The game is basically played by two players. German player commands U-boats and tries to sink Allied transport ships. Allied player tries to prevent it.

name: Encounter above the Yalu
description: This is the third game of Kilovolt Design's tactical mini wargame series "Winning or Losing". The theme is aerial combat in "MiG Alley" during Korean War. The game is basically played by two players. UN player commands USAF and tries to destroy a bridge over the Yalu. Communist player commands Soviet/Chinese MiGs and tries to defend the bridge.

name: The Game of Shopping
description:
This very early shopping game was published in 1879 as an advertising vehicle by Philadelphia department store Strawbridge & Clothier.

The board shows a circular track with 60 spaces. It is divided into four quadrants: blue, yellow, green and red. Each quadrant has spaces for three of the store's departments on the track, an elevator space inside the track, and a cashier's desk outside the track.

Players spin and move around the track. When they land on a department, they must go to that quadrant's elevator. There they stay until they spin one of three numbers, which then move them to a department either ahead or behind the one they left. A player landing on the same space as another bumps that player to the cashier's desk for the quadrant, from which he can move to the beginning of the quadrant with a spin of 3, or to the end of the quadrant with a 6.

No goods are actually bought or sold: the game is simply a race from the entrance to the exit with goods as distractions along the way.

The game board is of thin cardboard, and was given away in an envelope rather than a box.

name: Letter Head: Design Challenge Games
description: The Letter Head Design Challenge invited Letter Head fans to submit their own games utilizing the innovative Letter Head deck. Here, then, are six brand new Letter Head games, running the gamut from deckbuilding to subterranean exploration. These games expand and change the way Letter Head is played, providing hours of additional enjoyment. And they're free to download from the Atlas Games website—all you need is a Letter Head deck to play.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Word Game

name: Fürth hoch 3
description:
Description:
This game has been published for the 1000th anniversary of the city of Fürth in a limited edition of 1000 copies.

Description of the author:
Get on your way and explore Fuerth in a very special way. Two to four players go on an exciting journey through the Kleeblattstadt. On 240 cards, questions await you to be answered and events want to be discovered. In addition to three possibilities for answering each question, you will find a brief explanation for each question. Let us invite you to test your knowledge of the city of Fürth and also to find out a lot about the medium-sized Franconian town.

name: To The Last Man: Rules for WWI Skirmish Combat
description:
The era of the First World War is sometimes seen as one of unimaginative mechanised slaughter with the humble infantryman no more than cannon fodder.

In reality, personal skill and courage were often more important than ever to the men in the front line. Cut off from their comrades in the wastes of no man's land, without the communications which soldiers take for granted today, small groups men struggled to stay alive and defeat their enemies in ferocious close range battles.

To The Last Man is a 32 page set of skirmish rules for the period which enables you to take command of a section or platoon in such a desperate situation and lead it to victory or bloody defeat. Designed for fast, enjoyable and tactically challenging games, the rules are intended not just for the Western Front, but for all the far flung theatres of conflict in the early decades of the 20th century - from the steppes of Siberia to the jungles of East Africa.
categories: Dice, Fighting, Miniatures, World War I

name: Improved Historical Cards
description:
This is an 1884 trivia card game focused on American history. As with most such games, players are dealt an initial hand, and on their turn, ask a question of their neighbour to the left. If that person answers correctly, he keeps the card; if not, other players in turn have an opportunity, and if no one can answer, the questioning player keeps the card. The player with the most cards at the end of the game wins.

Most of the 180 cards in this game bear one or more title words (names, places, things or events) followed by two or more related facts. For these cards, the questioner states a title word or phrase, and the other players must state one relevant fact.

The remaining cards have specific questions, which players must answer completely. (For example: "Name the features of the Omnibus Bill. The 5-part answer: California should be a free state; Utah and New Mexico should be formed into territories; Texas should be paid $10 million to give up its claim to New Mexico; the Slave Trade should be prohibited in the District of Columbia; and Fugitive slaves should be returned to their owners.)

According to Annual Reports of the Department of the Interior, 1884 this game has 200 cards.

name: Orthoepy
description:
Orthoepy, which means the study of correct pronunciation, is an educational card game published in Chicago in 1899. It consists of two numbered decks each of 50 cards. One of these decks has Sentence cards, each with six numbered sentences; the other deck has the matching Master cards, showing the proper pronunciation of each difficult word in the sentences.

The rules provide several variations of the game. In the most basic, the Social Game, each deck is distributed evenly among the players. In turn, each player calls out the number of a Master card in his hand. The player holding the corresponding Sentence card then must slowly and distinctly read the sentence on that card of the Master's choice. If the Master player notices any mistakes, he must confirm what the Sentence player said, and then claims the pair of cards as a "book"; if he notices no mistakes, then the reading player gets the cards. Play then passes to the left, and the player with the most "books" when the cards run out is the winner.

The deck includes an Arbiter card, with whoever holds it being empowered to decide any disputes. In the Commercial game, the Arbiter card initially counts as a single point, and failed cards go to the Arbiter and count to his score. However, if the Arbiter makes a mistake, the Arbiter card goes to the successful Master player, and its value increases by one.

In the Professional game, the number of points won is equal to the number of test words correctly pronounced rather than the number of cards; a player missing even a single word scores nothing while the Master gets all the points for the sentence. This introduces an element of strategy for Masters: whether to challenge a given Reader with a long and difficult sentence that could mean a big swing one way or the other, or to choose a short and easier one with less risk and less reward. There are additional rules for Club play and Contests.

name: Kop the Kaiser
description:
This is a roll-and-move game published to mark the U.S. entry into World War I. It allows up to six players, each representing an arm of the U.S. forces: Infantry, Cavalry, Artillery, Marine Corps, Engineers and Aviation Corps.

The board has a circular track and six spokes leading inward to the center of the board. Each player starts on the space representing the headquarters of his branch (Boston, Portland, Savannah, Charleston, Norfolk or New York), and must complete a circuit of the board "Dodging Submarines".

Upon return to base, he then heads inwards on a spoke, along spaces marked: In France; On Wotan Line; In Belgium; Before the Rhine; Across the Rhine; Through Germany; Before Berlin; and finally the central space In Berlin, with a caricature of Kaiser Wilhelm. The winner is the first to reach the center circle.

The board indicates "Patent pending" but does not name a publisher or copyright holder.

name: Salt
description:
Salt is a game of exploration, building, conflict, and magic in a constantly evolving landscape.

In Salt, you take control of a gang in an alternate reality, wild west-inspired setting. By exploring the world, charting new territory, gathering resources, building infrastructure, and acquiring weapons, you will gain control of the resources in the world. Figure out how to strike the most delicate balance of these elements to be the most dominant gang around.

name: Perekond Oilbergi Reis Ümber Eestimaa
description:
The Oilbergs family travels around Estonia
Promotional game for Statoil
Usual Roll and Move around game board. In some places You move faster or miss a turn.

The first player who finishes the round is the winner.

name: Super Mario Bros. 3
description:
One of the games in Bandai (バンダイ)'s Party Joy series of lighter boardgames (#109).

This one is based off the videogame Super Mario Bros. 3.
Players separated into Mario Team and Luigi Team advance on the game board with their respective teams, go to various worlds, defeat the Koopalings, and aim for Bowser Castle.
Familiar transformation items also appeared, each with different effects, such as "can attack twice" and "high jump". Choosing the right path is the key to the game.

Components:
- Game board x1
- Team chip (Mario & Luigi) × 1 each
- Player chip × 28
- Player chip stand × 4
- World cards × 16
- Dice × 1
- Item chips × 28
- Enemy chips × 35
- Bowser Card × 1
- Koopaling Card × 7
- Airship (Tank) Route × 1,
- Fort (Bowser's Castle) Route × 1

name: Rocket
description: Rocket is casino style card game created by the makers of the game Pairs. The game can be played with any Pairs playing card deck, but was specially designed and introduced with the Bar Maids deck.
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Push Your Luck

name: Pingwiny z Madagaskaru: Oficer X
description: Bonus card added to second issue of Kurier Planszowy.
categories: Animals, Children's Game, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Modular Board, Set Collection, Worker Placement

name: Pingwiny z Madagaskaru: Roy
description: Bonus card added to second issue of Kurier Planszowy.
categories: Animals, Children's Game, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Modular Board, Set Collection, Worker Placement

name: History Maker Golf: 2017 Pro National Golf Card Set
description: Individual cards for over 150 fictional pro golfers, patterned after the current pro golf tour.

name: Clockwork Memolion (クロックワークメモリオン)
description:
User summary
クロックワークメモリオン (Kurokkuwa-ku Memorion) Clockwork Memolion is a two player fantasy cardgame. You battle against your opponent by customizing your memory-lost characters by injecting various memories (words). Hence, the same character may be altered to execute different effects and abilities. First one to put your opponents' life to 0 wins the battle.

It's a Print and Play cardgame, supported by a custom website. A player can create a free account, and keep cards they gain on their personal page. Every 8 hours, each player receives a free Gacha giving a random card. But players can also buy a Premium Gacha giving five extra cards, including more rarites. Since the game is entirely PnP, buying cards is the only cost (an income model akin to mobile games) other than printing.

Gameplay is in quick 1 vs 1 deck-driven battles but the rules enable partnership games. Players tune up their decks with new cards they have collected and printed.

https://www.cwm-memories.com/

A Note on the Name: Japanese tend to use the L as an approximation to the R which they don't have. This is intentional, not a mistake. So this game would be spoken in Japanese more as Memorion than Memolion, which comes from the game's theme of lost memories.

Publisher's summary
記憶を失ったキャラクターに様々な記憶(ワード)を入れ能力をカスタマイズしながら戦うファンタジーカードゲームです。
同じカードでも違った効果、能力にすることができます。
先に相手のライフを0にしたプレイヤーの勝利です。

プリントして遊べるカードゲームです。
https://www.cwm-memories.com/
上のサイトに無料会員登録すれば8時間に1回無料でパックを引くことができ、それをマイページに保管することができます。
そこにアクセスすれば好きなカードが印刷できます。
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Collectible Components, Fantasy, Fighting, Print & Play, Word Game
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management

name: The Princess and the Dragon Game
description: The Princess and the Dragon Game is an educational game for children teaching reading and matching skills. There are six different games, each of which involves collecting cards to fill the spaces on a board. They involve combinations of matching pictures to words or words to pictures. Some allow players to pick any card, others require them to pick off the top of a stack. One game involves miming words, and another requires players to come up with synonyms.

name: Monroviaopoly
description: Monroviaopoly is a city-themed Monopoly clone with a Monrovia, California theme. Spaces on the board represent local businesses and landmarks.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Flying Tigers
description:
Flying Tigers is game #4 in the Battle over Britain game series published by Minden Games.

Flying Tigers is an expansion module for the Battle over Britain game system. It may be used with the standard rules contained in any game of the series. It contains solitaire rules, optional rules, several new aircraft and scenarios. You must own the core rues for Battle over Britain to use this module. The rules and planes contained here may be used with any of the other titles in the game series.

Flying Tigers incorporates material from the out-of-print Battle over Britain: Solitaire Module and adds new content, particularly the planes and campaign involving the 1st American Volunteer Group fighting with the Chinese Air Force in 1941-42 against the Japanese. The module also contains campaign game scenarios and planes for the Polish (1939) and Dutch (1940) campaigns.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II

name: Verb Volcano
description:
To reach the peak of the fiery volcano, just identify the correct action words--but watch out for treacherous rock slides!

Verb Volcano is an educational game designed to teach verb forms and tenses. Each player chooses a card with a sentence and several possible verbs that could complete it. If they answer correctly, they spin a spinner to move up a track toward the top of the volcano. Spaces along the track may move players forward or back or grant an extra spin. The first player to reach the top of the volcano wins.

name: Visions
description:
Visions is a competitive game where the players collect cards that show clocks. They play the clocks to connect other cards via the hands of the clocks with their mental center. Those other cards represent different topics which belong to family Yates: ancestors, places where they lived, rooms where they used to be and their collection of jewels. While the players are visionary talented people, they try to help family Yates finding out what curse lies on them.

By connecting the family cards at the right time (represented by the clock cards) with their mental center the players gain victory points, visionary power and vision parts in different colors. Each player has got a vision card with a 3x3 pattern where they place the vision parts according to the rules. The players get victory points for full rows and columns.

The players may use the visionary power to change it into benefits, for example reducing the cost to connect family cards with the mental center or getting additional vision parts.
At a given time the player with the fewest victory points chooses a sort of visionary power and all benefits which are connected to this power will be more expensive for the rest of the game and all players have to deal with this limitation.

One family card lies at a special position and can't be connected directly with the mental center but it is possible to connect the card through the other family cards with the center to get the benefits and the chance to force other players to swap vision parts and/or visionary power.

The players also have to try to solve a master vision with the vision parts to get extra points and offer the best help for family Yates. Only the one with the most victory points is able to give them the chance to break the curse.
mechanics: Hand Management, Modular Board, Pattern Building, Set Collection

name: Extra! Extra!:  A Fact/Opinion Game
description:
Be the first to complete your paper route by answering questions about facts and opinions!

Extra! Extra! is an educational children's game, designed to teach players to distinguish between fact and opinion. Players start the game with five newspaper tokens each. On a turn, they choose a card, read the passage on the card and then attempt to answer the associated question. Correct answers allow the player to roll a die and move. Wrong answers cause loss of a turn. Players attempt to land on purple spaces, which are attached to houses and allow them to "deliver" one of their newspapers. However, they may not deliver to a house that already has a paper. A few spaces contain special instructions, such as extra turns or moves or loss of turns or taking a paper back. The first player to deliver all his/her papers wins.

name: Ortus Regni: Shire
description:
2-6 player, Ortus Regni variant.

The largest and most powerful shire in Mercia is before you. The Burhs (towns) of the shire are unique, and each can provide certain important services to its overlord. One Burgh is known for its great warriors, another for its persuasive lords and allies, another for its loyal and capable vassals. Take what Burhs you can, but choose wisely, with an eye on your own strengths and weaknesses.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Medieval, Political

name: Ortus Regni: Danelaw
description:
2-6 player, Ortus Regni variantmat

The Danes left their Long Boats behind and settled in the North East of your nation. They crushed the Anglo-Saxon kingdom of Northumbria along the way, and now rule a kingdom of their own up north known as the Danelaw! See that they do not take over the whole of England, by keeping them in their place.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Medieval, Political

name: Empires
description:
Description from the designer:

Empires is a drafting game, where each card has four quadrants. When a player plays a card, he or she plays it in one of these four quadrants, and it has a different effect depending on which quadrant it is placed in.

There is a buying phase after the drafting phase each round, where players will purchase upgrades.

Game Bio:
Become the leader of a local church, and grow it into the largest, most influential church in the country. Bring in money, sell books, and build additions on to your building, all to attract more and more followers.
The player with the most followers and the largest empire at the end of the game is the winner!

name: Mikan de Kyatto (みかんdeキャッと)
description:
User summary
みかんdeキャッと (Mikan de Kyatto) is MIKAN de CAT, a simple stacking game.

In Japan, the combination of oranges (Mikan) and cats is commonplace, and naturally understood. Kyatto is more of a pun on the sound 'kya' which is an exclamation, intended to sound like 'cat'. The game comes from the practise of always always keeping some oranges in Winter on your Kotatsu (a low table, heated underneath).

In this game, players use a cat spinner or cards, and stack oranges in the glass dish, placed on a table. The designer includes five different ways to play. The cat spinner shows a tomcat.

Publisher's summary
テーブルの上に置かれたガラスの器の中に、みかんを積んでいくバランスゲームです。
遊び方は5通りあり、カードを使ったり、ルーレットを使ったりします。

name: Tark Piimamees Taskus
description:
"Smart milkman in pocket" in English

Promotional game for The Estonian Chamber of Agriculture and Commerce. Based on Tark Laps Taskus there are thematic pictures of cows and milk production on one side of the card and letters on another side of the card.

Turn around top card and be the first to say something that is on the picture and starting the letter from another card and You get the card as a point. If nobody can´t say anything or there is a tie the card is kept for the next round.
If the deck runs out the player with the most points is the winner.
categories: Card Game, Educational, Party Game, Real-time
publishers: Goldmerk, The Estonian Chamber of Agriculture and Commerce

name: Eddie, pass auf!
description: The game re-themes Funny Bunny with groundhoges, who have to hide from an eagle. Groundhog-pawns are moved heading to the finish and number of spaces are determined by a deck of cards, just like in the original. What distinguishes this game is, that multiple pawns have to be brought to the end spaces, and that a speed element is added to the game. Whenever an eagle card is revealed, a button is pressed, which randomly might activate the eagle. Players are supposed to only hide their groundhogs, if the eagle takes off from behind a bush.

name: Enishi no hi (縁ノ日)
description:
User summary
縁ノ日 Enishi no hi is a Japanese card game set during a Matsuri.

Players manage street stalls at the local shrine festival. Every turn you can acquire new stall cards and trade to collect stall cards of the same genre or numeric value. Business begins on the day of the festival and the sets of stalls you own will decide how much you earn in profits. When the final settling of accounts is over, the player in possession of the most money wins.

Publisher's summary
プレイヤーは縁日に出店する露店を取り仕切っています。毎ターン1枚ずつ露店カードが獲得できますので、それをジャンルか数値で同じものを揃えるようにトレードしましょう。縁日が開催されると決算が発生しますので、所有するセットを参照して収入を獲得してください。最後の決算が終了した時点で、一番所有金額の多いプレイヤーが勝利です。

name: Hacked Off!
description:
In this deliciously gooey card game, you’ll build (or rebuild as needed) your body from a severed head, equip yourself with a motley collection of weapons and armor, and eventually behead the Chief of the Zombie Nest to take over leadership and win the game.

As a zombie, losing your head doesn’t kill you, but it sure can put a damper on your day. It’ll take time to forage and scavenge enough material to build a new body, but you’re determined to do it. Maybe you’ll get lucky and find some useful tools, maybe even a weapon or two.

It’s not going to be easy, because the other Players are all trying to do the same thing. Will you be lucky enough to find the chainsaw and the shotgun? Will some other zombie trick you at the last second into walking into helicopter blades? There’s only one way to find out!

Regardless, you’re not the kind of zombie that’s going to let a little beheading get between you and your ultimate goal: to rule the Zombie Tribe!
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Pick-up and Deliver

name: Multiverse: Catwoman Modern Age
description: Knight Models introduces the Multiverse line with this expansion. The Multiverse line is a series of expansions that expands both the Batman Miniature Game and the DC Universe Miniature game. This expansion includes a Catwoman figure and character sheet.

name: DC Universe Miniature Game: Shazam
description: This expansion introduces Shazam to the DC Universe Miniature Game. This white metal kit comes ready to assemble and paint.

name: Word Breaker
description:
A spelling card game that helps to improve your spelling, expand your vocabulary & have hours of fun competing with all your friends and families.

Somewhat in the style of a card based scrabble, each player takes turns taking 3 actions where they can either play a word, draw a card from the deck or a "spell field", or steal a card from another player's word.

The game ends when a player makes 5 words to which the final round is played. The winner is determined by the score from the words created. Words that uses 5 cards or more will score higher.

Players can also use various power cards which does various effects from drawing extra cards to stealing more than one cards from another player

name: In Bocca al Luccio
description: The game is the various phases of a game of sport fishing. Advances on the path to the fisherman, choose the most favorable fishing spot, mount the barrel, choose the bait, the float, the toggle and line. After that it faces a real fishing action: if a fish bites can catch it only if you have just installed your fishing rod. In the end who will win to his credit as many kilograms of fish.

name: Chrono Blaze
description:
Arrange a unit of humanoid robots, select weapons, and edit your tactics!

CHRONO BLAZE'' (ク ロ ノ ブ レ イ ズ)" is a full-scale card game of the main theme computer!

Divide the 36 decks into two players, take their weapons with limited resources, repair the mechanics, and drive the battlefield!

The aircraft has a "Captain" and a "Wardrobe." The two players decide whether to use "Blind Type" or "Mighty Type" at the beginning of the game.

Place your equipment on your turn and use it.

If you destroy all of your opponent's gas, you win.

The key to winning and losing is a calm judgment and an accurate reading ... ... But as time comes "Luck (Ruck)" and "Unlucky (ア ン ラ ッ ク)" all swallow!

I will release a new sensory robot battle this spring as a model!

Contents

36 cards (for 2 people)

One instruction book


The four-player competition is an extension rule, and two sets of these are required.



The game requires two separate 6 pieces of dice (due to packing, it is not possible to bundle the dice that were predicted in the early days, but it will be accepted)

name: LittleStorm in all Kinds of Weather
description: This page does not exist. You can edit this page to create it.

name: Meltdown Gulf
description:
Next week civilization as we know is obliterated in a catelysmic series of events the survivors simply refer to as "The Meltdown".

You lead one of four factions of these survivors to battle for supremacy in the rising tides above your former home, Los Angeles.

Each player starts with three decks: the Vehicle, Fighter, and Action decks. You can use your faction specific player mat to organize your cards during game play. The faction specific counter is used to mark your score on the battle mat.

Unplayed vehicle cards can be organized above the player mat in the "docks" area either face up or face down (I play face down so my opponent has to remember which vehicles I've played). The unplayed action cards are shuffled and placed face down on the left side of the mat; you will randomly draw from this deck as you play. The fighter deck will usually be in your hand but you can set it in the middle of the mat to keep things organized. Lastly, each player will have 4 action cards in his/her hand, store these on the right side of the mat. The bottom portion of the mat will fill up with won or discarded cards as you play.

The player who initiates combat will choose 1 fighter card and 1 vehicle card from his player mat and place them in play near the battle mat. Add the power scores from each card and place your faction's counter on the corresponding number on the battle mat. The next player will do the same, placing one fighter card and one vehicle card in play and adding his faction's counter to the mat. After all fighter and vehicle cards are played, in order, each player will place an action card face down. Once all action cards are committed to play they are flipped over to reveal their modifiers.

name: I'm In Charge
description: This page does not exist. You can edit this page to create it.

name: Cuvinte Încrucișate
description:
A challenge for your linguistic sense.

Form words in order to obtain a higher score. On your turn, arrange letters on the game board and try to cover more colored "bonus" squares. Words can be formed in two directions: horizontally and vertically. The game ends when all the letter chips are used or no other words can be formed. The player with the highest score wins.

name: Buzzed Bands
description:
Each player puts a band on a cup, wrist, or bottle. Players hang out at a party as they normally would while also carrying out the dares printed on their Buzzed Bands. Keep following through with your dare until someone switches bands with you. Play continues until a player has received the Switch Bands for a third time.

Everyone wins when they play this game. You get to drink while having a great time. This game also acts as a wonderful ice breaker game to get to know new people at a party.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game

name: Wacky Tobacky Comparisons
description:
Description from the publisher:

The game of wacky question and answer match-ups! Compete with other players to come up with the wackiest matching answers possible!

Players take turns asking questions or making fill-in-the-blank statements and other players submit hilarious answers. The one with the funniest answer wins! Hilarious entertainment to liven up any party!
categories: Card Game, Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game

name: Batman Miniature Game: Falcone Crime Family
description: This expansion adds the Falcone Crime Family to the Batman Miniature Game. This white metal kit comes ready to assemble and paint.

name: Batman Miniature Game: Alberto Falcone
description: This expansion adds Alberto Falcone to the Batman Miniature Game. This white metal kit comes ready to assemble and paint.

name: Orange Game
description: Players place simultaneously triangle-tiles on the table so that the two adjacent fruit-symbols match. If circle is formed on the table player drops his token in the middle of the circle. First player who first drops all 3 of his tokens is the winner.

name: Riik riigi vastu
description:
Country versus Country.
Traditional game with different countries all around the world with information: Land area, population etc.
Game is played like Top Trump. Active player looks at his top card , chooses category (f.e. population) and all players compare the population from their top cards. Who has the biggest number gets all the cards. The last player in game is the winner.

name: Auctioneer
description:
Description from the rulebook:

It is the purpose of each player to buy at auction articles put up for sale by the auctioneer. Each article has a hidden value revealed after its purchase by the Highest Bidder. If the buyer purchases the article at less than the revealed value, he scores a profit. If he pays more than it's worth, he loses the difference. The winner of the game is the player with the highest amount of money remaining after all articles are auctioned off.

Before play begins each player secretly decides what each article being auctioned is worth and writes the dollar amount on a slip of paper and then inserts the paper into the article envelope. Each player begins with $1,179 and uses this money to bid on articles placed at auction.

The "auctioneer" title is passed from player to player and the number of items auctioned per auctioneer turn is determined by the number of players (articles should be divided up so each player has an equal number to auction off. The game instructions use groups of five). After each item is auctioned, the article envelope is opened and the slips are totaled. The auctioneer acts a the bank and either collects money from the bidder if the amount bid is more than the revealed value or pays the bidder if the revealed value is more than the amount bid.

name: The Game of Abbie an' Slats
description: Simple children's race game based on comic strip characters. First player to reach the end by the exact number wins. The strip was written by Al Capp and drawn by Raeburn Van Buren and ran from 1937-1971.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Unmeiryoku
description:
User Summary:
運命力 (Unmeiryoku) is a dice-rolling game by the doujin circle カレーラーメン (in English: Curry Ramen'). It is based in the Project Touhou universe, with character cards representing various characters from the Project Touhou universe, drawn by many different artists (see below).

The game box contains 8 dice, 54 characters cards (6 x 9 characters) and 6 rules summary cards.

The players all start with the Daiyousei character card. They take turns at rolling dice.

More specifically, a player's turn consists of:
1. You throw initially 3 dice
2. You may use as many character cards you have in your possession to tweak that initial roll. The effects could be to change the dice value or add more dice for instance.
3. After modification, if you achieve a specific condition you can get a new character card which you will be able to use at your next run. Now your turn ends.

The game continues until a player manages to get the Flandre character card.

Note: The rulebook is in Japanese but no Japanese is needed for playing the game as the cards only have symbols (dice sides and numbers).

Publisher's summary:

Twist your　'Fate' !

You think it's over? But it's not !
Add dice, remove dice, use spells to alter your luck and be the first to rejoin with Flandre !

運命を捻じ曲げろ！

賽は投げられた？関係ないね！
ダイス目を増やし、減らし、逆転させフランドールの元まで辿りつけ！

カレーラーメンのカードゲーム第二弾『運命力』！
今度はひたすらダイスを振りまくるゲームです。
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Hand Management

name: Belagerungsspiel
description:
This mid-19th century game is quite different from the asymmetric movement game of the same name. This is strictly a die-rolling game, albeit also asymmetrical.

The board is a rectangular sheet of paper showing six artillery pieces behind earthworks firing at a multi-turreted castle. The castle walls are marked with 28 combinations of 2D6, some duplicated, while four piles of rocks in front of the castle are marked with doubles 1 through 4. (The main gates are marked with doubles 5 and 6.)

Above the castle are six spaces decorated with artillery pieces, each with a single 2D6 combination, and empty squares covering the rest of the possibilities. Players roll 2D6 alternately, and to win, the attacking player must destroy all the segments of the castle before the defending player rolls the six combinations needed to destroy his guns.

The game name and publication date of 1840 are handwritten on the reverse of the game sheet.

name: Batman Miniature Game: Professor Pyg & Dollotrons
description: This expansion to the Batman Miniature Game introduces Professor Pyg and his Dollotrons. This white metal kit comes ready to assemble and paint.

name: Pepe Repite
description:
Can you repeat everything Pepe says and does? ... And add something else?

"Each sixth chick sat on a stick."

Snoring with closed eyes.

"She sells seashells by the seashore."

Swim butterfly style.

This is a game with special cards of memory and corporal expression.

---

¿Puedes repetir Todo lo que Pepe Dice y hace… Y agregarle algo más?

“Quiero el panqueque que queda.”

Roncar con los ojos cerrados.

“María Chucena techaba su choza.”

Nadar estilo mariposa.

Juego con cartas especiales de memoria y expresión corporal.

name: Das Eisenbahnspiel
description:
The players have to get their trains from the main station at the center of the game board to space 50 of one of the six destination stations. Movement is determined by a standard die (1-6) and a color-die (red, white, green), which has the following meanings:
white: free track, the train moves the double number of spaces.
red: blocked track, the train misses a turn.
green: the train moves backward.
If a train gets to a rail junction, the player has to raise his red flag, to signal that the trains on the other tracks have to wait till he passed the junction and removes the flag.
The first player to reach his destination station wins the game.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: War: The Board Game
description:
Description from the designer:

War: the Board Game is an abstract wargame which captures the most difficult strategic and tactical decisions faced by generals in a war with a minimum set of rules that can be explained in less than 5 minutes. The design is effectively a deconstruction of the concept of a wargame, removing all ornament and unnecessary layers of complexity in order to retain only its essence. Despite its parsimonious nature, in War: The Board Game players face situations that can be considered direct representations of the reality in warfare. They need to protect the supply lines and headquarters, capture prisoners, flank and surround enemies, take advantage of geographical features etc.

The strategic depth of the game and the absence of in-game randomness, aims at rewarding experienced players. However, the learning curve is not steep and the millions of possible situations in the game make almost impossible to master it completely. Each games plays very differently depending on the type of strategy players attempt. Games can be very short if both opponents play very offensively or longer if they adopt a more conservative defensive strategy. As in reality, War: the Board Game can be won sometimes by a blitz attack or by attrition warfare.

Although War: the Board Game is a game with open information, the randomized initial setup and the addition of special rules for each scenario (e.g. antiquity wars, WWI, WWII, etc.) make the game replayable ad infinitum and avoid the problem of players memorizing and replicating standard initial moves and tactics. Moreover, the special scenario rules not only add thematic flavor to the game, but also introduce an different spatial element and make much more difficult to predict enemy's actions.

War: the Board Game is language independent and can be played 1 vs 1, 2 vs 2 (Allies) or 4 players (free for all). The Allies (2 vs 2) version of the game adds an extra twist and new strategic and tactical options. Allies version can be also playable by 2 or 3 players (1 vs 2) if players want to control two armies and headquarters.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Grid Movement, Pattern Recognition

name: Free Me the Game
description: Each player begins with 4 cards depicting a friend or follower. The object of the game is to be the first to get rid of those cards. Phone and notification cards are flipped one at a time from a central deck. The first player to slap the deck when two phone cards are flipped consecutively loses one of his friends or followers. A notification card requires players to compete in various battles, such as writing a humorous response to a hashtag. The winner of a battle loses one of his cards.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Humor, Party Game

name: Lawbreakers
description:
HOW TO PLAY
Lawbreakers is a game in which players must match the right character with the right weapon. Cards are based on popular video game characters and weapons.

Players start with three characters cards and three weapons cards in their hand.

Players deal damage by playing a weapon card from their hand. If they have a matching weapon card, they deal double damage.

The player to first lose all three characters cards, loses the game!
mechanics: Hand Management, Pattern Building, Player Elimination, Set Collection, Take That

name: Target, Aim, Assassinate
description:
HOW TO PLAY
Target, Aim, Assassinate is a card game in which the player's goal is to terminate high value targets for the most points.

Every player is dealt four random cards at the start of the game. The cards type are weapons, items or targets. Using their hand of cards, players attempt to match weapons to a target. Targets can only be taken out with their designated weapons.

At the start of play, a target is revealed. Each turn, players draw a card and then has the option to attack another player, draw a second card or assassinate the face-up target.

The player who assassinates the highest value of targets wins the game.
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Print & Play, Spies/Secret Agents

name: Geo-Shatter
description:
HOW TO PLAY
Geo-Shatter is a card game in which the player stacks cards in order to create point-scoring patterns.

On each cards is a geometric shape with points at various locations on the cards. As the cards stack, more points are revealed or removed from play.

Players play a single card a turn and when the cards have run out, the players get one last chance to play a card onto the stack.

HOW TO WIN
The player with the most points when all of the cards run out, wins.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Card Game, Print & Play
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Pattern Building, Tile Placement

name: Elemental Piggies
description:
Have you ever wanted to see piggies fight? In Elemental Piggies you get to do just that!

HOW TO PLAY
This game is about beating your opponent's pigs with pigs that counter the ones in place without being able to look at the opponents card, you will have to just trust them or call them out on their lie. However if you falsely accuse someone of lying you are the one that takes the cards.

Each player gets 10 cards. On each card are a number of piggies with an elemental affiliation: water, fire, wind, void and earth. One element beats another or you can overpower a card with the number of pigs in the card.

Players place their cards in the middle of the table and try to beat the value of the card that was previously placed. If they can't beat the value, they must take the pile.

HOW TO WIN
Play cards with pigs and elements and the first to get rid of all of their cards wins!
categories: Animals, Card Game, Fighting, Humor, Print & Play

name: Ortus Regni: Armory
description:
2-4 player, Ortus Regni variant mat.

Some might consider the heavily armored knight to be the final word in medieval combat, but the Long Bow and the Trebuchet may be the pinnacle of military technology in the High Middle Ages. Neither one was easy to acquire or operate, and both require specialized companies of skilled warriors to field effectively.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Medieval, Political

name: Ortus Regni: Inheritance
description:
2-4 player, Ortus Regni variant mat.

You are heir to a great old Earldom! Your ancient and noble family holds many assets and retainers. You can call upon all your house’s wealth to aid your endeavors but be careful when spending your family’s carefully acquired assets. They took generations to gather make sure you spend them wisely.
