The images include animals, geometrical forms and other edifying objects.

name: POWer Shapes
description: Be a card matching superhero! The more you match, the more POWer you gain! This on-the-go learning resource, POWer Shapes, for ages 4 and up is perfect for parents and teachers. Players match colors or shapes as they try to be the first to earn the most tokens and win the game!

name: Mother Goose and Her Friends
description:
McLoughlin Brothers of New York produced this Mother Goose card game. The copyright dates it from 1892.
Grouping children's rhymes together and calling them Mother Goose Tales, is known to date from 15th century Europe.
McLoughlin's game was a simple matching card game, a bit similar to Old Maid, with illustrations and verses from well-known childrens' rhymes.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Novel-based, Party Game

name: The Dickens Game
description:
The Dickens Game is a matching game from the 19th century.
The pack is divided into books of four cards each. The book E, 'Bleak House', for example, consists of four cards, each card representing an interesting character in Charles Dickens' novel of that name.

The instruction booklet states that this is 'A new social entertainment familiarizing characters in the novels of Charles Dickens'.

name: Das Feldherrnspiel
description:
This is a WWII-era German game similar to L'Attaque or the later Stratego. The playing board is only seven spaces wide and 14 rows deep, with four 2-space blanks in the middle rows that force attacks to go through the remaining three channels.

The playing pieces are wooden triangles that stand up so only the owning player can see their values. Players set up freely on their side of the board and than move them one at a time to attack opposing pieces and eventually capture the enemy flag piece.

Each side has 33 pieces, ranging in value from 11 (Scharfshutze or Sharpshooter) to 1 (Feldmarschall or Field Marshal). In general, the lower value beats the higher value, with equal values causing mutual destruction. However, the Scharfshutze kills the Feldmarschall while losing to everything else, and Mines kill anything that attacks them, but cannot move or attack.

name: Seven Families of Capetiens
description:
Seven Families of Capetiens is an educational card game about the history and genealogy of French royalty of the Capetien dynasty. The game comes with 55 playing cards, a rules card, a pamphlet on the history of the various Capetien family members, and a genealogical chart of those individuals.

The players have two decks of cards at their disposal: 42 people cards and 42 castle cards. The Bastille destruction card is included among the caslte cards and allows the person who draws to nullify a castle laid down by an opponent. The latter is then unable to reunite the corresponding family.

In order to win a player must, in their entirety, reunite more families than his opponents.
In addition a preliminary condition must be met: before beginning to reunite a family, you must have acquired a castle in which they have resided.

name: Where's Elmer
description:
The game comes with 35 cards, instructions and a Parker Brothers ad sheets for some other of their games.

To play the game, all of the cards are dealt. The players place all matches on the table and use one of the green tokens for each match they have. The players take turns taking a card from another player’s hand, hoping to come up with another match or to secure the Elmer card. The winner of the game is the one who ends up with just one card in his or her hand with that card being the Where's Elmer? card.

name: North American Song Birds Card Game
description:
The game comes with two different rule sets that can be played with the cards in the box.

For the game Cartoon-Strip Bird At the start of the game the 20 cards are shuffled and 5 are dealed out to each player. The dealer now draws a card from his left hand neighbor and tries to complete a set of any letter from A to E.
The next player then then draws for the neighbor on his left and so on.
The first player to lay down a complete set of 4 cards wins the game.

The second game that can be played is North American Song Birds. The two different sets of cards are shuffled in to separate piles. Then the bird picture cards are spread out on the table.
The dealer is given the verse cards deck and starts the game by reading a verse from the top card of the verse deck.
As soon as one of the player recognizes on of the birds that is described by the bird he quickly places his hand on that bird card.
Play then continues to the nex player who becomes dealer and so on.
When the verse deck is empty the player who made the most correct guesses wins the game.

name: Game of Doctor Quack
description: Storytelling game where one person reads out a text and the next player try to complete it by choosing words from cards they have in their hand.

name: Little Klinker in Santaland
description:
Little Klinker in Santaland is a simple roll & move board game for children published in 1960 by the Transogram Company in New York in 1960.
Each player moves his dog along a track via a spinner (so no dice rolling) on spots on the board, depending on the color of the spot where the dog lands different things happen.
The player who's dog reaches the final spot first wins the game.

name: RTS: Le Jeu
description: "RTS Le Jeu" is a quiz game about the Swiss radio and television in French language.

name: Scavenger Hunt
description:
The game comes with 45 cards, 40 have numbers from 1 to 40 on them, all the cards have illustrations.

Each player gets 8 cards dealed out at the start of the game, each player also gets a list card. On their turn they draw a card, if they have a card on their hand that's on their list card then they put it down. Then a player must make an offer to trade three cards with other players.

The goal of the game is to get the 8 cards on their list card in front of them on the table, the player who manages this first wins the game

name: Wyhoo
description:
The object of this game is to build a pile of ten cards, with the Wyhoo cards acting as wild cards.
The game contains 110 cards.

The first player to complete his pile wins the game.

name: Game of Mother Nature
description: The object of the game is to be the player who makes the maximum number of sets of natural processes, such as a set that details the life of a caterpillar as it becomes a monarch butterfly.

name: Birds of the World
description:
The game consists of 48 cards divided in twelve books (sets) of four cards.
Players try to complete sets (each set is called a 'book' in the rules) of cards during the game.
Play continues until all cards are drawn from the stak, the player with the most books (sets) wins.

name: No Sweets for Santa
description: No Sweets for Santa is a family game that can be played on three different levels for increasing difficulty. At level one, it is similar to the game memory. At level two, cards are taken into your hand and played similarly to Go Fish. At level three, card powers are used to add a special twist to the game.
mechanics: Hand Management, Memory, Pattern Recognition, Set Collection

name: Hvem vælter Villy?
description: You construct a wall, where Villy sits on top. Each player then removes a brick from the wall. The player who gets Villy to fall down from the wall loses.

name: Oduludo
description:
Alien Space Kings rival about world domination. This is a a Science Fiction take on the family game Trouble. You are the leader of an alien group racing to get an alliance with Earth. You can win the game by being the first person to get your pawns throgh the game or by killing the other Kings.

Players takes turn rolling a 6 sided die. First you need to bring your pawns into play, and next you need to make them take a turn around the board to the finishline.

The first person to get all four pawns through the board wins the game.

Through the game you can get your pawns stronger and you can fight enemy pawns.

name: Exquisite linguaex
description:
Objective of the game

This is a game to practice languages while a story is created among the players.

Vocabulary Cards

There are vocabulary cards of different colours with words in one foreign language. The cards are classified as pronouns, nouns, adjectives, infinitive verbs, adverbs, and prepositions + conjunctions (in the same group). In each cards there are 6 words numbered from 1 to 6. (There are two possibilities: a game of 900 words (150 vocabulary cards) and a game of 1500 (250 vocabulary cards) words)
There are also TWO dice with six faces
Each player must take one card from each group. Then he rolls the dice for to determinate the number of cards that he can substitute by the word he chose. Then for the others cards, he rolls again the dice and take the word that correspond at number given by the dice.
There is the possibility of using both dices for two determinate the verbal tense used in the sentence. From 1 to 12, each number correspond at one of the most used verbal tens.
Using all these words the player must make one or several sentences in a foreign language, say it out loud and write it in a notebook. You can also leave the sentences sketchy so that the next player finishes them in turn. The cards that have not been used remain for the next turn. The cards used return to the deck.
You can use the words that are already written in the the notebook
If a player has made mistakes, it can be corrected by another player. As a penalty, he will receive from the player that corrected him, one vocabulary card for each mistakes made.
If a player does not understand some words he has picked up or a phrase constructed by another player, he should ask. The answer will be given with gestures or an explanation in the foreign language. The one giving the explanation will give to the other player two vocabulary cards.
Vocabulary cards can be exchanged between players. The player says "exchange" and the cards are placed face up on the table.
Ways to discard vocabulary cards
If an error is made by a player, he receive one card for each mistake.
If an explanation is given, two cards are given
If you sing a song or recite a poem of at least four verses without making a mistake, the player can discard three vocabulary cards. For every mistake, a card is retained.
If the player tells a story, gives a lesson, or a talk, he gets rid of a number of cards equivalent to the minutes that the oral presentation lasted. The other players give him a score between 1 to 10. The player is allowed to discard the score multiplied by the number of minutes spoken divided by ten.
When a player has discarded all his vocabulary cards he moves to the second level.
Text cards
In the second level you play with the text cards. There are 45. In the cards there are indications of the type:

introduce a fantastic character
introduce a key discovery
enter an internal dialogue
a leap in time
describe a house
describe a city


*Introduce a metaphor

Introduce a comparison


*Introduce a hyperbole ...
There is also a letter that says:" the manuscript has been lost, you must rewrite the story ". And another that says: "write the ending". When this card comes out, the story is finish and the game is over.
There are 9 wildcards to write paragraphs of text freely.
If the player make mistakes, he will retake vocabulary cards, one for each mistake, and he will return to the first level where the sentences are constructed.
Who wins
The player that has used all the cards or has less than the others.
There must be among the players a native speaker or teacher of the language, in order to correct the mistakes.
You can consult books of grammar and conjugation
You can choose a winner in creativity
The one who wins has to read the story.

Of course you can practice your own language and use the game just to make up stories
The game is appropriate for player ages 8 to 90.
You can make two different games; one with the vocabulary cards and the other with the text cards. If you play only with the vocabulary cards, then the winner will be the one who gets rid of the cards first. If you play with the text cards, the winner is the one who makes the least mistakes. For each mistake five points are subtracted and 20 are added if there are no mistakes.

name: Bushido: Yama Uba
description:
The Yama Uba is demon from an age long forgotten, the centre of many a cautionary tale, a true horror and thing of nightmare. This shape shifting fiend is a terrifying foe, able to steal the abilities and form of any it touches, many a victim had no idea of their fate until the clicking and slicing sounds, of barbed claws piercing their soft flesh, reached their ears. Even when its true form is revealed the yokai of deceit and deception can vanish at will, a ghost in the dark, before emerging moments later to strike with deadly precision and speed.

Blister contains one model, one 30mm base and one full colour profile card.
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Bushido: Kami of Choking Fog and Blighted Earth
description:
For all the benevolent and benign Kami that fill the Jwar Isles, there are some that have become twisted, just as the Temple of Rokan has enlisted the Kami in the aid of the people and protection of the lands. These dark, corrupted mockeries are a curse against all that is natural and sacred. Their mere presence taints and blights the area around them. The motives unknown, their actions seem bent on destruction and death.

Blister contains two models, two 30mm bases and two full colour profile cards.
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Bushido: Kairai
description:
The secret and powerful art of soul trapping was thought lost for generations until Kato was judged worthy to know its dark secret. Yurei’s cruel mockery of the living, their anguished masks taunt the living for his amusement their fear adding fuel to his dark fire. They are puppets to their dark masters will.

This blister contains the parts to create the “B” Kairai model for the Kairai Villager, Kusatta Kairai, Kairai Farmer or Kairai Militia profiles.

Blister contains two models and two 30mm bases.
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Bushido: Plague Rats
description:
Man is not the only mortal open to the corruption and seduction of Yurei’s promises. Those that lie in the filth and dirt are easily swayed to its charms. The Plague Rats are a perfect tool in the unfathomable plan of shapeless evil, spreading disease and death through the population like wild fire, lurking in the shadows ready to pounce on the weak or vulnerable.

Blister contains three models, three 30mm bases and one full colour profile card.
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: 3rd Edict
description:
Two worlds collide as the magically rich Taethys collides with the technology driven Valkja. Utilize state of the art technology and powerful spells to establish dominance over all who oppose you. 3rd Edict is designed for 3-6 players and takes around 30-60 minutes per game. Players draw from a central deck and use unique abilities to shape their play style.

Throw a fireball to Scorch your enemies or Redirect and turn their attacks back on them. Take what you desire with Pickpocket. Barrier protects a player from all sources, including themselves. Equipment like Drone Guardian forces your opponents to deal with it before they can attack you. The Bag of Many Things means you will have more options than everyone else.

With eight game types, players will find a battle that works for them. In First Blood the first player to get a kill wins the game, just make sure you don't overextend. Recruitment has you destroy each other but instead of being eliminated that player joins your team instead. Secret Win Conditions is just that. Each player draws a mission at random and whoever completes it first wins.
mechanics: Player Elimination, Take That, Variable Player Powers

name: Jack and Jill
description:
'Jack and Jill' was published in 1890 by the Milton Bradley Company of Springfield, Massachusetts.

Based on the theme on the nursery rhyme, the object of this card game is to earn 100 points by helping Jack and Jill up the hill without tumbling down. The 21 card deck is complete and includes:

4 Jack and Jill cards numbered 1 to 4;
1 image of Jack and Jill tumbling down the hill;
1 pail card;
14 number cards from 1 to nine points;
An instruction card.

name: Which, What or Where? A Geography Game
description:
The Which, What or Where? game is a geography trivia game, where a player chooses one of the 36 large geography cards and her/his opponent finds the matching reverse-side card with questions for the geography card selected. Whoever answers the most correct questions about her/his card wins the round. A game constitutes each player selecting four different geography cards.

The game comes with three maps, one of Canada, one of the Pacific sea depicting Australia & the Americas and one of the Canadian states.

name: Larry Harmon's Bozo
description:
Published in 1972 by Edu-Cards and copyrighted by Larry Harmon Pictures Corporation, Bozo Educational Card Game strives to 'develop a child’s memory and ability to concentrate.
The picture matching is also a basic skill in learning to read.' The game includes 34 cards that illustrate the clown Bozo in different situations and are divided into a variety of point values.

name: Tableaux Célèbres
description:
Tableaux Célèbres is an educational game published by the French game manufacturer Fernand Nathan that introduces students to the grand masterpieces of the art world.

Tableaux Célèbres includes six colorful game boards (each displaying ten art masterpieces), a deck of 60 Painter cards, a deck of 60 Artwork Description cards, 60 circular Detail discs, and an instruction booklet. Depending on the number of players, each person plays the game with a minimum of one game board. After the two decks of cards are shuffled, each player is dealt 5 Painter and 5 Artwork Description cards and also selects 5 Detail discs that have been shuffled face down on the table.

Players then take turns playing as many cards and/or discs as possible. Any remaining cards are shuffled back into their respective decks and the discs are mixed face down with the others on the table. The goal is to match one circular Detail disc, one Painter card, and one Artwork Description card for each masterpiece on a player’s game board(s). The first player to do so is the winner.

name: The Rotfather: Intrigas – Takeda Expansion
description:
Translated from the rules: "The network of intrigues in Faux City is further complicated by the entry of Takeda, one of the Yakuza members! Master in influencing people, Takeda is able to make anyone change sides."

This Mini-Expansion for The Rotfather: Intrigas adds a seventh character to the game. Takeda's abilities increase the "take that" factor of the game, since its individual action serves more to disrupt the strategy of other players than to a direct advantage of the player who uses it. In addition, the increased number of cards allows for seven-player matches without major problems.

name: Fun and Fishes Aquarium Game
description:
At the start of the game each player selects a set of six tokens, e.g. fish or crab tokens, and one colored peg.
Players spin the pointer in turn and a six is required before a player can move.
Having scored a six, the player pegs his token in to the lowest hole of any of the four tracks and moves it up the track according to the numbers scored in turn. Each time a player scores a six he gets an extra turn.

When the end of the track is approached the exact number must be scored to put the token into the corresponding aquarium.

The first player to get all his tokens in the aquarium wins the game.

name: Keep Off The Grass
description:
A design is placed on the table with the mirror standing behind it so that the player can see the reflection of the design in it.
The player must not look at the design directly, but only at the reflection of it, and then by placing the point of the pencil he endeavors to follow the track, without staggering on to the grass.

The player who can complete the most tracks wins the game.

name: Railway Race
description:
Train racing game set in the golden age of steam.

Each player has a train which must keep keep to the same line throughout. Every player also has ten game pieces representing passengers.

To win the game reach the end of the journey. Players still score bonus points for passengers, the highes score wins.

name: Reilu Peli
description:
From the box:
Reilu Peli is an game that will take you whit it. To win the game the whole team needs to aim for the same goal.

The game is about ethics of sports and they are discussed trough real life situations.

The most important thing in the game is discussion and solving the cases.

Points are given on the bases of how well the co-operation of the players went and how well did they solve the case. Everyones effort is important.

Solving challenging cases helps to form the ethics and rules for your own team or activity group.

The game ends, afther a winner is found, to a collective end exercise, where common rules are made.

On the first turn players move on the board by rolling a die. Then they have to pick a card from a same collored deck that the squeare they landed on. Players taskut is to inventointi a solution to a problem on the card. Then everyone else Will decide If they agree or not. The player Will score points for every agreenment, and move forvard for every point. The first player to go araund the board IS the Winner.

name: SimplyClever.Cards Counting
description:
SimplyClever.Cards Counting combines traditional playing cards with math flash cards. The deck has 52 cards in 4 colours numbered 0-12, and 4 jokers.

Each card is illustrated with a number of symbols (dice, pencils, owls and faces of girls and boys) corresponding to the card value from 0 to 12.

One joker has a table showing which 4 cards match up for each value, in order to check the math when necessary. The remaining 3 jokers have mathematical operators +, - and = so you can make your own calculations using the cards.

Designed to function like a regular deck of cards with traditional pips showing suits and ranks, SimplyClever.Cards Counting allows you to play any regular card game you want to - but with a mathematical twist! Game examples: 500, Casino, Crazy Eights, Go Fish, Hearts, Memory, Old Maid, Slap Jack, Snap, UNO etc.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Educational, Game System, Math, Number
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Hand Management, Memory, Set Collection, Trick-taking

name: SimplyClever.Ninja
description:
SimplyClever.Ninja is a card game that expands the classic game of rock, paper and scissors to several characters like Ninja, Cowboy, Alien, Zombie, Robot etc. where each of them beats some of the others and is beaten by some of the others.

Different modes of gameplay allow for versatility and high repeatability:

PvP trick-taking: The player with the best card takes the trick, and the player with the most tricks when all cards are played wins the game.

PvP set collection: Build your army and win by collecting a set of the same warriors, or one of each warrior.

Co-op: All players compete against a common enemy (game AI).

Single: Campaign mode against the game AI.
mechanics: Hand Management, Rock-Paper-Scissors, Take That, Trick-taking

name: Dino 300
description:
The object of this game is to form as many sets of dinosaurs as possible in order to obtain 300 points. There are 13 different animals to build. The numbers on the cards indicate the quantity of cards needed to complete that particular animal. Sets consist of 3, 4, or 5 cards depending on the size of the dinosaur.

Contents:
4 TAR PIT cards
6 THREE card sets
4 Four card sets
3 FIVE card sets
1 Instruction card

name: Bushido: Taisho Tenbatsu
description:
Kurouma Tenbatsu is a broken and twisted man. The Kurouma line was cut over a century ago, only a small and insignificant clan during their short existence and Tenbatsu is all that remains of the clan formerly based in Eastern Jwar. The last son of the samurai clan is hardly even human although what he is, is up for debate. Some say that the colossus of a man is a twisted soul, torn between this world and Jikoku for his sins, some that the man is dead and that the cursed swords he is forever bound to carry constantly fight for control of him, others that he has sold his soul for eternal life and is simply a man too far down his dark path to ever come back. What is known is that he is welcomed and feared equally by his allies for he is inhumanely strong and savage, this damned warrior striking fear into the hearts of all those who dare to stand against his murderous rampage.

Blister contains one model, one 30mm base and two full colour profile cards.
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Bushido: Kami of Sapping Silt
description:
The Kami of Sapping Silt is one of waters and muds. Methodical and measured, reaching out to drain those around it, limbs become exhausted, bodies weary, one of the more malevolent spirits, drawn to the more destructive and chaotic forces in which they can achieve some unknown gratification.

Blister contains one model, one 30mm base and three full colour profile cards.
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Labyrinth, Howls in the Dark
description:
The young boys and girls from Athens are thrown into the Labyrinth, where a horde of Minotaurs dwells, much like the legend of Theseus.
The players are divided into two teams, the Athenians and the Minoans. The Athenians are trying to help the young boys and girls from Athens to escape, while the Minoans are helping the Minotaurs keep the young ones inside the labyrinth and wipe them out.
Every round a player from each team is nominated as team-leader and he makes a plan with 5 actions using the cards in his hand, along with those his team-mates gave him. The players draw cards from a common deck. The cards can help or hurt both teams depending on the correct timing of the actions. Revealing and executing the actions alternately comes next. Good planning, clever use of both the actions and the Heroes’ abilities will determine the winner.

Suspense is the main feeling of the game since every step towards victory depends on the players abilities to plan, predict and deceit.
mechanics: Action Queue, Modular Board, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Question Quiz
description:
A question master is appointed, he controls the game.
The outfit comprises a double spinner on to which is fitted one of the six discs provided.
The Discs are printed with the subject to which they refer to and the players decide which discs are used.
The question master then spins the question disc calling out the place where it stops. This determines which questions shall be asked.
Winner is the player who at the end of the game correctly answered the most questions.
It is possible to play the game in teams.

name: Crowning the Elf King
description:
Dexterity game produced in the 1920's by Chad Valley, goal is to score as many rings as possible around the Elf King figure.
Ten points are scored for each ring.
The player who first reaches 100 points wins the game.

name: Wonko
description:
WONKO is a dice game that includes a deck of custom cards and 40 D6 dice.

From the back of the card box:

"Short on time or attention?
No problem! Each mini-game takes only about 30 seconds.

Object of the Game:
Everyone rolls their dice in a race to be the first to meet the challenge on the game card (i.e. all the same number).

How to Win:
You choose the goal. Whoever wins the most in 5 minutes, first to win 5 mini-games, etc.

Competitive play for all ages!
With 9 levels designed for players aged 5 to 105, everyone plays at their own level.

Just toss it in your bag:
Play in restaurants, carpool, waiting rooms, camping, home, etc."

name: Space Race
description:
Sci Fi roll and move game from the 1950's?. Players move their pawns on the track via dice rolls, a six allows them another turn. Certain spots on the board give special actions or events; there are spots for food supplies, gravitational pull, pressure cab leakage, an attack by martians, atmospheric shock wave, meteorite damage, magnetic field, navigational error and rocket flame out.
The first person to reach the destination wins the game.

name: Face Off
description:
The machine was complete. As the complex was powered on the arena sprang to life and the AM summoned the first combatants. Pirates, Monsters, Ninja, Cowboys and many others groups began to fill holding cells. The AM played a recording of the master, "Welcome to the Arena, prepare yourself to Face Off for glory, for freedom, for your very lives...mwuhahah."

Face Off is a deck management game of fast paced violence and long term strategy set in a future where one individual's insane experiment has led to a vast arena filled with the greatest warriors, and sometimes misfits, of the universe.

In Face Off each player leads a faction from throughout the multiverse in an attempt to collect treasures and conquer enemy headquarters to prove their might and gain their freedom.

Each time a Face Off is decided the victor can choose to take a treasure, upgrade their deck, or acquire a victory point, the currency of Face Off. Each time a Headquarters is cracked (destroyed) a high value treasure, global effect, or victory point is acquired. Once all Headquarters have cracked the game ends and the faction with the most victory points can buy their way to freedom!

Each faction in the game has a completely unique set of cards and mechanics to draw upon for victory. Play style and game focus will depend heavily on the faction chosen, but no faction is "best".

With a streamlined pool of 12 starting cards and a 5 card hand, fast turnover and card throughput is a staple of Face Off. A unique scoring system mitigates complete blowouts and maintains tension until the final battle, insuring that each Face Off and HQ is of utmost importance.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management

name: Tycoons
description:
In Tycoons, players will roll the dice in order to move to adjacent provinces of Canada, states of the USA or into Mexico. As they move into new areas, they will have to either draw a "Sale" card (which will give them money) or a Disaster card (which will make them lose money or some other detrimental effect. While the game is a simple roll-and-move with random effects that appear through drawing cards, the purpose of the game is educational. The publisher states that by playing the game multiple times, "each player will automatically learn every province, state and [about] Mexico and their capital cities."

The first player to reach a specific amount of money (set by the players before the game begins) will be the winner.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: The Battle of Kuortane
description:
A free print-and-play, regimental-level wargame covering the battles of Ruona and Salmi, 1808 (sometimes known collectively as the battle of Kuortane). These battles were the turning point of the Finnish War of 1808-1809 which would lead to Finland being annexed to Russia for over 100 years. Can you change history?

The Battle of Kuortane is a classical IGO-UGO wargame with an innovative system for melee attacks and defensive fire, to better capture the feeling of the chaotic bayonet charges of the Finnish War. The game features assymetric goals and reinforcement rules which create different playstyles for the Russian and the Swedish-Finnish armies: whereas the Russian player needs to advance carefully but with a determined pace, the Swedish player needs to wait for the perfect moment to pounce with maximum strength to claim victory.

The game is offered as a print-and-play of only two pages: one page for the rules, and one page to mount on cardboard and cut out. No advanced crafting required.

name: The Invisible Man
description:
The object of the game is to become invisible and escort a criminal to the police station.
The player who first succeeds in doing this wins the game.

There are four Invisible Men on the platform, each outlined in a differen colour. The players choose the one thy are going to represent and take a counter and five sections marked A, B, C, D and E to match the colour of their invisible man. Cover the invisible man with these sections.

Players start on the inner track from the letter 'A' corresponding to the colour of their counter.
After spinning, each player in turn either moves his counter round the board the number of spaces indicated by the arrow when it stops or he takes a card, he cannot do both.
On whatever letter a move ends, the player removes the section bearing that letter from his invisible man.
Should the move end on 'risk' the player must take a card and follow the instructions on it. In either case this ends his turn which passes to the player on his left. Should a move end on a letter from which the section has already been removed this also ends his turn.

The game is won by the first player who manages to remove all sections from his invisible man.

name: Coronation Street Trivia Game
description:
A True or False Coronation Street trivia board game
Includes over 760 True or False Coronation Street question
Question cards span over four decades of the popular television soap opera


Game description from the back of the box:

Take a trip around the cobbles with this fun True or False Trivia Board Game and test your knowledge of all things Coronation Street and includes over 750 True or False questions spanning four decades. Use voting chips and cobbling chips to earn extra points to help you around the board and be the first to reach The famous Rovers Return.

Start the game by deciding if you will play as individuals or in teams and then choose a character mover and place them on the Start space. Each player or team is then given a True or False voting chip and three cobble chips.
Taking it in turn to be the Question Reader, they must pick up a card from the deck in the centre of the board and read out the question. Opponents then need to decide whether the trivia question is true or false and lay their voting chip up the correct way to answer the question. Once all voting chips have been paid down, cobbling can begin.
Cobbling gives players the chance to pick up bonus points to help them move further around the board based on an opponent's true or false answer to the question. If the opponent's answer that you 'bet' your cobble chip on is correct then you get to keep your cobble chip and gain an extra point. But if their answer to the question was wrong and you chose to cobble, then you lose that chip.
Once players complete a full lap of the board and move past the Start space on the board, they can collect a 30 points token. If you pass Start twice, then flip the token over to reveal 60 points.
After the last True or False card is played and all players have moved their character mover the amount of spaces they've earned, the player with the highest score (most 30/60 token points plus the score on the board) is the winner.

name: Luku Luku: Noun
description:
Luku Luku is a fast thrilling educative game for two players.

SETTING THE GAME

Players spread the Number Sheet wide open and place their playing tokens at the No 1 point on the spread sheet.

They then place the Luku Luku PAD on the sides of the Number Sheet.

HOW TO PLAY:
Players decide on who should begin the game. Active player (player whose turn it is) asks the other player to find something on the Luku Luku Pad. When the other player begins to search for the item, figure, name etc on one of the pads, the Active player begins to move their token on the number sheet and tries to move to the FINISH LINE.

When other player finishes the task, they immediately shouts, STOP! And they becomethe ACTIVE PLAYER

HOW TO WIN?

The first player to reach the FINISH LINE WINS.

Luku Luku is designed to help improve the quality of education in Nigeria and hopefully other part of Africa and the world soo.

name: Nightbreed Skirmish
description:
A 2-player tactical skirmish game with a Nightbreed Theme. Humans (Naturals) are attacking Midian (a Necropolis, the home of the Nightbreed) in force. One player is the Nightbreed. The other player is the Humans (Naturals).

An 8 x 8 grid is used to depict the surface and upper layers of Midian. Underground is a series of tunnels, chambers, and caverns. The surface resembles a graveyard but with additional statues, fountains, walls, and tomb like structures that are actually dwellings and gates to the subterranean areas.

Terrain types are marked on the map according to players’ preference. Some terrain types will be referenced by cards but terrain types comprise: Clear (Paths, Roads), Graves, Fountain, Wall (and Gates), Trees, Tomb and Statue.

Each player has a unique “army” list comprising 16 units of differing strengths (hit points), with differing characteristics.
Each player has a unique deck of cards of four different types (Attack, Defence, Move, Special)

To set up the decks are shuffled separately and units are placed in the back three rows of the player’s side of the board.

Naturals go first with players taking turns. Each turn has 3 Phases:
1. Draw Phase
- Draw 3 cards and place them in your hand.
2. Action Phase
- Play cards (no limit).
- Play a Move card to move a unit the indicated (range) number of spaces.
- Use an Attack card to attack a unit at the indicated distance (range) from the attacking unit.
- Your opponent may use a Defence card to negate an Attack card.
- An attack card that is not negated causes the target to lose 1 Hit. Use tokens to keep track of Damage (lost hits) sustained by units. Any Unit reduced to zero Hits is killed.
3. End Phase
Max hand size is 7 cards. Discard excess cards.

The first side to lose 10 or more units will break and flee.

name: Nutcracker Skirmish
description:
A 2-player skirmish game with a Nutcracker Theme. One player is the Nutcracker and the toy soldiers, the other player is the Mice.

An 8x8 Grid is used as a board. The “battlefield” is the living room floor at Christmas time. There are two terrain types – clear or obstacles (boxes, christmas tree, furniture). Obstacles block all movement and attacks. Terrain is laid down at the players’ discretion.

Players share a common deck of cards. Card are of four types: Attack (A), Defence (D), Movement (M), Special (S)

Each side gets a unique set of 16 units that can be moved around on the board. Units have different movement allowances and strengths (hit points). One unit on each side is designated the Leader. Units cannot stack but friendly units may move through each other.

To set up each player places his units in any of his 3 last rows.

Players take turns.
Each turn has 3 Phases.
1. Presents Phase
- Draw 3 cards from the deck and place them in your hand.
2. Action Phase
- Play cards from your hand.
- Use Move cards to move one of your units up to the indicated number of spaces. Your opponent may use certain special cards to negate a Move.
- Use Attack cards to have a unit attack a target unit at the exact range indicated by the card and do 1 point of damage to the target (when hits are reduced to 0 the unit is destroyed). Your opponent may use Defence cards to reduce hits caused by an Attack.
3. End Phase
Max hand size is 7 cards. Discard excess cards.

The game is won when a player destroys his opponent’s leader (Nutcracker or Mouse King). The last (killing) hit on a leader unit may only be made by the opposing leader unit.

name: Sumrun
description: Horse racing game that comes with 5 metal horses in different colors. It uses roll & move mechanics, he who crosses the line first wins the game.

name: Smelly Seth
description:
Description from the designer:

What is Smelly Seth?
Smelly Seth is a fast paced and easy to learn card game. Your goal is to get the other players to “+11 Smell” and knock them out of the game. It’s great for warming up gaming night or at your local watering hole.

How many friends can I play with and how long is an average game?
You can play with 2-4 people, but 3-4 is best. An average game lasts between 15-20 minutes.

How do I play?
Every player starts with 3 cards. Each turn you will draw a card and then play a card. There are 3 types of cards: smell, clean and action. Smell cards can only be played on your opponents and clean cards on yourself. Action cards provide a fun turn of events in your favor!

name: SPARKUP
description:
Sparkup is a card game for 1-10 players that turns everyday people into entrepreneurs. Get inspired with new ideas. Pitch your invention. Vote for your favorite. From outrageous to ingenious, ignite the future.

Sparkup can be played as a party game for many people or as more of a brain game for 1-2 players. The game not only entertains but also can inspire those who play to come up with great ideas. It's game that goes beyond the game itself.

In just 20-30 minutes, players get the chance to become inventors and entrepreneurs as they are guided through an idea generation phase where they come up with a new idea. The entire game plays in 5 phases through a series of "minute to win it" challenges. This keeps everyone engaged and creating at the same time. When the time's up, each team takes turns pitching their ideas to the group. We're always amazed at what incredible things people can come up with given a little spark and a time limit. Next, each team secretly votes for the idea they like best. In the end, votes are revealed and one team is declared winner.

-- dscription from the designer:

name: Köpcentrum
description:
A simple roll and move game about owning stores and selling goods with no real decisions.

Flavor-text from the rules (translated from Swedish):
"Everybody is already familiar with the concept of "A Mall" where several different kind of stores are located. But how would it feel to own one of these stores? This game is meant to give a taste of that experience."

Published in the 1960's.

name: Muchik Spondylus Princeps
description:
Based on Mochica culture history.
The board shows a long path on which each player's pawn will move. The places on the path may contain a special card, that the player will draw.
The pawns move along the path and may fight each other when they end up on the same square. The winner of the fight may steal a card at the other.
The cards can be used to create shortcuts on the board for one self. Or to prevent others to go to the end of the path. They work in the same way as snakes & ladders work in the game of the same name.
Some special cards allow removing opponent cards from the board.

name: Piratinies
description:
THE GAME

PIRATINIES is a quick and light game that plays in 15-25 minutes for 2 to 5 players. In PIRATINIES, the players take the role of captains of a pirate crew with the goal of looting different locations and obtaining fame and wealth. The first player to reach the required victory points will be the winner of the game.

HOW TO PLAY

Each round is divided into two phases: Looting and Recruiting

Each player start with a crew of 4 starting pirates who allow the player to roll 4 red dice

In the Looting Phase, each player (in order) roll their dice and all players, at the same time, try to match the numbers in one of the four location cards (the skills of their crew can modify the dice)

The first player to do so must grab the Map and claim a location. If successful, the player get the victory points and coins indicated in the location card

When all players have played a turn, the Recruiting Phase begins. Each player, in order, can recruit a new pirate paying its cost and replace it with one of their current crew

New pirates have special skills and some give a blue or a purple dice. When a player roll, for example, 3 red and 1 blue dice, another player whose crew have 4 red dice can only use the red dice of the active player's roll, not the blue one

The Looting and Recruiting phases alternate until a player reach the required victory points to win the game

COMPONENTS

60 pirate cards
40 location cards
9 dice
1 board
1 Map
20 coins
5 numbered tokens
5 player tokens
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Dice, Pirates
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Pattern Recognition, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: The Game of the Sociable Snake
description:
Simple role and move game with a beautiful board, player follow a track in the form of a snake, depending on where they land certain events happen.
The player who reaches the end of the track first wins the game.

name: Time Machine Death Race
description:
Description from the publisher:

Strap yourselves in for the future of racing... Time machine racing! Participants race as fast as they can to reach specific checkpoints in time throughout a day and then race back to the moment they left. The racer with the least amount of time missing on his internal clock wins! Beware of other racers on the time track as they can short you out and make you miss your connection! Pick up tricks, weapons, and boosters when successfully hitting your time checkpoints in your silly little time machine! This is a very easy game with lots of fun stuff going on. Totally safe for kids over 4 who don't put random stuff in their mouths.
1-5 Players pick unusual time machines each with their own weapons or abilities and then race around 6 clocks using a 13 spaced spinner and 2 dice. Players pick up boosters as they lock in checkpoints in time and try not to be lost in the fabric of time and space by shorting out. Depending on the number of players short out limits can be 3-6. If a player completely shorts out all acquired checkpoints and cards are lost and the player must pick a new time machine card to start over.

Booster cards are acquired by locking in a checkpoint each player has the chance to collect a total of 5 of these in a game and they can give the user special weapons, advancements, or tricks. After all players have locked in a checkpoint time wraith tokens are placed on the five outer clocks. These devil drivers are trying to catch you. Some are good and some are bad. The spinner is used any time the game starts to find your spot on the central clock or anytime someone either shorts out or locks in a clock and must return to the central clock to continue. There are 6 black holes on the board. One on the 13 in the central clock and 5 on the bands that lead out to the outer clocks. These short you out as well as if any player lands on you. after the spinner is used players roll 2 dice to advance Players must travel up the next band to the next clock that they do not already have acquired. If a player rolls doubles They go again but after 3 sets of doubles the player shorts out.
To win players must lock in all checkpoints on the outer clocks by landing on the set time indicated on the clocks and then return to the center clock and lock it in as well.
This game comes with colored stones to place as markers when clocks are locked in, custom cast pewter game pawns, wraith tokens, and spinner device set in laser cut 1/8th-inch birch, an Eco canvas 18-inch game board and, a few extra black holes for the black hole generators.
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Shanleya's Quest: Patterns in Plants card game
description:
Test your skills at identifying the eight plant family patterns described in the book, Shanleya's Quest (the book is not necessary for playing this card game). Match each photo card of an individual plant to the correct plant family.

Included cards:
1 guide to playing the memory matching game
1 plant patterns answer key (shows which picture cards belong in each of the 8 families)
2 overarching category cards describing monocot vs. dicot plants
8 cards describing characteristics of each of the plant families: mints, parsleys, mustards, peas, lilies, grasses, roses, and asters
42 color photograph cards of individual plants that fall into these various families

name: ヨコドリJewel (YOKODORI Jewel)
description:
User summary
ヨコドリJewel (YOKODORI Jewel)

You are a jewel thief, but you prefer to call yourself a jewel collector.

You will choose which card you would like to take among the Jewel Cards dealt on the table. (With four players, you will choose among number one to four. A player will indicate this number using their hand cards).

If you don’t get in the way of another player’s path, you will get those Jewel Cards. If you play the same card you won’t be able to get them. In this case, however, if this player has previously taken a lot of Jewel Cards, you will be able to steal cards from their loot. You will continue to take Jewel Cards in this fashion, and the player who gets the highest score at the end of the game will become the winner!

Publisher's summary
あなたは、自称宝石コレクターの宝石泥棒です。
あなたはテーブルに並べられた「宝石カード」の中から欲しいカードを選択します。（４人プレイの時は１番～４番まで番号が振られています。プレイヤーはその番号を手札を使って指定します。）
他のプレイヤーとバッティングしなければ、その「宝石カード」をゲットでき、バッティングした場合はゲットできません。
しかし、バッティングした場合、バッティングした相手が獲得している「宝石カード」が多い時、相手の持っている「宝石カード」を奪うことができます。そうやって宝石カードを取っていき最終的に点数の高いプレイヤーが勝利します！！

name: Savannah
description:
Savannah is a highly tactical drafting game about scarce resources.

Introduction
The African summer sun is burning down, heat shimmers over the wide land. Food becomes scarce and the fight for survival begins. Herds and prides of numerous Savannah residents get a move on the draining water holes, trying to get an edge on the last food resources with cunning and trickery.

Aim of the Game
Players are trying to maintain the balance between animals and resources in the Savannah. The resource that a player collected the least of is crucial for end game scoring (a player's score is equal to her worst-scoring resource, not her best). The player whose least collected resource exceeds the least collected resources of the other players wins.

Course of the Game
One game consists of a set number of rounds.
One round consist of the following four phases:

(1) Dawn – choosing Animal cards (drafting)
(2) Noon – placing Animal tokens (add to play area)
(3) Sunset – resolving the course of the day (scoring)
(4) Night – preparing the next round (clear play area)

Game End
The game ends after a certain number of rounds, depending on the player count. 4 rounds in a 2–3 player game and 3 rounds in a 4–5 player game.

Each player counts separately each of the food resources and determines the lowest result of these. Compare this result with the result of the other players. Winner of the game is the player with the highest number for this comparison.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Modular Board, Open Drafting

name: Liquid Courage: On The Offensive
description:
Liquid Courage is a (drinking) card game with pickup lines. Players take turns trying to eliminate other players by having a better pickup line than their opponent. Players can also play action cards to make everyone play at the same time but you have to be careful because you may end up taking a shot yourself! After 4 shots you're out.


108 Cards Total
74 Unique Pickup Lines
20 Action Cards
categories: Card Game, Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game

name: TradeWorlds: Tactical Core
description:
Description from the publisher:

A breakthrough in the Deck-Building genre, the Tactical Core features 60 miniatures (5 unique) and a foldable 18" x 18" tactical board used in conjunction with the Exterra Edition core.

This Tactical Core allows players to travel around the galaxy and attempt to "re-conquer" Terra Prime (the planet of origin for all the Mega-Corporations). This game Expansion uses a "King of the Hill" mechanic which allows players to control Terra Prime for a certain amount of turns in order to obtain a victory! As such your opponents must race to Terra Prime in order to try to stop you from winning the game.

In addition, players can benefit from the use of all the other Expansions that add onto the game an extra layer for Tactical play. There are a couple notes regarding how certain Expansions may alter Tactical game play (in minor ways)... which will be explained further detail in the rulebook used by this Expansion.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Space Exploration

name: Aliens vs Cows
description:
A print and play game of unexplained bovine abduction for two players by Jonathan Leistiko. One player represents the Alien Leader whilst the other is the Top Cow.

The goal of the Alien Leader is to abduct enough cows of sufficient quality to complete the experiments necessary to ensure success in the upcoming invasion before the space-time fold device runs out of power and transports them back to Dimension Aleph-Zootie. The goal of the Top Cow is to prevent as many cow abductions as possible.

To start 20 cows from the cow deck are laid out face down in front of the Top Cow and a cow marker placed on top of them. The 20 cow pawns (each matched to one of the cow markers) are placed on 20 of the 160 spaces on the playing board – which represents a pasture. The Alien Leader’s flying saucer token and 3 x alien pawns are placed, together, on any other vacant space.

At the start of each round, the alien and the cow player each roll two dice. There are four phases in each round - Cow Cards, Alien Research, Alien Activity, and Cow Movement. The Alien Leader gets to allocate one of the dice he rolled to one of those four phases, then the Top Cow gets to allocate the dice he rolled to two phases that have no dice. By default, the Alien Leader’s last die gets assigned to the last phase without a die.

Cow Cards Phase:
If you’re the Top Cow: Draw cards from the Cow Deck equal to the number on the die assigned to the Cow Cards Phase. Look at the cards you drew. Put each card face-down under a cow marker in front of you. No cow may have two cards more than the cow with the least cards on the field.

Alien Research:
If you’re the Alien Leader you get research points equal to the number on the Alien Research die. You may spend a research point to look at the letter on the bottom of any cow in the field or look at one face-down cow card that’s attached to a cow. You may spend any number of points to look at that many cards on the top of the Cow Cards deck and put them back on top of the deck in any order.

Alien Activity Phase
If You’re the Alien Leader the number on the Alien Activity die indicates how many aliens you can command this round and how many actions your alien(s) can take. When an alien acts, it can take the following actions: Move, Recover, Abduct, Fly Saucer, Repair Saucer. The main aim of this phase is for the Alien Leader to manoeuvre pieces around the board with the intent of abducting cows.

Cow Movement:
If you’re the Top Cow you get movement points equal to the number on the Cow Movement die. You can spend a movement point to move a cow one space. Cows may not move into occupied spaces.

Once the last cow card is drawn, the Cow Cards phase no longer occurs and cannot have dice assigned to it at the start of a round. The Alien Leader does not get to assign his second die at the start of each round.

If there are no cow cards at the start of a turn and you’re the Top Cow, roll a die. If it’s odd, the game continues. If it’s even, the game ends.

At the end of the game, tally the victory points of the cows in the flying saucer. The Alien wins if he has 45 or more Victory Points.

name: Nexus: Scrapyard
description:
In Nexus: Scrapyard, you and up to three friends take turns as entrepreneurs looking for affordable CivShips to purchase from Syd's Scrapyard. Each turn you take actions to customize the available CivShips and hire a crew to ensure you can buy the best CivShips in the scrapyard, or sabotage your friends.

Experience the first chapter in a series of connecting games detailing the rise and fall of a galactic tyrant! In this "Chronicle" game, winners, losers, and events will impact the rules and mechanisms of the following chapters. Create and enjoy a new story every time you play the Nexus Series!
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Memory, Science Fiction

name: Tapete Mágico
description:
A new game for the kids!: the Flying Rug! It flies by the help of a magnet and looks like is really flying. How many treasures it can bear without falling down?

Pick up a treasure from the bag to put on the carpet, making it heavier and heavier! Who makes the rug falling down first loses the game.

...............
Put the treasures over the rug very carefully avoinding it to fall down.

name: Tarzan and His Animals
description:
There are two ways in which the game can be played.
One is for two players, in which one player is Tarzan in charge of the animals, and the other player is the Hunter operating the cage and attempting to capture the animals.
The object of the game is for Tarzan to direct the animals to the safety of the game reserve without letting the Hunter capture the animals.
The other way in which the game may be played is for two to five players. Tarzan and his helpers share out an equal amount of animals each. In this game one player plays the Hunter so this is a one versus many game.
The animals are moved according to the result of dice throws. A player may move only one animal per turn. Each player must move one animal the number he throwed.

name: Full Metal Alchemist Adventures
description:
A card game for 2-4 players.

Players share a common deck comprising 7 Suites: Brothers, Villain, Location, Alchemy, Friend, Plot, Theme. Each Suite has 13 cards ranked from 1 to 13.

Each player is dealt 5 cards. Players take turns with each turn having four phases:

1. Draw Phase.
Draw 2 cards from the top of the deck and put them in your hand.

2. Action Phase.
You may play (discard) exactly one card from your hand. This will have an effect depending on the suite of the card:
- Brothers: Draw 3 cards and discard any 2 cards from your hand.
- Villain: Opponent must discard 2 random cards.
- Location: Look at an opponent’s hand. Draw 1 card from the deck.
- Alchemy: Cannot be discarded in action phase. However,
extra Alchemy cards count as wild cards in meld phase.
- Friend: Draw top 2 cards of the deck and put them in your hand.
- Plot: Steal 1 random card from an opponent’s hand.
- Theme: Take 1 target card from the discard and put it in your hand.

3. Meld Phase
If possible, you may make a Meld. There are 4 types of meld:
- 7 cards, one from each of the 7 suites
- 7 cards all from the same suite
- 7 cards in consecutive Rank Order
- 7 cards of the same rank (This is very difficult and consequently automatically wins the game)
Immediately discard the Meld after you reveal it, then draw 5 new cards.

4. End Phase
Max hand size is 9 cards. Discard excess cards.

The first player to make 5 melds wins the game.

name: Het vrolijke Kerstspel
description:
Translated from Dutch:

The cheerful Christmas game is a wonderfully fun game for under the Christmas tree, especially for everyone who wants to enjoy that ultimate Chistmas feeling during these days.

A humorous and dynamic game to play during these wonderful Christmas days with your friends or the whole family!

The "Christmas wheel of Adventure" adds to the tension and continuously causes hilarious situations. With the " Rudolph, the red-nosed"-assignments you will roll off your chairs laughing. In contrast, the "Christmas memorybreakers" will test your knowledge.
But during the "Cheerful Christmas song" you will find out who sings the best.

name: Architacky
description: Players take on the role of competing architects designing parts of a ridiculous and oversized McMansion. Players roll dice and add features (cubes) to the house in the numbered column of their dice roll. New floors can be placed atop the cubes when there are enough supporting feature cubes on the floor below. Adding new floors gives players a cube refund and initiative on building the next level. The architect with the greatest amount of features on the top levels of the house wins.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Tile Placement, Worker Placement

name: Evl
description:
Story – There’s no I in EVL
The world vanquished the very concept of evil along with evil itself long ago. Unfortunately, boredom took its place. If that gives cause for concern, fear not! A small ray of hope exists for the late forces of darkness. The Library of Evil has been rediscovered. As these massive underground ruins are excavated, newfound epic tales of good versus evil regularly send waves of excitement to droves of EVL* fans all across the world. The entire world is drowning in an EVL craze as it yearns for the eradication of boredom. Team EVL believes bringing evil back from the ancient past will do just that. If only they could find a way how. . .


Social media has deemed the modern spelling of evil to be EVL in an effort to avoid the use of the selfish letter ‘I’. Any instance of selfishness, though not inherently evil, is viewed as a lesser good since evil forms of selfishness do not exist.


Gameplay
'Evl' is an UN-cooperative card game where memory, deception, and deduction are key. Join your friends to cure boredom, and release evil back into the world. CAUTION: As you play, evil whispers destroy your once noble thoughts. You will seek the ruin of your friends and to rule the world through the absolute power of evil.

With only one action per turn (Play, Peek, Draw, …), you must manipulate the state of a ritual circle in an effort to control the most information on the board. All cards are played face down, so carefully observe your opponent’s expressions and moves. When you believe the ritual to be in its correct state, declare it complete! If you are right, claim victory as you release evil back into the world! If not, take a seat while the remaining players continue to play.

Evl is designed and illustrated by Ethan Weber. Evl is for 1-5 players and meant for multiple short play sessions at 10-40 minutes each.

name: Are You Yuusha?
description:
User Summary
Are You 勇者？ (Are You Yuusha?) is a fast-paced were-wolf card game by the Japanese doujin publisher ザキさん工房 released at the Game Market 2015 Autumn convention in Japan.

In Japanese, 勇者 means 'Hero' so the game name can be translated as 'Are you a Hero?'.

Within 2 rounds only, the monster players must find and eliminate the Hero player to win, otherwise it's the Hero player win.

There is only 1 Hero player card, and there are 5 monster cards available. Each of them has different abilities.

The game plays roughly as the following:
1) Each player draws a character card. The players can only check on this character card and must keep it face down so no other player can see who they are.
2) Give two action cards to each player.
3) Before the start of the game, in order all players but one will close their eyes so one can play their power if possible.
4) Round 1 starts. All players discuss and try to figure out the other player's identity. It is of course okay to lie.
5) When time is up or everyone decided, all players put forward one card face down.
6) The players reveal at once who they are going to play their action card against. You can play a card on yourself.
7) Depending on your character, you may reveal you identity and use your ability.
8) All the players reveal their action card and proceed to resolution of their effects. Any player whose HP reaches 0 is KO and is out for the game. They cannot display their action cards not their character card and cannot take part in the discussion until the game ends.
9) Without replenishing action cards, move proceed to Round 2 by repeating steps 4 to 8.
10) The game ends. If the Hero player is still alive he wins. If he's dead the monster players win.

Publisher Summary
【Are you 勇者？とは】
・３～４人で手軽に楽しめる人狼型ゲーム
・魔王復活の２日後までに勇者役のプレイヤーを推理して攻撃だ！
・勇者のＨＰを０にすることができればモンスターサイドの勝利！
・推理するだけでなく、キャラクターとアクションカードの能力を駆使した両陣営の攻防がアツい！
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Deduction, Party Game
mechanics: Player Elimination, Role Playing, Team-Based Game

name: Apochalyptica: A Game About Humanity, Survival, and the Atomic Bomb
description:
Description from the publisher:

Apochalyptica is an advanced board game for 4-8 players based around a group of people that find themselves facing nuclear war in the late 1940s. WWII has just ended, but any celebration to be had is cut short by news of bombs falling worldwide, with more headed their way. This ragtag group must gather as many supplies as they can before locking themselves away in a bunker for twelve months. During this time, they will have to deal with a number of trials from petty arguments among themselves, to food, water, and oxygen running out; all with the threat of fallout exposure looming around every corner.

The game is board-and-card based, but plays like your average tabletop rpg. Players have the opportunity to roleplay as their characters, dealing with interpersonal relationships within the bunker as you wait for the timer to tick down and free you. Each character has their own unique set of skills and traits to bring to the table, and players must decide how to best use them to ensure the survival of the group.

The first section is the gathering section. Based on the chosen level of gameplay difficulty (easy or normal. Hard doesn't have a gather section and instead starts directly in the bunker with a set amount of supplies) players will travel around the board to "locations" to search for supplies. To search, they roll 1d10 and compare it to a table of outcomes.
At the end of three rounds, they enter a "voting" phase to choose which characters enter the bunker with their supplies, and which must be left outside.

Section two, the "main game", is twelve rounds in the Bunker where the surviving characters must monitor the levels of food, water, and oxygen. All while trying to keep their sanity levels intact so they don't end up killing each other, or themselves. They have ways of slowing the drop of each of these supply levels, including farming, building a water purification system, monitoring a radio for information about the outside, and interacting with one another in positive ways. Each round, however, players must roll to determine events that occur on their turns that could either help or hinder their progress. It could be something as little as having a bad day and losing a few extra sanity points, to something as disastrous as a radiation leak that permanently seals off a section of the bunker from use.

name: Achtung Achtung
description:
This is a playing card game developed for italian band BIZARRO WELT. It is based on their Song "Bizarro-Planet der Affen". A limited amount of decks printed in professional-grade quality was sold on Christmas 2016.

The objective of the game is to draw cards from a pile and avoid cards labeled with an evil, mutant ape by neutralizing them with a "battle" card. If an ape card cannot be neutralized, the player looses. The number of battle cards in the game decreases over time. The last player still standing wins.

Additional action cards can give an individual player and advantage over others, for example:

- The "future zombie" card allows a player to look at and reshuffle the top three cards of the drawing pile.

- The "fight" card allows a player to challenge an other player to a side competition (e.g. arm wrestling, throwing darts, drinking etc.). The winner may then take one of the loosers' cards.

- The "downfall" card moves all "ape" cards in the game to the top of the drawing pile.

The game can be played by two to five players, but is most fun with four or five players.

name: Covfefe: The Game
description:
Description from the publisher:

Covfefe is about the nightmare scenario of 21st Century Supervillains that take over countries from the people through a mix of technology, misinformation, and outright deception. Players are sociopathic dictators trying to dismantle the world to profit themselves and their friends, all the while trying to keep one step ahead of government investigations. The winner is the one with the most Hubris when the world is hobbled by Nuclear War, Economic Depression, or Tribalism.

All players are recently-elected populist politicians who only won their elections through corruption related to an evil empire that is hellbent on world domination. Through manipulation of the public, pointless but politically popular actions, and bald-faced lies, the players try to destroy their governments, making money from evil corporations, and stay one step ahead of government regulations and/or unpopular opinion.

The game has worker placement (we call it ‘scapegoating,’ as your worker may not come back) and worker-developing (like deck-building for workers), multi-purpose cards, and a lot of deception. Welcome to 21st Century politics!
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Worker Placement

name: A.I.
description:
Description from the publisher:

The players in the game run the last bastions of human control, corporations. Governments long ago failed after being dismantled by Emperor Trump. In A.I., corporations are trying to continue to line their pockets with the use of technology, except the technology is starting to work against that. Players are trying to profit handily while staying one step ahead of the A.I., which is starting to think of humans as a virus in the physical world.

A.I.’s key mechanism is the idea of an engine-building game with a potentially intelligent engine. In most engine-building games, players assemble an engine through the acquisition and management of resources to construct from a selection of parts. At some point in the game, the engine that will be run for the sole purpose of making victory points. The interesting decisions in these games is when to make that shift.
In A.I., the engines have a chance to become sentient and could actually become part of a dummy player in the game that both hinders the ability of the player to progress and competes against all players to possibly win the game.

name: Bangaroo
description:
Marble game in which Bangaroo spin-wheel is spun and marbles are sent whirling into the various pockets of the Bangaroo. Five different ways to play:
Bang-a-Roo Numbers Game - Highest score wins
Bang-a-Roo Word Game - Make single word from letters and score based on length of word.
Bang-a-Roo Word Tournament - Make as many words as possible with letters.
Bang-a-Roo Long Shot - Make longest word before spinner stops
Two-Way Bang-a-Roo - Make words and highest score after 5 spins wins.

From box "Four new spin, spell 'n' score games in one, each more fascinating that the next. All for fun and fun for all.

Contents:
Bangaroo
Bangaroo Spin-wheel
5 Bangaroo Balls
Paste on letters and numbers
Bangaroo Score-pad and pencil
Bangaroo tips for hours of fun

name: 続・リア充爆発しろ!! (Zoku Riajuu Bakuhatsu Shiro!!)
description:
User summary
続・リア充爆発しろ!! (Zoku Riajuu Bakuhatsu Shiro!!) is a Japanese card game by 楠本舗 (Kusunoki Honpo) released for the Game Market 2016 Spring in Japan.

In Japanese, リア充 (Riajuu) refers to "someone who is interested in real things and has a successful social life". It was invented in opposition to the word オタク (Otaku).

リア充爆発しろ!!, Riajuu bakuhatsu shiro!!, the title of the game, is a famous expression on the Japanese internet.

In this game, the players are split into 3 groups: Riajuu, non-Riajuu and Narcissist.
In the Debate Phase you try to get information from the other players on their identity, then in the Voting Phase you design the two players you think are Riajuu and you proceed to the Scoring Phase.
If the non-Riajuu could find the Riajuu, they get points.
If the Riajuu are not found by at least 2 person they get points.
If the Narcissist gets designated as a Riajuu, he get points.
After several rounds, the player with most points wins.

Publisher summary
とあるヲタサーの集会でリーダーが言い放った。
「この中にリア充がいるっ！」
サークルのルールは『裏切り者には死を』である。
サークルメンバーは一癖も二癖もある『スキル』を持った変人ばかり。
果たして非リア充たちはリア充を追放することができるのだろうか・・・。
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Deduction, Party Game

name: Fools and Prospectors
description:
A worker placement/set collection card game about mining gold during the American Gold Rush.

Put your miners to work in the gold mines. Get as much gold as possible, but watch out – make sure you aren’t wasting time collecting Fool’s Gold! Pay to check the quality of gold in the mines, and call out your opponent for trying to pay with Fool’s Gold or just plain rocks. Collect the highest values of gold by the end of the game to win.
categories: American West, Bluffing, Card Game, Print & Play
mechanics: Action Points, Push Your Luck, Set Collection, Worker Placement

name: Finansije za kasnije
description:
Finansije za kasnije ("Finance for Old Days") is a game about different financial products and how to use them. Players start with a birth and childhood, after that they have to decide would they work or study. On the half of the game they form family, and at last work for better carrier. They have different financial products, cash credits, home credits, savings, private pension fund and etc. Goal is to collect as much money for retirement.
Game is not for sale, but for education purpose, my firm is arranging turners around the country in middle schools to teach pupils how to save money.

name: Spanish Saint Augustine
description:
A card game for 2-4 players based on survival and accomplishment in the Florida City of St. Augustine.

St. Augustine was founded in 1565 by Pedro Menendez. It is the oldest, continuously inhabited European settlement in North America. For the first 200 years of its existence, it was controlled by Spain. The town itself was always very small and poor, but it held an important strategic position. It helped defend the treasure fleets on their way back to Spain by preventing the English and French from building their own settlements along the Gulf stream.

In this game players actively recruit townsfolk, earn gold, gain military glory, and build structures while being mercilessly subjected to hurricanes, raids, disease, and hostile indians.

Each turn is equal to about a decade. The game ends after 20 turns, at which point, historically, the British take control of the city.

Each Player gets a player mat which is divided up into 7 boxes: Government, Churches, Forts, Population, Gold, Glory and Victory Points. Tokens are placed in the boxes on player mats to keep track of each players score in that category. Each player starts with 7 population, 5 gold, and 3 glory.

There are 2 Common Decks:
1. The Event Deck - one random event occurs each turn.
2. The Action Deck which comprises four suits:
- Economic (Types: Industry, Agriculture, Trade)
- Military (Types: Fight the French, Fight the English, Control)
- Population (Types: Indians, Blacks, Europeans)
- Buildings (Types: Government, Churches, Forts)
Each suit has 3 types of card with 4 cards for each type. In addition the deck has 4 leader (wild) cards.

Each turn is divided into 7 Phases:

1. Draw Phase
- Each Player fills their hand to 10 action cards.

2. Trade Phase
- Players may trade action cards with each other and may also trade tokens on their player mats.

3. Meld Phase
- Players may make melds. A meld consists of 1-4 cards of the same type. One card in a meld may be a leader. One card in a meld earns 1 token. Two cards in a meld earns 3 tokens. Three cards in a meld earns 6 tokens. Four cards in a meld earns 10 tokens.
- You can make a max of 4 melds, one from each suit.
- Tokens earned go into the relevant box on the player’s mat. (e.g. tokens from a population meld go into the population box, tokens from a military meld go into the glory box).

4. Building Phase
- Buildings provide bonus resources. Tokens are awarded for having the highest and second highest church, government and fort scores.

5. Event Phase
- Flip over the top card of the event deck. The event is resolved immediately and affects all players.

6. Score Phase
- Players gain Victory Points (VP) in based on their population, gold and glory scores.

7. End Phase
- Players may discard their action hands down to zero cards.
- Each player loses one half his gold rounding down.
- Each player loses all his Glory.

The game ends after 20 turns. The player with the most VP at the end of the game wins.

name: The Roots of Magic
description:
The Roots of Magic is a tabletop miniatures game of duels between competing wizards in fantasy world. Players activate their wizards to perform mundane actions such as movement as well as casting spells and using other special abilities. The goal of the game varies depending on the scenario chosen and there might be multiple paths to victory.

The game can be played with a single wizard per player or the players may decide to use additional models such as apprentices and animal companions for a larger game. Individual scenarios may also add neutral monsters to the game.

The game rules are published online and the models are sold individually. Each model has their own card listing their various abilities. Players may add also tabletop terrain to the game from their collection.
mechanics: Action Points, Simulation, Variable Player Powers

name: Guardsman
description:
This is a two-player game where one player controls the 32 Peasants and one player controls the Three Guardsmen. The guardsmen control the castle ( 3 x 3 positions) and the peasants try to gain control of the castle. They start in the four corners of the board (each corner has 8 positions.)

To play: Peasants move first and then each player moves alternately. Peasants move one space at a time and never jump. Guardsmen may move one space or may jump one peasant, removing it from play. Guardsmen must jump if possible or be removed from play. Moves can go in any direction, following the lines on the board. Once in castle, the peasant can not leave. The guardsmen can move in and out at will.

name: Energy Crisis
description:
Peppermill's Energy Conservation Game

From Cover:
Q. Is there really an energy crisis?
A. Yes, we are using up our favorite non-renewable fossil fuels at a furious pace, but we can learn how to conserve and use solar energy for most of our energy needs. That's what this game is all about.

From Instructions:
Energy Crisis is a fast moving, game of chance, strategy, and educational fun. It will challenge adults and fascinate children. It's a game the whole family will enjoy.

Game Play:
This is a role and move game where players are trying to insulate their house, convert to solar energy and conserve your energy units. Use your energy units to pay your bills. There are various spaces on the board where you buy solar collectors and insulation, collect energy, and pay bills. Play continues until one player acquires 10 solar collectors or until all other players run out of energy units.

name: Underlords
description:
Underlords is a 1-4 player fantasy game where players take on the role of the Underlords, hard done by masters of the dark who only want to make an innocent evil subterranean empire filled with minions and monsters. Alas these tranquil utopias find no peace as pesky adventurers keep turning up at the door trying to steal everything and killing every minion in sight.
