In Underlords players use tile placement to build a dungeon full of rooms and caves, into which minions and monsters are placed. Each turn the underlord push their luck by sending monsters out to raid villages, towns or cities to gather plunder which is used to recruit minions and build the dungeon.

Each turn one hero arrives at the dungeon seeking treasure. Depending on how hard the Underlord raided, this could be a plucky peasant or a gristle nemesis of evil. The hero travels through the dungeon in a tower defence fashion being battled on the way by the dungeons defenders.

The game is won by the player who accrues the most magic items from fallen hero's by the end of the game.
categories: Adventure, Fantasy, Maze, Medieval, Mythology, Territory Building
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Network and Route Building, Point to Point Movement, Push Your Luck, Tile Placement, Variable Player Powers

name: Tentacle Bento: Teacher's Helper
description:
Metal miniature and Expansion Card for Tentacle Bento

Card Details
Target opponent draws two cards from the school pile.
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Mature / Adult

name: Tentacle Bento: Detention
description:
Metal miniature and Expansion Card for Tentacle Bento

Card Details
Shuffle the entire field back into the pile.
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Mature / Adult

name: Tentacle Bento: Kendo Club
description:
Metal miniature and Expansion Card for Tentacle Bento

Card Details
Remove any one sporty student from an opponent's noble capture and place it in the field.
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Mature / Adult, Miniatures

name: Kashi-Katariki
description:
User summary
菓子、語りき。 (Kashi-Katariki) is a pun on the expression かく語りき (kaku katariki) meaning 'thus spoke', as in "Thus Spoke Zarathustra" 「ツァラトゥストラはかく語りき」(Zarathustra ha kaku katariki). 菓子 (kashi) is generally a noun for sweets. But this game is all about 和菓子 (wagashi), traditional Japanese sweets. So an English title might be 'Sweet Talking'.

Kashi-Katariki is a word game with some similarities to Apples to Apples, but there's little language dependence, so the game is playable with a crib-sheet. The game has cards for different Wagashi, and cards for subjects. Players are trying to give new Wagashi interesting names.

The Dealer draws a random Wagashi card from the Wagashi deck. That is the Wagashi to be named. The Dealer then chooses some subjects from the subject cards. For example, the subjects are like 宇宙 (outer space), 風景 (scenery), 自然 (nature). Each of the other players must choose a subject, and think of a name that fits the Wagashi and subject. The Dealer chooses the best name. The named player gets a point, and the next player becomes the Dealer.

Publisher's summary
Wagashi, is to be enjoyed with all five senses.

Beautiful colors and shape, a bit of incense, tactile feelings from your fingers and your mouth, rich taste. And, with a nice ringing name.

There are many kinds of Wagashi. Yokan. Manju. But in Wagashi culture, in addition to those names representing the types of Wagashi like Yokan, they name their Wagashi with a specific name, called a "Kamei" (菓銘: name of Wagashi).

You are a confectioner in a bizarre Wagashi shop named "Kashi-Katariki.", having a selection of bizarre Wagashi-s.

Your colleagues have just created a brand new original Wagashi, but couldn't come up with a good Kamei. Help your colleagues naming their new Wagashi, and become the Kamei-master.

和菓子は、五感で愉しむ。

美しい色や形、ほのかな香り、
手触りや口に含んだ時の触感、豊かな味わい。
そして、菓銘の響き。

和菓子には、「羊羹」や「饅頭」などの種類を表す名称とは別に
菓銘（菓子の名前）をつけるという文化があります。

皆さんは、奇抜な菓子ばかりが並んでいる
風変わりな和菓子屋「菓子、語りき。」の菓子職人です。

新作菓子を創作したものの
味わい深い菓銘をつけられずに悩んでいる仲間を助け、
菓銘名人としての地位を築いてください。
publishers: analog lunchbox (アナログランチボックス)

name: Blood and Dust
description:
Description from the designer:

Blood and Dust is a game of strategy and adventure enabling players to participate in fierce battles between armies of Medieval times. The game faithfully reenacts the harsh combat reality of this period - heavy cavalry charges breaking enemy lines, lethal salvoes of archers or brutal infantry melees. Players have to choose the right tactics making flank or rear attacks as well as organize their regiments in proper formations. It is also important to take advantage of the lay of the land and use special abilities of commanders and units.

The game can be played in three different game modes for 2 to 4 players: standalone Scenarios designed by the author, standalone Scenarios custom-build by the players and the Campaign. In the Blood and Dust Campaign, the players become captains of mercenary forces who sell their military services in a world full of dangers, intrigues and brutal battles. Your heroes start from commanding a small detachment of units, but as the Campaign progresses, they will muster additional units for their armies. They will improve skills and search for fresh recruits, while their soldiers will gain experience in uncountable skirmishes. For a sack full of gold they will accept commissions, helping the wealthy and the powerful attain even more influence. Alternatively, they will seek glory and money on their own.

name: Trump!
description:
Trump! is a new take on traditional playing cards--adding special symbols to many cards, which alters game play of favorite card games like Cribbage, Go Fish, War, Hearts, and dozens of others.

Each card has a Trump administration official or staff member and includes additional information about the individual.

Officials can be crossed out if fired, resign, or are impeached, changing their value or giving them special abilities in many card games.

The game is one part update on classic card games, one part education, and one part resistance, Trump! should provide hours of fun and politicized entertainment!

name: Baseball Classics All-Time Greats Splits Edition
description:
The Greatest MLB All-Time Teams

Our Baseball Classics All-Time Greats Game with 22 Major League Baseball franchise team sets of team charts with color-coded batting, fielding, bunting, stealing, base running, and pitching ratings.

National League
Houston Colt 45s-Astros, Boston/Milwaukee/Atlanta Braves, St. Louis Cardinals, Chicago Cubs, Brooklyn/Los Angeles Dodgers, New York/San Francisco Giants, New York Mets, Philadelphia Phillies, Pittsburgh Pirates, Cincinnati Reds, Montreal/Washington Expos-Nationals

American League
Los Angeles/California/Anaheim Angels, Philadelphia/Kansas City/Oakland Athletics, Cleveland Indians, Baltimore/St. Louis Browns, Boston Red Sox, Detroit Tigers, Kansas City Royals, Washington/Minnesota Senators-Twins, Chicago White Sox, New York Yankees, Washington/Texas Senators-Rangers

name: SimplyClever.Cards Addition 1
description:
SimplyClever.Cards Addition 1 combines traditional playing cards with math flash cards. The deck has 52 cards in 4 colours numbered 0-12, and 4 jokers.

Each card is illustrated with an addition calculation (e.g. 0+0, 2+1 or 6+6) corresponding to the card value from 0 to 12.

One joker has a table showing which 4 cards match up for each value, in order to check the math when necessary. The remaining 3 jokers have mathematical operators +, - and = so you can make your own calculations using the cards.

Designed to function like a regular deck of cards (including traditional pips for suits and ranks), SimplyClever.Cards Addition 1 allows you to play any regular card game you want to - but with a mathematical twist! Game examples: 500, Casino, Crazy Eights, Go Fish, Hearts, Memory, Old Maid, Slap Jack, Snap, UNO etc.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Educational, Game System, Math, Number
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Hand Management, Memory, Push Your Luck, Set Collection, Trick-taking

name: SimplyClever.Cards Subtraction 1
description:
SimplyClever.Cards Subtraction 1 combines traditional playing cards with math flash cards. The deck has 52 cards in 4 colours numbered 0-12, and 4 jokers.

Each card is illustrated with a subtraction calculation (e.g. 1-1, 3-2 or 15-3) corresponding to the card value from 0 to 12.

One joker has a table showing which 4 cards match up for each value, in order to check the math when necessary. The remaining 3 jokers have mathematical operators +, - and = so you can make your own calculations using the cards.

Designed to function like a regular deck of cards (including traditional pips for suits and ranks), SimplyClever.Cards Subtraction 1 allows you to play any regular card game you want to - but with a mathematical twist! Game examples: 500, Casino, Crazy Eights, Go Fish, Hearts, Memory, Old Maid, Slap Jack, Snap, UNO etc.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Educational, Game System, Math, Number
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Cooperative Game, Hand Management, Memory, Push Your Luck, Set Collection, Trick-taking

name: SimplyClever.Cards Multiplication 1
description:
SimplyClever.Cards Multiplication 1 combines traditional playing cards with math flash cards. The deck has 52 cards in 4 colours numbered 0-12, and 4 jokers.

Each card is illustrated with a multiplication calculation (e.g. 0*1, 2*2 or 3*4) corresponding to the card value from 0 to 12.

One joker has a table showing which 4 cards match up for each value, in order to check the math when necessary. The remaining 3 jokers have mathematical operators +, - and = so you can make your own calculations using the cards.

Designed to function like a regular deck of cards (including traditional pips for suits and ranks), SimplyClever.Cards Multiplication 1 allows you to play any regular card game you want to - but with a mathematical twist! Game examples: 500, Casino, Crazy Eights, Go Fish, Hearts, Memory, Old Maid, Slap Jack, Snap, UNO etc.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Educational, Game System, Math, Number
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Cooperative Game, Hand Management, Memory, Push Your Luck, Set Collection, Trick-taking

name: SimplyClever.Cards Division 1
description:
SimplyClever.Cards Division 1 combines traditional playing cards with math flash cards. The deck has 52 cards in 4 colours numbered 0-12, and 4 jokers.

Each card is illustrated with a division calculation (e.g. 0:1, 3:3 or 48:4) corresponding to the card value from 0 to 12.

One joker has a table showing which 4 cards match up for each value, in order to check the math when necessary. The remaining 3 jokers have mathematical operators +, - and = so you can make your own calculations using the cards.

Designed to function like a regular deck of cards (including traditional pips for suits and ranks), SimplyClever.Cards Division 1 allows you to play any regular card game you want to - but with a mathematical twist! Game examples: 500, Casino, Crazy Eights, Go Fish, Hearts, Memory, Old Maid, Slap Jack, Snap, UNO etc.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Educational, Game System, Math, Number
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Cooperative Game, Hand Management, Memory, Push Your Luck, Set Collection, Trick-taking

name: Unexpected Plots
description: This is a party card game for 3-7 players (or teams). Players create film reviews, deforming the plot, hiding some elements of it or magnifying other aspects. The goal is to ruin the movies (series or books) you love or love to hate.
categories: Humor, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game

name: Furious Ascent
description:
Furious Ascent is a cooperative game for 2 to 4 players. The object of the game is for all players to progress as a team through four ascents to reach the mountain summit. If all players are healthy enough to reach the summit, the game is won. If any player becomes too injured to continue on during the game, it will result in an immediate loss.

Teammates play colored rope cards in the proper order to conquer four ascents, with each ascent becoming more difficult than the last. Each of the four camp cards has different requirements on how many rope cards and how many colors can be used to progress to the next camp.

If any player during their turn is unable to play the next card in the sequence, they must draw from the Event Deck. Events can penalize the individual player with various ailments, or the team as a whole with loss of progress in the ascent. If any player obtains too many ailments during the game, the entire team fails, and the game is lost. If all players reach the summit, the game is won!

name: Civ Quest
description:
A Civilization type game using dice, map, and record keeping for 2-7 players.

A map of the Mediterranean is divided up into multiple areas (about 20 per player).

Each player has a set of units of a unique colour. There are 2 types of units, Population Tokens(PT) and City Tokens(CT). Each player starts by placing 7 PT onto one empty area on the board.

A pad and pencil is used to keep track of Idea Points, Resource Points, Victory Points, and Advances.

There are 8 Phases:

1. Leader Phase
- Roll once on the Great Leader Table. Dependant on result a player will receive population tokens or points (Idea, Resource, Move or Victory)
- The old Leader dies and a new leader is rolled for each of your turns.

2. City Phase
- Roll once on the City Table for each City you control. Dependant on results a player will receive a population token or a point (Idea, Resource, Move or Victory)

3. Advance Phase
- Gain 1D6 Idea Points (IP). Idea points are saved from turn to turn.
- A player may turn in 5 IP to gain 1 random advance. This is determined by rolling once on a Research Table.
- The second advance you buy in a turn costs 7 IP, the third 9 IP and so on.
- Maximum IP you can store is 15. Excess is lost.

4. Growth Phase
- Gain 1D6 Population Tokens (PT). These may be placed in any areas a player controls.
- Max PT a single area can maintain is 10 (plus 1 city). Excess is lost.

5. Build Phase
- Gain 1D6 Resource Points (RP). A player may spend 5 RP and discard 5 PT to build a City in any area he controls. An area may contain only 1 city.
- A player may spend 10 RP to gain 1 Wonder of his choice. You cannot build more Wonders than you currently have Cities.
- Max RP you can store is 15. Excess is lost.

6. Disaster Phase
- A player rolls 1D6. On a roll of 5+ his culture experiences a disaster.
- Next a player rolls 1D6 to determine how many Population Tokens he loses. These are taken from any of his areas. A city may be broken down into 5 PT to take losses.
- If you have an Advance that mitigates a disaster you get -2 to the casualty roll.

7. Clash Phase
- For each other Civ a player is adjacent to, he may choose either trade or war.
- If he chooses trade roll on a Trade Table to determine results
- If he chooses War, attacker picks 2 adjacent areas, 1 controlled by each player. Each player rolls 2D6 and adds bonuses from War advances.
The higher War roll total wins (Defender wins ties). Loser loses all units in the area lost. The winner gains control of the opposing Area by placing 1 PT from off the board onto the newly conquered area.

8. Migration Phase
- Roll 1D6 to get that many Move Points (MP).
- A player may use 1 MP to move 1 PT to an adjacent area. Sailing and road advances allow PT to move further.
- Move points are not saved from turn to turn.

The Game ends when any of the following happens: All areas containing land are occupied; all wonders are built; any one player has 7 or more cities or only 1 player is left (automatic winner).

At end of game add up Victory Points from advances and Iconic Leaders, city rolls + 1 per area you occupy + 5 per Wonder built. The player with the highest VP score wins.

name: Umleitung
description:
Each player has to get his car to any destination space. If there are 4 or 6 players, 2-player-teams are formed. The Starting spacese and order of play are determined by the draw of numbered cards (1-6). The players take turns to place one disc each on any crossroads. When all discs are placed, the cars begin to move. Movement is 4 spaces per turn.

If a car gets on a space with a black dot, the player may turn one unoccupied disk of his choice to any position. A car may stop on any space with a black dot, even if it has to move less than 4 spaces to get there.

If a car gets on a space with a "T" the car has to turn around and the player may exchange 2 unoccupied discs with another.

When a player gets to a destination space, he scores the corresponding amount of points and stars again at his starting point. The first player to score 100 points wins the game.

name: The 2016 Election Game
description:
A party game for the politically incorrect! Put all that debate watching knowledge to the test with this snarky card game featuring quotes from your least favorite candidates. Includes:

-50 red cards
-200 blue cards
-Custom box
-Game rules
​-One email from Hillary Clinton (kind of)

Can be combined with Cards Against Humanity for extra (nervous) laughs!

name: Shylock
description:
Inspired by Shakespeare's The Merchant of Venice, Shylock is a medium-weight trading game, featuring innovative loan-taking and auction mechanics combined with elegant hand and resource management.

Players play Merchants of Venice, using their connections to buy and sell goods and ship them around the Mediterranean for profit. However, to invest in goods and ships they need to take loans from the moneylender Shylock, and the penalty for not repaying a loan can be heavy indeed.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Trading, Turn Order: Time Track

name: Lorrein: Extension for 5 and 6 players
description: A set of additional game pieces (brown and purple), allowing Lorrein to be played with 5 or 6 players.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Action / Dexterity, Ancient, Animals, City Building, Civilization, Educational, Farming, Industry / Manufacturing, Medieval, Negotiation, Renaissance, Territory Building
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Modular Board, Team-Based Game, Trading

name: BULLA AUREA 1356 (ブラアウリア1356)
description:
User summary
ブラアウリア1356 (BULLA AUREA 1356) is a 2 player game where you endeavor to become the next Holy Roman Emperor by gaining the confidence of the seven Prince-electors.

Players become influential aristocrats, competing to assemble the necessary financial and military means to win the favor of the Prince-electors — which is measured in points. The first player to reach five points wins control of the empire.

It is crucial to read your opponent’s movements and make decisions that will maximize your own returns.

Publisher's summary
神聖ローマ皇帝になるために7人の選帝侯から信任を得ることを目指すゲームです。　
プレーヤは有力貴族となり、選帝侯の信任を得るに足る資産や軍隊を集め力を示します。選帝侯の信任は勝利点となり、先取5点で勝利となります。
互いの行動を読み、最大限自分の利益につながる選択を取ることが大事です。
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Modular Board

name: Aurora Strike Wrestling Group: Dark Match
description:
Description & Theme
Wrestlers! Management has asked you to stick around and put together a dark match to keep the fans in their seats. There isn't enough time to choreograph the whole match, so it is up to you to put on and improvise the best match possible. The only requirement is there are specific spots management wants you to hit because the fans want to see what the fans want to see! Can you put on the most electrifying match and keep the fans cheering or will the only sound you hear after the 1-2-3 be the sound of crickets?

Goal of the Game
Unlike other head-to-head wrestling themed games or fighting games, the goal is not to beat your opponent by depleting their hit points. The goal is to put on the best match possible and getting the most fans (victory points)!

Gameplay
1. Separate the cards into a Momentum Deck (cards 1 – 7) and a Spot Deck (cards 8 – 13).
2. Place 3 pairs of Spot cards in the center of the table face up. The sum of each of the pairs is the goal you are trying to reach for each Spot.
3. Place the Momentum Deck to another side.
4. Each player draws 5 cards from the Momentum Deck.
5. Choose a player to go first.

Players now take turns playing a card from their hand on one Spot, trying to reach that goal on their turn. Reaching that goal perfectly wins the Spot and equates to more fans, but passing (when a valid card can't be played) forfeits the Spot to the opponent and giving them more fans. Cards played from the hand represent simple wrestling moves, like strikes and holds, that escalate to the Spot, which are power moves like DDTs and spears!

When there are no Momentum cards or Spots remaining, players enter the Pin Fall attempt! Play turns into a War-style game, flipping over remaining cards in the hand to see who wins the pin. After the pin, all Perfect and Botched (passed) Spots are scored up.

Reading your opponent, evaluating the cards in play, the cards in your hand, and measuring the potential outcomes on future Spots will determine the bright fan favorite in ASWG: Dark Match!

name: Hear Say: The Talk Twisting Game
description:
First player reads a phrase. The second player must repeat it as accurately as possible. Players receive points for the words repeated accurately.

The phrases are tongue-twisters.
categories: Card Game, Humor, Party Game, Word Game

name: Bezzerwizzer: Promo Pack
description: Contains 25 new cards and quick start rules.
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: ReBoot Hacked
description:
A dice game based on the Computer Animated TV series Reboot. Can be played solo or multiplayer.

In a round, each player gets one turn. Each player’s turn represents a single episode. During his turn a player will roll dice against a number of tables and gain (or lose) assets. Each Asset has a power level and/or modifies the power levels of
other assets. Pencil and paper are used to keep track of roll results, power calculations, and Victory Points (VP).

Each turn has 6 Phases:

1. Location Phase
- Roll 1D20 on the Location Table to determine the key location for the current episode. Take actions as described on the card – this may involving rolling on another table.

2. Threat Phase
- Roll 1D6 on the Primary Threat Table to determine what is the major threat for the current episode. Dependant on threat type (Game Cube, Virus or Web) roll on respective threat tables and resolve (which may involve rolling against other tables)

3. Hero Phase
- Roll 4 times on the Guardian Hero Table. You may then reroll any or all of these rolls once.

4. Ally Phase
- Roll once on the Ally Table. You may then reroll this roll once.

5. Key Phase
- Roll once on the Key Tool Table. You may then reroll this roll once.

6. Score Phase
- Guardian Power = Combined Power of all Heroes, Allies, and Key Assets.
- Threat Power = Combined power of all Game, Viral, and Web Assets.
- If the Threat Power is greater than the Guardian Power, the Guardians fail and you score no points. If the Guardian Power is greater, score Victory Points equal to the Threat Power.

The winner is the player with the most Victory Points (VP) at the end of 6 rounds.
If playing solo, players should attempt to beat their previous score.
categories: Dice, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction

name: SimplyClever.Cards Addition 2
description:
SimplyClever.Cards Addition 2 combines traditional playing cards with math flash cards. The deck has 52 cards in 4 colours numbered 16-45, and 4 jokers.

Each card is illustrated with an addition calculation (e.g. 8+8, 6+10 or 22+23) corresponding to the card value from 16 to 45.

One joker has a table showing which 4 cards match up for each value, in order to check the math when necessary. The remaining 3 jokers have mathematical operators +, - and = so you can make your own calculations using the cards.

Designed to function like a regular deck of cards (including traditional pips for suits and ranks), SimplyClever.Cards Addition 2 allows you to play any regular card game you want to - but with a mathematical twist! Game examples: 500, Casino, Crazy Eights, Go Fish, Hearts, Memory, Old Maid, Slap Jack, Snap, UNO etc.

name: Cultists
description:
Description from the publisher:

You find yourself a member of a small-town cult. Excitement is in the air as the day of reckoning looms - though some members have fallen into disbelief, and seek to escape the cult before that day arrives.

Believers strive to keep the membership strong enough to survive until Achieving Glory, while Runners work secretly to escape before they become a cautionary tale.

Each player is dealt secret character and loyalty cards. For five rounds, you all have the opportunity to play actions and purchase cards with the aim of earning points for your team. Bluffing is critical to the game, but be careful - if caught, you lose your anonymity and valuable action options.

Will the Runners prevail and return to safety, or will the entire town perish at the hands of the Believers? The clock is ticking, and the time to run is running out.

name: Electromagnate
description:
Description from the publisher:

In Electromagnate, two teams, of 1 to 3 players per side, compete to close circuits on the game board. Players traverse grid nodes and place component cards onto grid lines. Once you close a circuit you begin to draw power from the enclosed area.

Acquired power can be used to purchase character upgrades, which increase player abilities. Or technology can be purchased, to help your play or hamper your opponents. Finally, megaliths can be purchased/built, to increase the power gained from areas.

Combat can be enacted to battle your opponent for control of grid nodes or grid lines. Inserted into the combat/poker deck are random event cards, which bring elements of chance to the game.
mechanics: Action Points, Auction/Bidding, Enclosure, Grid Movement, Hand Management, Network and Route Building, Variable Player Powers

name: Beat the Drum: A Game of Skill
description: This is another shooting game from Rosebud Art Company. The purpose of the game is to launch wooden discs by flicking them off a launching block with your flinger, then ricocheting the discs off the drummer backstop and onto the drum or the scoring grid below. 100 points a rewarded for landing on the drum. Points on the are as follows: 10, 50 (under the drum), 5, 5, 25, 15, 15, 50 (center), 10, 25, 15, and 5 points. The players take turns shooting one of four colored wooden discs at the target until one player reaches 1000 points.

name: Das kopflose Dinner 2: Das Pferderennen
description:
Das Pferderennen (= "horse race") is the second part of a medieval trilogie around the intrigue of the family "Gräfingen". "Friedrich von Gräfingen" invites for a horse race.

A crime happens and you and your guests have to solve the mystery.

Gameplay:
Just invite your guests and host your own murder mystery dinner. Everybody gets a roledescription and after the game started more and more hints to the murderer.

Goal:
Mainly you have to find the murderer, but you can also bet on other people's secrets.

name: Das kopflose Dinner 3: Der Kreuzzug
description:
Der Kreuzzug ("The Crusade") is the third part of a medieval trilogie around the intrigue of the family "Gräfingen". "Friedrich von Gräfingen" invites his guests for a funeral service. Suddenly a crime happens

Gameplay:
Just invite your guests and host your own murder mystery dinner. Everybody gets a roledescription and after the game started more and more hints to the murderer.

Goal:
Mainly you have to find the murderer, but also everybody has his own interests and private goals. So for example the second born would be interested to blame his older brother and let him get arrested and punished, so that he can get the heritage.

name: Das kopflose Dinner: Tod im Saloon
description:
A terrible thing has happend in Little White Creek. The singer of the saloon has been found dead. Hank Butcherman - owner of the saloon - wants to find the murder and invites citizens and employees to help him.

Every player gets a role. One player is the murder and the others players have to find him/her. The players try to find hintzs by interviewing the other players to solve the case.

name: Das kopflose Dinner: Geheimnis des Toten
description:
It is Lady Lucy Bosworth-Crowley's birthday. On the guest list there are lords, ladies, an opera diva and an industrial magnate. Even a raja from India is with the party. Suddenly Lady Lucy's son is murdered. She and her guests have to find the murderer.

Every player gets a role. One player is the murder and the others players have to find him/her. The players try to find hintzs by interviewing the other players to solve the case.

name: Mord in der Villa
description:
A party takes place in Oskar Ottman's luxurious mansion. At 9 pm Oskar goes to his bureau because he doesn't feel well. At midnight he is discovered lying dead in his bureau.

Mord in der Villa is mixture of board game and role play. Each player gets a character and instructions on how to play their character. The players try to find the murderer who is one of them. The murderer tries to avoid being found.

There are 2 parts:

Moving a pawn around the plan of the palace by rolling a die to find objects.

Interrogate the other players to get more information.

name: Flash Cards
description:
A card game based on the TV show The Flash

There are 3 Decks:
- The Flash Deck. Cards in the Flash deck have 2 numerical Traits: Speed and Investigation. Speed is used to overcome the Threat trait of Foe cards. Investigation is used to overcome the Plot Trait of Foe cards. Numerical values of these cards range from +1 to +7.
- The Foe Deck. Foe cards need to be overcome using Flash cards.
Cards in the Foe deck have 2 numerical Traits: Threat and Plot.
- The Mod Deck. Modifier cards are attached to Foe cards and increase their trait values. Cards in the Mod deck have 2 numerical traits: Threat and Plot.

Flip over the top 2 cards of the Foe deck. Place them face up in the middle of the table.

Players take turns with each turn comprising 4 phases:

1. Foe Phase
- If there are less than 2 Foe cards face up in the middle of the table, then flip over replacements.
- Each Foe card gets 1 Mod card attached to it. If a Foe card does not have a Mod then card flip over a Mod card and place it slightly under the Foe card to show they are attached.
- At the end of Foe Phase there should be 2 face-up Foe cards in the middle of the table with a Mod card attached to each.

2. Flash Phase
- The current player fills his hand to 7 cards from the Flash deck.

3. Capture Phase
- The current player plays Flash cards from his hand to capture one of the face-up Foe cards. The Total Speed value of the Flash cards must exceed the total Threat value of the target Foe card and attached Mod card. The Total Investigation value of the Flash cards must exceed the total Plot value of the target Foe card and attached Mod card.
- If both these conditions are satisfied, the player puts the Foe card into his victory pile. The Flash and Mod cards are discarded.
- The current player may then also capture the second face-up Foe card, if he has the resources to do it.

4. Final Phase
- The current player may discard any number of cards from his hand.

The game ends when the last Foe card in the Foe deck is captured. The player with the most Foe cards in his victory pile wins.
categories: Card Game, Fantasy, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Gods of TYN HARRA
description:
A game of skill designed to take luck out of the equation by drafting your entire 25 card deck, or 12 card quick draft, then placing your Vorpal Shard in one of the 3 places that will benefit you the most. Each player begins with the same base amount of Mystic Shards each turn, to cast spells. The only advantage you have is your skill in drafting, casting and using your abilities at key times during the game.

There are 3 types of cards you’ll use to defeat your opponents, Creatures, Relics and Spells.

When you cast your angel, demon, dragon or wizard you must choose between the defense zone or the attack zone. You can move them later if you need more defense or attackers to finish off someone.

When your creatures die, collect Soul Shards and use them to acquire more powerful spells!

The best part, in a 3 or 4 player game, is you’re defending yourself against the player on the right while attacking the player on the left. This makes the strategy change throughout the game as you react to the other players. In a 4-player game, you cannot attack the player directly across from you or to the right; you may only attack the player to your left.

Every game is different
Fast Rounds
Action Packed
Several Expansions Planned
Learn in 5 Minutes
2 Different Modes
mechanics: Open Drafting, Player Elimination, Variable Phase Order, Variable Player Powers

name: Space Nazi Skirmish
description:
A board & card game of abstract skirmish level space combat for 2 players.

The game is based on the Iron Sky movie. In 1945 Nazis, using flying-saucers, escaped to and colonized the dark side of the moon. They call themselves the Fourth Reich. Ever since, and unknown to us, they’ve been plotting their return. Their fleet is currently in low earth Orbit, bombarding New York with large moon rocks and sending down waves of Attack saucers. Unknown to the Nazis and to each other, each of the major Earth nations has secretly weaponized their communication and science satellites. These have now banded together to fight off the Nazi Invasion Fleet.

Play is conducted on an 8x8 grid using chits, figures or miniatures to represent units. Units start on the back two rows of the player’s side of the board. Units are of various classes (Dreadnought, Carrier, Flying Saucer Squadron, Large, Medium and Small ships). Each unit has a designated hit value, and may have specific capabilities. Players can elect to play from 3 different scenarios though gameplay is common to all three.

Players share a common deck of movement, attack, defence and special cards.

Players take turns with each turn comprising 3 phases:


Tactical Phase
Draw 3 cards. Max hand size = 5 cards. Discard excess cards.

Move Phase
Play (discard) a move card to move one of your units. The move card has a number indicating the number of spaces the unit moves. Moves can be diagonal or orthogonal. Units may move through (past) other units.

Fire Phase
Play (discard) an Attack card to have a unit attack. The attack card has a number indicating the range of the attack. Attacks can be diagonal or orthogonal. Units may attack through (past) other units.
Every attack does a base of 1 damage (target loses 1 hit). A unit reduced to 0 hits is destroyed.
Your opponent may play defence cards to negate your attack.



Victory is achieved through complete destruction of the opposing fleet.
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Hand Management, Open Drafting

name: Kipoud: La pioche ou la raison
description:
Kipoud is a card drafting game in which you try to build the biggest, most valuable house.

In Kipoud, you will have 2 stack of cards, one with "construction" cards and the other with "tree" cards. There are two ways to start the game, in fast version each player will have a "foundation" card, and in normal version players start empty handed.

In turn, the active player will first roll a six-sided die. On a 6, he loses his turn. On a 1, a 3, a 4 or a 5, he has the choice between drawing 1 "construction" card or 2 "tree" cards. On a 2, he performs the action "draw" twice. Then, if he can, if he wants, he can play cards from his hand. The goal is to build the houses of the "Moigeux", small creatures who think only of their material goods and who never cease to build ever bigger or always more ... To build, we will have to make combinations. For example, to build a roof, you will need the "roof" card and a "green wood" card + "brown wood" card. You discard the raw material and place your roof in front of you.

There are action cards that let you interact with other players or defend yourself against action cards from other players.
Once your turn is over, you must not have more than 10 cards in hand.

How do I win?

When the "Construction" stack is empty, the game ends. The points in the top right corner on the "Construction" cards are counted and the one with the most points is declared "Grand Vainqueur" or Winner.

name: Interstate
description:
Description from the designer:

Interstate is a quick-playing family game in which each player is taking a vacation or road trip through the United States via the Interstate road system. The first player to visit all of their destinations and return home is the winner. The game has a deck of Interstate cards which allows for interactive card play as players can help their own cause or hinder other players' travel.

Interstate is presented as an easy-to-learn basic game but also has several optional variants that can be used to spice up the basic game. Because of the randomness and unpredictability inherent in the play of the game, as well as the variants, Interstate has excellent replay value.

Most games of Interstate are close; it is rare to have a runaway winner. The play of the cards helps to rein in anyone who gets too much of a lead over the other players. There will always be unpleasant events that will hinder your game but basically the person who can most efficiently plan out the course of visiting their destinations will have the best chance of winning.

name: S-Tris
description:
S-Tris is 2-player game that combines tile laying like Blokus with the use of cards.

Before play starts, players modify the usable part of the board by putting some blocks anywhere on the board. Each players is dealt a certain number of cards, depending on the amount of players.

On his turn a player plays a card, either a square or a helper card. In case of a square card he puts the corresponding piece on the board as long as it fits somewhere. In case of a helper card he carries out the special function. Some cards, like The Bomb, allow you to remove a piece first for instance.

The player who gets rid of his cards first or with the least points on his cards left after all players have passed on their turn, wins.

name: Robot Monster Hologram
description:
We wanted to create a game that kids could play but had hidden depth that would keep adults engaged. The result was an an easy-to-learn but surprisingly strategic card game that is a cross between Uno, War, and with some Texas Holdem sprinkled in.

Players take turns drawing and playing cards to win battles (and cards). Some special action cards allow players to steal cards, change their character, void other player's cards and more.

During battle everyone plays one more "reinforcement" card just for themselves except for Holograms who play two. Monsters count claws, Robots count lasers, and holograms count monster, claws, or lasers (whichever has fewer in the middle).

Add up your totals and the highest number wins. The battle winner takes all the cards in the middle and their reinforcement card and sets them aside. This is their point pile and counts toward winning the game. The battle losers keep their reinforcement card.

Keep playing until someone runs out of cards and whomever has the most cards wins the game

name: The Way of Kings
description:
The Way of Kings is an epic miniatures based game designed by Matt Riddle and Ben Pinchback under license from Brandon Sanderson, the author of The Way of Kings novels.

The game will be a Euro/American hybrid. 60-120 min big box game. 2-4 Players, with custom dice and minis, custom player decks, player mats, etc.

Minis included will be: Dalinar, Sadeas, Sebarial, Roion, Adolin, Generic Shardbearer, Parshendi, Parshendi Shard Bearer and oversized Chasm Fiend

name: Roll 4 Gold
description:
This Gold Mining themed game is a great learning tool for young players and it can be a great family game. The primary objective is to roll out and rid your hand of cards before your opponents and collect gold and WIN. As you collect the gold tokens you will collect Prospector level badges.

Ways to win: Reach the Expert Level Badge-Rookie, Gold Finger, Elite and Expert
Most gold collected after 5 rounds.

Each player will be given a determined number of gold nuggets depending on number or players. 4 players 25 nuggets each. Game play starts with each player in the game will 'dig' or ante a gold nugget and place it in the middle of the table. This gold becomes the pot. The players will be given a three card hand and they will be given the option of rolling one di or two dice to roll out their hand of matching card and dice values. EX 1=1, 7=7 11=11.

There are some features such as 'THE GOLDEN ROLL' If a player rolls two sixes they will automatically win the pot. Another feature is if a player rolls'FOOL'S GOLD' which is two ones they are automatically out of that hand.

Each round begins with the players deciding if they are 'digging' ante in or folding.

The player with the most gold or the player who reaches Expert Prospector WINS. Prospector Levels are determined by number of players playing. Happy Rolling!

name: Imperium Chronicles: Grunts and Grav Tanks – Mech Assault
description:
Description from the publisher:

Grunts and Grav Tanks: Mech Assault (G&GT:MA) is the first major expansion for the Grunts and Grav Tanks tactical wargame. It includes a brand new faction called the Talion Republic (allied to the Magna Supremacy) and new units (mechs and attack craft). The expansion also includes a completely new battle map (30" x 22.5") that can be used alone or in conjunction with the map from the original game.

Features

A new faction (Talion Republic)
New units including mechs and attack craft
A new full-color map (30" x 22.5”, divided into 9 sections)
500+ unit counters (full-strength & damaged sides) & markers (minefields, bridges, and craters)
Six new scenarios including a grand campaign using the new battle map and the one from the original game.
Straight-forward rules for fast gameplay

name: Ocean in the Sky
description:
Description from the publisher:

A semi co-operative board game for two to five players, Ocean in the Sky tells the tale of a village in a wondrous post-apocalyptic world where the world is a barren desert because most of the waters in rivers, lakes and oceans has been sucked into the atmosphere and created a huge ocean that surrounds the world.

Now, great flying submarines traverse the skies and dive deep in the ocean in the sky, as the protagonists of the Village vye for power and prestige in their quest to expand and protect their communal holdings.

All the while, however, great mad gods come forth from this strange Ocean, spreading destruction and desolation, abominations that need to be stopped together.

The core of the game is its colorful Characters and their mighty Submarines, aided by Techs and other conquered Villages as they protect their homeland from the terrible Mad Gods. Amass Victory Points by defeating the Mad Gods as well as keeping the goals of your loyal Characters in mind.
categories: Card Game, Fantasy, Print & Play, Science Fiction
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Phase Order

name: Warlord Chess
description:
A new set of rules to play the age-old game for two players, using a chess board and all of the chess pieces. Warlord chess is designed to be simple and easy to learn, but offering a strategic depth and its main goal is to be played with nothing but the typical chess set you can find everywhere.

Players use pawns as Farmers, creating patterns in order to bring forth more powerful units such as Knights, Bishops, and ultimately the King and Queen to win the game- but there's more than one way to win the game!

name: Knockoff
description:
"The Executive Trivia Game". Game consists of six decks of cards, a game board, and four colored markers. The decks are shuffled together, then the players take turns answering questions from the category of their choice (people, places, or things). If the player answers correctly, they move the number of spaces (1-4) indicated at the top of the card. There the player must answer a question in the category dictated by the color of the square they have landed on. The same player continues until they answer incorrectly. Play proceeds clockwise.

Some squares are marked "Knockoff". If a player lands on one of these, they pick the category for their question. If they answer correctly, they may either go again, or "knockoff" an opponent by sending them back to start. The player knocked off now has a turn.

Players win by reaching the end square by exact count of spaces indicated by the card, and correctly answering a question in a category chosen by their opponent. If a player on the end square answers incorrectly, they remain there, and are eligible to be knocked-off by an opponent.

name: Smile
description:
Thrilling family boardgame! In this game players will place Smiley tiles on the board to form chains of the same emotions. Players who does it best wins the game!

In their turn, players place on tile from their hand to the board. Then, they get points according to the number of tiles in the same color and colors neighboring on the Color Wheel. Tiles are joined into chains of the same colors, so you have to place them carefully to gain the most points and block opponents' movements. The game ends when whole board is filled and player with the most points wins the game.

name: Owocowa Kanapka
description:
Mad doctor Sausage invented fusion of bratwurst and fruit! The humanity will never taste ham and sausage again, but they now have fruits in long, square form! Doctor wants to show his invention to the world, so he founded his own restaurant. As chefs in this place, you will make sandwiches from these fruits. Player who makes the most tasty sandwiches wins the game!

In their turn players first roll the dice. Then, they place them on the appropiate spots on the board, which will allow them to collect up to 3 ingredients. Ingredients can be used to prepare the sandwiches. Sandwiches give taste points, player who collects 15 points first wins the game.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Push Your Luck, Set Collection

name: Nowa galaktyka
description:
Spaceship Tailor-10 arrived in new, unknown galaxy. The crew, that means you, will have to research the planets in the galaxy. Send probes and claim the title of the most prolific scientist!

In their turn, players can place one of their probe counters on the edge of two planets. When there is required amount of probes on the planet, player with the most probes on it will claim it, gaining points and opportunity to use the special ability of the planet. Player with the most points at the end of the game wins.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Enclosure, Modular Board

name: S.T.A.R.T.: Small Town Auto Race Track
description: In this 2 to 5 player deck building game, players take turns playing their hands to earn driver points which can be used to take new cards from the track. Some cards can be used to sabotage other players. At the end of each turn a player may leave up to two unplayed cards in their pit for later use. The player with the most victory points in their deck at the end of the game wins.

name: Lanterns: Alpha Demo Decks
description:
Description from the designer:

Lanterns: Alpha Demo Decks

About Lanterns: The War of the Lights, Unofficial & Unauthorized Print N’ Play
Lanterns: The War of the Lights, Unofficial & Unauthorized Print N’ Play is a Print N’ Play sci-fi style, top-down, action/adventure, unofficial and unauthorized group of fan created card games based on the DC Comics Green Lantern propriety. It currently consists in a couple of games that are still under development. Lanterns: The War of the Lights is developed by Justich Fan Productions. Find it at http://www.facebook.com/thewarofthelights.

What you'll need

Some tokens (this can be anything, from pennies to popcorn. We suggest something non-edible)
The 2-Player Starter Deck Pack
A printer
Adobe Acrobat or another PDF viewer installed on your computer.


Instructions for printing

Download the 2-Player Playing Card Pack.
Print onto cardstock (preferred) or regular paper.
The card game pack is set up for double-sided printing, if your printer has that feature. Choose “Flip on long edge” to print both sides simultaneously.
If your printer does not have double-sided printing, in order to get cards that are printed on both sides, you can choose to print only the odd pages first, reverse-order the pages, then place them back into the printer and print the even pages.
If your paper is lightweight, I suggest you print single-sided only and glue two pages together before cutting.
Color printing is highly recommended.



(As all printer setups differ, I cannot provide much troubleshooting with this step. If you're having issues, contact someone you know who you think can resolve it locally)

Once printed, cut out all your cards. Try to give them a uniform appearance.
You're ready to play!


Welcome to Lanterns: Alpha Demo Decks
The Lanterns: Alpha Demo Decks features characters mostly from the 2016 DC Rebirth Event comics up to now. Alpha Demo Decks is the first series of cards and features 28 different cards. It was released in July 2017 on the Lanterns: The War of the Lights Facebook page and features Green Lantern Corps vs. Sinestro Corps displayed as a Print N'Play 62 Cards Two-Player Starter Set.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Collectible Components, Print & Play, Science Fiction, Space Exploration
mechanics: Area Movement, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Open Drafting

name: Crazy DOS
description:
CDOS, short for Crazy DOS and stylized as C:DOS, is a game themed after DOS, more specifically MS-DOS and multi-user Concurrent DOS (CDOS).

"Set in your average office from the late 80s, your task is to transfer the files in a floppy disk before your pesky coworkers crash the server."

Crazy DOS borrows mechanics from Crazy Eights and related games but what makes it a unique game is the use of real DOS commands (most cards represent both a file to "transfer" and a command you can "execute" to protect you from your opponents' actions or to speed up your shedding strategy) and a gameplay that simulates working with networked PCs.

The 18 commands in C:DOS work like they would on the computer: with MD you can create a new directory (pile), CD lets you change the current working directory (the pile where cards/files can be transferred to), CLS cleans your shell (the pile where you execute commands), with ATTRIB you can set files as hidden files (to transfer them face down and bluff), DEFRAG lets you see the contents of piles and reorder the cards/files to your liking...

C:DOS has an educational component in that it can be used to teach players basic computing in general and DOS in particular.

Removing the DOS and PC rules from the game, a deck of Crazy DOS can be used to play what is basically a slightly different version of Crazy Eights, making for a simpler party game that can be used to introduce players to Crazy DOS itself.

name: Adrift
description:
A semi-cooperative resource management survival game, Adrift sees you lost at sea in the Pacific after the sinking of your whaleship, fighting for survival while maintaining the whaleboat the surviving crew are drifting on and managing your thirst and hunger.

3-5 players take on the roles of 19th Century whalers, each with their own unique abilities, trying to survive long enough to reach land while encountering daily events and slowly dying of thirst and hunger.

The number of actions you can take each day depends on how thirsty and hungry you are, so when you only have 1 action left, the boat is about to sink and you desperately need to eat, what will you choose?
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Player Elimination, Set Collection

name: Nebulus the Board Game
description:
Description from the publisher:

Nebulus is a space-exploration game focused around exploring and conquering a new galaxy called Nebulus. The player is one of four galactic entities who have ventured into Nebulus hoping for salvation for their people. Players will construct settlements and stations on planets and stars, mining them for their elements and using those in their efforts to secure their place in the galaxy.

This game is designed for replay-ability for all ages.

name: Multitude Game Set
description:
Description from the publisher:

The Multitude Game Set combines the Strategy of Cards with the Excitement of Dice. This unique game set contains 72 Cards and 50 Dice.

The unique feature of this set is that all of the games use both Cards and Dice. Each game has rules and game play exclusive to this Game Set.

There are 50 different games in the Game Rules Booklet included in this set.

Many of the games in this set are variations of popular card games which have been adapted to integrate dice into the game. There are also some variations of popular dice games which have been adapted to integrate cards. There are also original cards and dice games created to utilize the versatile features of this Game Set.

This exceptional Game Set also includes Board Games which use custom Board Game Cards and dice. Some of the board games are inspired by classic board games and some are original.

There are also some games that use manual dexterity. These games use dice rolling skills where accuracy is used to score points.

The games vary in strategy from simple family games that children can play to highly strategic games and wagering games similar to the classic casino games.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Dice, Game System
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Betting and Bluffing, Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Push Your Luck, Trick-taking

name: Anchors Aweigh
description:
This is an educational board came designed to teach boating safety for both power boats and sailboats. The safety rules are specific to the Canadian market. The players roll a die to move boat shaped pawns around a track and must answer questions to advance. The game also includes boating safety guide books. There are also destination and hazard cards.
This game was developed by three members of the Canadian power and sail squadrons.

name: The Great Crossing
description: This is a race game published sometime in the 1980s. Players race in an ocean crossing across the North Atlantic. The wind direction is adjustable via the wind dial. Players move pawns across a board representing the North Atlantic. There is a movement grid and 80 cards.

name: 26 minutes challenge
description: "26 minutes challenge" is a quiz game about the show "26 minutes" broadcasted on the Swiss television in French language.

name: Dragon's Teeth
description: This is a roll and move game where players move their pawns to the end of a track. Some of the spots on the board are cut out and wooden columns (dragon's teeth) are placed in these gaps supported by the cardboard of a wheel beneath the board. Players rotate the wheel and eventually gaps in the cardboard of the wheel line up with the dragon's teeth causing them to drop below the elevated game board.

name: Professor Davensteev's main idea board game
description: In this reading comprehension educational game, players read question and answer cards to move pawns around a board. There are different versions for different reading skill levels.

name: Bite Me Cutie
description:
Description from the publisher:

'Bite Me Cutie' is a card game combining pop-culture, Japanese anime, adorable animals, and food! 'Bite Me Cutie' contains chibi animals that meet delicious foods only to be fused together to make a collectible “Cutie.” It’s a fast-paced game focused on collecting cuties and trapping other players' cuties. Feed them, collect them, and buff them!

The game contains 3 separate decks: the cutie deck, the flavor deck, and the effect deck. The Cutie deck contains kawaii-style cutie cards you collect. The flavor deck contains food bites to feed and collect the cuties you want. The effect deck has trap and buff cards to save your cuties from harm, or keep other players from collecting cuties they want!

The goal is to have the most valuable collection of cuties when the last cutie is collected. The player with the highest tallied cutie class points wins.

name: Brilliance
description:
Brilliance is a strategic card game in which players try to earn the most points by earning and selling gems.

Play a card on the table to form groups of gems. Take a gem for every group you form. When you sell gems, the price you get is equal to the largest group of that gem on the table.

As the game continues, the values of gems fluctuate, so you want to sell when the price is high. Just don't wait too long! One skillful play by an opponent can drastically reduce the price of your favorite gem!

name: Hoppla Tante
description:
Each player has a set of 4 aunts that start in his or her corner of the board. The goal is to move the aunts around the board to the "home" section. Movement is determined by a die. All players move around the same board, so they may capture each others aunts. Captured aunts are returned to their player's corner and must start their journey over. The green shortcuts may only be used to capture other aunts. If an aunt gets on the same space as another aunt of the same color, they get stacked one on another and form a double-aunt. The double-aunt may move twice the rolled number of spaces. The winner is the first player to move all aunts "home".
Variant: When an aunt captures another aunt she is stacked on top and the captured aunt has to carry the opponent aunt (mixed double-aunt) and may move only half the rolled numbers.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: The Game of Air-Sea Rescue
description:
This game was published with a license from the RAF benevolent fund and was published during WWII (exact date is unknown). The manual describes some aids used to facilitate pilot rescue.

Players roll a die and move a downed pilot up a track. Once the pilot reaches a certain point on the track a spotter plane launches from the other end of the track. The player may only move the pilot or the spotter plane. Once they meet at a specified point on the board, then a rescue ship is launched from the end of the track and must go meet the pilot at which point they move to the end of the board and rescue.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement

name: 7 ühe hoobiga
description:
There are 52 different animals and information about these animals on the cards and You can play 7 different variants more and less similar to Top Trumps.

Draw the top card from Your deck, ask either average lifespan, weight and offspring and who has the biggest number in this category take the trump.

name: The Spanish Main
description: Vintage spin and move game. Players are traveling across the board so many steps as shown on spin indicator. The first player, who occupies Merchantman square wins the game.

name: Gloup!
description:
A fun game which enhances memory and logic skills. Knowing that goats eat cabbages, that wolves eat goats and that all of them fear dogs, how will you cross a river with wolves, goats, dogs and cabbages without losing too many of them? Rules are simple, the goal is to earn as many points as possible by saving "passengers" (animals or vegetables).

Each player begins the game with a hand of 4 cards taken from his own Passenger deck. Each turn, the active player reveals the top card from a common Placement deck, perform the appropriate action by playing a card from her hand, then discards it. She may also optionally play an Action card from her hand if she has any left.

Passenger cards are cards picturing animals (Wolf, Goat or Shepperd dog) or vegetables (Cannage), while Action cards have an effect on all players.

Players must fill boats with 3 passengers before they leave for the Island where the passangers will disenbark. Players must keep in mind that when disembarking, Goats will eat Cabbages and Wolves will eat Goats, unless there's a Shepperd dog in the boat to check on everyone. Players get points for all Passengers getting safely to the Isaland.

The game ends when a players plays the last Passenger card from his hand, which triggers the last turn. Players add-up all their points and the one with the most points wins!

name: Tact
description:
Description from the designer:

Tact is the quick game of pure negotiation.

In this 10-minute alternative to Diplomacy (One Night Ultimate Diplomacy, perhaps), players receive one colour card each and have one minute to talk to other players and submit their order cards detailing which player they will attack and with whom (if anyone) they will ally. When it comes time to submit orders, however, those alliances may count for nothing. Points are earned for successfully attacking and for not being attacked and are tallied to crown the winner.

Wheel, deal, backstab and betray. Make friends, make enemies. A winning strategy just takes a little Tact.
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Negotiation, Print & Play
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Super-Letra-Mix
description: Super-Letra-Mix combines the games of Letra-Mix and Letra-Mix: Spiel mit Sätzen in one box.

name: Dilemma Holdem: The Dilemma of Investors
description:
User summary:
ジレンマホールデム～投資家達のジレンマ～ (Jirenma Ho-rudemu ~Toushika Tachi no Jirenma~) is DILEMMA HOLDEM ~The dilemma of investors~, a variation on the Poker game Texas Hold'em. The game has a deck of 40 cards ranked Ace to 10, in four suites; Fuel, Bio-chemistry, Securities, Grain. Every card also has a Bonus or Penalty. Some cards have a special ability, activated when in a player's hand or when showing as a table card. Otherwise, text on cards is for flavour.

This game also has a secondary pot, the Bank. The winner of a round gains a bonus from the bank, the losers (players who didn't fold, still active in the round) pay penalties to the Bank. The bonus and penalties depend on table cards. Therefore, in this game, players are allowed to fold whilst others check, since a player may want to get out of the round when they see the penalties.

The Bank also serves as the game timer. There are three Banks made at the start of the game. Each time a Bank is depleted, the next Bank starts but the minimum bet is raised. When the third Bank is exhausted, the game is over.

The text on the cards is fairly simple (for example: 'you don't have to pay the penalty as the loser' or 'the bonus values for Grains is doubled this round". So whilst a player might use a crib-sheet, this would give away their Poker hand. Using paste-ups on the cards would be better for foreign players.

Description from the publisher:
Themed on investors. Game mechanics based on Texas Hold-em poker. One major feature is, in addition to players' bet, you may gain bonus chips or pay penalties depending on your hands and/or community cards.

『投資』がテーマのゲームです。
テキサスホールデムのルールがベースになっています。
プレイヤー同士が賭け合うチップの他に場札次第でボーナスやペナルティが発生するのが特徴です。
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Hand Management, Player Elimination, Set Collection
publishers: Joururi Soft Ten'yu-dan (浄瑠璃ソフト天遊団)

name: Peanuts Gag Grab
description:
A board game for 2-4+ players with a Charlie Brown, Snoopy, Peanuts theme.

There are 2 decks:
- The Gag Deck - These cards form the board. They are claimed by players and are worth gag points. In order to be claimed the player must move his pawn onto that card and discard 2 Kid cards of the indicated type.
- The Kid Deck - There are 2 basic types of Kid Cards: main characters and Peanut gallery. There are 4 sets of main characters: Charlie Brown, Snoopy, Linus and Lucy, with 10 identical cards in each set. There are 12 Peanut Gallery cards each listing one supporting character.

The board is a 6 X 6 grid with each space containing 1 face-up gag card. As gag cards are claimed during play they are replenished from the Gag Deck. The game ends when a gag card needs to be replaced on the board, and there are none left in the Gag Deck.

Players start with their pawns in separate corner spaces of the board and with 2 Kid cards in hand. Players take turns, with each turn comprising 5 phases:

1. Draw Phase
- Draw 2 Kid Cards from the top of the Kid Deck and put them in your hand. If your pawn is adjacent to any opponent’s pawns, you may trade Kid cards from your hands. Trades must be agreeable to both parties.

2. Roll Phase
- Roll one die.

3. Move Phase
- You may move your pawn a number of spaces equal to the number you rolled in roll phase OR less. Moves may be orthogonal or diagonal. You may not land in the same space occupied by another pawn though you may move through (past, over) other player’s pawns.

4. Claim Phase
- You may claim the Gag card in the space your pawn currently occupies. Each Gag card lists 2 Kid cards that must be discarded in order to claim it. Place the claimed card into your Gag pile. Replace the gag card you just claimed with the top card of the Gag deck. If there are no Gag cards left, the game ends.

5. End Phase
- Max hand size is 7 cards. Discard excess cards.

The secondary character cards in the Kid Deck have a variety of extra uses:
• Discard 1 card to increase the result of a roll by 1 or 2.
• Discard 2 cards to draw 3 Kid Cards and discard any 2 from your hand.
• Discard 2 cards to cause a target Gag card on the board to be discarded and then replaced.
• Discard 1 card to get a second move roll.
• Discard 1 card after you have made a Claim to get an extra Roll, Move, and Claim phase.

The player with the most gag points at the end of the game wins.
categories: Card Game, Comic Book / Strip, Dice

name: Mary Kay-Opoly
description:
Description from the publisher:

Mary Kay-Opoly is a game celebrating the 50th Anniversary of one unique company - Mary Kay! Collect highlights and increase the rent by adding Car Keys and trading them in for Crowns. It's all fun and games until you're sent to Cancelled Party, and you're out of the game for three turns!

Play to be your own Success Story!

Choose your token and advance to Start! Who knows - you may soon be qualified to drive a brand-new Mary Kay Cadillac or you might lose your date book on the way to a Career Conference! Whatever happens, it's going to be done... the Mary Kay Way!
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Stock Holding, Trading
publishers: Late for the Sky Production Company

name: 13 Minutes At The Speed Of Light
description:
Description from the designer:

An accident of physics has flung your starship at light speed! You need only to endure 13 minutes until the engine runs out of fuel. All that stands between you and rescue is Outer Space...

13 Minutes At The Speed Of Light is an asymmetrical game of cosmic strategy and manipulation. A team of Astronauts attempts to survive ever increasing waves of danger from Outer Space.
In Cooperative play, you command four Astronauts in their frantic fight to survive. In Competitive play, one player takes the role of Outer Space, and all other players command the four Astronauts.

Rounds looks like this: (1) Outer Space plays a Card Game: drawing a hand of hazards and laying them in ambush on the table. (2) The Astronauts play a Worker Placement Game: positioning workers around the ship to use its defenses. (3) Players compare Space’s cards with the Astronauts’ workers, dealing damage wherever defenses fell short.

Outer Space wins if it manages to kill enough Astronaut workers in order to achieve victory. Astronauts win if they manage to keep enough of their workers alive until Outer Space runs out of hazard cards.

name: Learn English: Play and have fun
description:
Description from the publisher (translated):

With Learn English children will have a fun experience while learning through playing.

Learn English can be played for fun, but has been though up as an entertaining supplement to English teaching in the lower grades (0th to 3rd grade). The game is based on the thought that younger children learn best when they do so by their own choice, and remember best when they learn through playing. With Learn English children will be challenged on their own level, so they will learn actively, inquisitively and playing.

Playing is a good way to learn, and especially in the lower grades it will be beneficial to learn in a playful way, which is the reason Learn English is focusing on playing.

Learn English comes with 60 picture tiles and 60 word tiles with a focus to create or increase the children's vocabulary with words from their daily life. Learn English consists of several small games with increasing difficulty, including variants of memory and picture-lottery with a focus on English words.

Learn English:

Increases the children's English vocabulary with words from their daily life.
Strengthen the children's pronunciation of English words.
Gives the children a sense of connection between the written and spoken English language.

name: quizzone stories 3
description:
quizzone stories 3 is a trivia game with 100 cards each containing 1 picture and 6 questions. The first question is based around the picture - the next is based on the answer to the first question and so on.

When the game ends can be freely decided and it is therefore a great game to bring on a road trip and the like... The winner is of course the one with the most correct answers.

quizzone stories 3 can be combined with any other quizzone stories box, or be played on it's own.

name: INSIG I
description:
A (not entirely serious) Division level game published in OVERKILL magazine. It covers the German reoccupation of the Rhineland on 7th March, 1936. Players take either the invading German or defending French forces.

The game can be played solo, although this is better done playing the German side.

name: Wine Rating: Vintage Upgrade Pack
description: A small expansion to the Japanese game Wine Rating. This expansion comes in a red envelope and is made up of eight new cards to add to the base game: two each of Premium, Monopole, Decant, and Grand Cru.
publishers: JUGAME STUDIO (ジュゲムスタジオ)

name: Feetball
description:
A new type of Fantasy Football is here!
​
Watch football and play Feetball, predicting what will happen each play using Feetball Cards and the game board. Out-gain and out-score your opponents, advancing your Feetball team down the field with every play you call. Pick up Audible Cards along the way to shake things up like steal cards, double yards, play multiple cards, sack your opponent, swap field position, and more.
​
There's no such thing as garbage time anymore. No matter what football game is on TV, there is an intense and competitive Feetball game waiting to happen!
mechanics: Area Movement, Point to Point Movement

name: Supplement One: Adaptation of Ancient Rules to 14/15th Century Warfare
description:
This supplement expanded the Second Edition of the rules to account for wargamming the 14th and 15th century battles. The rules adapted troop types and reaction tables for the medieval armies. The rule were design for use in the 1970 Wargames National Championships.

Note: The title on the cover of the supplement is "Adaptation f Ancient Rules to 14/15th Century Warfare" while the title in the header on the interior of the rules is "Adaption of Ancient Rules to 14/15th Century Warfare."
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Renaissance, Wargame

name: Antarus 7
description:
In Antarus 7 you are a prospector competing with other prospectors for a mining contract on an asteroid. Use your Drones to gather minerals and combat your opponents Drones. You can use minerals to build new Drones and upgrade your Drones defense, attack, movement and cargo capacity. Be the first player to gather 10 units of Altonium to win the game.. or simply destroy your opponents the choice is yours.

Antarus 7 is a 2-4 player game with game time averaging 60-90 minutes. With three ways to win and several strategies you will have fun playing Antarus 7 over and over!
mechanics: Grid Movement, Player Elimination, Set Collection, Take That

name: Dancing Spinner Game
description:
The object is to equip your dancer with a costume, head piece, bag, music, and bouquet. Each player selects a dancer and give her a name. The spinner is twirled and items are gathered to match each category. For example, the costume might be a beautiful dress, the bag might be a knapsack, and the bouquet might be summer flowers. Players can collect matching items (to dress a ballerina, for example) or mix and match for a silly version. The first player to complete an ensemble is declared the winner.

Includes four doll displays, four complete outfits, a spinner, and a storage bag. The components are sturdy cardboard cutouts.
The doll displays are 10 inches tall.

name: Land, Air, & Sea
description:
A simple dice game designed by Jonathan Tweet (On the Edge, Hecatomb, Dreamblade), that was made freely available on the Wizards of the Coast website in the late 1990s.

From the publisher's website in 1998:

Game Design by Jonathan Tweet. If you really like it, you can send a toy dinosaur to the designer c/o Wizards of the Coast.

Goal

Control two out of the three battle zones to win the war.

Summary

There are three battle zones: land, air, and sea.

Each player has two boxes per battle zone. Players take turns rolling a die and writing the number rolled in any open box--including an opponent's.

The two numbers in a player's battle zone are multiplied together to determine that player's strength in that battle zone. The player with the highest strength in a battle zone controls it.

When all twelve boxes are filled, the player who controls two out of three battle zones is the winner.

Setup

Players start with a blank Land, Air, & Sea score sheet, a pen, and a twelve-sided die. (If you don't have a twelve-sided die, any die will do.)

Play

In turn, each player rolls a die and writes the number rolled in any open box on either player's side. (Hint: Put high numbers in your boxes and low numbers in your opponent's boxes.)

When both boxes in a player's battle zone have numbers in them, multiply the numbers together and write the result on the "Strength" blank.

When both players have a result for Strength in a battle zone, circle the higher number. (Cross out both numbers if there's a tie.)

Winning

When all twelve boxes are filled in and all six Strength numbers written down, the player who has higher Strength numbers in at least two battle zones wins the game.

If each player controls one battle zone and the third is a tie, then the game is a tie.

name: Disney's Pocahontas: Gigantik Game
description:
This is a children's game based on the Disney movie Pocahontas. Players take turns rolling a die and moving around the board to collect various leaf tokens. The first player to collect all the leafs and return them to where they belong wins.

The game is played on a "Gigantik" board--a large, plastic playing mat measuring 76x96cm (30"x 38").

From the back of the box:
"Join Pocahontas and all her friends on an adventurous trip to discover the colours of the wind. A gust of wind has blown through Grandmother Willow's enchanted glade and scattered an assortment of coloured leaves into the river. Help Pocahontas, John Smith, Meeko and Flit collect their leaves and return to where they fell from. The first player to return all of their leaves wins the game."
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Hot Button Baseball
description:
Electronic, baseball card game.

Object of the Game: Have the most runs after three innings (or the number of innings you and your opponent decide to play).

PLAYING THE GAME:

Getting Started: Each player selects 10 Hot Button Baseball Cards and puts them in a batting order.


One side chooses a pitcher and the other chooses a hitter. Each slides their card into the appropriate side of the small electronic device. One player then pushes the start button and the device generates a result by lighting up one of the spaces.
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Electronic, Sports

name: Scavengers: A Skirmish Game About Steam and Loot
description:
VERSION 2.0 ARE ON THE WAY!!!!

Description from the designer:

Scavengers is a game that passes in a world different from ours, with a mixture of magic, steampunk, and lots of history. I did not mention it, but I love writing, and during this time I designed the system, I wrote a lot of lore that I intend to put together with the game, My native language is not English, but Portuguese (I was born in Portugal) and I’m translating / Locating all this material for English.

The game was designed thinking in skirmishes combats, small groups of warriors who are fighting each other in pursuit of a larger goal. I have added to this some characteristics that I will present here:


System based on 6-sided dices;
Live system, constantly expanding and with rules entry and new game supplements
1/100 scale (15mm can be used as well)
3D print miniatures available for free
Movement system using tape measure or hexes grid
Action cards to increase the aspects of gameplay
Simple rules that allow the novice player to enter in an easy way in the game and advanced rules system for the more experienced.
2 initial factions: humans and orcs


The game is being released with two initial booklets


Core rules, the basic rules of the game that cover the primary aspects of gameplay
Encyclopedia Belicosa - Official Magazine with supplementary information that will contain: additional rules, game factions, stories and a whole series of information for the player.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Open Drafting

name: Box Battles: Cold War Evolution – Alter-Force 1: Right-Size Eastern Europe
description:
This expansion scales your game of Box Battles: Cold War Evolution with a modular addition for the forces of the Warsaw Pact. Includes miniatures, unit cards, command cards, and additional punch-out counters for the game.

Included miniatures are:
(3) T-62 Tanks
(3) BMP-1 Infantry Vehicles
(3) Motor Rifle Squads
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Modern Warfare, Wargame

name: Box Battles: Cold War Evolution – Alter-Force 2B: Late Decade Tanks, First Platoon
description:
This expansion dials the clock forward for your game of Box Battles: Cold War Evolution with a modular addition for both forces as they each deploy a new tank series. NATO upgrades to the M60A3, and WARPAC releases the fearsome T-72. Includes miniatures, unit cards, command cards, and additional punch-out counters for the game.

Included miniatures are:
(5) M60A3 Tanks
(4) T-72 Tanks
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Modern Warfare, Wargame

name: Box Battles: Cold War Evolution – BattleMatch Kit 1A: Mortar Platoons
description:
This expansion scales up both NATO and Warsaw Pact forces for your game of Box Battles: Cold War Evolution with a modular addition of on-board artillery. Includes miniatures, unit cards, command cards, barrage counters, 3D barrage smoke, and additional punch-out counters for the game.

Included miniatures are:
NATO (3) M106 107mm Self-Propelled Mortars + HQ vehicle
WARPAC (2) MTLB w/ (2) towed PM-43 120mm Mortars and (2) crew minis with mountable grass stripping
(5) sandbag emplacements
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Modern Warfare, Wargame

name: Box Battles: Cold War Evolution – BattleMatch Kit 2A: Tanks, 2nd/3rd Platoon
description:
