This expansion scales your game of Box Battles: Cold War Evolution with a modular addition for the forces of both NATO and the Warsaw Pact. Use this same kit for both 2nd and 3rd Platoons to form your first Armored Company. Includes miniatures, unit cards, command cards, and additional punch-out counters for the game.

Included miniatures are:
WARPAC (5) M60A1 Tanks
WARPAC (3) T-62 Tanks

Included miniatures are:
(5) M60A3 Tanks
(4) T-72 Tanks
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Modern Warfare, Wargame

name: Global Connection
description:
Global Connection is a drawless connection game for two players: Black and White. It is played on the cells of an initially empty hexhex board with eight or ten cells per side. Before the game starts, the perimeter cells of the board, except the six corners, are filled with black and white stones alternating in color. Each corner cell must be adjacent to one stone of each color.

Black plays first, then turns alternate. On your turn, place a stone of your color on an empty cell. When the board is full, the player with the lower score wins. Your score is the number of groups of connected stones of your color including at least one perimeter stone.

To make the game fair, White will have the option, on their first turn only, to swap sides with Black instead of making a regular move.

name: Ghost Pirates: Officer's Club
description: Officer's Club is the first expansion for Ghost Pirates, offering a dozen new Captains to immensely increase the play possibilities.
categories: Card Game, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Pirates

name: Ghost Pirates: Sunken Treasure
description: Sunken Treasure is the second expansion for Ghost Pirates, offering 3 each of six all-new Treasures to scuttle your opponent's strategy.

name: Mountain Man Board Game
description: This is a hunting and wilderness protection themes board game produced by a classic gun manufacturer. It is about the fur trade in the era of the Louisiana purchase. It is a roll and move board game (also has a spinner). Players progress around a board following the tributaries of a river.

name: Navy loto
description:
Description from the publisher (Translated):

GAME PREPARATION:
Each player chooses one of the 6 fish cards, 3 of which are with colors and the other 3 with numbers.
The game box with the fish inside is placed in the center. The fishing rod is placed to one side, within reach of the players.

GAME DEVELOPMENT:
In turns, the player has to fish a fish, turn around to see what he has underneath and if the number or color has it in his fish chart he associates it and places it on top, like a bingo. If you do not have it, leave it with the other fish, with the number or color face down.
The first player to complete his fish card will be the winner of Navy Loto!

Description from the publisher (Spanish):

PREPARACIÓN DEL JUEGO:
Cada jugador escoge una de las 6 cartas pez, 3 de las cuales son con colores y las otras 3 con números.
La caja del juego con los pececitos dentro se coloca al centro, tal y como se observa en la imagen. La caña de pesca se coloca a un lado, al alcance de los jugadores.

DESARROLLO DEL JUEGO:
Por turnos, el jugador tiene que pescar un pez, darle la vuelta para ver lo que tiene debajo y si el número o el color lo tiene en su carta pez lo asocia y lo coloca encima, como si fuese un bingo. Si por el contrario no lo tiene, lo vuelve a dejar junto con los otros peces, con el número o el color boca abajo.
¡El primer jugador que complete su carta pez será el ganador de Navy Loto!

name: Otherworlds Zero
description:
Otherworlds Zero features the core rules of the Otherworlds System, The Oasai Ruins Adventure, optional encounters, six playable characters, detailed backstories and relationship dynamics noted in the book, to make the story come to life, and so much more!

If you're wondering what Otherworlds has to offer, then check out the game's features and benefits:


D6 System: A simple d6 system that allows you to handle any situation with a simple roll of a d6, that doesn't get in the way of the story, but rather lends towards it.



Dynamic Combat: Combat utilizes opposed rolls, so you always feel more involved in the


action! Combat Maneuvers, are special feats you can perform and keep the combat experience fresh and ever-changing to prevent stale combat!


No Two Are The Same: Imagine and play the character you want to play as. Acquire new abilities in an open way, where your character's progression isn't picked for you by a chart allowing you to have the ultimate freedom for character building!



Enhanced Story: Choose your character's Destiny, which will guide their evolving story throughout your adventures. Character connections, personality traits, convictions, and secrets will add many layers to the story that's being created.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Role Playing, Storytelling

name: Clachan
description:
Description from the designer:

Clachan is an abstract strategy game inspired by Draughts, Connect 4, and Go. Clachan is named after the Scottish Gaelic word for "stones".

Clachan is played on a board that can be used as a 5x5, 7x7 or 9x9 board. The goal of Clachan is to create a line of stones from one side of the board to the other while your opponent works against you by blocking your progress or capturing your stones. The game is over when a player either creates a line which results in a win, or the board is filled with no lines created resulting in a draw. During the game players may place new stone, move existing stones, and capture opponent stones.
mechanics: Grid Movement, Network and Route Building

name: Mercenaries
description:
Mercenaries incorporates a mix of a tabletop game with the strategy of a deck building game. Players move around a grid while fighting monsters using cards from their hand. Be careful though, only the player that lands the killing blow gets the glory! Players must strategize when to attack, when to defend, and where to stand. Players also have to contend with other players using their abilities to turn the game on its head, charging ahead of the pack, making a monster retaliate against someone else, or coercing other players into helping.

This is a deck building game that incorporates strategical movement on a tabletop board. We have removed as many dice as possible to prevent the game from being too luck based, allowing your own strategies by what cards you acquire to thrive. The game also has multiple strategic levels. What cards to acquire, where to move on the board, and when to attack. All of these can alter what other players might be planning!
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Paper-and-Pencil, Role Playing, Team-Based Game

name: Swinegel
description:
This game is about the race between the hare, the hedgehog and the hedgehogs wife. Movement ist determined by two spinners, one for the hare and one for the hedgehogs. The hedgehogs have to complete the track once from and start in opposite directions. The hare has to run the track twice (back and forth), so he ends at his starting space.
There are obstacles on the track (trenchs, fences, hedges, furrows, crossroads) which hinder hare and hedgehogs differently. Every time the hare passes a hedgehog the player has to shout:" Hoppla Swinegel (oops hedgehog)". If a hedgehog passes the hare the player shouts: "Ick bün allhier (I'm already here)".The first player to reach his destination space wins the game.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Dick Pics
description:
You’re having a great day. You won a hip hop dance contest, got a raise, and even fought off a bear! Then BAM some asshole sends you a dick pic. Day ruined.

So goes the card game of Dick Pics.

Dick pics is a party game that allows you and your friends to live through hilariously relatable events in your day, positive and negative. As you play the game, you build your ‘day’ by placing event cards on the table. Even if you have a negative event on the table, there are action cards you can play to change the tide of your day (as well as your opponents’). These actions include acting, confessing, bluffing, and general sabotage. The ultimate ‘fuck you’ action is to send another player a Dick Pic, which wipes their day of all positive events..

The player who manages to complete a full day of 5 positive events wins the game. You can even take it a step further and gloat to your opponents about how great your day was by telling a winning story using your cards.

name: Uh!
description:
Description from the publisher:

Uh! is a fast and furious card game based on the Machiavelli's mechanics. The deck is composed by cards inspired at the cave men world (torches, bowls, flints, etc.). Aim of the game is to remain without cards before the other players, combining them in succession or triplets. You can add or subtract cards on the desk and draw from the deck if and when you want. The thrilling of the game is that there's no turn: all players play at the same time, so you have to be smart, fast and aggressive.

name: NumBugz
description:
NumBugz is a game platform that provides a range of unique, fun, competitive and stimulating family games using six sets of 25 Bugz and a 30-second timer all packed in a handy travel bag.

There are lots of different games to play from the most challenging numbers game Colonyz (think Scrabble with numbers where the aim is to be the first to link your set of Bugz to the Colony), the Strategy game Legionz (try to build the longest legion whilst blocking your opponents), memory and concentration games Memorize and Pairz, or quick fun games of 25z, SumBugz and the easiest of them all Sequenz and Sortz. Games range from age 4+ to adult and as there are new games are being developed all the time, there should be something for everyone.

NumBugz comes with English, German, French, Italian and Spanish rules - all of which can be found on www.plyt.co.uk - but because new games are being added all the time, the pack only contains the rules for Colonyz.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Memory, Pattern Building, Set Collection, Tile Placement

name: Whotchilli
description:
Whotchilli consists of a deck of 36 chilli cards and a 12-sided die. In the pack are three different games for people who enjoy competitive, fun, and mentally stimulating family card games - but there are rules to more games available on the www.plyt.co.uk website (such as Scorchio and Holy Moly) with new games being developed all the time.

Lookin' Hot is about reading the minds of your opponents to work out whotchilli they're playing while using cunning and skill to bluff and double bluff each other. The hottest player wins the game leaving everyone else feelin' chilli. A fast, fun game for 3 to 6 players

Salsa is a game of logic for 2 to 6 players as you try to work out whotchillis are in your opponent's Salsa recipe. Build your rating and try to be the first to unlock the recipe.

Chilly Chilli is a game for 2 to 6 players where you try to stay cool by remembering whotchillis have moved where. The coolest hand wins the game.
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Deduction, Memory, Number

name: Lanterns: Red Dawn Board Game
description:
Description from the designer:

On this Print N’Play Board Game your goals are simple: Acquire a Treasures/Loot, fight Villains and discover/explore the MAX number of Locations on Lanterns.
As a little treat we decided to make the cards from this board game 100% compatible with the others upcoming Lanterns products, but for now the Lanterns: Red Dawn is designed to be a Stand Alone Game, so that is our focus today.
What you'll need:

Two (2) Dice [regular D6 dice];
Some tokens (this can be anything, from pennies to popcorn. But we suggest something non-edible);
The playing cards:
4 Characters Cards (Jessica, lvl 1-2; Simon lvl 1-2; Bleez, lvl 1-2 & Krunn, lvl 1-2)
12 Sectors Cards (Locations Cards)
36 Tactics Cards (9 Characters Cards, 9 Moments Cards, 9 Tackles Cards & 9 Dilemmas Cards)
9 Prize Cards (7 Relics Cards & 2 No Luck Blank Cards)



Lanterns: Red Dawn is a board game which you control a Lantern in a journey to gather 7 Relics on Lanterns to save the world from the impending doom. Your enemies are other Lanterns, you may even find a mirror image of your own, curse those Technomancers and their cloning, that run for the possession of the 7 Relics to control the world of Lanterns.
You have your Lantern in play at the start of the game. He’s your main force. You also have a 25 – card deck minimum. Your Deck contains the various resources to which you may have access: Tackles, Moments, Companions, and other stuff.
You start the game laying down some cards that will act like your Sectors board. Then you choose some Dilemmas cards and place them beneath them. Next you'll place some prize cards beneath them. Then you'll be ready to start.
Roll a dice and place your character on the respective Sector card. Then you'll turn that card and see if you have all the card skills (the necessary card skills will be printed on the Sectors cards). If you meet all the skill you may see what the card Dilemma card says. if you manage to survive the Dilemma card. You may see what your Prize card is.
You win the game when you gather the 7 Relics or when you defeat your entire opponent’s on the board!
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Exploration, Print & Play, Space Exploration
mechanics: Action Queue, Area Majority / Influence, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Player Elimination

name: Lanterns: Agent Orange Quest!
description:
Description from the designer:

Welcome to Lanterns: Agent Orange Quest!
Lanterns: Agent Orange Quest! is a print n'play board game where you play all by yourself with the objective to entice a variety of exotic and dangerous (or not) Lanterns Characters! They're all mine!!!

1.0 Game Overview
Each game of Lanterns: Agent Orange Quest! represents one quest in the Lanterns Universe. Your job is to make a trap powerful enough to catch the Lanterns. Each Quest you make brings you closer to victory. Each Quest is split into a series of Waves. Once a Wave starts, you must struggle to keep control because at any moment you may loose your momentum. As you gain experience, your most effective Traps are unleashed. Each Trap has different capabilities, so be sure to choose the one that is right for you.

Objective
It's just you against the clock. Can you beat the game in time to capture all the Lanterns Characters?

Lanterns: Agent Orange Quest! is fully compatible with all previous Lanterns: The War of The Lights releases!!!

name: Star Wars: Box Busters – Asteroid Field Chase & Endor Attack
description:
Description from the back of the box:

"ASTEROID FIELD CHASE Han Solo made the decision to pilot the Millennium Falcon into an asteroid field in an attempt to lose the Imperial pursuers. ENDOR ATTACK The Galactic Empire established an outpost on the planet that included a shield generator complex to protect the incomplete Death Star II which was in orbit around the moon."

To play Star Wars Box Busters each player needs their own Battle Cube, which is a small folding diorama. Each Battle Cube has a unique combination of capabilities.

While Asteroid Field Chase is exclusive to this two-pack, Star Wars: Box Busters – Endor Attack was also sold as an individually packaged item.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Player Elimination, Variable Player Powers

name: Reef Madness
description:
Reef Madness features the battle for survival between predator and prey. One player takes on the role of the fish, who is trying to navigate the ever-shifting reef and escape the shark. Meanwhile, the other player endeavors to find the shark its next meal.

The game plays out on a 5x5 grid made of double-sided cards, with one additional card. On a player's turn, first the reef must be shifted. The player chooses any row or column that wasn't just shifted by the other player and doesn't contain any player tokens. All the cards in the selected row or column are moved by one space in the grid, thus changing the map layout. After shifting the reef, the player moves according to the rules for their role.

The fish player wins if they can move across the reef and move off the shark player's map edge, while the shark player claims victory if they can land on or move over the fish player's token.

name: Bezique
description:
Description from the designer:

The classic card game Bezique, ON A BOARD. Create melds and runs directly ON THE BOARD for points while you block your opponents from doing the same.

This is a Board-Game VERSION of the old card game. Fun and addictive with many strategies to explore. If you like the game SEQUENCE and CONNECT 4, even a good Chess Game, you will enjoy BEZIQUE, the Board Game.

ORIGIN: (Bésigue is a 19th-century French melding and trick-taking card game for 2 TO 4 players. It's derived from Piquet; The peculiar liaison of the Q♠ and J♦ is also a feature of Pinochle, and similar games).
mechanics: Hand Management, Player Elimination, Take That

name: Light of the Gospel
description:
Don't let your LIGHT go out!

A Christian Board Game designed to get you acquainted with the Gospel message of the Bible.

(1) Keep the LIGHT of your churches burning and be the first to build the Temple of God with 12 candlesticks.

(2) Keep your churches from dying as Babylon and going to the graveyard!

Game Play: Players take turns answering questions from the Trial Cards included with the game. A right answer allows you to gain candlesticks by moving a slider clip UP on your church card. A wrong answer will cause you to lose candlesticks by moving the clip DOWN. The number of spaces to move up or down is determined by the complexity of the question and is stated on the Trial Cards.

The first player to maximize his/her church card by reaching the top (12 candlesticks) has successfully built the Temple of God!

A player who loses the last of his or her candlesticks (bottom of the church card) loses that church. It dies as Babylon and should be flipped over.

name: Cubicle Raiders
description:
You wrote your resume, you nailed the interview and now you’re a manager at your new company. There’s just one thing, the only way to earn your seniority is by trading for it; with office supplies. You’ll need to recruit a team and search through desks on your break to find the supplies you need. Trade the supplies in the break room to the department requesting them and try not to break any drawers in the process. You have one work week to get your seniority and you’ll need to get it by any means necessary or lose your job!

Cubicle Raiders consists of 5 Days (rounds) and each Day there will be a number of Breaks(turns) determined by the Department card for that day. During their turn, each player will be able to pick 2 of 3 actions: Search, Trade or Recruit. To Search, a player will move their meeple to a drawer on one of the desk cards that has a supply they need. They will then roll the Search Die to determine if they successfully found the supply, did not find it or broke the drawer. If they found the supply they add the amount to their supply tracker, if they broke the drawer that drawer is no longer searchable. If more than 50% of a desk’s drawers are broken that desk is no longer searchable, if 2 desks are no longer searchable the day is over.

To Trade, a player moves their meeple to the breakroom and trades only the supplies the current department is looking for. Each supply is worth so many seniority points determined by the trade ratio on the players supply card. Each player can trade up to 5 Seniority Points worth of each supply during their trade action. To Recruit, a player must move their meeple to the breakroom, they can then recruit another employee by paying the recruit’s seniority point cost, this is identified on the recruit’s card. These recruits add special abilities to help the player in the game.

After the last day is over the player with most Seniority Points wins!

—description from the publisher

name: Mountain Raiders
description:
Story and Concept
A huge treasure is waiting for the brave MOUNTAIN RAIDERS on the top of Mountain. Master three digit additions along the way.
We have done extensive research to develop this unique game board. It comes with a special 20 faced dice and built-in challenges along with hours of fun. At the same time, you will be mastering addition skills like no one else! Go MOUNTAIN RAIDERS!

Skills
• Addition
• Number recognition
• Number sequencing
• Speed
• Analytical thinking
• Flexibility
• Cognitive and Developmental skills

Practice jump
11 times over class time and worksheets
At Logic Roots, we are passionate about Math and work with the vision of Reinventing how kids practice Math through gamification of its concepts. Our Board Games, Card Games and Apps are widely used by top schools and homeschooling parents to help their boys and girls fall in love with Math. These games are best used for Learning, Education and gifting purposes for children.

Target group
Grade 1 and above || 6 years and above

Contents of the box
• Special 20 faced dice with numbers from 0 to 19
• 1 Mountain board with custom number layout
• 4 raider coins
• 4 write and wipe Logic Slates
• 1 rule book
• 1 Game themed wall poster

name: Outnumber
description:
Story and theme
Welcome to OUTNUMBER, a place where numbers live with their families. As in life, each family here has a unique and quirky personality and style. The yogic 4s, the angry 3s or the beautiful 9s, all stay at OUTNUMBER. Each family has a Papa Number (Number in words), Mama Number (Number in count) and two little kids (English and Hindi numeral). Here is your chance to make them your friends for life.
Have hours of fun in this addictive numbers game. The revolutionary design and play rules give story and personality to each number. You will notice an instant improvement in number recall. Master the most fundamental math skill – the number system

Skills
• Recognition of number shapes
• English Numerals
• Counting
• Sequencing and comparison
• Number in words
• Addition
• Flexibility

Practice Jump
6 Times more than class. OUTNUMBER comes with specific game plays for each Math skill. For example
• Match up – game play with 20 game cards to practice number recognition
• Bazaar – game play with 30 cards to practice Number to words

Target Group
KG and above

Contents
• 1 hand crafted wooden hut – the number home
• 60 thick and glossy number cards
• 1 rule book

name: Sick Puppy
description:
Description from the designer:

The local dog shelter has too many animals on hand due to a puppy explosion, and many of these are puppies which require treatment for various health issues. You take on the role of a veterinarian, and your goal is to cure the most puppies of the most maladies.

The object of the game is to amass the most victory points (VPs) by curing puppies, which appear at the start of and during the game. Each puppy will have a certain number of (fixed and random) maladies and a VP rating.

Players have a hand of cards which are used to cure the puppies' ailments. At the start of a player's turn s/he draws a card and may cure a puppy if willing and able to do so, taking the card and its VPs. A card may need to be discarded into a face-up discard pile, from which the next player may draw.

A few special cards offer unique choices to the lucky player who draws one. The game plays quickly, has surprisingly tough choices, and can end in three ways. The vet with the most VPs wins!

KICKSTARTER CAMPAIGN COMING SOON!

name: Canon: The Card Game – New Testament Edition
description:
The debates in the history of the church were heated, but the game based on them is fun to play! You, your cards, and your opponents will determine what is in the canon - but it is up to you to be the player whose own canon matches the central one most closely and most often, to earn the most points.

Each player begins with a hand of five cards. Throughout the game, players will collectively play cards into and take cards from a set of seven central canon cards. Players also play into and take cards from their own personal set of seven canon cards. On a turn, players can draw a card or play a card. Cards can be drawn from the central canon, personal canon, draw stack, or discard pile. Cards can be played into the central canon, personal canon, or discard pile. Matching cards can be placed on top of each other in subsequent turns, which can make it more difficult to remove a card from the central canon or make that stack of cards in your personal canon worth many more points. The game ends the turn after the draw pile is depleted. Final scoring is determined by the number of cards in each player's personal canon that match the central canon.

The New Testament Edition includes passages from the New Testament of the Christian Bible.

name: New England Town Meeting
description:
User summary:

You roll dice and move your pawn that many space along a path through the town. There are incidents in your path concerning the town meeting as you progress to the town common. You may lose a turn, return to start, go forward or go back depending on what the space tells you to do. The die determines how many spaces you move. The incidents are believable and reflects what could actually happen before or during an actual town meeting. First player to reach the town common wins!

name: Growby
description:
User summary:

Growby is a tile laying game. The tiles are square. Each corner of every tile is colored (so that the interior of the tile is a blank diamond that has a number inscribed). Players lay tiles from their hand in a square grid trying to match up the colors on their tiles corners with the colors on the orthogonally adjacent tiles. The more colors that match, the more points that are received for that tile placement.

If a player can not place a tile, she must draw tiles until she is able to place a tile. Each tile drawn this way results in negative five points.

Games are played to 1000 points.

The tiles are wooden. This game was hand made in a limited run in 1988. At least 155 games were produced. A patent was applied for to protect the game but was not granted.

name: Minnesota Trivia Tour
description: This game has cards similar to trivia pursuit cards, but has no board. Players take turn answering cards to score two points for a correct answer. First to 30 point wins. The questions are all about Minnesota, and the categories are: geography, sports/leisure, business/science, nature/outdoors, and Potpourri & the arts.

name: Horse-Smart
description:
This is an educational game set for young horse riders. It contains four games packaged together.

Game 1 - Horse Talk: This is a game about reading horse body language and understanding horse sounds.

Game 2 - Safe And Sound: A board game involving chance and skill. This game educates players about safety rules when catching, Grooming, Riding and putting away horses.

Game 3 - Parts Of The Horse: Players identify and label the parts of the horse using clues in six categories (Rhymes, Anagrams, Word Associations, Fill in the Blanks, Horse Facts, and Descriptions). It has a rigid plastic game board.

Game 4 - Bits And Pieces: A card game that is based on both luck and skill. This game is educational about tack and equipment.

The games are packaged with "The Horse-Smart Activity Book".

name: Activity 4: Stadt-Land-Spielt Promo Cards
description: 11 Stadt-Land-Spielt promo cards for Activity 4 with 6 game titles on each card.

name: Jammie Dodg'ems Game
description:
The object of the game is for the Jammie Dodgers to try and move from the start line to a Jammie Heart on the finish line without losing their lives to Danger Dodger.

Before the Jammie Dodgers move, Danger Dodger secretly records which square he will move to.

The Jammie Dodgers move and then Danger Dodger moves.
If Danger Dodger lands on a Jammie Dodger the Jammie Dodger loses a life.

The game ends when everyone has had a turn as Danger Dodger.

The winner is the player with most points.

name: Papilio
description:
Four small caterpillars set off on a big journey to the prettiest and biggest flower in the meadow. The luck of the dice decides on how far each caterpillar gets to it. After having arrived on the big flower, the correct pair of wings must be found yet, in order to transform the small caterpillars into a beautiful butterfly.

Develops: Colour recognition and color matching, Fine motor skills, memory, Knowledge of different types of flowers and development stages (caterpillar- butterfly)

name: Doodle Monster
description:
Using the Monster templates, each player tries to draw his or her own Doodle Monster using the Monster Card as a guide. In each round, one body part can be added and is decorated with a pattern. The winner is the player who succeeds in drawing his or her monster first.

Have you already met Julius the Dragon? He lives with his friends, nimble little Filine the Mouse and Paula the wise owl, in a big old castle where lots of thrilling stories are hidden
away, just waiting for you to discover them.

Julius and Filine are feeling excited as they sit in front of the old fireplace in the castle. Paula has promised them a big surprise. In the castle library she has found an old book about
monsters. She says the word “monsters” in a mysterious whisper. Julius’ and Filine’s eyes open wide. “These monsters are everywhere in the castle. They are friendly and playful. They can change their colours and their patterns”, wise owl Paula goes on. “Yippee! Let’s go on a big monster hunt!” they all shout.

Have you ever seen a monster? Try to collect as many shapes and patterns as you can for your own special Doodle Monster.

name: Tark Mees Taskus mängude komplekt
description: This set contains: Tark Mees Taskus, Tark Mees Taskus 2 and Tark Laps Taskus. All three decks may be played separately or shuffled with each other.

name: whatchamaCARDit
description:
Description from the publisher:

whatchamaCARDit is a fast moving card game that rewards strategic play, a sharp mind and a little bit of sneakiness, but doesn’t require strategy or a sharp mind to have a great time.

Collect Single and Combo Collection Cards to be the first player to spell whatchamaCARDit while using CAPTUREit, REQUESTit and REVEALit Cards against other players to improve a hand, but watch out for the BLOCKit Card.

Win on one’s own turn, or on another player’s turn. Just be the first player to collect/spell and shout whatchamaCARDit.

name: Gobby +
description:
Mouthpiece game similar to Speak Out and Watch Yo Mouth!.
There are 2500 phrases, 20 mouthpieces and sand timer.
This game includes red deck for adults only.

Player must say a phrase with a mouthpiece until somebody guesses it or timer runs out. If one phrase is guessed but there are still time left He/She may continue.

The player or team who collected the most cards wins the game and becomes the Gob Master

name: Trailer Park Boys Park Wars
description:
Bring the Trailer Park home...to your kitchen table. This print and play tabletop war-game pits two or more players against each other in an attempt to raise the most cash before time runs out.
Players each have a set of goals (scams) they are trying to accomplish, while trying to prevent the opposing team(s) from doing the same. Alternatively, players can choose to simply start a trailer park brawl, and try to be the only team with characters left at the end of the game.
Each character has unique abilities to choose from, and any character can work with any other - if you so choose. So make your team of characters, and get ready to rule the trailer park.
Printable characters are provided as part of the game, but players are encouraged to use the miniatures from the Trailer Park Boys board game as well.
categories: Fighting, Humor, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Print & Play, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Pick-up and Deliver, Variable Player Powers

name: After Everyone's Dead The Game
description:
“You can’t lose hope. Without hope, then you have nothing.”

Based on the hit novel, After Everyone’s Dead, this game pits a team of heroes against a hoard of zombies. Choose your side in the fight, a hero trying to get to the safe house or a zombie trying to turn all humans into flesh eating zombies like themselves!

Ever want to take out a hoard of your friends who turned into zombies?

Ever find yourself as a zombie trying to kill your friends?

In After Everyone’s Dead the game, now you can!

Two teams, one human one zombie battle against each other.

Customize the board however you want! With thousands of board layout combinations, every game is a new adventure!

Play on a small layout with a few friends for a short fun game, or a larger layout for a more open experience.

Use weapons like guns, hammers, and rockets to take out your enemies

Be careful though because a human might switch teams if they die, turning into a blood thirsty zombie!

To win, the humans must get the key and make their way to the safe house. For the Zombies to win all they have to do is eat every human brain.

So do you have what it takes to survive a zombie outbreak? Or do you have what it takes to devour your friends?
mechanics: Area Movement, Grid Movement, Team-Based Game

name: Malware Containment (Malcon)
description:
English Summary:
We can simulate a series of security incident response　with playing "Malware Containtment(Malcon)"
As a member of CSIRT, players investigate and contain terminals infected with malware in the organization.

Players need to investigate the terminal card on the field and remove two specific cards.
Players have special abilities according to job title cards, and each will investigate the terminal.
Players can not talk each other.
However, if pleyers are in the same field you can exchange information.

Japanese Summary:
「Malware Containment(Malcon)」をプレイすることで、セキュリティインシデント対応の一連の流れを疑似体験することができます。
プレイヤーはCSIRTの一員として、マルウェアに感染している端末を調査し、封じ込めていきます。

プレイヤーは協力して、フィールド上の端末カードを調査し、特定の２枚のカードを取り除くことを目的とします。プレイヤーは、初めに配られる役職カードに応じた特殊能力を持ち、各自で端末を調査していきます。プレイ中、プレイヤーは会話できませんが、同じフィールドにいる場合は情報を交換することができます。

name: Sight words challenge: Grade 4 – Mountain bike mania
description:
This is an educational mountain bike themed word recognition game.
Players move around a board landing on words that they must recognize by sight. They must then try to use it in a sentence on their game cards. First to complete eight sentences wins.

name: Jutlandia: Juego de las Flotas
description:
Jutlandia: Juego de las Flotas

Jutland: Game of Fleets

This is a game produced in Mexico in 1942. Unfortunately the version I found does not have a set of rules. Through research I found it was published in Mexico in 1942.
It consists of a set of battleships, cruisers, destroyers, submarines, Base Flags, Air Bases and coastal fortification for two players. It also includes a large map with the ability to designate each hex with a letter and a number.

name: The Founders of ENDE
description:
User summary
エンデの建国者 (The Founders of ENDE) is a board game with a theme of island development. The game board is a geographical map of an island called Ende. Players try to score victory points by constructing buildings and/or winning battles on the island.

At the beginning of the game, each player has a different set of four action cards, which varies by player order. Each round, they take turns playing action card until all players have taken three actions. At the end of round, they pass their set of cards to the player to the left.

By performing an action, players may construct/upgrade a building, gain resources, raise military power, initiate a battle, etc. There are plenty of player interactions, such as limited nubmer of buildings in a territory and initiating a battle with a specific player. But battle is not always necessary to win the game.

A player can win immediately by upgrading a building into the castle, but it requires much military power. Strategy selection (winning by castle, battles, buildings, or their hybrid) and action planning with consideration of rotating sets of cards are keys to winning the game.

開拓しつつ、資源を獲得し、建物を建てて、勝利点を得ていくタイプのゲームです。
基本的にはリソースマネジメントです。
資源獲得をして建物を建てて、建物の効果で方向性が定まります。

インタラクションは、豊富にあります。
建築や目的地カードの早い者勝ちという要素や、特定のプレイヤーに戦争/内戦を仕掛けるという直接攻撃もあります。ただし、直接攻撃を強制される類のゲームではありません。

城によるの勝利条件と、戦争/内戦による牽制と、カードセットの巡りによる計画性がこのゲームのポイントです。
mechanics: Action Queue, Area Majority / Influence, Worker Placement
publishers: イマジンゲームズ (imagine GAMES)

name: Expo Playing Cards
description:
A baseball game played with a single deck of 56 cards depicting different actions, either defensive or offensive, happening during a baseball game. Even with Expo in its name, the game is not officially affiliated with the Montreal Expos.

According to the rulebook, the game can be played 3 different ways:

Game 1: Simply shuffle the deck and flip cards to "simulate" a nine innings game.

Game 2: Two players, each simultaneously completing a half-inning, alternate drawing and playing cards to either accumulante runs or give 3 outs to their opponents. This is the recommended rule set in the rule book.

Game 3: A variant of game 2 but played with 4 peoples, in partnerships.
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Team-Based Game

name: World of Happy
description: World of Happy is a roll-and-move game given away at McDonald's restaurants. In the game, players roll a die (made by folding a punched-out section of the game board into a cube) and move to the next matching symbol on a track. One side of the die causes loss of a turn, and some space move the player forward or allow skipping of part of the track. The first player to reach the "World of Happy" at the end of the track wins.

name: King & Crown
description: King & Crown is a modular microgame for 2-5 players. With only 5 cards per deck, King & Crown offers five different games utilizing the same cards, though some variants require each player to have their own deck of cards. From dueling to bluffing, to social deduction, there’s something in here for everyone. And with the small size and few components, it’s great to take along and play while you’re in line waiting for other things.
mechanics: Hand Management, Rock-Paper-Scissors, Variable Player Powers

name: Box Quiz: Travel
description:
One of the over 50 implementations of the Box Quiz series, this one with the theme 'Travel'.

The game consists of a tin box with 50 questions and answers within a category, here about travel. It is a small and simple quiz game, where players simply answer the different questions.

name: SUM Card Game
description:
Description from the publisher:

SUM is a Maths based card game where your goal is to make equations using the cards in. Solve the most equations or get rid of all the cards in your hand to win.

SUM is a great game as well as a fun tool to help people improve their Math skills. The distribution of 1 to 9 numbers well as +, -, x and ÷ cards allow younger players to make simple equations while still staying competitive against those with a broader knowledge of Mathematics. While older players can try their hand at making more complex equations to get rid of more cards in their hand at one go.

And for those who want a stimulating party game to play with their friends, the Wild cards add an extra level of strategy to each game.

name: À Descoberta da Madeira
description:
Quiz game about the current and historic development of the Madeiran (Portugal) archipelago.

A dice is rolled to move the player's piece and they are required to correctly answer a question about various places on the islands, in order to conquer the current place on the board.

The winner is the one with the most conquered places on the isles of Madeira and Porto Santo.

All questions are in Portuguese and require quite some knowledge of local politicians, sports teams, companies, places, events, etc.

name: Monster Destruction
description:
Description from the publisher:

The Monster Destruction Deck Building game centres around earning reputation points from destroying buildings and accumulating Mutations, Enhancements and Minions. Starting the game with your basic monster card and some smash cards and exhausted monster cards you play them to gain new cards and abilities that will increase / build your deck. The game ends when you have destroyed all the cities and you then count up all your cards deck to see who has the most reputation points.

name: Stack3D
description:
Description from the publisher:

Stacked is a trick taking dexterity game for 2-5 players that mixes the dexterity and simplicity of tower stacking (like a Jenga), with Tetris like shapes and a simple trick taking mechanic.

The game is played to a number of points or rounds decided by the players (typically 2 rounds or 50 points).

The oldest player calls a trick type (color or if playing with color blind, symbol) and then counts down, 3, 2, 1 FLIP! The player who reveals the highest card wins that trick, takes the lead (so they may start the next turn) AND gets to give their shape to another player who must stack it on the tower for them!

There are two of every number in the deck, so watch out for ties! Both players play their own piece and nobody wins the trick. Fun for all ages with parental supervison.

name: The Terminator: System Upgrade
description:
Available during The Terminator Kickstarter campaign, this expansion consists of:

12 Gear cards for 1984
6 Skynet 2029 upgrade cards
6 Resistance 2029 upgrade cards
2 New missions + Rule insert
1 Skynet Mainframe model
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: The Terminator: Dogs of War
description:
Available during The Terminator Kickstarter campaign, this expansion consists of:

4 Dog miniatures
2 New Stat Cards (1984, 2029)
2 New Mission cards + Rules insert
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: The Terminator: Enemy of My Enemy
description:
Available during The Terminator Kickstarter campaign, this expansion consists of:

20 Character cards + Rules insert
1 Double-sided Stat card
1 Mini
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: The Terminator: Tunnel Vision
description:
Available during The Terminator Kickstarter campaign, this expansion consists of:

8 Resistance action cards
4 Skynet action cards
1 Punchboad of Sewer & Travel tokens
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: The Terminator: Road Rage
description:
Available during The Terminator Kickstarter campaign, this expansion consists of:

4 Key Location tiles
4 Key Location cards
4 New Mission cards + Rules insert
3 Freeway tiles
2 New Vehicle minis
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Friegur: Das Kriegsspiel um Festung und Fahne
description:
This game was published in commemoration of the 20th anniversary of the beginning of World War I. The title "Friegur" stands for: "Feldgraue rangen in Ehren, gewannen unsterblichen Ruhm"

Exerpt of the description by Elfriede Strey, as suplied at June 9, 1934 to the US patent Office: My invention relates to a game to be played on a board like chess by two persons or two parties and in which the aim is for one party to beat the other, under observation of determined rules.

Whereas in chess the various chessmen are moved merely according to their nature, the board of my new game has aspecial division or characterization of the squares which prescribes that determined menmust move only on determined squares.

According to the leading idea of my new game the board represents a terrain which comprises a fortress for each party, a glacis surrounding each fortress, and a battle ground situatedbetween the positions of the two parties. Both in the battle ground and in the glacises there are obstacles of various kinds which are denoted by differently marked squares. These obstacles further determine the moves of the various men, beyond their motion prescribed by their own nature. The rules of my new game, which may represent for example a battle for fortress and flag, further prescribe that the men or fighters may be both promoted and degraded, so that, for example, the
private soldier may be promoted to oflicer, if certain conditions are fulfilled, whilst an officer who has been derelict, may be degraded. Finally, as in chess, my new game provides that the fighters of one party may be taken according to determined rules, in order to break the fighting power of the enemy gradually.

name: Assumptions: XXXpansion
description: An adult add-on to Assumptions that contains 15 new characters and 40 new assumptions. Illustrated by Brooklyn artist Louie Chin this limited run (500 copies) was also manufactured in the US.

name: Cutlass
description:
Description from the designer:

Cutlass Deck building Cardgame is a Piratey, Cthulean-esque Character driven deckbuilder that uses expansive decision trees to garner incremental advantages over your opponent. With a vast array of options of amassing victory points, whether be chipping away at your opponents health, or push your luck economic growth, players aim to build enough wealth so that they can retire as wealthy pirates.
Cutlass hopes to incorporate vivid story-telling, and luscious art direction to immerse players in a in-depth world of pirates, monsters, gods, and conflict.

name: Rollosseum
description:
Description from the publisher:

Rollosseum is a dice battling game where players attempt to defeat their opponent(s) in an arena of fighters. Each player takes on the roll of a character/fighter with special abilities, and completes attacks with the roll of the dice provided. With various attacks at your disposal, easy to complete attacks wil do little damage to your opponent, while more difficult attacks will really cut your opponent's HP down. Normal attacks can be made with the dice, and doing so will eventually allow you to use your special abilities to give yourself and edge and finally defeat your opponent(s).

One player wins when the others have fallen, bringing their HP down to (or below) zero. Various modes of gameplay available, adding to the replay value and versatility of the game.

name: Warfare: A New Game
description:
Very little has been found about this game. Looks to be produced around 1900. The picture on the cover shows British Colonial troops on the attack but they could be in South Africa, Afghanistan, or some other part of the empire.

The map leads me to believe the game is a representation of the Boer War. It has two different sides, one of which appears to contain a British camp. The other side has a town that appears to be more European and trenches manned by combatants that look to be Boer.

name: Shipwrecked
description:
Description from the publisher:

You and the other players are castaways on an uncharted island. A gang of motley monkeys has stripped all your shipwrecks of vital parts. The goal of the game is simple: collect the plunder and monkeys that you’ll need to repair your ship and sail home. In order to get those items, you’ll need you’ll need to outbid and outsmart the other castaways in auctions run by Captain Coconuts, the wily monkey leader who controls the island — and your fate.

Shipwrecked is a classic auction game with a twist: Instead of bidding with your bananas, you’ll have a hand of six tokens that you’ll use to make your bid in a series of secret auctions. Each token interacts with those placed by the other players - but no one knows who has played what until the bids are revealed. Once a round of the auction round is won, the other players can spend their bananas (cash) in order to push the auction to the next level. If they do, more plunder and monkey cards are added, and the auction continues!

During every round, the cost of winning increases by one banana, as does the cost of pushing the auction forward. Your bid tokens all have unique effects, but once they’ve been played in an auction they stay on the board. That means you’ll want to save your most powerful bid tokens for the moment when they count the most.

It’s easy to learn, but the more you play, the more you’ll discover the layers of depth and strategy in the bid and push gameplay. The order that you use your tokens not only determines the outcome of the current auction round but your ability to effectively bid in upcoming rounds as well. Winning auctions will give you the plunder and monkeys you need to win, but you’ll be tempted to trade in your hard-won booty for short term gain: plunder cards can be traded in for extra bananas, while the monkey cards have special powers that can shift the outcome of the auctions — and the game!

name: Whatcha Say
description:
User summary:

Another party game with dental mouth openers.

Teams of players, hampered by lip retractors, attempt to read and interpret phrases. If your teammates guess the phrase you get the card as a point.

Team with the most points wins.

name: Lipless: Expansion Pack #1
description:
User summary:

200 all-new phrases for the base game.

Players wearing a mouth opener, must get your teammate to understand phrases without using your lips! to score a card.
Team with the most cards at the end of the game is the winner.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Party Game

name: Weltraumflug
description: Each player has 4 pawns (cosmonauts). They have to get to a planet and back to earth again. To determine the destination planets, each player draws 4 cards. Then the players turn the spinner. If the spinner shows the angular coordinates of a destination planet, the player places a cosmonaut on the planet. When a player has all 4 cosmonauts on a planet, he begins to bring then back home, by spinning the angular coordinates of the planet they're on. The first player to get all 4 cosmonauts back to earth wins the game.

name: Durch Sparen voran!
description: This is a simple roll-and-move game. On some spaces events benefit or hinder the players. The first player to reach space 100 wins the game.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Listening Lotto: Nursery Rhymes
description:
In this educational children's game, players match sounds played from a cd (e.g. Clock or farm noises) to images. To play, players listen to the sounds on the CD and place tokens on the images on their game cards that match what they hear. The sounds are all associates with common nursery rhymes. Players win by matching the most images correctly.

Each game set includes 12 game cards with 8 photos per card, 120 game tokens, an audio CD, and directions in English.

name: Listening Lotto: Find That Action Verb!
description:
In this educational children's game, players match narrative action verbs to photographs demonstrating that action. To play, players listen to the sounds on the CD and place tokens on the images on their game cards that match what they hear. Players win by matching the most images correctly.

Each game set includes 12 game cards with 8 photos per card, 120 game tokens, an audio CD, and directions in English.

name: Listening lotto: Sounds at Home
description:
In this educational children's game, players match sounds produced in the home (e.g. Hair dryer, faucet) to images depicting those items. To play, players listen to the sounds on the CD and place tokens on the images on their game cards that match what they hear. Players win by matching the most images correctly.

Each game set includes 12 game cards with 8 photos per card, 120 game tokens, an audio CD, and directions in English.

name: Listening Lotto: Outside Sounds
description:
In this educational children's game, players match noises occurring outdoors (cricket; lawnmower) to images depictions those items. To play, players listen to the sounds on the CD and place tokens on the images on their game cards that match what they hear. Players win by matching the most images correctly.

Each game set includes 12 game cards with 8 photos per card, 120 game tokens, an audio CD, and directions in English.

name: Listening Lotto: Find that Food
description:
In this educational children's game, players match The names of foods to photographs of those foods. To play, players listen to the names on the CD and place tokens on the images on their game cards that match what they hear. Players win by matching the most images correctly.

Each game set includes 12 game cards with 8 photos per card, 120 game tokens, an audio CD, and directions in English.

name: Listening Lotto: Community Helpers
description:
In this educational children's game, players match The names of specific jobs (e.g. Firefighter or nurse) to photographs of those people. To play, players listen to the sounds on the CD and place tokens on the images on their game cards that match what they hear. Players win by matching the most images correctly.

Each game set includes 12 game cards with 8 photos per card, 120 game tokens, an audio CD, and directions in English.

name: Listening Lotto: Learning to Read
description:
In this educational children's game players match spike words to those word printed on cards. To play, players listen to the words on the CD and place tokens on the words on their game cards that match what they hear. Players win by matching the most words correctly.

Each game set includes 12 game cards with 8 words per card, 120 game tokens, an audio CD, and directions in English.

name: Listening Lotto: Rhyming Pictures
description:
In this educational children's game, players match Spoken words to photographs depicting things that rhyme with the spoken words. To play, players listen to the sounds on the CD and place tokens on the images on their game cards that match what they hear. Players win by matching the most images correctly.

Each game set includes 12 game cards with 8 photos per card, 120 game tokens, an audio CD, and directions in English.

name: Listening Lotto: Where is Puppy?
description:
In this educational children's game, players match images of a dog in relation to its dog house to word escribing that relation ship (inside; on top of). To play, players listen to the sounds on the CD and place tokens on the images on their game cards that match what they hear. Players win by matching the most images correctly.

Each game set includes 12 game cards with 8 photos per card, 120 game tokens, an audio CD, and directions in English.

name: Kann, le combat
description:
Description from the publisher:

Kann: le combat is a confrontation game for two players, inspired from Jules Verne's book "20.000 lieux sous les mers".

One plays the "Nautilus" submarine and its crew while his opponent plays the giant Squid.

The Squid player wins if he meets any of these 3 conditions :

eat the captain of the Nautilus
eat 3 crew member (out of 10)
inflict 6 damages to the Nautilus


The Nautilus player wins if he cuts 5 tentacles (out of 6).

Each turn, both player roll two dice and use them on their dashboard in order to trigger various actions.

The Squid can throw ink (an attack meant to deal damages to the Nautilus), gather anger (anger points can be used to influence subsequent dice), deploy or retract his tentacles.
Tentacles do hit the Nautilus when they reach it, and can capture a crew member when deployed inside. In order to be eaten, a captured crew member has to be brought back to the Squid's mouth by retracting the tentacle.

The Nautilus player can move his crew members, rescue a crew member fallen to the sea, improve his moral (moral can influence subsequent dice), repair damages, and attack the Squid with axes, harpoons, or electricity.

name: Arith Magica: Adventures in Gossamyr
description:
Description from the publisher:

Arith Magica: Adventures in Gossamyr is an all-ages friendly board game based on the award winning graphic novel, "Finding Gossamyr". Arith Magica encourages players to solve problems with their minds as well as weaponry. Up to five players choose one of our unique, mathemagically powered heroes and embark on quests and adventure in the glorious land of Gossamyr. Together they will use, modular, double-sided board pieces to explore scorched deserts, illuminated forests and eldritch towers where they will face perplexing puzzles, wield powerful Arithmancy, fire geometric bows, and face the terrible scourge that threatens this beautiful world.

name: East Indiamen
description:
Players are English merchants circa 1590 - 1600’s financing marine voyages to seek treasure in India and SE Asia.

Each player may have a max of 4 expeditions in play at one time. Each expedition must have one or more (to a maximum of 4) ships. Expeditions can also have trade goods or silver to trade for cargo. They can also have gifts to give to foreign rulers, and great Captains to improve their chance of success. Expeditions are created using cards drawn from an “expedition” deck of 60 cards.

Each player has an expedition mat divided into 4 sections numbered 1 to 4. These correspond to each of the 4 possible expeditions the player may have going at the same time. The expedition and treasure cards of a particular expedition are placed in its own section.

Play is conducted on an expedition track that is 40 spaces long. There is a start space (England) and an end space (Pacific Ocean). The spaces in between represent locations or event that may a have a positive, negative or no effect on the expedition. When starting out, an expedition moves towards the end space. When reaching the End space or any point before then, the expedition may turn back. When an expedition finally returns, its treasures go into the expedition’s profit pile, and all its expedition cards are discarded.

Players take turns with each turn comprising 3 phases:

Expedition Phase

Draw 2 cards from the expedition deck and discard 1 of them. Add the card to your expedition pile.


Launch Phase

If your expedition pile contains at least 1 ship, you may launch an expedition.
If your expedition pile has 8 cards you must launch, unless you don’t have a ship, in which case you must discard your entire expedition pile, and gain 1 treasure.
Place an expedition counter onto the start space of the expedition track and place all the expedition cards from the pile into the corresponding section of your expedition mat.


Action Phase

In order of expedition number, move your expeditions along the track by rolling 1D6 and moving the expedition that number of spaces. Each space offers one possibility, helpful, or hurtful: trade, resupply, hardship, storm, capture ship, gift, cotton or naught. Spaces are resolved accordingly.


The game ends after 2 hours, or when the treasure deck runs out. The player with the most Treasure Points (TP) in their profit pile at that time wins.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Arguendo
description:
'Let your inner demons out to play'

A party card game of polemics and moral descent.

Suspend your moral and ethical values in this adult card game, where players argue against each other to defend a host of depraved and damnable acts.
Choose a sinful scenario from the stack of Case Cards and play devil’s advocate to fabricate a winning case, or inflict an unholy deed on your opponent and watch him squirm before the Judge!
Not for the pure or faint-hearted, this game will test the limits of the unscrupulous mind.

Features:
178 Case Cards featuring possible scenarios.
20 Clause cards.
Game Rules
Small size box suitable for travel and social gatherings

name: Jedes Tierchen hat sein Pläsierchen!
description:
The players have to move their three pawns on the track of their color from space 1 to space 50. Movement is determined by the "Verolette" in the center of the game board. The "Verolette" gives 8 different results, symbolized by an animal:

ant: 14 spaces forward
donky: 6 spaces back
cat: 10 spaces forward
snake: 8 spaces back
dog: 12 spaces forward
snail: 2 spaces back
bee: 16 spaces forward
pigs: 4 spaces back

From space 50 to 52 the pawns advance 1 space at the spinn of an ant or a bee. The first player to get his 3 pawns on the spaces 51 to 53 wins the game.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Trans-TK (fan expansion for Trans Europa / TransAmerica)
description:
User summary
Trans-TK is a variation map for TransAmerica, which changes the playing scene to the Tokyo, Chia, Saitama, and Kanagawa prefectures.

This variation pack only includes the map and cards. You will need either Trans America or Trans Europa to play. Contents include a game board (4 fold A4) and 36 cards.

Publisher's summary
Trans-TKは東京、千葉、埼玉、神奈川を舞台にした「トランスアメリカ」のバリエーションマップです。
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Trains

name: Diggers of Gold
description:
For 2 players. One player is in charge of the two miners, Alf and Jack, and the other player is in charge of the three outlaws.
The cards and discs should be placed appropriately on the board. Two pyragons are used. The players throw to decide who will start and the one with the highest score begins.
The men may move forwards or backwards. One man may be moved the total number thrown or two men may be moved according to the number of each pyragon. If a red is thrown, the player must miss a turn. If a green is thrown he has another turn.

Miners.
The object of the game for the miners is to collect as many sacks of gold from their mines as they can.

Outlaws.
The object of the game for the outlaws is to rob the miners of their gold.

Winner.
The winner is the player with most gold when the mines are empty.

This one of a series of games designed to help the beginner reader learn to read words in different situations.

name: Question Writey Downy Game
description:
Description from the publisher:

In our opinion a successful party game should be three things: hilariously entertaining, easy enough for drunk people to understand and personally revealing. There are loads of dirty party games out there, but not many that also have a "getting to know you" element. And that's where we come in.

QWDG is pretty simple. It's a deck of personal questions that range from thought-provoking to ridiculous, awkward to obscene. When a card is drawn, everyone writes their own answer to the question. Then one person tries to correctly identify who wrote each answer.

To sum up: QWDG is a dirty party game for people who want to show off their disgusting sense of humor and prove how well they know their friends.

name: Lese-Memory
description:
A cheerful introduction to reading for children 6 and over.

Lese-Memory is a memory game in which you have to find pairs made up of matched pictures, pictures and corresponding words or split syllables of a larger word.

144 cards included in the game.

name: TradeWorlds: Smugglers Run
description:
Description from the publisher:

This Expansion features as primary mechanic a "Push-Your-Luck" (PYL) mechanic in a "Race"-type scenario. Players will be racing against each other to be the first player to earn 500 credits to win this NEW scenario. During the game, players will take on a NEW and "Special" Mission called "Smuggler's Run" and in doing so may exchange cards for various tracks to UNLOCK a given dice. With a maximum of five (5) dice which can be UNLOCKED, plus a BONUS 1D20 when you unlock two (2) or more dice results in the possibility of Scoring 60 Credits. But as this is a Trade Mission ... You must be wary that your Tradeship does NOT get destroyed as you collect more valuable illegal Cargo during this mission while avoiding "losing it all" in the event that your Tradeship gets destroyed.

Remember this Expansion is build upon the framework of the "Planetary Expansion" and not only the "core" game. However at this present time we feel that it may be incompatible with the Tactical Core (Future Expansion currently not available). Both expansions add a certain depth to the game which alter the way the game is played. Because of the contrasting winning conditions, these two expansions cannot be played simultaneously.

Additionally this Expansion offers update Player Game Pads (Horizontal) which are more compatible with the NEW "Smuggler's Cache" Game Pads which are exclusive and personalized for each Faction in the game. This also adds a bit of variability in Game Play allowing players to TRY the various Factions and their Resources for a different experience (in terms of resources).
categories: Economic, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction
publishers: K2 Games Inc., Outer Limit Games (II)

name: Treble Treasure
description:
There are two sets of composer discs numbered from 1 to 36. Place numbers 1 through 18 on the board in random order. Use the set of cards numbered 1 through 18 with the composers' names on them. Place these composer cards, which correspond to the discs on the board, in a pile with the names of the composers showing. Each player takes his turn identifying the composer whose name is on the top card by calling out the number which appears on the disc with the picture of the composer whose name is on the card.

And eduactional memory game.

name: Gangsters et compagnie
description:
Play with gangsters and cops using cards.
On one hand, there are 4 gangs with a godfather leading them. On the other side, 15 cops are trying to avoid the gangsters to rob a bank.

Gangster et Compagnie is played in two teams. The dealer, the player with the bank and the player with the bomb are one team. All the others are the second team.
These teams play tricks. In a trick where the first card is a Gang or Police, other players can follow or play whatever (if they can't follow). In a trick where the first card is a Bank or Bomb, nobody can play a card. The round ends a soon a player played his last card.
The team with most points in the tricks, win the round.

name: Yesterdays: 60's and 70's Edition
description: The musical cassette game. Correctly answer questions on the provided cassettes in a race to reach the finish space first. Questions may be musical clues, spoken lyrics, multiple choice, complete the lyric, or identify the year.

name: Wraith
description:
Description from the publisher:

In Wraith, you must recruit champions and use your magic to reach into cross over to The Other Side and bring powerful spirits back to the land of the living. Once summoned, your wraiths may fight along side you or merge with you and your champions to give you supernatural abilities, armor, and more! Face off against your friends with competitive battles or team up to stop the encroaching darkness with both campaign and defense co-op play.

Wraith is a fast-paced deck-building game for 1-4 players that focuses on recruiting and building up champions to defeat your opponents. The game features three modes of game play: competitive versus, co-op campaign, and defensive co-op. The campaign and defense variations can also be played solo.

name: Spore Stages
description:
A card and dice game for 1-5 players based on the Spore series of videogames. Each player is control of his own race as it evolves and develops from a single cell to spacefaring.

The game plays in 5 stages (Cell stage, Creature stage, Tribal stage, Civilization stage, Space stage) with each stage having a separate deck of trait cards, and event, challenge type and challenge result tables. Players move from one stage to the next at different speeds and do not directly interact until the last stage, the Space stage. At the beginning of each stage, each player chooses 1 characteristic for his race – these characteristics improve a particular attribute for the race.

Players share a common set of Victory Point Tokens (VT), Food (Resource) Tokens (FT), Hunger Tokens (HT) and Death Tokens (DT). Each player starts with 1 VT and 3 FT.

Players take turns with each turn comprising 5 Phases:

Mutation Phase

Draw 1 (or, possibly, more) card from the deck (of the stage you are in).


Event Phase

Roll once on the event table (of the stage you are in) and resolve the event.


Selection Phase

Most events are challenges between your species and another species that is either weaker, equal, or stronger than you.
To resolve a challenge first roll on the challenge type table to determine what attribute will affect the challenge. Next Roll 1D6 (Attribution Roll) and add your level in the indicated Attribute. This is your Attribution Total.
Next roll 1D6, 2D6, or 3D6 depending on the Strength of the Challenger.


This is the Challenge Roll.

If the Attribution Total is greater than the Challenge Roll, you win the Challenge.


If it is equal or less, you lose the challenge.

Refer to that stage’s Challenge Result list to determine the benefits or consequences of winning or losing the challenge.
You may attempt to evade a challenge. If you do so, add +4 to your attribution roll.


However if you win, you get no reward.

Evolution Phase

You may gain 1 Trait by playing 1 Trait card from your hand and paying its cost in food or resource tokens. The Trait card stays in play in front of you.


Metabolic Phase

Discard 1 Food Token. If you have no food tokens gain 1 hunger token. If you have 2 hunger tokens, discard them and gain 1 death token.
Max hand size is 5 cards. Discard excess cards.
Determine whether your race moves to the next stage:
If you have 6 Trait cards in Cell stage in play go on Creature stage.
If you have 8 Trait cards in Creature stage in play go on Tribal stage.
If you have won against 5 villages in Tribal stage go onto Civilization stage.
If you have won against 7 nations in Civilization stage go onto Space Stage.

If going on to the next stage set your old Trait cards aside in your Progress Pile. Except for and VT they might score, these do not apply to later stages. Select a new characteristic for the new stage and discard down to 2 FT or RT.


The game ends after any player has completed his 15th turn in the Space stage at which point scoring is undertaken:

Gain 5 VT for completing the Civilization stage and entering the Space stage.
Add up the VT bonuses from all the Trait cards in your Progress Pile.
Each Death Token counts as a -2 VT penalty.
Add or lose VT arising from Events and Challenges.



The player with the most Victory Point Tokens wins.

name: Survivors of the Silver Fleet
description:
Description from the designer:

Survivors of the Silver Fleet is a dungeon-crawler style monster-fighting, treasure-grabbing game for 2-4 players. Each player will take on the role of the Captain of a salvage ship in the immediate aftermath of the sinking of the Spanish Silver Fleet off of the coast of Florida in 1715. Race other players to accumulate as much treasure and rescue as many survivors as possible. But, with nearly a thousand drowned sailors laid to rest under the waves, it will be almost impossible to avoid aggressive sea monsters out searching for a waterlogged snack!

You’ll need to upgrade your ship to survive. Purchase cannons for attack, defensive porthole upgrades, and additional sails for speed from nearby merchant ships. Then, hope you're prepared for everything you haul up from the depths of the sea. The Captain who has salvaged the most treasure at the end of the game will be rewarded with early retirement, and the admiration of their peers.

Good luck, Captain. You’ll need it.
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement

name: Empathy Toy
description:
The Empathy Toy is a blindfolded puzzle game where players must recreate each other's puzzle patterns without sight. Instead they must use only their words to describe abstract shapes with no name. To succeed, players must create a common language, understand each other's perspectives, and tackle the problem collaboratively.

https://twentyonetoys.com/pages/empathy-toy

name: Invest
description:
Description from the rulebook (translated from Swedish):
Invest is a game for 2-6 players. The players takes of to more southern locations, each with 30 grand, to buy properties where they can build Bungalows and Hotels, giving them rental fees when the other players visits.

User summary:
It is essentially a Monopoly-clone but with lots of 1970s Charter-craze flair to it.
It also has a quite unique plastic game board.

Component list (Inventoried from a Thrift store copy, so there might be errors)

1x Game board (paper wrapped in soft plastic casing)
6x Generic plastic player tokens in different colors
1x Small brown dice cup (perhaps not included?)
2x 6 sided dice
12x Larger red plastic houses
38x Smaller green plastic houses
30x proofs of purchase (including 2 extra blank ones)
30x 'Chans' cards
28x 10,000 paper bills (checks actually)
33x 50 paper bills
50x 100 paper bills
40x 500 paper bills
96x 1000 paper bills

name: Japanese Spella (日本語スペラ)
description:
User summary
日本語スペラ (Japanese Spella) is a Japanese word game.

Players are dealt 17 tiles of Japanese hiragana characters. They take turns drawing and dicarding a tile until one player uses up all of their 18 characters forming several Japanese words and/or sentences. That player takes big points, while the others take small points according to the words and/or sentences made in their hands.

手許に配られた17枚のひらがなのタイルを、１枚ずつ入れ替えながら、１枚を引いて18枚のときにすべてを単語か文に組み替え終わると「上がり」です。上がった人には高い得点が与えられ、上がれなかった人にも、手許で作った単語や文に応じて得点が与えられます。
publishers: Japan Spella Association (日本スペラ協会)

name: VEKTOR: The Abstract Card Battle Game
description:
Vector is an abstract customizable battle card game. Players take turns playing action and reaction cards with a variety of effects to be the last player standing. The Game is designed with simple rules and a surplus of cards to allow players to customize the deck to their preferred play style. Whether passive or aggressive, chaotic or ordered Vektor offers the quick spontaneous action of a filler game while offering the flexibility of game modes to increase replay value.

Vector is a vibrant, colorful game that mixes fun clever interactions while not being overwhelming for new players. To put it simply, Vektor is a spell slinger wearing a Skip-Bo / Uno mask.

The game functions best with 3-5 players and takes 5-15 minutes to play.
The game comes with conditional rules for more silly and chaotic games, and also comes with
A deck of attack order cards for players that may be scared of mercilessly destroying your significant other in a card game. The idea is that the simple mechanics of the game allow freedom of format on how you want to play. Be creative, add or subtract cards, use the blank cards to add your own unique experience!

More games modes are currently in development:
-Sword and Shield (2v2 Co-Op)
-Center of Attention (King of the hill)

name: Cat Academy
description:
Cat Academy is a card drafting game by Harle Games released as a free print and play.

Players match different scoring adjectives to 'Cats' to achieve the best score by drawing and passing cards between them until all players have at least 5 cards.

In battle mode, two teams play against each other to build the friendliest or most ferocious team my matching red and blue cards together for their team.
categories: Animals, Card Game, Children's Game, Print & Play
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Open Drafting

name: Lost Gemma
description:
User summary

失われた宝玉 (Lost Gemma) (ロストゲムマ on the card backs) is a member of the "Lost Legacy" games family, but builds on the base formula. Players are trying to locate the "Lost Gemma" (Latin for "jewel") which is hidden among the growing ruins. The game consists primarily of two phases: Investigation and Search.

During the Investigation Phase, players decide whether to place their starting point card or draw and play something from their hand. The former action can only be carried out once, while the latter forms the bulk of the phase. With a few exceptions, cards played are added to the 5 x 5 grid that forms the ruins. When players can no longer complete either of the main actions, play moves onto the Search Phase.

Players are hot on the trail of the "Lost Gemma" during the Search Phase. The player holding the card with the lowest search value goes first and then turns continue in ascending value order. Each player begins at their starting point card, chooses a direction, and then follows the path until they either locate the "Lost Gemma" or face failure (via a "Dead End" or by leaving the ruins).

The first player to uncover the "Lost Gemma" wins. However, if all searches end in failure, the game ends in a draw.

The game was published for the Tokyo Game Market Autumn 2015 show, and features the characters from the Game Market catalogue.
mechanics: Hand Management, Memory, Network and Route Building, Tile Placement

name: IFC: Free Agents
description: Here's the fan created expansion to the original IFC set. 16 fighters make up this expansion with the likes of El Halcon, Freakenstein, Muck, Stretchrrrr and more! Same game play, just more fighters to enter the fray!
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move, Take That

name: IFC 2: Darkness Rising
description:
The sequel the IFC sees Power Monger trying to make a power play and take over the league. 8 sponsored fighters arrive and have to be defeated consecutively before the spell cast can be unlocked...
there's more surprises in this 9 card expansion that you'll have a blast playing it.
categories: Card Game, Fighting, Science Fiction, Sports
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Roll / Spin and Move, Take That

name: IFC: International Incident
description:
Here comes 8 more fighters to the league, plus the addition of the Duos Division and a strap/chain match and ladder match!
Get guys like Papa Dhark, the Rocket Riot Express, Crimson Cross and more!
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move, Take That

name: Sunkun karuta
description:
A traditional Japanese trick-taking card game played with a special 97-card six-suited deck. This deck developed from 75-card Unsun karuta deck, which derived from Tenshō karuta, itself a close copy of the 48-card traditional Portuguese cards.

While Unsun karuta adds a fifth suit and three extra ranks per suit, Sunkun karuta further adds a sixth suit (arrows), a sixteenth rank (kun, くん) and a variant duplicate of a single card (the robai of hau).

While Unsun karuta survived into the modern era in a few locations, Sunkun karuta was rather short-lived.

name: Alien Duel Ben 10
description:
This is a game like Memory with cards and a 8-sided dice.

With help of the Omnitrix Ben 10 changes with ease in any Alien. Using your wits you can find the right Alien! But be aware of the evil Alien like Dr. Animo or Vilgax! They dare you for a duel from time to time and only with a little luck you can defeat them.

Contains 36 cards and an 8-sided dice.

name: Reclame Slogans Raden
description:
Reclame Slogans Raden ("Guessing Advertising Slogans") is a card game. A players takes a card from the draw pile and reads one of the 2 Advertising slogans to his neighbour. The neighbour has to guess the company that uses/used that slogan. If he is right he scores 3 points. When he doesn't know the company straight away he gets 4 options (on the back of the card) When he now choses the right company he scores 2 points.
If he choses the wrong option, the other players get a chance to name the correct one. The player who does scores 1 point.
Winner is the player that has the most points after a set number of rounds.

name: Money Dice
description:
