Government bonds of countries - the economy of the world - are now entrusted to the hands of you who surround the table. Whether investing in the future of which country, when to hand out, of course, is a freedom translation.

But it is not us who decides fate. Nobody knows how much the tradeoff will be. We have funds.

When there are unexpected inconveniences, let's try to settle in a smart way ...
publishers: Chicken Dice Games (チキンダイスゲームズ)

name: This is the easy work just to put a dandelion on sashimi
description:
In the game everyone plays a worker at a sashimi factory. Please carefully determine the workable amount and engage in delicate work.

Please enjoy the pleasures of the balance game.

name: Tsukisas Hold'em
description:
The player judges whether to participate in the game or descend after seeing the situation of his hand and the situation. The player with the lowest number who participated in the game loses and the other player can pierce one spear per player in the losing player's doll.

The player who stabs the most spears and is not stabbed becomes the winner.

name: Perfect League
description:
Perfect League is a game of cards in groups of two, by sending a message to build mutual understanding. Each time the cards are going to link to each other more, compete in the same work in pairs as quickly as their partner, those teams will have a better chance of winning.

When the game ends, the player with the most understanding ore will be the winner.
mechanics: Hand Management, Memory, Team-Based Game, Trick-taking

name: Kitsunesangakoronda
description:
In the woods behind a certain village shrine, you met up with mysterious foxes and began to play “Daruma-san-Ga-Koron-Da!”.
Mysterious raccoon dogs were attracted its mystic atmosphere .
They came and joined before you knew.
The woods behind the village shrine became party mood usually it had been desolate.
Win the game “Daruma-san-ga-Koron-Da!” by capturing more numbers of foxes than that of approaching foxes.

You become “it” of “Daruma-san-Ga-Koron-Da!” and capture approaching foxes.
Place 1 , 2 or 3 cards with face down on the playfield from the stock, then place a last card with face up.
Move the last card to “Captive Zone” if it is “Running Fox”.
Move the last card to “Approaching Zone” if it is “Standing Fox”.
You may turn the tide when the last card is “Raccoon Dog”.
Game is over when there are no cards in the stock.
You win if there are more numbers of cards in “Captive Zone” than that in “Approaching Zone”.

name: Martial Arts
description:
Description from the publisher:

Fast-moving man to man combat for one to six players.

User summary:

A ziplocked game consisting of six 8.5x11" sheets of paper (a cover sheet, 3 pages of rules, a chart, and a hex map). The game used unmounted counters that had to be cut apart.

name: Eskimo Fishes
description:
The annual Ice Fishing Festival... a day when all the Eskimo children in your village get a chance to show off their skills and see who can catch the most fish. You are finally old enough to participate and anxious to prove yourself to the other children. You will need to carefully scout the area for the biggest fish, cleverly maneuver across the crowded ice, and strategically manage your limited supply of lures if you hope to out-fish the competition. Do you have what it takes?

Eskimo Fishes is a competitive tile placement game in which players use an assortment of colored lure tiles to influence (and hopefully catch!) fish scattered throughout a modular lake map.

At the start of the game, ice tiles are shuffled and laid face-up in a grid to form the frozen lake and colored fish tokens representing holes in the ice are placed on each of the tiles. Players’ turns consist of two phases: movement and fishing. During the movement phase, players must move their Eskimeeple to a new unoccupied ice tile. During the fishing phase, players manipulate a rondel on their player board to select a lure tile that must then be placed adjacent to their Eskimeeple. After a set number of rounds, each fish is caught by the player with the highest sum of like-colored lures placed around it. The player who catches the highest total value of fish is the winner!
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Hand Management, Modular Board, Set Collection, Tile Placement

name: Shape Whiz
description:
Description from the publisher:

Race your opponent to find the shape that fits the geometry clue. Everyone must agree the shape is a match or flip the card to check the facts. So fun, you won't even realize you're learning all about geometry.

name: Junk Race
description:
Description from the designer:

In Junk Race you play the driver of a car that is constantly falling apart in the middle of the most important race of your life. Thankfully, this is happening to all the other drivers too.

Junk Race is a destruction management racing game for 2-5 players set in a creative, but perhaps mechanically challenged world. Players will face the constant breakage of parts of their cars, and will have to spend their limited Wrench resources between repairs, attacking other players, and simply driving their car.

The hazardous and varied terrain of the Junk Race will push your car to its limits, and will send you careening off a cliff or into a tree if your car isn't equipped to handle the challenges of the land. But, wait! Do I see an upgrade station ahead?
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Open Drafting, Point to Point Movement, Simultaneous Action Selection, Take That

name: Conquer the Kings
description:
Description from the designer:

WELCOME TO CONQUER THE KINGS!

This game was created with two purposes in mind: first, for those of you who already play chess, Conquer the Kings is a fresh, exciting take on the classic game while maintaining the principles of movement and strategy that made the original so beloved.

And second, for those of you that may have been intimidated by the original game, Conquer the Kings presents an interesting variance to the original that allows for learning to be had in a friendlier, perhaps more easily digestible manner.

What's most intriguing is that neophytes and experts alike can sit at the same table and, at times and when necessary, join forces to reach the ultimate goal: Conquer the Kings!

WHAT MAKES CONQUER THE KINGS SO SPECIAL?


2, 3 or 4 players battle at a time (individually or in teams) - You get to talk about your moves too!!! Work together in teams to discuss strategy, or to help out a weaker player.
Unlimited openings, strategies and styles of play are available
Pawn Movement arrow - Allows you to move your pawns as a unit;


Either Forward, Left/Right Flank or Retreat

Each player has complete discretion on the initial setup of his/her pieces
Alliances between players are allowed, and sometimes necessary
Friendly banter between players is anticipated (but keep it clean!)


So, who amongst you will be the last one standing? Who amongst you will Conquer the Kings?

name: Duchess
description:
Description from the designer:

Duchess is a multi-player Chess variant for two to six players.

In addition to the King, Queen, Bishop, Knight and Rook there are two combination pieces, called the Duchess (bishop + knight) and the Fortress (rook + knight), as well as the Wizard, which moves like a King and also enables pieces next to it to move `by teleportation'.

Pawns can move forward, backwards or sideways and take on any diagonal. They promote by moving to the central "square" (which is really hexagonal).

name: Ferret Card Game
description:
Ferret is a fun, energetic, card game. The object of the game is to find the elusive Ferret and then give, take and trade your way down to one card. If you've managed to hold onto the Ferret, you win!
There are 4 animals in the game: The Ferret, The Fox, The Hound and the Weasel. These little rascals love to chase each other. The other cards are number cards (0-6) and action cards (Give Left, Take Right, Trade Anyone, etc).
The cards are shuffled into an Number card pile and an Action card pile. The Animals are considered Action cards. Players draw cards and perform the actions on the cards. Play shifts to the left and the next player does the same. Play continues until someone finds the Ferret.
categories: Animals, Card Game, Children's Game, Deduction, Humor, Party Game

name: Puck Luck Hockey Game
description:
This is a two-player magnetic hockey game. The board is an ice rink, with a clear plastic cover, and a magnetic puck underneath. Each player has a plastic hockey stick with a magnet in the end. The players use their hockey stick to shoot the magnetic puck into each other's nets.

The first player to score 10 goals wins.

name: Fuel Tycoons
description:
Fuel Tycoons is a microgame for 3 gambling industrial magnates whose trust controls the global oil and gas reserves.

Anyone who fulfills best the self-negotiated agreements of the trust sells the fossil raw materials most successfully and receives economic power.
The cards indicate the amount of different fuel types (oil or gas)in this turn and whether the raw material should be sold cheap or expensive. Based on this information the players have to decide whether to sell a small or big quantity at a high or low price. The agreement is made jointly, but usually only one player profits from it, the others go empty.

Bluffing and clever tactics are the keys to profit & power in this fast and elegant microgame.
mechanics: Commodity Speculation, Hand Management, Set Collection

name: Rückenmaler
description:
Rückenmaler translates as 'Back drawer' and is a shape recognition game for children aged 3 and up. The game consists of 12 wooden tiles with a basic shape engraved in them. Player one picks a tile from the stack, follows the line of the engraving with his finger, then draws that line on the back of player two. If player two guesses the shape right, he gets to keep the tile. If not, the tile goes back into the stack.
The game ends when all tiles have been collected. The player with most tiles wins the game.

name: Fwends
description:
Description from the designer:

The Fwends Game is as simple of a card game as it gets which makes it great for all ages to play.

You are dealt 7 cards. The first card is flipped over from the top of the deck. Each card has at least one Fwend on it. If the colored dots in the corner match the Fwend card in your hand, you can play it.

There are three types of action cards: Toss 2 (throw away 2 Fwends), Take 2 (the player who plays this card must draw 2 Fwend cards), and Give 2 (give any two Fwend cards to another player).

Each player takes turns putting their Fwend cards down. The last person with Fwends in their hand loses.

name: EverSquad
description:
Description from the designer:

The First Game in the EverSquad Series follows 4 unlikely heroes attempting to save their city, New Meepleton, from an alien invasion brought about by a 5th grader's science project gone wrong.

EverSquad is a solitaire game of Area Control with variable character powers, and a simple point-buy-based dice-combat system, played in turns of 3 repeated phases.

Spawn Phase - Where new alien threats are added to the 6 different sectors of the modular board.

Heroic Action Phase - Where the heroes are activated in succession, taking the fight to the alien threat.

Alien Attack Phase - Where each of the 4 unique alien types attacks your heroes.

EverSquad also comes with 4 hero-based mini missions to help players learn the game.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Solo / Solitaire Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Kaalu
description:
Description from the designer:

Kaalu is an abstract strategy game about balance.

The game consists of 63 stones -- 21 in each of two player colors (referred to as black and white), and a third neutral color. At the start of the game, seven piles are placed on the surface, each consisting of three neutral stones, and two of each player colors, for a total of seven stones in each pile, with each player maintaining the remaining seven stones in their color in front of them to form their stock.

Play consists of players taking alternating turns starting with black. Each move is either the placement of a stone from their stock into a pile on the board, or moving any number of neutral stones and/or stones of their color from one pile to another, in order to create a number piles with 'primacy' in their player color. There are a few small restrictions on moves that can be used by cunning players to strategically limit their opponent's viable options. The first player to reach the target number of piles with primacy in their color wins.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Pick-up and Deliver

name: Elgom: Master Of The Elements
description:
Description from the designer:

2-6 player card game which was inspired by poker, chess and pokemon. In Elgom - MOTE players are trying to draw special cards from the shared deck and with their wits overcome opponents to become MASTER OF THE ELEMENTS.
categories: Card Game, Fantasy, Party Game, Word Game
mechanics: Hand Management, Memory, Player Elimination, Rock-Paper-Scissors

name: Microtopia
description:
Description from the designer:

Microtopia is a round-based board and card game that has players controlling their own colony of bugs; all competing to collect the most resources from a rotating selection of habitat tiles by the end of the game. Players can spawn a variety of bugs for the purposes of collecting resources, hunting opponents bugs, or protecting their own hive.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Animals, Educational, Environmental, Farming
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Chit-Pull System, Modular Board, Variable Phase Order

name: Dust 1947: Panzerkamplaufer I-L – "Luft Horst"
description:
Description from the publisher:

This airborne operations ready walker is used in the Luftwaffe Ground Divisions. Thanks to its thrusters, it can be parachuted directly on the battlefield, joining the action as soon as the rest of the invasion force arrives. This walker is tasked with providing long range fire support thanks to its Nebelwerfer Rocket Launchers. They can obliterate whole areas of the battlefield in seconds. It is also capable of delivering smoke shells that are very effective in disrupting enemy's fire, protecting the Luftwaffe forces. It is presented here in its Cerberus Camo Pattern, as used in Europe circa 1947.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Modular Board

name: Dust 1947: Panzerkamplaufer I-G (Laser) – Luft Hermann
description:
Description from the publisher:

This airborne operations ready walker is used in the Luftwaffe Ground Divisions. Thanks to its thrusters, it can be parachuted directly on the battlefield, joining the action as soon as the rest of the invasion force arrives. This model is tasked with destroying enemy tanks and walkers with the help of its powerful long range laser guns. It is presented here in its Cerberus Camo Pattern, as used in Europe circa 1947.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Modular Board

name: Going Places in Africa and South America
description:
Description from the publisher:

Explore Africa and South America!

Visit 76 cities in 52 countries and explore 8 points of interest across the continents.

Each player receives one Destination card to determine their starting position, or hometown. Another 12 Destination cards are then dealt to each player. The goal is to plan a round trip from your hometown via the 12 destinations. The first person to complete a round trip wins!

To aid the traveler, train stations, airports and harbors are available as a quick travel option if a player has a corresponding Compass card. The Compass cards can help or stall your trip in a number of ways, including changing the outcome of the game. A comfortable lead can change into a frenzied contest!

Designed for 2-4 players and takes you on a different path around the continents each round!

name: Going Places in Asia and Oceania
description:
Description from the publisher:

Traverse the vast continents of Asia and Oceania!

Travel down the ancient Silk Road and visit the many cities in Asia and Oceania.

Each player receives one Destination card to determine their starting position, or hometown. Another 15 Destination cards are then dealt to each player. The goal is to plan a round trip from your hometown via the 15 destinations. The first person to complete a round trip wins!

To aid the traveler, airports and harbors are available as a quick travel option if a player has a corresponding Compass card. The Compass cards can help or stall your trip in a number of ways, including changing the outcome of the game. A comfortable lead can change into a frenzied contest!

Designed for 2-4 players and takes you on a different path around the continents each round!

name: Uvaldeopoly
description: Themed version of Monopoly based on Uvalde, Tx.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Himmel und Hölle
description:
The players have to get their 4 pawns into the blue center space (heaven). Movement is dertermined by a die. The 5th pawn is called "hellhound" and is placed on the big ringed space of it's own color to guard the neighbouring hell of the same color.
Enemy pawns may be captured while moving on the outher ring of the game board and are placed on the hell-space of the active player. The hell-spaces are ringed by 7 smaler spaces of the same color. These are called hell-yards. pawns caught in hell may be rescued by another pawn, that enters hell through the hell-yards. It's the hellhounds task to prevent this.
Pawns that are caught while moving on the inner ring aren't sent to hell but have to start from the beginning.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Lost Vegas
description:
There are many things buried in the sands of the new Old West, just waiting to be discovered and claimed. But the sandstorms are coming; they always come. They have long since swallowed the city, and no matter how much you uncover, they will continue their malicious barrage. They strike fast and without warning, unless you have the right equipment.

As prospectors in Lost Vegas, you seek to dig up what the desert has reclaimed. You can move from location to location collecting money and valuable artifacts. Barricade your locations from the storms, or you'll find yourself having to uncover what you've already worked to find — or get ahead of the game and use your radar to see where the next storm is coming from. After the storms have passed, the prospector who has the most money and treasure (points) from the locations they occupy wins.

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, American West, Exploration, Science Fiction
mechanics: Modular Board, Open Drafting, Set Collection, Worker Placement

name: Konito ? TV
description:
The TV edition of Konito?. Complete the fill-in-the-blank statements on the game cards in order to move forward on the modular scoring board. (The length of the game is determined by how many sections are used to create the board.) There is a time limit to complete each card.

The object is to be the first to complete famous TV catchwords or try to make your teammates find the right answer by any possible means.

This micro edition can be added to the base game or be played as a standalone with special included rules.
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game, Trivia

name: Topp-Memento
description:
How to play:

Put the red pieces over all the holes and move the top image sheet to a new position.
Lift up two red pieces at a time and try to find similar pictures underneath.
If you find two similar pictures, keep the red pieces and try again.
The player who gets the most pieces wins the game.


—user summary

name: DC Universe Miniature Game: Atrocitus
description: This expansion to the DC Universe Miniature Game introduces Atrocitus to the game. This white metal kit comes ready to assemble and paint.

name: DC Universe Miniature Game: Crime Syndicate
description: This expansion to the DC Universe Miniature Game introduces the Crime Syndicate to the game. This white metal kit comes ready to assemble and paint. Contains 3 figures - Power Ring, Superwoman, and Ultraman.
categories: Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game

name: Multiverse: Owlman
description: Knight Models continues the Multiverse line with this expansion. The Multiverse line is a series of expansions that expands both the Batman Miniature Game and the DC Universe Miniature game. This expansion includes a Owlman figure and character sheets.
categories: Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game
